reviews.review:
A must !. I would rank the lion head before the table mountain because the climb up is fun (not for everyone, not an easy one).
Number one attraction in capetown !

Wear good shoes. . Well this was a walk that i wasnt expecting. I assumed (which I should never really do!) that it would be a moderate walk. Well half way up you kind of become a novice rock climber! It was unexpected but they best walk I've ever been on. Its totally safe the views are well worth it when you get to the top for a 360 view of cape town.

Great hike & views, but crowded. I probably picked a wrong day, but I hiked the hill on a sunny Sunday morning, so it was really crowded. But it was worth it - the views are great along the way, and at the top, you are rewarded with a 360-degree panorama of Cape Town.I do recommend wearing proper hiking shoes, as there is some climbing and rocks can be slippery - I was wearing running shoes and did not feel really comfortable & secure.

Did it twice !! . This place is really good for hiking, especially before you reach the top part. I did the hike 2 times in my Cape Town trip. You don’t need to bring large backpack since you will kick it away when you try to climb the very steep rocks. All I got were just a bottle of water and a camera, as well as my phone. I could see some hikers brought their own picnic and had a meal up there. The view along the way is also awesome. I could see the whole Table Mountain together with the beach (Camps Bay) and the V&A waterfront at the same time. The first day I wore jeans and I ripped the knee part while climbing. So, in the second time I wore shorts.
360 dgr fantastic view. Entering this mountain takes about an hour. Mostly walking in easy stairs, but the last part is a little bit more climbing big rocks. Fantastic view from the top.

Great mountain hike but can be dangerous!. This was a beautiful hike alternative to Table Mountain (which was very cloudy the day we considered hiking it). However it is very steep and there are chains and footholds needed to help you up the hike at certain points. While it was not physically exhausting for 2 fit people, it was dangerous - i.e. Sections of the hike where if you slipped or lost your footing, you could die! So wear good hiking shoes and NOT worn out sneakers like I did. The view at the top was rewarding with 360 views of Cape Town. It took us about 2 hours to hike up, with quite a few breaks, and about a half hour to get down.
Hiking up Lions Head. One of the top attractions of Cape Town. Spectacular 360 deg views of the City Bowl, Rrobben Eiland, Atlantic Seaboard , Table Mountain, Clifton, Camps Bay.
A wonderful walk. The whole family took a walk up and down lions head and we would recommend it 100%. The views are spectacular. Take lots of water and some snacks.

Lion's Head. Stunning panoramic views. Do try the full moon evening/night hike I possible. Basically a walk with 1 or 2 rock scrambles near the summit. No equipment needed, but decent shoes and warm clothing (wrather dependent) and water.

better than table mountain. I sincerely recommend the hike to Lion's head, which offers an incredible panoramic view on the ocean, and a bit of climbing! (very easy and accessible). Count two hours back and forth

Spectacular views. We went to Lions Head for our first trip on our holiday. I was amazed at how big the area was it covered and the hike to the top was a bit challenging but manageable for careful general walkers. We found a lovely spot for a picnic and despite the busyness with other walkers it didnt stop us enjoying the peaceful atmosphere.
Lovely place to visit . Great place to visit and see around. Any one of my family members enjoyed there. Highly recommended !!!

Nice walk up and great view over cape town.. Nice walk up and great view over cape town. Maybe not recommended for those who have health concerns or fear of heights as the top section there are a few areas of climbing over rocks and climbing with chains.

The breathtaking view . We went over there in the early morning and by 7 o'clock were on the top. Better not start later because it will be really hot. The last part of the route can be very hard for old people and kids.The breakfast on the top is smth incredible. If you r in cape, it is MUST

One of the best free attractions in Cape Town. Early morning or late afternoon this is a great experience. You do not need to be superfit. Keep in mind Lion's Head is very popular so exspect some foot traffic, but everyone is fairly chilled. Definitely pack a picnic basket and take water.Do not rush climbing up or down the chains as this is where accidents can happen.

VIEWS FOR AFRICA!. For tourists and locals alike who are able to walk at a brisk pace without puffing and panting, a climb up Lion's Head is an absolute must. Not only will it open up your lungs but you'll all be reward with some spectacular views of the pristine beaches along the Atlantic coastline as well as the Cape Town CBD. If your'e planning on climbing on a warm day better you start either early morning or late afternoon to avoid the excessive heat!Enjoy

Go hike Lions head. Lions head is a brief 2 hour hike at a very moderate level. Compared to certain routes on table mountain which are hard! It's a great way to start the day and the view when you finally get to the top and look out over Cape Town is truly spectacular. You'll need suntan lotion in summer because it's quite hot, unfortunately in CT it's windy and the weather changes quickly so maybe a zip up or carry a light top with you. Also, one of the routes has a little bit of climbing and you'll need some strength to pull yourself up. If you can't do that make sure you take the other route. Some of the best profile pics you'll ever have will be when you're standing on top of Lions head!
good for sundowner or sunrise. perfect to go there with your crush and stay in the car to watch the city beats. it has a parking area wich is big enough for lots of cars.

Strenuous.. A strenuous walkover a boulder strewn path.Near the summit a ladder and chain to get you up.Very busy when we were there on a Saturday afternoon.Views are magnificent.Looking back up after our descent this 66 year old felt a sense of achievement.

Sunset walk - awesome!. Walked up for sunset - highly recommend this! Took us 45 minutes to walk up - some groups took around an hour. Great sunset views from the top!! We left the top just before sunset to beat the rush for the ladders at the end. The top portion of the climb is ladders and chains, so is quite steep. Take a jacket as it is windy at the top.

Excellent Walk. Great views and a moderate walk with ladders and chains. Accessible by anyone of reasonable fitness. However, we underestimated the time required. It was a busy Sunday morning and you had to wait at the ladders for others. In an hour, we still had a fair way to go and had to leave due to a lunch appointment. So make sure you leave enough time to go up and back. I would allow 4 hours but maybe someone who made it all the way up could offer a better estimate.

Amazing views. Most of the hike is not difficult, however there is a section which requires pulling yourself up by metal bars and chains (I think there may have been a longer way around this). The views from the top are incredible. We ended up doing this hike because it was too windy to do Table Mountain, but our guide said this one is actually better because you get a view of Table Mountain as well as the city down below.

Crazy steep at the top. Gentle winding slopes until you reach the Lion's Head itself and it is an extremely steep climb requiring all fours. As a person with a fear of heights, this was not an easy endeavor. Climbing up was manageable, but coming down, looking into the vast fall below was nearly impossible for me. Thankfully, I met kind hikers who helped and coached me through some of the most challenging parts such as climbing down ladders and metal bars. I highly recommend the hike for those without a fear of heights. The views going up and at the top are incredible. Cape Town is such a natural beauty.

Conquering with a roar. Not the easiest place for a hike, Lion’s Head is definitely not for the faint of heart. The first time I tried to climb this was mid-year during the rainy season with lots of strong wind. I had to give up as I got to the path/rock interface which was really slippery and scary at that time. This time around, I had decided to go during the drier months and with the sun’s blessing and just a faint gust. It took me a total of 2hours and 45 minutes to get to the top and come back down to the parking lot. What was really nice was the camaraderie you form when travelling with other hikers who are also trying to get to the top, walking the steep path and then scaling the rock face with the metal handles and chains. Along the way, you are greeted by magnificent views of Cape Town and Camps Bay. And at the top, the sight is just breathtaking.Definitely a must but you have to be well prepared for it. If unsure, better do the hike with somebody who knows the area well. And for those who may be physically challenged, there is no shame in going half way.

Prepare your sports wear !. Good place to see good views and improve your fitness as well , prepare the proper sports wear as you will move a long distance upwards till you reach the lions head , will enjoy the breathtaking views but also requires effort
Panoramic Beauty. Wish I had done this hike a long time ago. An epic hike.Highly recommended its easy challenging at times but most pretty breathtaking views.
A must do . Amazing view of the city. About 2 hours of walking. The Last part of the track going up is challenging.

Spectacular views. The hike is nice, they views are spectacular. Just make sure you don't go on a public holiday, it gets very busy and annoying. Once you get closer to the top, you have to wait in queues for the ladders to get up or down and this takes a very long time. Carry water and a camera

Rewarding hike. So glad we did this hike!! The view at the top is just breathtaking. You'll want to take pictures along the way but trust me, the view at the top is the one you're really looking for. I was a bit worried about the hike from the reviews but it wasn't too bad. We are in average physical shape and the hike took an hour each way. I would suggest not to rush as there is some climbing of rocks and ladders involved and it is just best to take your time to avoid injury. Because of the climbing it was a bit cumbersome to have a bag with me so try not to pack too much or have bulky items with you. As long as you are in average/good physical shape, highly recommend this hike!

Good hike . My friends and I wanted to hike table mountain but were unsuccessful because we arrived at the base at 1600h and the cable cars were on strike. We didn't want to risk the chance of injuring ourselves while hiking in the dark and we were told there were thieves on the trails. We opted for lions head cuz it was a shorter hike (~2h up & down). We made to the top for sunset and it was beautiful. Not to mention you also get the full view of Table Mountain, the city and the sea. Bring a jacket because it gets cold at the top. Good for people wanting to hike but are in a cram for time

Stunning Views. We stayed at the base of Lion's Head and took our morning walk around it. Everywhere you look there are views to die for. We had 2 total strangers ask if they wanted them to take our photo, which was awesome. No selfies! Easy hike if you can keep from gawking at the ever changing vistas.
Beautiful views. A good walk followed by some great views that are quite different to table mountain. The walk is a good 90 mins but worth it.

Easy hike to great views, good intro to fynbos plants and geology. The trails were well maintained, and took us to great view points.
We learned a lot about geology of the Cape and the plants and flowers that are unique to the area/

Amazing sunrise hike! . This hike was done on the first morning we had in Cape Town and was perfect! Great way to understand the layout of the city while getting in spectacular views and a great workout. The climb is challenging at times but very doable if you just take your time. The chains and handles are very well placed and even if you decide to turn around at any point, the views are still great! Highly recommend doing this hike early if the day is expected to get warm. The peak can get windy and chilly so layer up and you will be good. Water is a must and enjoy!! You will feel a great sense of accomplishment as you look back up at Lion's Head from sea level and know you got up there!

Beauty which we Couldn't Enjoy due to Heavy Fog. Due to heavy fog we werent able to climb this one....but we are pretty sure of the beauty it offers as the drive to Signal Hill, and then to the base area of Lion Head itself was damn beautiful. Hopefully, better luck next time.
A doable hike. This hike gives you the most beautiful views of Cape Town on all sides. The hike is not very strenuous. Enquire about easy route to take before you start.

A sentinel over the city!. This is one of the 3 main mountains that together comprise Table Mountain. Lions Head lies to the west of the city bowl ,and according to locals, it is a relatively easy walk to do but I think a head for heights is necessary to actually reach the summit.Nothing gives me greater pleasure than to take pics of this World Heritage site - it also evokes memories of a happy childhood spent in Seapoint, with Lion's Head featuring in most family pics!

Blissfull Views. This is a favourite hike amongst the locals and tourists alike. It is most busiest in the summer and during the full moon and don't forget the summer sunsets.It is a pleasant hike that requires a little bit of fitness to climb this 2.5km trek to the top. There are chain ladders that one must go through, however, if you do not trust yourself or the queues are too long for your patiance, there is another route you can use to by pass these.Enjoy the views once at the top.

Great Hike, Amazing Views. Had such a great time hiking up Lions Head. It required moderate fitness level. We took the route with the chains and staples - which was fun. The view at the top is to die for. 360 degree view of Cape Town. Great place to watch the sunset.

A rewarding hike.. Next time we will know the logistics better. We walked all the way from the city center to Noon Gun and further to Signal Hill and further towards Lion's Head and then down to the city. Next time we are probably going to take a taxi to the area at the base of the Lion's Head so we can simply spend more time there. It is an amazing mountain and rewarding hike. The views are unsurpassed anywhere along this hike.

Better hike than Table Mountain!. I would hands down recommend doing this hike over hiking up table mountain. The entire climb up the mountain you have amazing views of table mountain as well as the coast, and the city. The view from the top is simply breathtaking!Hike is good for people of all ages and abilities. It is not too strenuous unless do choose to do the route that requires scaling some ladders.
Short Walk. Best view in Cape Town. An hour to get up and An hour to go down. Beautiful view. From oceaan to City to table mountain. Just do it

My favorite hike in Cape Town. Get up early and head over to Lion's Head. The hike begins with a slowly curving path that circumambulates this downtown landmark. Then it starts to climb in earnest, until you are going up ladders and grabbing onto hand holds to scale a rock face. You end up after about an hour on top of the rock, looking at the best view of Cape Town that I know. The sense of satisfaction will carry you back down, energized and ready for a beer or a bite to eat. Well worth the couple of hours required.

Breathtaking view. I went early in the morning with my local friend to hike this place, it took like an hour and a half or two but it was totally worth it. Incredible feeling to get on top of it, fresh air and amazing view of the beautiful Cape Town.

Great Hike. . Not easy. But doable for most! There are some ladders involved to get all the way to the top. If you go for the sunrise or sunset give yourself plenty of time to make it up at your own pace. An hour and a half seems reasonable.

lion's head at sunrise. Three of us hiked up lions head for sunrise. The views were lovely, but the route is more dangerous than we anticipated, so a torch is a definite must, and a head torch even better for when the path turns from horizontal to vertical! The view from the top was stunning and we even got to see a group of dolphins riding the waves!
Mother/daughter. Beautiful view from Table Mountain, but you can see this from just about anywhere. Took many pictures of this,

Sweet Views!. This was not as spectacular as Table Mountain but totally worth it. Lion Head dominates the skies of Capetown and has stunning views of the beach and ocean from up there. You even have a nice view of Table Mountain. Beautiful mountain that accentuates the beauties of Capetown.

Short and sweet. Great hike for the not-so-keen on hiking.... like me :) Takes about an hour to hour-&-half up depending on how often you stop along the way to enjoy the views. Take your own supply of cold water and a towel to protect you against the heat. Best time to hike is before sunrise..... but be vigilant. Although I've never been a target, I've heard about some robbery incidents. Awesome photo-ops as well.
Beautiful views . Lovely views and there is a walk you can do to the top. Well worth a visit if you are in the area. Weather dependent.

Must do in Capetown if you like outdoor activities. My spouse and our two teenage daughters climbed up the Lion's head. Great views (of the town and the Atlantic oceanside etc...)Moderate activity (take breaks look around)Took a few hours up and backParking at different places up the mountain you can start at.Photos may make it look "treacherous" and you should be careful but it is quite walkable and climbable, up to what ever point you wish.We saw different plants and para gliders as well.People actually took their dogs up the climb (though having to carry them up and down the ladders provided...so if you want to take your pet along it's possible)All in all great activity.We were there in Fall of 2015.My family would like to return to Capetown.We really enjoyed the area.

Awesome experience for the outdoor fans.. everyone told me you gotta climb up Lion's head, and my girlfriend convinced me. we took our three young boys age 7-12 with us, and what an awesome experience it was indeed. The best view of one of the most beautiful cities in the world, so GLAD I did..
Fantastic views. We are fit and found the hike easy. it is dangerous at the top because of overcrowding and careless visitors
Stunning. So worth the quick drive - views are breathtaking! Can take the most incredible photographs from there and get perspective of whole of Cape Town.
Hights and views. I went up with a bunch of friends, my 4th time doing it. The views you get are to die for and the panoramic scene over cape Town is one you'll never forget.

Breathtaking views and fun hike . Really enjoyable hike with ropes and chains at the top for the steep areas. Not for those who do not like heights. Can get busy with queues in peak time. Small amount of fitness required.

If This Is Your First Hike, Get Ready For A Challenge!. This was where I chose to do a hike for the very firs time, and I wish I hadn't! Oh, it's completely beautiful on the way up, but the closer you get to the summit, the more difficult and steep it becomes. By the time I reached the top I was so out of breath I thought I was going to faint! Regardless, the view was definitely the reward. I plan on going back to Lion's Head and do this climb at least two more times....But I'm going to prep at home first by doing some local hikes! If this is your first time hiking, then I suggest you go slow and don't try to keep up with anyone else. Using a guide is a good idea but not entirely necessary as there are many people on the trail at various times of the day. But most importantly, enjoy the view on your way up!

Amazing view of table mountain! . This walk is fantastic on a clear day as you get views over camps bay, Cape Town and of Table Mountain! It's about an hour up and a reasonable walk for those who don't want to walk Table Mountain! At the top there is an option to use the chains and ladders or an easier route- the chains are really cool and it's a good workout! Definitely recommend it if you have a morning or afternoon free in Cape Town!

More than a short hike. I was so surprised when we got to the end of the hike, as it got quite more difficult than I expected, but totally doable. But so worth it as the view was beautiful. Great to see fitter people running up it. Just be patient if you go up during rush hour, as you may wait quite a few minutes to go up the ladder parts. Remember to take plenty of water when going up and a camera for the beautiful views.

Went for a hike up. A really piece of work thereon the shores. And when my colleague suggested to be of a beginner level climb. I was laughing to myself assuming to be a piece of cake and believe me it isn't. There is no chains or support to climb for many places. Overall it's a brilliant experience. A worthy hike to burn some calories.

View for free. Hiking up Lions Head from Green Point via the Signal Hill walk was awesome. The first 2 1/2 hours were like taking a walk and only towards the end of Lions Head did it get slightly more difficult as you had to climb a bit and even use metal bars and chains to support yourself. But once you reached the top you had an amazing all around view. And better than Table Mountain: You do not have to pay one single penny for it!

Best panoramic hike in town. By far my favourite place in Cape Town. Park at the bottom and do the full hike, it lasts about an hour and a half. Teenegars would love it as the top gets a bit tricky. lots of floers everywhere and funnny little dassies calling and jumpin from rock to rocks. The panorama is stunning as you overlook the sea and the coast. Not to be missed!!
Must do in Capetown if you are fit. A Great short but reasonably hard walk/climb to the top for 360 sensational views, make sure you have a headtorch if you climb at sunset

Worth the effort! . Let's get this out up front, this is not an easy walk. You climb ladders at stages and are often walking along paths which are hugging huge cliffs. With the fear and thrill comes the enjoyment of reaching the top. We went at sunset and it was breathtaking! Highly recommended. Ensure you check the weather before taking on the walk.

Great adventure. This hike is perfect for the people that seek real adventure, yet have an average condition. It's not easy though, it's nice and hard. The view above is an amazing 360 degrees. Be sure to come down before sundown, or bring a propper flashlight. It gets pitchblack dark in a half an hour.

Stunning short challenging hike . It's a stunning short hike up to the top with amazing view all the way. Make sure you have good proper hiking shoes and NEVER try this when it rains. The trail especially the top part consists of ladders and chains as aid for climbing up and it's not for the faint hearted or people who has fear for heights. As a frequent hiker myself, I still consider this hike short but technically challenging, would take around 1.5-2hours return. You would need to take a taxi to the starting point of the hike, it seems to be quite a distance away to walk from city center and not sure whether it's safe to do so..
Walking. Amazing views of Cape Town and Table Mountain! The walk turns into a climb as you reach the top so be warned.

"LONG WALK". Me and my wife walked halfway up with my son,my son continued but we turned back as we didnt have appropriate footwear on.My son continued on and we walked back down.Lovely walk,very steep,great views.Will take a good 2 hours plus.

A must-do hike. From the bottom it seems insurmountable but there are chains and handholds in place which make it easy. Much easier to climb than Table Mountain and the view is as good. Very popular with the locals.
Scenic Hike. Starting from the car park is a gradual ascent that turns rocky and ends with a climb. Definitely worth doing with 360* views at the top and the best view of table mountain

Fantastic Climb and Stunning Views but WARNING!. We thoroughly enjoyed our climb to the top of Lion's Head despite the dense fog covering the view on the way to the top. We decided to do Lion's head instead of tabletop because we wanted a shorter hike, it should take around 2 hours to go up and back down again at a 'leisurely' pace. Arguable better than Tabletop as you get to see Tabletop!WARNING! This is not a walk as it was described to us, it is definitely a climb. You have to climb the rocks to get right to the top. There is a proper path around the base of the hill though as an alternative.

A stunning walk without the hustle and bustle of Table Mountain.. Lions Head is a great hike for families. A 40 minute walk up and then a 20 minute walk down. You can also do a smaller round half way up. At the top there are chains to help you climb the steep slopes (or you can walk around). I love this walk with great 360 degrees views of Cape Town. Of course going up Table Mountain should be on your bucket list, but if it's too crowded then go climb up Lions Head. Bring lots of water and go around 8-9am or late afternoon if you want to see the sun set. There is a coffee cart in the morning.
Incredible . Such a stunning hike! The path is well kept and the sunsets are incredible. Definitely a must for any one who visits Cape Town. Just don't be like me and take water with you.
Lion's Head. Lion's Head Mountain, Cape Town, South Africa. Please see my first impression photos. Thank you very much indeed:-)

Awesome Hike . If you are looking for a morning or afternoon hike that is not too strenuous this is a great hike. You will get to see great views of Cape Town and surrounding areas.Always a blessing to do this hike and see the beauty of our country. Great for the adventure tourist.

Lovely view! . It was a fairly easy hike up to the top (almost to the top) . The last part you had to climb up the cliffs which was pretty hard but worth it in the end! Perfect view of Cape Town and Table mountain.

Wonderful and easier than Table Mountain. Lion 's head is an amazing and terrific place.To live in the best way your day, you have to wear comfy or trekking shoes.Lion's head will give you breathtaking views and the feeling to be very small in this amazing world or just to Cape Town ;) .I suggest the next travellers to walk at Lion s head in the early morning!

Most amazing views. I've been up Lion's Head many times, because it really is amazing. Sunset, sunrise, cloudy or sunny - every time I go up is a unique experience. It's a short walk up (and good exercise), with some climbing on ladders and chains which is fixed to the mountain. Pick some snacks and enjoy a lovely picnic at the top, since there is plenty of seating space. There are not many trees (Western Cape vegetation is mostly fynbos), so sunblock is essential. Kids from the age of 6 (with parental assistance) will be comfortable with this hike, but I wouldn't recommend it to the elderly. Do not attempt it on misty / rainy days, since the rock surface gets very slippery.
Awesome hike!. Views from the top are absolutely breathtaking. Despite being a popular hiking trail or tourist hotspot, its still well worth the hike. Sunrise hike is by far the best.

Spectacular!. We climbed this on a weekend so there would be lots of other people around because we were a bit spooked about warnings of being attacked with only 2 of us. Lots of people and very spectacular views. Sometimes a bit nervous about possibility of slipping. A person we know who lives near this says he often sees helicopters near the site rescuing people.
Well worth it. It is necessary to go at the too of Lions if you are at Cape Town. It's a perfect mix between adventure and nice sights. It will not be easy to get the top, but is worth it.

Soul shifting experience. If you are looking for a great hike, peppered with some climbing obstacles to get the adrenalin going then this is the spot. The perfect distance to feel like you are getting in a great workout. The view is beyond spectacular, full 360 view of just mind blowing nature. If you are up for an adventure then go off the track for some bundu bashing and find some secret caves!

Best orientation of the city. It's free and the views are excellent! When the mountain is under high wind or cloud, it's the best place for an all round view! It gives you a great orientation of the lay of the land! Trying going up for sunrise or sunset!

Hike on a small part. Excellent easy walk with rangers on every corner, it's at the right they call it lions head but still part of the table mountain the view is spectacular from there. At the table mountain turn off, go in the opposite direction 1km down the road starts the trail.
The view from the top is worth the climb. Not the easiest of walks/climbs, but worth it when you get to the top! A view that is breath taking literally... after all the climbing.

Lion's Head. Easiest walk to reach one of the summit with spectacular views. There are easier routes on Table Mountain but this is the easiest if you want to reach the top of a peak. This is much lower than Table Mountain but views are as spectacular. Can be done with children over 7 with lots of water and incentives.
great. try to arrive early as it is expensive for just an hour as we didbeautiful placebaboons great to see

The Pinnacle Point. A must hike when you visit Cape Town. Be correctly prepared before you set off as the weather can change. Make sure you wear good shoes. If you are afraid of the ladders you can walk the route however there is a final scramble at the top which could be tricky if you are not too able but you will still see the 360 degree view and it is worth it.

A View without equal. A view without equal in my humble opinion. Lion's Head is a rocky peak 669m high overlooking the City of Cape Town with views down the Twelve Apostles, Clifton, Camps Bay, Bantry Bay and Sea Point and of course the Cape Town Stadium. It is crossed with various walking and trail running paths. Close by on Signal Hill you can even do tandem paragliding with landing taken place on the Sea Point Promenade.
Mrs. Great hike. Not too difficult. Beautiful view of Cape Town from the top. At full moon you can hike up absolutely amazing.

Happy to have made it off the mountain. Hiking up Lion's head was the first real hike i've taken. Many people told us it would be easy..... Halfway through the mountain the hike got extremely difficult. I'm happy to have made it off. Overall, it was a solid feeling of accomplishment but is very difficult for a beginner.

It worth the effort. If you are in Cape Town you have to climb here for the sunset. Maybe it is not for everyone, because there's a couple of steps where you need to be carefull, but if you are in a common shape just do it! The view is amazing and if you are brave enough to step in an isolated rock you will be rewarded with an astonishing picture. Grab your torch and enjoy the way down.
Awesome Hike. Just do it! It was amazing. We did the first morning we were there to get into the sunshine and alliviate jet lag. It did the trick! Awesome!
Don't miss it!. Many people go to Table Mountain in Cape Town but not Lion's Head. In my opinion Lion's Head is a nicer and more fun hike than Table Mountain. So don't miss it.

Mountain with a view. Driving for about 10 minutes from Cape Town CBD. Parkins available and then a steady but steep climb to the top of Lions Head. The view breathtaking. Take water with, especially on a hot day. Not advisable for persons with a fear of heights.

A place that you must conquer!. I suggest best time to hike up Lions Head will be late afternoon around 4pm. The sun will not be too hot during this hour and will take approximately 1 hour to get up to the top (depending on you fitness level and hiking experience). I took the chain and ladder route for more challenge and adrenaline. The view at top is certainly worth dying for.

go with a local if possible. Lion's head walk trail is in the DNA of Capetonians , they love to hike it on weekends with friends. Many also use it as a free gym to have a daily exercise. If you know a Lion's head lover go with him and he will show you also the secret cave, it becoame famous after a blogger put it on his instagram. The view from both the cave and the top are breathtaking. If you fell of vertigo you'll stop almost at the top, but it will still be worth the hike.
Great views. It is quite a climb but I made it and I am not fit! it look me a few rest stops but it is worth it! push yourself to get to the top!

Great experience. Even though you have to walk and even climb in the end it is totally worth the effort. The view from up there is just wonderful and you feel so accomplished after doing a little exercise to get to the top. Not only can you see Captown but you also get a nice view of the Table Mountain. I would suggest to wear good shoes as some of the stones are quite slippery but don't hesitate to go there and don't be afraid of the climbing part. It's not too difficult and there's plenty of ropes and iron handles to hold on to. I'm a little bit afraid of hights but I still managed to get up there.

Visit Wally's Cave halfway up Lions Head. Lions Head is a climb you can do many times. Sunrise, sunset, full moon, Sunday afternoon... Do them all! it will not cost you a sent. In fact, you are so much richer after you've done it. Also, try and make a visit to the famous Wally's Cave on your way up the mountain. It's a little bit trickier to find, so I recommend you do it with someone who has done the path before. It's worth your while.

A stunning view of the coast. We attempted this walk for the first time and were worried about safety but were pleasantly surprised to see so many people walking up to Lions Head. It gets a bit steep in some places and quite rocky. We had taken our breakfast there and ate while watching the beauty down below. Fun but you need to be quite fit!

Good to see when table mountain is closed. I cannot say if it is better than table mountain but as the table was closed, we were at lions and at the end of the day the colours are really beautiful ! Go right now ;-)

Breathtaking Views!. I'm not the fittest of people but made it to the top. (make sure you wear comfortable walking / hiking shoes) Took me just over an hour, could've been less but the views were just so amazing and had to stop to take pics. (remember to take your camera along) The spectacular views make such awesome photographs (memories) and you get to see, just how BEAUTIFUL CAPE TOWN really is! Great excursion for overseas visitors and if you are from Cape Town and you've never been, make the effort to go up Lion's Head.

Amazing view!. I am not fit at all but I can do it! So do you! It took me around 3 hours to the top.We started at 7.00 am. The trail is quite steep in some part but with proper pair of shoes, you can do it for sure.You need your both hands for this trail so try not to bring heavy stuffs with you.( I bought the trip from an agency, my female guide was awesome)
Great exercise, great view. The hike is not the easiest but the whole walk offers an amazing view, so if you do not make it to the top you will still have a lovely experience.

Always something different.. Depending how lucky you are with the weather. You can have different experiences. I normally take students there for photographic workshops. Great place to spend time. Take a some snacks and bottle of wine and relax and watch the sun go down. Or do something sporty.

Hiking for womens day,even though we unfit we did it too. This was quite an adventurous experience for me ,especially those chains and clip to get to the top was scary but i did it for fun.Take your camera,comfortable shoes,sun hat,snacks and water and bring along kids or family and friends and enjoy that cape town view from the top of the mountain.Its doable even for children but be careful of slips on rocks and old tree roots.You can even bring your dogs with.

Beautiful hike with stunning views. Lion's Head offers a incredible hike with some moderate (optional) climbing near the end. The trail is very safe, but you should still go as a couple/group. I went to the mountain alone, but quickly found a group of people to hike with. Hikers are always nice people. It's true that the hike can be a bit difficult, however as long as you are careful it's certainly doable for anyone willing to hike it.

Decent Climb for View. This is a hike, albeit a scenic hike that will take you to great views overlooking Cape Town and the Atlantic seaboard. The paths are easy and the pace gentle but you need a bit of dexterity for the ladders and chains.
Get moving. Very good for a nice quick climb and watch the sun rise or sun set as you see the city come to life in the night. Really an easy spiral joy..

A perfect weekend morning. My girlfriend and I love the outdoors and we did Lion's Head for the first time.
It was great, the views amazing, the paths very visible.
My advice is to familiarize yourself with all routes as there can be a wait at the ladders and chains. There is a longer route to the top and it is just as fun.
Lions Head. Very nice place to see CTP from TOP, you can also enjoy Paragliding, drive to to is very good and scenic.
Gorgeous Views. Such a fun hike with gorgeous views of the city. A little steep/difficult at times - would not recommend for the very young or very old.
August 2016. Wonderful experience. Loved the climb and the views. Great seeing Cape Town from so high up. Very relaxed climb

Quite a climb. We were told this is an easy walk. It is not. This is quite a steep very rocky climb which would be very intimidating if you are afraid of heights. The trail winds around the mountain and is very narrow in places with large sheer drops to the side. Then you climb up vertical rock faces with metal steps attached to the rock and chains to hang on to. Don,t take your grandmother or very young kids. Having said that it is an awesome climb and well worth the effort for the fantastic views from the top. Sensational sunset from here.

Fun times. Lions head will always have a special place in my heart as it was the last activity I did with my late father. Now whenever I have the chance I would walk up. You get a breath taking 360 view of the City. The view at Sunset is even better but it can get a bit nerve wrecking climbing down when it is dark. It is worth a while to take a hike up.
lion's head. beautiful view of nature, the sea, the sun, the wind, the fauna and the flora and of course lion's head and the hiking trails

On a clear day you can see for miles. The Lions head can be impressive , but it is weather dependent. If you are lucky it is a worthwhile visit. Be prepared of it to be windy and or chill depending on the season
Natural pyramid . One can get a good view of the Lion's head on the way up to the Table Mountain.It looks like a natural pyramid. Had captured this stunning pic through the cableway

A fantastic Climb , worth the sweat! THE VIEWS ARE AMAZING!. I climb lions head as often as I can, the view never gets boring , and with so many different parts and ways to climb it you can try a different route every time if you want.Although most people go up the traditional way, the first part being the worst as the gradient of the sandy slope is a bit steep, after that you pretty much walk up steps and rocks spiraling in a round a bout fashion until you reach the top.I recommend first timers don't go on the chains and ladders and rather opt for the slightly more tame route around, so ask people for some direction if you are not sure.also always wear hiking shoes or sneakers and comfortable exercise gear, DON'T do this hike in jeans and sandals, its a hike not a walk.You should be able to make it up to the top in about 40 minutes if you are relatively fit , and you will want to take water with you in a light backpack as there are no water points.its also advisable to go in a group of people and not alone, especially if you are a first time climber, also try go early morning in summer as it gets hot, and busy. winter although not as hot is busy on a good weather day as its a favorite activity for locals to climb this amazing mountain.

Amazing trek. Had a good hike to the top.
AStarted early morning so weather was nice.
Lots of people there of all ages, all friendly.
Great view from the top.

Awesome views!. Go early because it gets windy later in the day sometimes!
Camera was doing overtime😊 So many amazing views of Cape Town- camps bay and beyond.
It's a good uphill trek so wear layers and good shoes- definitely take water and energy snacks- no break up on the hill.
A must do activity when you visit Cape Town

Best attraction of Cape Town. You can't see Table Mountain when on Table Mountain. Climb/hike up Lions Head and you see the best view of Cape Town. You only need to be semi-fit. If you can walk 5km without much problems, you can do this. Not suitable for people that have extreme fear of heights and or bad knees, but kids/teenagers and elderly can do it!

Great walk to blow away the cobwebs!. Lovely walk for a couple of hours to get a spot of exercise in the easily accessible country. It feels a million miles away from the city up there!Make sure you take the longer trail path around the back for a much nicer nature experience away from the crowds :)

Full-moon hike gives unique CT experience. My friends and I climbed up Lion's Head to see the full moon over Cape Town. We started around 7:30pm, and were told that the hike would be a short 45 minutes up. The path was more challenging than we expected, and it took us around an hour and half to get up the mountain. To get to the top, it is a bit more of a rock scramble. Pay attention to the path up--it is hard to see in the night & we got lost once! Other than the path being a bit more rugged than we expected, Lion's Head is an absolutely ideal hiking destination in Cape Town! The views are incredible all the way up (we stopped multiple times for pictures). On top, there is plenty of flat space to snack, rest, and take in the view. For a unique experience in Cape Town, Lion's Head is not to be missed!
Very nice town. Very nice place to visit. Beautiful beach and nice restaurants. If you ever around that area, you must see the lighthouse.
Best in the world. Great exercise with the most rewarding views at the top. Best to go in groups and a stock of water to stay hydrated.
Must visit. You haven't been in mother country if you don't climb some mountains :). THere is an option to either hike or take the easy way by transportation

Every day Easy. We walk up Lions Head as often as we can. The views are fantastic and it's a good bit of exercise... The only thing that annoys me is seeing people litter as there aren't any bins! If you're a smoker, please take something to put your buds in, and if you can carry that bottle of water or candy up with you it won't kill you to keep the empty wrapper till you come back down! Our mountains are beautiful and we'd like to keep them that way!!

Afternoon Hike. Our hotel travel advisor recommended this hike for amateur hikers. It took us about 2 hours to do the entire thing, and it was a little difficult, but easily manageable to anyone who is physically able to hike long distances, climb rocks, and lift their body weight for some portions of the climb. I would not recommend it to anyone with bad knees or who is afraid of heights. Although the climb was a bit challenging towards the top, the view was incredible and it was a lot of fun climbing it. You can still see amazing views halfway up the walking path (small incline, well-maintained, about 20 minutes up the mountain) if you are not an adventurous climber or if you are traveling with children. You have breathtaking views of Table Mountain the whole way up. We had our hotel taxi drop us off at the entrance, then we called him to pick us up when we were done. Give yourself enough time to climb down before sundown, and I wouldn't recommend attempting this in wet conditions. We did not need a map or a tour guide to navigate the trail, it is well maintained and easy to navigate. Overall, an amazing experience and the highlight of our trip!

Great 360 degree view of Cape town. Great hike and views as the reward, fairly comfortable start for hike but gets a little steeper near the top.At the top you get a perfect view of all parts of Cape Town which is one of the prettiest cities in the world.Weather can change very quickly so I'm back pack make sure you have jacket and lots of water and happy hiking.

So fun we hiked it twice!. Fabulous little hike. We liked it so much we woke up early to do it a second time on our last day. Circling around the mountain ensures amazing views for the entire route. And the “chains” route with a couple of ladders and two or three spots where you climb up using metal handholds and chains is delightful. We hadn’t heard about this hike before going, but it’s a must do!

Beautiful scenery.. It is a good hike to the top and the view is worth the effort. There are some chains and step ladders to help with the difficult parts but the climb is not too hard. The climb can be dangerous, so don't take risks as their have been multiple deaths and injuries. Also do not attempt this alone, take a friend and if you are going up for sunset make sure to take a group as it can be dangerous at night.

AMAZING Sunset Hike. We did a sunset hike on a relatively clear day/evening and it was INCREDIBLE. Honestly the view was better than Table Mountain because you could see over both sides (Sea Point on one side and City Centre on the other). Sunset was at 5:50ish and we started hiking at 4:15 at a medium pace and we made it with about 20 minutes to spare.
Lions Head. Passed by. Lots of pictures, interesting site. Must seegood for families. Enjoyed very much this scenic area

Take plenty of water and wear shoes with grip!. Decided to climb to the top on a whim without doing any research. It's not that easy! And I've done a few actual summit climbs (eg. Mt Rinjani, Mt Kinabalu) before. It only takes a few hours but the last half an hour gets pretty steep, tricky and easy to lose your footing. It was a clear sunny day but a bit windy, but I'd be wary to go up if it was very windy or had been raining as it would get quite dangerous at parts. Take plenty of water and shoes with grip helps. Views at the top are incredible and so worth the slog!
Vacation in South Africa. Excellent view of the surroundings and a good atmosphere. You can take a trip on cable car or a long climb up which needs a real stamina

Awesome climb, but avoid weekend crowds. We hiked/climbed up Lions Head on a Sunday, starting around 11 am. The low parts of the hike are easy, with things getting progressively more difficult the higher up you get. Once we got up to "the chains" there was a big tail back of people waiting to get up so we headed around the "easy route". Suggestion from a friend later on was to avoid the crowds on the weekends entirely. But regardless, we got to the top and it was an awesome view. Totally worth it! Took us 2 hours from Camps Bay to the summit, so we guess around 1.5 hours from the base (taking it easy).
Great hiking adventure. Great hike, definitely recommend the harder trail to the peak which includes some actual vertical climbing. Great view from the top with some good photo opp spots.
My first hike. What an awesome hike, the views are amazing and well worth a few calf cramps. Going up is a bit steep in certain areas but coming downs much easier. Quite busy on a Sunday

Well worth the hike. This attraction offers beautiful natural sites and you are spoilt with the views of natural vegetation.
You can drive up to a certain point to catch the sun set and the view of the coastline
VIew from a boat. We were on our way to Boulders Beach and the guide pointed to a rock formation on the mountain top that really looked like a lion's head.
A great hike with unforgettable views of the cape.. This hike will take you about 2 hours. It gets tough at the top but what a view!! Sometimes you've got to work for the good stuff.

Easy Climb. The views as a 360 over Cape Town from beaches to city-bowl, are great! Yes, the first 200m on the gravel incline is huffy and puffy, but from then and coming down (even the climb section is easily scaleable) if you're remotely fit, it's a fun and scenic climb.
Sweeping views but often crowded.. This is a really beautiful hike. Perfect for a family outing. This is a very popular hike amongst locals and tourists so it can get very crowded.
Good climb. Starts off as a long slight incline then becomes a fairly serious climb involving hands at some points- amazing views from the top though.
Wonderfully Maintained with incredible views. An early morning hike with wonderful views. The trail was excellently maintained and very safe. Beautiful!

Great hike but avoid if you don't like heights. My husband, two teenage daughters and I decided to walk up Lion's head last Sunday. The first part on the pathway is manageable and pleasant but unfortunately I don't really like heights. I kept going with my very patient husband encouraging me every step of the way despite the path becoming steps. Finally I looked up and to me it appeared a steep climb so I sat the remainder out. The others carried on to the top which took them a further 20 minutes. Of note I skipped down the mountain!!! Superb views of Cape Town and Camps Bay.

Must Do!. This isn't a "must see", it's a "must do". Unlike table mountain, there isn't an option to ride to the top. Everyone hikes... All the way. This isn't "easy" hiking. And some parts are moderate to strenuous. Take water, wear sunscreen, and call Uber for a ride. It was $4 USD and we were staying at 12 apostles, Pretty far out. Would do this again, but I'll wear better walking/hiking shoes, not my flimsy tennis shoes.

Lovely little hike.. If I lived in cape town I would do this every week. Depending in how you take it, this could take you as short as an hour and a quarter to more than three hours. There is a little short cut you can take up on some securely fixed chains and ladder, which can also be avoided if you're not feeling adventurous. Great views of table mountain and all over cape Town on a clear day, but if it's cloudy you may not see very much at all at the summit. Which is a good excuse to try the climb again on another day
Not what I expected.. Saw this on part of our day tour around the area with African Eagle Day Tours. Was part of the outstanding scenery right across the are.
Easy Hiking. Great hiking trail leads you to the top of Lions Head. Hike itself is fairly easy going. A little climbing, but not strenuous or frightening. The views from atop are magnificent.
Hike up lions Head. If you are looking for a breathtaking view and a good workout a hike up lions head is for you! super fun.

Lovely hike for whole family. The hike is great for the whole family but tends to be busy during summer so I advise you arrive early to get a head start and parking easily. It is short enough for you to do quickly, requiring less replenishment. There is safe parking with car guards closer to the start. on very

"Easy Stroll" - Fantastic Views. I love this walk! The downside may be that everyone else does too. On the weekends it can get rather busy. So start early.It is well worth the effort. The popular route spirals around Lions head with an easy rock scramble at the end. The views along the route of the CBD and Cape Town's Atlantic Sea Board more than make up for it.

Though walk but worth the view. Lion head is a beautiful place to enjoy a wonderful climb/hike when the sun is shining. The car can be parked at the bottom of the path. First part untill the paragliding point is easy to walk but with a steep slope, after that, the path changes in boulders that function like stepping stones untill the top. It is not recommended to walk here in the rain since stones can become wet and slippery. No fences are even at some steep points which may be dangerous.The view is wonderful of cape town, you walk in a 360 degree circle around lions head which allows you to see the entire city.

A spectacular walk by day and by night. This is an iconic Cape Town location. Beautiful to look at. Wonderful to walk. Lots of tourists go there and enjoy the walk. The ful moon walk is a definite must do. You will see many others doing this unique and spectacular amble. Take care. Take a flashlight if doing the night walk at full moon. Dress warmly with layers. Enjoy.
Great hike . Beautiful climb to the top with amazing views of all Cape Town as you go up. Took us about a hour to get to the top for some excellent photos!!

Great hike with fantastic views of the city, table mountain and the see. This is not a very strenuous hike, hardest part is actually the steep gravel road before the trail that winds around Lions Head, it can get quite busy by the chain ladders, but if you continue along the pathway past them you come to a section with a bit of Rock scrambling that will take you to the top.
Nice activity!. It does not take you too much time but we prepared to climb on ladders and higher rocks! Take some water with as well as you will get thirsty.

Mr Ian. The drive up Lions head is most impressive views perfect photo haven so many places to stop off and take amazing photos of famous Table Mountain and the city of Cape Town when i reached the top top point of Lions Head you park your car and go for a awesome hike on a well located path if you need to get a bit higher for more epic photos of coast line it's really a beautiful view point a must visit guys enjoy.
Great Sea View. Took a boat tour and captured some great pictures. Very clear, beautiful waters and gorgeous towns nestled along this shore.

A sunset hike is beautiful!. You can challenge yourself or take the easy route and the view is beautiful. It is extremely popular so you will confront a lot of other people, but I met a guy from the UK and we walked down together after sharing interesting conversation so that's a plus!

What an amazing hike!. Hands down, one of the best hikes I have ever done. I had no idea what to expect. You reach a point on the trail that gives you the option "non-strenuous route or ladders and chains" of course my kids opted for the ladders and chains route. It was challenging and a little scary at some points, you are using chains and ladders to climb up vertical faces on the rocks. This hike is so worth it when you reach the top. The views are incredible.

Great way to spend a Saturday morning. We are actually regulars on Lion's Head, it's a great way to out in the open, get some fresh air and it's even kid and dog friendly (provided you have a permit for the furry kids!)At a nice brisk pace you can reach the top in under an hour. Pack breakfast and enjoy the view!

Nice short hike . Parking is available at the base of the hike with a security guard in place. The clearly demarcated hiking trail starts off to the west and bends all the way around Lion's head until you reach a section of climbing facilitated by chains, walkways and ladders. The top of the hike reveals a panoramic view of the whole of Cape Town. The hike is an easy and short one.
"It is possible". Hiked up Lions Head several times, very popular route, trail is well set out, accessible even in darkness but with torches, great all round views, highly recommended.

''Great view''. The city of cape town is magnificent while going up to the table mountain one can see the lions head . one can also go the place by hiking it would be fun and tiring but in the end it will be worth each drop of sweat, the nature has made the place so beautiful and kept it like that for ages,

Sunset hike/Full Moon. We hiked up so we could see the sunset from the top of Lion's Head. It was incredible. As the sun set, we watched all the lights in Cape Town come on at the same time. It was breathtaking. The hike up was strenuous. There are ladders and chains you have to use to climb up the mountain. We saw the full moon rise from the top of Lions' Head and light up everything. We climbed down Lion's Head using the light from the moon and our headlamps.

Very difficult, worth the view!!. the hike to the top of lions head is beautiful the entire way up. not really sure where it gets the "easy" reputation from because it is a lot of climbing up rocks and all up hill one way and down the other. that being said absolutely do it!!! especially go when the weather is nice
Magnificent view. Be ready to get tied, but the view is worth it. Not to be missed, and if you come prepared it could be the best part of the day.

Fabulous views, exhilarating hike!. My favorite views of Cape Town were from the top of lions head. We took the main trail up to the top and it is not for the faint of heart. The first 3/4ths are pretty easy but the last quarter is up a cliff but there are chains to help you climb. It was worth the effort!

Nice climb with fantastic views. The climb to the top of Lions Head was one of the highlights of our visit to CT. The trail takes you around the mountain giving you views from every angle and finally 360 degree views when you get to the top.
A climb to cherise!. Such an awesome climb... Anyone that is capable of walking should do it! Even although we climbed in part mist n drizzle, I loved every minute!

Beautiful views of Table Mountain and Cape Town. A moderate 1.5 hour hike to the top rewards you with a beautiful 360 view of Cape Town and Table Mountain. Bring a flashlight if you are hiking up to see the sunrise as it's quite dark in the early morning.

The second best hike. If you can't or don't want to do table mountain, this is your 2nd best bet. The hike is amazing and it's not very long. No need to go with a guide here, it's safe and there are always plenty of travelers.

Worth the effort. Its a great walk and well worth the effort. We took it slowly and reached the top in 90 minutes. The chain ladders are great fun. I am 70 years old and managed the climb but it can be hard on the knees!
Wonderful view at the top.

On Top of the world. This is my favourite hike in Cape Town. Do not miss this experience. Be careful though - even though the mountain isn't that high - there are areas that one has to be cautious. While hiking around Lions Head stop and look at the spectacular view around you. One area you see Camps Bay beneath you and while you are walking around the mountain you then come across the City of Cape Town and further along the Atlantic Seaboard and beyond. Magnificent!

Well worth the climb. View forever. Enjoy the path that curves around the mountain as you climb higher. You can use the circular path or climb all the way to the top. Going all the way up requires that you are agile. Fantastic outdoor activity. Go with other people for safety.

A good hike with awesome views. It's a great hike. Difficult for beginners and if out of shape, and easy if you hike often. Some steep portions scare people off. The last portion of the hike is a bit steep too. Bring Water and sunscreen and a hat. Go early in the morning if possible. There's a great stall at the bottom where they offer fruit juice drinks.

Fun hike! . Takes about 45-60 minutes to get up the mountain. You walk along a nice dirt road and then around a bunch of rocks. There are some chains and ladders that can be hectic but fun. Highly recommend a sunrise or sunset hike. Beautiful views of the city and the Camps Bay Area from the top!
Wonderful sun set. Went up to the LionsHead to watch the sunset. Fantastic. Well worth the trip. Would advise wearing warm clothing as it gets very cold towards evening in June
Best way to start your day. A good uphill and climb, no need for a backpack and always has the best views of the city. sunrise or sunset is best!
Don't Miss- hike Lion's Head!. The entire hike is beautiful and overlooks the ocean and the city. It is relatively easy, close to 2 hours up and down, and the view is spectacular.
Good alternative hike. Hiked up to the top during the week. Amazing views of the Cape. we hired 'Hike Table Mountain' guide service to show us around. Very good idea.

Awesome views. The view from the top is absolutely stunning and amazing. The walk provides a scenic view of beautiful Cape Town. It took us about four hours to climb up and down. One feels being on top of the world. We expected a much easier walk.
Worth the drive. If you have a spare day while in Cape Town, the drive around the Cape is worth the drive. Going out to Lions Head takes some time, so plan on a block of time to do this.

Great Hike in Cape Town!. My wife and I hiked Lion's head on a weekday in early June, taking approximately 1 hour to get to the top (where we had a picnic lunch, followed by another hour hike down). This is a great short hike that's accessible from Cape Town. It offers some of the best views of Table mountain and the "12 Apostles" peaks along the west coast of the Cape peninsula. This is a moderately-challening hike, with a few places where scrambling is required (and/or using the ladders bolted to the mountain). The trailhead is on Signal Hill Road. Take note that the only toilets are at the Table Mountain Park entrance (not at the trailhead).

Must do when in Cape Town. Amazing views, it wasn't that busy, but we had amazing weather and the view at the top was beautiful. Loved it, the way down is harder and we had muscle aches for 3 days... Haha

Worth every step. We climbed (walked) the opposite side to most people because it was a beautiful day and just about everyone in Cape Town decided they wanted to climb Lions Head, but it was beautiful and there was good spirit. A definite must if you are a traveller
Great hike. This is a challenging walk but if you are looking for some exertion on your Cape Town trip along with spectacular views, this is the walk for you.

This Lion will bite ....... Being a bit overweight, I was hesitant to tackle the hike to the top of this iconic landmark in Capetown. I thus spent about a month conditioning myself by taking my lunchtime and walking up the first section of the trail about halfway around Lion's Head. I need not have been so concerned - if you take a relaxed stroll and don't try to set any speed records, you can make it to the top without being Superman. The steeper sections have nice chains to hold on to and remember to keep to the RIGHT hand path going up and the LEFT hand path going down. Once you get to the top and have your breathing under control, be prepared to lose your breath again as you take in the best views of Table mountain, Devils peak, Cape-town, 12 Apostles, Robben Island and Clifton that will get anywhere in the Cape.
Spectacular view.. For avid trekkers. Lion'a Head is a must while in Cape Town. The views from the summit are simply amazing especially during sunset.
Hike it, awesome. great hike and the payoff is the view. Trail is easy to follow and there are lots of hikers, so you never feel as though you have to worry about being somewhere you should not be.

A beautiful almost iconic spot. Another big rock and another sexy name - not to decry this particularly beautiful spot which offers delightful views from it and to it. also a mighty fine walk if you're in the mood, well prepared and the weather's clement.

Go for the sunrise. I went up on lions head for sunrise as many times as I managed to wake up that early. I can only say I highly recommend it (and highly recommend to bring breakfast too). It's magical.
The Best View. For the best view of Cape Town and Table Top Mountain, climb up Lion's Head. The hike should only take around 45 to reach the summit.
Lovely!. Lion's Head in Cape Town is a hill/ mountain that you can hike in about 2-3 hours. Views of the city from here are scenic and spectacular. Recommended

Quick but excellent Hike. We did this hike with 30 students. We choose Lion's head instead of Table Mountain because we were with such a big group. It took us +/- 2 hours to get to the top with a stunning sunset. Make sure you bring a phone with flashlight for the walk down.
Scenic view. This view was the view you only see in travel brouchers. Absolutley stunning and amazing. Try to go on a sunny day too see these awesome views.

Get up, then get up!. Even on a misty, drizzly morning coming up for sunrise was spectacular. The city comes to life beneath your feat as the sun kisses all the valleys around you. Push on to the summit, your climb is worth it!
The views!. A great hike. Easy most of the way with a few little challenges to keep things exciting. Found getting down harder than getting up. Thoroughly enjoyed

Bird's Eye view. One of the most rewarding activities to do in Cape Town. The walk provides a 360 view of beautiful cape town. Can be done during the day but also night time hiking on full moon days offer a unique experience. 2 to 3 hour hike up and down depending on fitness level. My 7 year old boy did it in 3 hours at a gentle pace with multiple stops. My favourite activity in Cape Town hands down.
Hike. We took about two hours to hike up and down (being sick slowed us down). We headed up in the morning around 7 and the best views ever. Close to the reliable City Bus.

A good hike, but not for the acrophobic. A good stiff hike, esp. near the top. There are chains, staples and ladders to assist getting to the very top, so, if acrophobic might present issues. The views of the city Center, Table Mountain, Camp's Bay and the ocean are incredible.A custom is to be up there for sunset with wine and cheese. Doing that without a good headlamp or flashlight could endanger one's life on the way down.

beautiful View. we travelled via a booked excursion from our hotel. My Uncle who was recovering from major surgery coped well with the excursion which was uphill then a steep cable car ride to the top. The views are stunning, you can see Robin Island and a wonderful vista of the whole of Cape town and beyond. Unfortunately there are lots of tourists but I guess this is such an iconic place.

Stunning views of Cape Town, Camps Bay and Table Mountain.. If you only have time to do Table Mountain of Lion's Head, I'd recommend the latter. The views are incredible, and you actually get to see Table Mountain. It's particularly good to do on a slightly windy day when the table cloth is on the mountain, as you'll see it rolling off - mesmerising. It's about a 1-2hr hike depending on where you start - it's not difficult and absolutely worth it.

Perfect short hike. This is a perfect short hike that gives amazing views of Table Mountain and the surrounding areas. There is a small parking area right across from where the trail starts. It starts off as a wide path, and the views on the way up are stunning. The path narrows and gets steeper, and at a couple places there are rungs and chains that you can scale, or bypass for an easier route. It can get chilly at the top so take a jacket.

Short and sweet, but quite steep. Nothing like as strenuous as climbing Table Mountain but very worth while for the exercise and the views. Some ladders at the top but nothing too difficult. Flip flops not recommended. I took it at a run - 45 mins up, 30 down, but a more leisurely approach could comfortably double those times.

Must do. I am a person who is terrified of heights and I did regret going up. I was proud I made it almost to the peak. Please if you really do have a fear of heights or climbing do not go up. The view is amazing from the top but be warned it is not easy for those afraid of heights.One recommendation is that the recommended path be clearly marked out where it splits from the difficult path on the way backd own

SUNRISE OR SUNSET, ESPECIALLY ON A FULL MOON AND YOU WILL EXPERIENCE ONE OF THE BEST, INNER-CITY HIKES IN THE WORLD. Whether you are on your own, with a friend, a group of friends or your dog, you simply must do this hike, either at Sunrise or Sunset (or both). Do'able for even the most ardent couch-surfer, you will be handsomely rewarded for very little effort as the trail, like the people you will meet, is friendly, luring you to the top with a visual display every step of the way. It is safe at most times, as there is a constant stream of locals and tourists alike, from 05h30 - 12h00pm (midnight). Always pack a warm top, water (or wine) and a sense of humour as the weather in Cape Town is notoriously fickel and you dont want to have to hurry this one. Go up early and watch the sun rise over the distant Helderberg Mountains, whilst simultaneously watching the moon descend into the sea and rise in Rio. The muted traffic tones drifiting upwards, reminds you, you are in the middle of one of the most beautiful cities in the world. Depending on your fitness, allow anything from 25 minutes to 1 hour to get to the top, and there are many places to sit and absorb the visual feast along the way. Pack some food and fine Cape wine and savour the views and social atmosphere at the top. You will be back!

Beautiful Fitness Spot. If you looking to have a nice run, with a really amazing view then Lion's head is a wonderful place to do that. I would recommend doing the trip as earlier as possible as it is quiet a popular location in cape town. There is plenty of parking around just be careful of the narrow roads. The hike is medium level difficulty. Once you get to the top the view is amazing and really enriching. I've done it several times and would recommend it to anyone.

Views to die for!. The drive might be hair raising with all its curves but definitely a must do in the area. Safe but rugged trails all over. Sunny day best for long range views including seeing the horses on the beach from 500 ft away

This is not easy. The mountain is gorgeous and so close to wherever you are in Cape Town - so why not climb? Well one reason to avoid lion's head is because it is dangerous (no guard rails, no water, there can be lots of people). Lion's head is hard (a long uphill walk to get to the steep rocks and the lots of scrambling for uphill traction). Lion's head requires muscles (going up the chains..... Nuff said). Having said all this -- the lion's head is a glorious adventure. The views all the way up are terrific, the feeling of accomplishment when you get to the summit is worth the effort. I was 63 yrs when I climbed it the first time and I have been back several times since. I strongly recommend the climb - but don't expect it to be easy. Bring water, good hiking shoes and sunscreen.

Beautiful!. have done this hike a few times during day and night. recommend bringing head lamps although can also use your phone if you need. would be nice to bring a picnic up on top. if you want to find the cave you should look up directions prior. it's not something you are likely to come across on your own

Amazing hike with amazing views. I've done this hike a couple of times already, and the views on it never cease to amaze me. The top of Lion's Head is the perfect spot to view the sunset, as well as to view the lovely city of Cape Town. This hike should definitely be on one's bucket list when visiting Cape Town

Has to be one of the most scenic hikes you will ever do!. Living in one of the most beautiful cities in the world,one has so much choice of spectacular outdoor activities which many locals take for granted but as a visitor to Cape Town ,a hike up Lions head is a MUST.For the relatively fit, it should take anything from 45 - 75 minutes but don't be fooled ,it's not as easy a hike as it seems.Gravel is loose,and the steps are uneven so be sure to wear sturdy shoes. Preferably proper hiking boots or decent trainers ,not like some fools who go up in flip flops!You can get to the top faster by using the chains (which I prefer) or if the idea makes you a little nervous then there is a slightly longer,less steep, route around.Views throughout the hike are spectacular and you get a 360degree view of the city!The full moon hike is extremely popular, as well as very busy!!Even better is to go up earlier,have a picnic at the top ,watch the sunset from the one side and then the full moon rise from the other...it's the most breathtaking sight!!But coming down can be tricky with it being so busy,make sure you have a flash or headlight and take it slow.Whether morning,afternoon or evening, always make sure you have enough water to keep hydrated.Another thing you don't want to forget is your camera but better to leave other valuables at home!!One word of advice ...be careful and ideally ,don't go up alone.
On top of the world!. It's not too difficult to reach the Summit and once you do, you are treated to one of the most incredible city views in the world! This is a must for anyone visiting Cape Town.

Stunning, Fun, and a MUST. My wife and I spent 6 hours walking all around the mountain and taking photos. You can get up in about 45 minutes if you'd really like and it has amazing views of both the sea and the surrounding mountains and towns. If you really want to have some fun, spend some time researching other paths and caves that are on the mountain (like Wally's Cave). A quick Google Search of "wheres-wally-how-to-find-wallys-cave-lions-head" is the guide we used. Seriously - incredible views. To see some of our photos around Cape Town look up our #MutzInSouthAfrica tag on Instagram!
A spectacular view. Not for those not in shapeMy kids did it and and had a blastI saw pix and glad I didn't try the climb!!
Even better views than Table Mountain!. This is where you want to be for the sunset! Bring a flashlight and a bottle of wine, and you've got yourself a lovely plan for the evening!

360degree views of Cape Town coastline & city. Just a 45 minute walk to the top (for most). The route wraps around the Lions Head mountain and stunning views across at Table mountain. Not technical nor difficult climb. One section with two easy ladders, but you can walk around rather. Safe for young children and even dogs make it up to the top. Even seen mothers carrying toddlers in chairs on their backs! Lots of space to relax on the rocks once you reach the top.
A great Walk!. This is a great walk. You can do it in about 45 mins up and down if you are fit, if not then 1.5 hours is ample to take your time and enjoy the views.

Nice walk to the top!. Firstly, Lions Head is a popular walk so if you go at peak hours you can expect bottle necks and slow moving hikers on your way up and down. The path is easy for all levels most of the way, as it conveniently wraps around the mountain for an easier traverse up. Its only the last section that turns into more of a direct up route, with a bit a scramble up the rocks and up a few ladders at one point. I saw people of all ages and fitness levels making it to the top. Just take it slowly and be careful. The views from the top are fantastic and well worth the hike.

An amazing climb with rewarding views. Completed the climb on our last day. It was so fitting to see the views over Cape Town as the day ended. Parts of the climb are physically demanding, needing your hands to assist. There are metal ladders and chain ropes so it is not for the faint hearted. It is very exposed to the elements so check the weather before you go. The sun began to set as we reached the top. Some brave climbers descend in the darkness with head torches! At the top we were lucky enough to meet an experienced Lion's Head climber who took us down a different route. Much faster, but without him I'm not sure we would have risked a different path!

Sunset to remember. Took a nice short hike to the mountain top for sunset. Stunning views and friendly athmosphere as it really is popular! Just be carefull about footwear - the last part is more demanding technically.

Spectacular Panoramic Views. We took a challenging route to see a cave about halfway up. Was fairly strenuous in parts, rock climbing and with some assistance with chains and ladders. I understand the main path is easier, though near the top may be tough for some. The view is spectacular! You can see Capetown, Table Mountain, Camps Bay, Clifton, the Twelve Apostles, the gorgeous water. And it's a shorter hike than to the top of Table Mountain. I'm in reasonable shape and was short of breath in a few places. The top is worth the climb!

Beautiful hike. An easy hike until almost the top. The very top is very steep and has chains and ladders to climb up. Great views over CBD and Camps bay. Tiny caves offer a good shade if you would like to sit down and meditate.
Lovely but not safe. Abslolutely love climbing Lion's Head but it's become dangerous as there are a lot of muggings so please, please, please go in a fairly large group.

Worth the hike!!. Do not think to leave Cape town without climbing up the Lion's Head..!! Amazing experience, ultra magnificent views of the city and it's only one hour walk up.. Climbing Lion's Head is number One of the must do's in Cape town!
Awesome view. Climbed by my partner, an awesome experience and amazing view. a great sense of achievement. Not for the feint hearted.

One of my highlights. The climb up was very doable, could be quite scary in some places, scaling ladders, chains and rocks.
The view from the top was definitely worth the climb.

Visit to Lion's Head. I actually went to Table Mountain but as the queue was over an hour long I left and stumbled instead on Lion's Head which is not far away. I was not disappointed. It's not a hard climb and suitable for all ages, and the views of Cape Town and the Ocean are spectacular.

Get a different perspective of Cape Town . Lovely short hike up lions head will give you great views of what Cape Town has to offer. We did it instead of table mountain because of the mist, and the view from lions head was still clear enough to see some landmarks. Views of camps bay, the CBD, waterfront, Table Mountain and signal hill can be seen. Can be quite strenuous for unfit people, but taken at a slow pace everyone can do it. If you do it on a weekend or full moon, expect it to be busy. Would recommend a weekday or early morning on weekends or public holidays.

Sunset hike up Lion's Head. Great hike up the winding trail on Lion's Head. More strenuous that it appears. Have to go up some iron ladders and in a few places you need to grab the rock to step up. Amazing views all the way to the small table top summit. Right after the sun set - spectacular view - the hordes (maybe 40 people on top) began the descent. Just have to be careful not to slip on the gritty rocks as you down climb. Handy to have a headlamp or flashlight as it gets dark quickly. Well worth the effort and nice to stay away from the cable car crowds.
Sunset. Great place to look at the sunset. Nice hike, about an hour up. A lot of people at the top, drinking wine and enjoying the view
