Wonderful views. A great little walk as an alternative to Table Mountain. I really enjoyed climbing up the ropes and ladders they have (don't look down!), but if you aren't sure-footed I would be careful as some areas get very steep. Beautiful views and was magical when the fog rolled in!

Tiring but Worth it. I'll start off by saying that I'm not overweight but I don't exercise so the hike took its toll on me but I still challenged myself to make it to the top and the view was worth it. I probably had to stop 5 times for a water and breathing break. There's a point where you can take a shorter route by using ladders and hooks on the rocks to get up but I didn't want to overdo it for myself so I chose to do the steep climb and make wide steps upwards over rocks. My lungs were burning by the time I made it up but I settled down for 30 minutes to observe and get great pictures. The way down is obviously easier but I'm glad I pushed my lazy butt to do it. Luckily we did this on a clear day but it was hot (80F/30C)

Best hike in Cape Town. I love this hike and have done it a couple of times now. The way up is offering beautiful views of Cape Town, Table Mountain and the ocean. The hike is pretty straight forward, but gets a bit more tricky at the top - but most people can do this one!The view at the top is amazing. There is often a lot of people, which is a great mix between locals walking their dogs and first timers. It is nice to watch the sunset from the top, but it's also very nice to do it as an early morning hike.

Amazing views. We decided to climb Lion's Head in the morning so it wouldn't be too hot on our way down. It took some time to climb Lion's Head, but the views were definitely worth it. A must do when you visit Cape Town!

Great hike . Love this mountain it's only 45 min hike from car park not to steep and you ll get an amazing view to Cape Town, table mountain and also camps bay !! Only think is that its get a little bit busy closed to the top so you need to wait for a people in front of you otherwise one of my favourite mountain to hike !!

Exciting climb to the top of Lions Head. We climbed Lions Head in the morning which was a perfect time as it was not too hot. The climb itself was fun with a mix of straight walking combined with hiking over rocks, climbing ladders and using chains and handholds on the more challenging route to the top. While we took our time we were passed several time by people who were actually running to the top. People do climb it very early in the morning with headlamps to see sunrise and sunset. The top of Lions Head has excellent 360 degree views of Cape Town, Table Mountain, Robben Island and the Ocean. Our pictures were excellent. It takes about an hour and a half to climb and an hour + to climb down.

Breathtaking views. Great hike with a few minor climbs to make things interesting, leading to some of the most stunning views across Cape Town and of Table Mountain. Pick a clear and bright day to really take advantage of the amazing scenery.

Excellent but technical climbing at the top. Lion's Head was the highlight of Cape Town for me - I climbed up in the dark so that I could catch sunrise at the top. I don't think I would have done so if I'd realised how technical the top is, however, since the path isn't that easy to see. I was lucky enough to meet fellow climbers who showed me the way but if I hadn't had them I would have found it difficult, though with them it was easy enough. I hadn't planned on doing the chains and staples but in fact they weren't SO bad ... a little scary if you haven't got a head for heights, but not actually technically difficult. I'd 100% recommend this but do it in the day if you're unsure what the path is like!

Short but intense hike with a good reward. It will take almos 45 minutes to reach the summit and, if you don't stop, it will make you sweat. The reward will be your best photos during your stay in Cape Town. You can also bring your own food/drinks an enjoy them with beautiful views
Excellent 360 views. Be prepared for a 45 min hike up. Check the weather update prior. There are slow routes and fast steeper routes to the top.

Best Cape Town views. Lion's head is famous for it's glorious sunsets and views, so many people drive up just before sun sets to admire Cape Town and the beautiful views you get from up there! Can pack a picnic basket too!

Adventurous walk and great view. What is much nicer about Lion's Head compared to Table Mountain is the walk up, starting with an easy walkway, the second half consists of climbing, ladders and chains, which is adventurous but possible to do for everybody with at least a little bit of fitness. The view on Table Mountain with its magic "cloud waterfall" is amazing, sunset is also highly recommended, if you decide to go there on full moon, come early enough, it's gonna be packed!

Climbed above the clouds . Brilliant experience, it took us around 4 hours to clime up and down, but we did spend time sat at the top and didn't rush getting up or down. As we were climbing up the weather came in and clouds covered the view of Cape Town. However when we got to the top we had the amazing experience of being above the clouds. I would suggest wearing walking boots or similar as the last part of the clime up is very rocky and quite a scramble, using chains, ladders and hooks. This clime is not appropriate for someone unsure of there footing or fitness as it's quite demanding at the top. However if you want some of the best views of Cape Town it's the best place!
Unforgetable view. I went to see the sunset and y was one of the best view I haver ever seen, without a doubt is a must in cape town

One of Cape Town's most rewarding hikes. Starting from the trail head on the road to Signal Hill, the path starts as an easy, moderate incline until it climbs to the opposite side of the mountain. After 25 minutes it becomes more of a scramble over a rocky path and eventually a steep climb occasionally assisted by chains and ladders. About one hour to the top at a brisk pace. Magnificent 360 degree views extending from Heldeberg to Blouberg, down to Camps Bay and the 12 Apostles. Fantastic!

Lions head full moon adventure hike. Ever wanted to feel on top on the world. Well then if you have the time highy recommend you don your hiking shoes,warm jacket, rugsack with water,snacks and head torch. The hike up Lions head requires medium grade fitness. This will take you approx 1.5 hours to reach the summit. You will need to climb ladders and chains at specific spots. . But WOW you will be in absolute heaven when you reach the top.. stunning 360 degr views of Cape Town city bowl. Table mountain, V&A harbour, Atlantic seaboard and lots more. Suck in th e awesome views ,fresh air whilst you watch sun setting over the Atlantic in west and soon thereafter the moon rushing up on easterly side over Stellenbosch mountains... Enjoy the essence of pure nature at its very best ..The walk down should be done slowly and carefully as it will be dark and path has couple loose rocks.. you will have to use your head torch. As you make your way down stop and look back up and see the other hikers descending with their torches.. this is a brilliant sight. .This is certainly a truly rememorable experience.... **** Love Cape Town The mother city ****
Great views. There are some spectacular views over the city and Table mountain. Towards the other side, there are some nice views over Sea Point. Also a good spot to see sunsets.

Breathtaking!. I dived with sharks and went on a skydive but the hikes are the most memorable. Lion's head at sunset is breathtaking! Make sure you take a good torch for travelling back down at night. Lots of people paragliding from Lion's Head above the bay but didn't do it myself - looked fun though!

Nice hike followed by 360 panorama. This hike should not be considered casual or for beginners. There was a section that involved the use of chains and ladders to ascend since it was very steep (see pic with warning sign posted). There was also a longer way around which I believe was more moderate.Once the summit is reached, you have a wonderful panorama of Cape Town, including Table Mountain, The Twelve Apostles, Robben Island, Camps Bay, and others.We saw a lot of people hiking up to catch the sunset. I recommend wearing sturdy footwear and bringing headlamps if you plan to do that.

Lovely spiralling walk. An easy walk for beginners. This is a one and a half hour walk up along a spiralling footpath. The views are therefore every changing as you complete a 360 degree circuit. It can get quite windy on top so just choose a good day!

Beautiful Amazing Climb (Although Wouldn't Call This a Hike). Starts off as a hike that just about anyone can do but soon you get to a narrow walk way along the edge of the mountain, not much more difficult but if you are afraid of heights this may scare you...then the worst comes (if you have a fear of heights)...you really have to start using your arms and legs and actually climbing. There are even parts where you will have to climb ladders and use chains a bit. Not your average walk in the park. The views from the top are stunning! And the challenge was well worth it. BUT if you have a terrible fear of heights don't do this...and if you are totally out of shape or have injuries that keep you from climbing (using both arms and legs) don't do it. The scariest part for me was getting down and the whole way up I was dreading the climb down. In the end I was glad I braved it out and made it to the top and back down in one piece. Give yourself 2 hours total.
Amazing natural . The view more beatiful of Capetown. A way of entertainment. A perfect plan to do with friends. Capetown has been in the top of the best cities to visit.
Awesome to hike. You must do this with a nice fit group. Awesome views and choose a beautiful clear day. Alternatively, if you are daring, try the full moon hike

Lovely climb. A fantastic walk and reasonable climb. The walk is not suitable for people who are very unfit, scared of heights or have problems with knees and hips.The route is very popular and I would recommend attempt the climb before sunrise to avoid the crowds and to witness the sunrise in the mornings .The views are spectacular from the top and worth the climb.Remember to take fluids on the climb.

Climb of Lions Head . What a treat
Being afraid of heights I was unsure of completing this climb.
I left 35 minutes before sunrise and there were already many people there.
It was a tough climb but so worth the effort!
P.s give yourself an hour at a pretty good pace ;)
daily hike. Really need to control the number of people on Lions head on weekends better - just for safety. The paths are getting so worn and are very dangerous. Needs to be managed better

Fun hike, beautiful views!. It was not a stroll in the park as some people say- the hike itself was quite difficult! The beginning for some reason gets you out of breath so don't give up- It gets better as your body gets used to it and it is definitely WORTH the effort! If you're not too comfortable with heights, the scrambles towards the top may be a little unpleasant but I always love to encourage people to get out of their comfort zone. There were several young kids on the hike and they did just fine! It also gets VERY HOT after sunrise so make sure you take PLENTY of water and keep yourself hydrated. Despite all this, it was an extremely FUN HIKE! I really LOVED the scramble at the top and the small bits of rock climbing they had. It wasn't very difficult at all and added that extra bit of adventure to the hike! The views at the top were amazing and it was nice to just sit on the edge and ponder the beauty. We had amazing weather for photos (though not so good for sunburns!)- clear blue skies and endless visibility! The route is obvious- just keep climbing upwards, so you don't really need a guide. If we had done a sunrise or sunset, I might have used one just for the safety though. It would be a little scary for me to have done that in the dark! There is a diversion (several routes) to the 'cave' just near the first ladder at the top. There were plenty of Capetowners that helped us along the route and we made it to the caves safely. That was also definitely worth the extra walk.If you like the outdoors, a bit of sweat and fun, don't miss out on Lionshead! Then head over to the main street on Camps Bay and indulge in a gelato!Best of all, it's TOTALLY FREE TO DO!!Ps It may get a little slippery on a rainy day and the views may be clouded over, so choose wisely!

NOT an easy hike but worth it . This is not an easy hike and there is rock climbing in places. Although it is very safe. We were walking quite quickly and It took us 45 mins to get up and 45 mins down. The view at the top is amazing and definitely worth the pain!! Highly recommend it!
A must while in Cape Town!. Either you go in the morning, day, evening or sunset - it is a must! The view is spectacular and the hike is easy and nice :)

best thing to do in Capetown. only accessible via the hiking route. free of the "classic tourists". a beautiful spot during the day and specially for the sunset. but do not underestimate the hike, it is exhausting specially the last 20 minutes!

Wonderful walk with amazing views. A tiring but wonderful walk up the mountain with amazing views as you circle your way up.I love that so many people are always climbing up Lions Head, its a great activity and completely achievable with basic fitness But don't forget you are walking up a mountain so have water, sunblock etc. My 9 year old son is able to do it for those unsure of difficulty. For those scared of heights parts may be a bit daunting.

All ages & fitness hike. Have climbed Lions head several times. Easy enough even if you're unfit or have never hiked before - yet still enough rock climbing to make you work for it. Start is steepish walk up gravel, followed by steps, followed by some chain climbing, some rock climbing and then the summit. Great view of Cape Town and surrounds - awesome for sun rises & sets.

Incredible VIews. Easy climb. But does get quite tricky for inexperienced climbers or newbies. I was a bit surprised people could casually climb up to the top. Amazing views! Be prepared for a challenge if you take the route with ladders and chains - views definitely worth the climb!

Not a walk in the park. Although it is rated as an easy walk, it is not for the people who are afraid of heights. It involves some serious steep parts, where you have to climb ladders and scramble up the rocks. However children as young as 8 or 9 are doing it. It is mainly a walk for locals, whereas the tourists prefer the table mountain. The view of the lion's head are however maybe even better, because you see the table mountain as well as the city below. The steepest part can be avoided by a longer and easier route. The way back is tougher than the way up.

Amazing views, safe path and free!. From the top of Lions head is going to be the best view of Table mountain you're going to get! The path is well maintained, its free with no entry cost and cheap to get a taxi to the base. It can take between 1-1.5hrs to walk up say (some were even running it). Starts off as a path, then into steps, then bit of scrambling. Theres also an option to use the chains and grab handles but there is an alternate route.People from all walks of life and levels of fitness walking it. If the suns out - do it.

A great sense of achievement.. Don't be put off looking up from the road. The path is easy until the very last part which involves step-ladders and chains. Fantastic views at the top and a great sense of achievement. I found the descent harder on the knees. Recommend using a taxi/Uber to get to the start. On the descent we picked up a trail to Signal Hill (about 30mins) then took a taxi back (Uber cancelled twice on this location - don't really know why).

Excellent but be careful. Superb if you want wonderful views but be warned its not all easy going,the first half is pretty easy if your kinda fit but it gets harder later on,there are ladders chains to grab on and some steep climbs ahead it's pretty hard going,the views are amazing

walk up Lion's head to see sunrise on top. fantastic experience.. leave approx. one to one and a half hour before sunrise... you will reach the top to see the sunrise illuminate the city and Table Mountain. the path gets rocky and you will use chains and ladders, so you need to be fit to walk up to the summit. best on a sunny day, check the weather forecast..

Rewarding hike. One of the most rewarding hokes to do in Cape Town, short enough that even the less fit friends and family can join. Even though the hike is not too long and seems fairly easy and calm at first, there are areas that require climbing and a bit of pulling yourself up ladders, so smaller kids or VERY unfit people may struggle here. Views from the top are worth any energy to get up there. NOTES:Try go on weekends when there are numerous people on the trail as there have been mugging attempts before.If the weather is really bad, rather give it a skip as the rocks can get slippery and this is a natural hike (no hand rails etc)

There used to be a lone tree atop. I climbed Lion's head many years ago and this time just went round the base. It used to have a tree on top but that has gone. The views are spectacular and it's a great walk. Exercise vigilance at all times!!

Short, easy and beautiful hike - highly recommended!. We do this hike every time we come to Cape Town. It is for all types of persons; children, unfit, older (my mum 65 yrs came along this time with a newly operated hip!). It is safe (so many people along the trail). It takes 45min to over an hour up (bring water and a little snack, and apply sun screen before you go). The view is breathtaking! You will see all sides of Cape Town as you walk around the Lions Head on your way to the top. Put your trainers on and go!

Quick hike even for the unfit. I am not the most active person, in fact I'm not active at all. I expected to not make it to the top but the amazing views as you walk up kept me motivated and I made it. You'll see Cape Town from the best angle possible. Highly recommended for everyone. Suggest you go early morning before it gets too busy.

Very nice spot to see The CapeTown and that other Mountain!. I got a ride up and walked about for several hours on Lion's Head, great exercise and significantly easier to get to than Table Mountain. The view is worthy and certainly a good hike. I liked the no line too!I must say, I didn't make it to the top, but maybe next time .

Beautiful views but crowded . Lion's Head is a cakewalk after you've hiked Table Mountain. The scenery is beautiful. We started about 3pm to arrive at the top for sunset. The views are stunning, but it's really crowded. It's hard to get a picture without someone else being in it. I was surprised that locals hike this for exercise. If you arrive at the top for sunrise, coming down is a bit tough because it's dark by then. It's actually pitch black. I had to use my cell phone light just to see directly in front of me quite a few times. It was a large group near us. Trying to come down in pitch black with 15 people right in front of you is really annoying. I'd still recommend though, just be patient if it's super crowded.

Good Hike when Table Mountain Cable Car is Closed. Lion's peak provides a amazing view of Cape Town. However the best part of this place is the hike to the hill top. The place is accessible by hike only and thus moderate fitness is required. About half of the distance is relatively easy with moderate steep up hill, however later half requires climbing steel ladders, steps and chains. An alternate route option is also available to the top however cannot comment on that as we took the chains and steel steps trail. At an easy pace with photos, we took 2 hours one way. Some places on the trail have strong cold winds and thus a wind cheater is recommended along with some snacks and water.

Great trek and wonderful views. We drove up to the half way point and then trekked up from there. I admit that it did get a bit treacherous, and you really have to be aware of your footings. At a few locations, you will need to grab some hand rails and chains as well as use ladders to advance to the next area. It was uphill nearly the entire way, but well worth it. Allow yourself at least 2-3 hours.

Amazing views. NOT an "easy" hike if hiking isn't your thing. I only write the title because I based my plans on tripadvisor reviews and most said that this was an "easy" hike. Now, I am not a hiker so maybe it's easy for those who do these things often but once you hit the ladder (there are still amazing views at this and before this point so feel free to stop!), it gets quite difficult in that you are properly climbing in several areas and there are steep drop-offs. Excellent views, though! Amazing for full moon but it was extremely crowded and there are no lights to get down with so definitely get a head lamp or do not go up to the climbing sections. We came down just after the full moon rose with enough light, which was perfect.

More Dangerous than it looks but incredible views. We definitly didn't do our research before starting this hike. The views at the top really are incredible but it does get quite dangerous at times if you're clumsy like me. One small trip or a big gush of wind and you can fall 1000ft! The first half is just walk up and then it becomes quite narrow and rocky and you have to pay attention to your footing, even on the "easy" route as you're walking on the edge with no protection. It didn't help that we chose to go for full moon so it was pretty crowded up there and some areas cant fit two people going in each direction so it bottle necked quite a bit which made it a bit stressful at times. I would recommend to go in the morning so you can take your time and check the wind levels that day. Keep in mind that an average of 3 people die each year falling before you read the excitement of the other reviews!

Excellent half-day hike. Excellent hike up one of Cape Town's icon mountains. Your level of activity doesn't need to be very high, but your appreciation for the outdoors should be. It took us 1.5 hours to the top with three children (youngest 6). Take enough water and make sure to hike in a group. At one point you can opt for the chains - remember there is an alternative more kiddies friendly route to the side.
Great place. This is a great place to watch the sunsets, but get there early, as it gets extremely busy, and you can't find a parking space.
Views are amazing. the views are amazing from Lions Head, one can see the whole of CT. it is very high and the roads are rather narrow.
Beautiful View of Cape Town. Lion's Head is a must-do while in Cape Town. The view from the top is amazing and recommended to do during sunset - especially with a full moon!

Awesome :). Hiked up with my Husband. I am relatively fit (well I think so) - We managed the hike up to the top in 1 hour and 20 mins (approx) - It was well worth it. We set off about 9am which was a nice time - It wasn't too busy and the sun was not too blistering. It is scary at some points as you have to use ladders, chains etc. to hurl yourself up the side of the mountain. Once your up, your up and WOW what a view and what a personal achievement!! A must see if your able too. Take water, wear suitable footwear and take a camera for the top!!!!!!

Amazing, amazing hike!. This hike was one of the best hikes I've ever done. A local told us this was an easy hike but this was definitely not easy. To get to the top you must essentially rock climb, use ladders, metal peg steps, chains, you name it - but it was entirely thrilling. The views are spectacular. The weather changed about 6 times while we were on the mountain so be prepared! Get there earlier to find easy parking!

Magnificent beyone belief: Moderately fit.. This is a must when visiting our magnificent Mother city. It is not just a walk. You do need your walking shoes and your walking outfit and lots of extra water in the summer months. I have seen lady tourists start out in their pumps. No No NO although a medium level of fitness is required, you do need proper walking shoes. However this is not just a mere walk - In the summer months it can be a hot long and thirtsy walk - it is not just a walk in the park - there are bits that do need a bit of a scramble and strength enough to hold onto and haul yourself up with chains. It is an awesome experience and once at the top[ the views are breathtakingly beautiful and well worth the effort - pretty much 360 degree views of our beautiful Cape Town. However please be warned always take something warm with you even on a hot day - take plenty of water as it can can very windy hot and dehydrating up there. Unless you are extremely fit and know your body, make sure you have a snack like a banana or a sandwich. ALways make sure you do not go up alone and that you are well aware of your surroundings. As much as we like to promote safety and we do love our tourists, there have been unfortunate incidents of theft etc. so just be vigilent at all times - keep your guard up like in most places in the world today. It really really is well worth the effort once you have got to the top. Enjoy it and the wonderful sense of achievement once you have got to the top. Have fun

Worth the climb. There are two stunning times to climb up Lion´s Head. Sunrise or Sunset. 2/3 of the walk up lion´s head are easy to walk. You must climb the rest. Don´t go to late otherwise you end up half way and the sun already sets. You have a 360 ° view around capetown.

Hike to Wallys cave and Lions Head. Well maintained with steps built for easier climbing. Chains and ropes well positioned and generally very clean. Heaps of visitors at any given time. Always worth the visit.
Nice hike..... To get a beautiful view over cape town and camps bay you have to go on the Lions Head. Be there before sunset.

Easy walk for the most spectacular views.. The footpath up Lion's Head can be approached from various points around the mountain, including Signal Hill, Tamboerskloof and Camps Bay. The path is broad and circles up the mountain. Only the last bit is steep as you have to get across the rock face to the top. You can do this by chain ladder or up a steep footpath. At the top, the 360 degrees views of the Table Mountain, Cape Town, Cape Flats and winelands, the Atlantic ocean, Clifton and Camps Bay are stunning. Children, dogs and adults can manage this wonderful walk.

Exciting adventure. This hike had to be one of my favorite part of this trip, the hike up lion head was much fun that table mountain. It was nice to hike and even see dogs hike the mountain, best view is during sunset. I took one of my favorite pictures on Lions head.

Don't miss Table Mountain and Lion's Head while in Cape Town!!!. Definitely Lion's Head is not a place to climb if you are not in excellent shape! But if you are .............. words can't describe the view of Cape Town from the top!Now for Table Top Mountain. The line up for the cable car can be between 2 to 4 hours depending the day and the time of day. A bit expensive but worth it if you have the time and patience to wait in 90 F heat. The view is spectacular.

Stunning views. Definitly not the easiest of hikes, would not recommend to anyone atleast moderately fit, but the views make it all worth it. On top you can enjoy a 360degree view of capetown and campsbay. The climb takes about 1,5hr and includes ladders, steps and chains forged in the rock and alot of rock climbing.

Great views from the top. It's a good walk up there not for the faint hearted. Take a taxi. Great views of the coast line with camps bay around the corner. Good shoes are required if you are going up the track.
climb up lions head. did the walk up Lions head not for the faint hearted. can be scary in places you need to have a head for heights but some fantastic views when you are at the top.

Great view and fun hike. Awesome hike to do at night and a great way to see Cape Town. Pack a picnic bag and enjoy supper at the top while you over look the whole of Cape Town and Camps Bay the hike is a easy walk but the best is to do it a hour before sunset and then hike down in the moonlight, try doing it when there is full moon

Morning hike. This is a great way to start the day. The hike is perfect for beginners but be warned that some degree of fitness is required. Carry atleast 2 bottles of water 750 ml and a snack! You can have a picnic at the top. Lovely to do in a group.

Great Hike. Incredible views, although it clouded up before we got to the top, so we couldn't see much. But when it did clear for a minute - wow! Also, it's fun to look up at it when you're in town and think "I climbed that!" It's mostly a walk, although there are a few places where you will climb up ladders or hold on to chains to pull you along. But very easy - nearly anyone can do it.

Crazy, challenging and nice at the same time. I thought it would be challenging but not so much. It was fun but you have to be very aware of heights and careful step by step. It starts easy and gets more difficult and has some climbing parts. The view at the end is really wonderful. There have been a lot of people about 11 am. Recommendation: start about 8 am. There have already been a lot of cars and people but it was less stress getting up. When I went down about 10:30 it was really busy. Take water with you!!!! And maybe a selfie stick ;) enjoy! It's effort but you get a recognition.

Feast for the senses!. Good hike up Lion's Head - challenging at parts, but the all-round views makes up for that. Definitely worth the time, effort and sweat. Allow enough time to spend at the top, to feel that view! Don't forget sunblock and water.

Amazing view, Adventure trail. To get up there you can choose wether you are up for the climbing part or if you just want to hike all the way up. The climbing is a lot of fun with ladders put right into the stone. It isnt a very long way so you do not have to be in the best shape.what is really worth it, is going up there for the sunrise. You should start around 60-90 Minutes before the sun is meant to rise and get up there to enjoy the best morning you ever had over one of the greatest cities in the world!

Nie hiking. Nice in the early morning and with the moonlight. Might be a bit overcrowded and even if it looks easy pay attention, some people dyed there.If you go in the night (except when the moon is full that is overcrowded) might be dangerous for the robbers

breathtaking excursion. Suggested by a walking tour guide, this excursion was just perfect. We are a couple in our honeymoon and decided to explore Cape Town on our own. Everyone want to go up to Table Mountain, but this walk is even more special, since it offers a true climbing experience. So you must be a little bit prepared to walk (sneakers and trousers) but not longer than 45 minutes. We reached the top at the sunset so it was really magical. We stayed at the tope for a few minutes to see the sun go down, shared a beer and went back to the parking. Just perfect for a couple!
Why a lion. Wondering why it's known as lions head, the must be a local reason.Always looked a great view during the day and took some good sunset pictures of it.

Ideal for a good work out and view. The golden rules are:1. Take a friend along2. Start early3. Pack water4. Time it well – it will take equally as long to ascend as to descend5. If it rains or the wind is howling, quit6. Start slowly and pace yourself7. Enjoy the 360° view from the top8. Take lots of pictures from the top9. Start the journey downwards before you start to cool down10. Be alert and do not flash cameras or cash11. ENJOY!Ideal for those who love the great outdoors!

Great hike, with some show-stopping views to reward you at the end.. I hiked Lion's Head with a couple of friends, timing it so that we would reach the top ahead of sunset. It was not as gruelling a hike as I expected (definitely need to be moderately fit though!) and watching the sunset at the end was amazing. Quick safety recommendation: If you're interested in doing this in the evening, by all means do so, just time it so that you begin your descent immediately after sunset. We were surrounded by people on the way up and down, but I wouldn't recommend going up later than we did, as you'll probably have a very isolated descent.

part walk, part scramble. The first part is a hike, uphill to be sure, but a hike. The second part is part hike and part scramble. Chains, bolts, and ladders are there to assist as you climb up/down over rocks. It gets more strenuous the higher you go. I found it very difficult with my short legs as the next step or foothold was often farther than my reach. Beautiful views though.

Great views different perspective. Beauty is in the eye of the beholder so if you don't like this one you must be blind. Breezy and rugged and great views of the Bay and surrounding area. For me it's a must see.

Hiking Lions Head. It was totally nice... awesome if you ask me... group hike would be great. The hike does not require a great amount of fitness and almost anybody can hike, however care has to be taken. If you are the adventurous one like me don't hesitate to use the ladder, chains and staples...There are totally safe. If not the alternative route.

Do not go on a weekend. The walk around Lion´s head will give you wonderfule views of Cape Town. The way is good to walk but some basic fitness is required and of course there is not much shade. Avoid Weekends bacuase then a lot of People will make the track and so it looses ist serenity.
Nice walk. It's a nice walk with a beautiful view. But please be careful, never do it in the dark, no matter how romantic it seems to be!

My favorite place in the mother city . Such a beautiful hike with amazing views. Get those endorphins flowing with friends, family or even a date. Take enough water, some snacks and drinks to enjoy while taking in the panoramic views of the city and the Atlantic seaboard. This remains my favorite place in Cape Town.

Worth it for expert, novice and child. Just mind bad-knees.. Definitely recommended 100 fold over. Go for a sunrise hike or start before 06:30 am to avoid crowds and bottle-necks. Take water and a light snack and a camera. Be prepared for a few hipsters doing yoga poses on outlaying stones for Instagram. Ensure comfy shoes. The ascend with the chains and holds isn't too high grade but might be a stretch for shorter companions (see what I did there? ;)If you are lucky enough to be around Cape Town over a full moon, absofrikkenlutely go up Lion's Head for a full moon hike. If you have a head light with a red setting, take it with but you will blind fellow hikers like deer in headlights if you hike with it on a different setting...and might "fall" or "slip" by the time deer 3 passes you.Avoid in mist, winds or rain as there is actual scrambling involved.

TIP: do this hike for sunrise!!! less people and not hot!. Tip: The days in cape town especially in the summer time can be VERY warm and so doing an early morning hike makes sense so its not too hot outside ! Pro: -there is an easy trail, not a hard hike to do and takes about an hour for the physically fit- beautiful views of cape town plus the ocean!- there are some harder variations of the hike which include using some metal staples to climb up and metal ropes. makes it somewhat interesting - we managed to go on a very windy day and somehow had the tip top all to ourselves, it was quite a beautiful view!- if you go in the morning you can also see the shadow of the mountain in the water which is just so coolCons: - it can get to be a really busy place later on in the morning with a crowded trail - gotta go early to get a parking spot!
Amazing! A must-do!. The climb up to lion's head is a must for everyone who likes being active! You are not only rewarded with a fun climb, but most of all with a stunning view from the top!

Long walk - well worth it. First of all, I would like to advise you - do not underestimate the walk, it's much longer then one can expect. Honestly, we were not ready at all, the hill itself doesn't look that tall, yet the walk is really long and gets a bit tricky on the way. Make sure to pack enough water and probably even some snacks :)I would suggest picnicing on the top, watching the sunset - breathtaking!

Breathtaking. We got up early and started hiking at 6am. I definitely recommend doing this in groups, though it was quite busy when we went. Near the top, there is the option of climbing up using chains, or taking a less strenuous but longer walk.
Well worth the hike. Bring plenty of water, comfortable shoes and pack light. There is also a little bit of climbing involved so be prepared.

A must! . Wow! My husband and I climbed the top of Lions Head at the perfect time! Clouds covered the whole coast then shifted to the top of Lions Head. What an experience! Take a light jacket (weather can change dramatically), water and a good pair of shoes!

Worth the effort to reach the top. Do this hike if you can. It's an effort but completely worth it. The first part is a good warmup for the main hike. It's steep after that, with rocks to climb and chains/hooks for support. We were exhausted by the time we reach the top, 80-90min time. But the layoff: SPECTACULAR views. Bring lots of water, and a sandwich to eat as you take in the 360 degree views after your work. And then be ready for the hike down!!!
AMAAAZING VIEW. the hike to Lionshead gives you an amazing view of all cape town. (campsbay, green/seapoint, waterfront, civic center etc!!)
top view. stupendous walk, the view from the top rewards the efforts to get to the top ...I recommend it at sunsetdo it

Worth every step. Best visited by car/ my city bus on hot sunny day. Taxis are available at start/end point.Access open & free all year round.Popular with hikers & runners. Not suitable for kids under 15 yrs & dogs in my view.Walk starts off with a easy steep climb along a jeep track. Then tappers off into a single track.The path can become sandy & rocky at times.Watch out for loose stone & sand.It can be considered a bit strenuous with a few ladder & chain climbs along the route.Not for the faint hearted.Safety chains are well kept & solidly mounted.Allowing for one way traffic up & down.Respect , safety & courtesy is key.Else take a 5 minute chicken route.Views are most amazing & worth every step of the route.Much better views than from the top of Table Mountain.Camera is a must to capture the beauty of the Atlantic Sea board,Table mountain ,city bowl, V& A surrounding areas from ever directional angle.A must is sunscreen, hat,water & light jacket incase wind picks up.Perfect for a sunset & light snack on top.Watch out for indegenous harmless rock " dassie" / rocky hyrax lurking among the rocks expecting food from visitors.Keep your dirt with you.

A stunning View. Beautiful place with a marvellous view. Interesting path leading up, with ladders and some clambering in the upper part. Just a bit crowded, as one should expect at such a central location. Probably slippery when wet.
Climb up at sunrise for stunning views. A fantastic challenging hike with the reward of stunning views at the top. Make sure you wear good footwear and carry water.

Awesome hike. While it plays second fiddle to Table Mountain, Lion's Head is another one of Cape Town's unique natural wonders. Whether you go up early in the morning, at midday, or for a spectacular sunset, Lion's Head offers beautiful views without as much of a crowd as its larger counterpart.

Spectacular hike, views and scenery!. We found our hike up Lion's Head in Cape Town to be both inspiring and relaxing. Even though we are at times climbing up steep inclines, the provided chains and hand-holds make it quite easy and the views of Cape Town are memorable!
Beautiful climb. We climbed Lion's head multiple times throughout our stay in Cape Town. We couldn't get enough of the 360 degree views of the city. Truly worthwhile.

Best to do it once . For someone that is afraid of heights I most certainly conquered my fear by climbing up lions head. Going up it wasn't such a mission but coming down good god was it terrifying but it has to be done atleast once in your lifetime.
Better than table mountain. Great views of Table Moutain, Cape Town and the sea. There is quite a bit of wildlife here although I suspect many people will miss most of it.

Lion's Head in CapeTown. Lion's Head in Cape town was the last place that I have visited in Cape Town, I have been there in a rainy day and I wasn't able to see a lot of things but I have sure that in a beautiful day it is a excellent place you should go to visit.

Good alternative when Table Mountain is closed. This location gives you a very good vantage point of Cape Town and surrounding area. If Table Mountain is closed, you can still get some shots from here and of able Mountain as well.

Crazy Sunset. Outstanding views from this magnificent place makes the hiking to the summit a big pleasure and a reward to everyone who decide to climb this mountain. This will be on my mind to the rest of my life!

Trek it!l. Inspire yourself. Go climb this mountain. The views are breathtaking. A popular trek to watch the sunset.Avoid it in the night if you don't have torches.Carry little.Loads of water is recommended.Listen to great music.Wear the right trekking shoes and apparels.Carry a camera and a tripod, if you want to take pictures in the night.Stunning!!

Great walk, great scenery. Too challenging to call a walk, but too easy to call a climb. There's a split that offers a more difficult route, which is worth taking as it involves some ladders and metal handles built into the rock face to climb.If you're capable this'll be easy and fun. If you're overweight/elderly/etc you may find this difficult. If you go up to watch the sunset make sure you bring torches (preferable a head torch as you need your hands for scrambling!) for the way down. Would be pretty dangerous in the dark.
Wonderful climb. Avoid Sunday very busy - beautiful scenery. Take some water and good footwear. Remember sunscreen!!!
The greatest View!. The climb is not easy, but it's worth it! You'll have the best view over Cape Town, Table Mountain, Camps Bay and the Twelve Apostles!
Spectacular viewpoint.. An interesting drive or walk with rewarding views both day and night. Great views of Robben Is.,Camp's Bay and around to the city.
Stunning. An amazing activity-long and challenging walk to the top-stunning views all around-great for picnics-very peaceful and relaxing at the top-pure heaven
Beautiful. Superb scenery, free of charge. Cape town's natural beauty personified. A must visit whilst in the city.

Hike of the life. Hiking both ways will take around 3 hours, its not really a hike for beginners but can easily been down by anyone as long as you stay motivated. Best to go early in the morning so its not too hot. Views are mind blowing, make sure you get water and pack something for a snack, wear comfortable trainers and try to stay light in terms of luggage. Reward in the end of the hike is totally worth it. Those afraid of heights mind find challenging one of the stairs in the very top as it requires you to clime vertically up for around 10 meters.

Trek up!!. 600 plus meters high.. this is a good semi-difficult trek starting with a smooth off-road like climb and going on to a few steep rocks. Best done in the morning as it gets hot later. Sun-block is must.

Lets Hike :). we were planed to hike to the table mountain but according to the wind in that day , the clouds cover the top of the mountain so we hiked the Lion head....it was easy and interesting.when you get closer to the top you will have a perfect view each

Lovely views, great if Table Mountain Cable is out of action.. This is really just a viewpoint which is worth visiting. The Whole of Cape Town is laid out below you. Skydivers launch from this area and you can hitch a ride if you are so inclined.
hike, run or just sightseeing. In my eyes a better hike or run than table mountain hike or run. Beautiful suroundview and cool climbing sessions. Not very hard, but probably not for everyone.

Love this hike!. This hike is my favorite! I always felt completely safe and the views are incredible! I did it once on a Saturday and it was a little too busy for my liking because there were bottlenecks at the ladder portions. I would suggest taking the 'easy' route if it is crowded. I also did it on a Monday and it was perfect - no lines and it is not too strenuous but it gives you a good work out.
Sun set. Nice view of the city and fantastic sun sets! Take a picknick up here and enjoy! A bit crowded but good atmosphere

Hike up. Hiking up is very nice, especially for sunset. You get the best views of table mountain. However, it is a proper hike - don't go up in Flip Flops or with a dog or small children. There are a few places that are really dangerous as nothing is secured against falling down. (!!!)I was up there on a full noon night. It was very busy, expect some 'traffic jams' when you do that. However it was worth doing.

Moderate hike with great views - no need for a guide. There are various options for the Lion's head hike, all beginning from the same, clearly marked, trail head. Don't worry about losing your way - paths are very obvious. This hike has a couple ladders and climbing handles near the top. Skip this activity if you are at all afraid of heights. Will require a fair amount of physical exercise. Hiking boots preferred but tennis shoes will work as well. Allow 1.5 hours round trip for the super speedy and 3 hours for the less active. Option to walk all the way around the mountain on a wide path, then up to the ladders and steeper rocks. OR Walk about 150 meters from the trail head and turn right onto a narrow trail. The path to the right is the path less traveled, consisting of small stairs and city views. You will eventually come to a sheer rock wall with a chain dangling down between gaps in the rock (3 meters of climbing - obvious places to put your feet - somewhat hidden, so keep your eyes pealed!). Additional option to continue to the right and walk the path around to skip the chain climb.

Amazing . Something not to miss in this city for hiking lovers with amazing views on the top. Only recommendation would be either do it to catch the sunrise or sunset then you would just want to do it everyday.

Fantastic views and can be done as easy walk . It is well worth going for a walk around Lions Head. You start from the road on Signal hill and commence on a jeep track that then becomes an easy path. There are fantastic views first of the back of the 'Lion' ie Signal Hill and then Camps Bay, Bantry Bay, Seapoint, Greenpoint and finally the City Centre and glorious views of Table Mountain. It's a good walk to do if Table Mountain is closed but please check before you start that Lions Head is not covered in cloud too and if there is cloud pouring over Table Mountain ( ie the 'table cloth' is over) then please note it is likely to be windy on Lions Head too and be prepared. The walk can be done up to a point as an easy slight incline walk and stop at the point where there are ladders and chains. It will take you about 45 mins to reach this point at an easy pace. You will still get sensational views without going all the way to the top. But for the more adventurous then the best and safest route to the top is to use the metal fixed ladders which will take you to the very top. Note this is a very popular walk and can be very crowded with walkers
Nice. The way up is not very hard but the view is still very nice, so it is a good combination. Recommend being there in time for sunrise - it is pure satisfaction.
The View!. A serious walk with a bit of clambering up this steep and invigorating hill to the best view of the peninsular.

Really fun hike. A really fun mini hike with added rock climbing included. Head up around 7 so that you can watch the sunset, although don't stay up too long otherwise you'll be walking back down in the dark!
Quick run up the hill . Has a lovely quick "run" up Lion's Head, well a brisk walk. Great way to spend a few hours in the Cape for fit people who love the outdoors.

Tough but rewarding. Climbing the Lion's Head is one of Cape Town's greatest free attractions. The price you pay for the views across the city is an hour's toil up a rocky path, with two ladders and a bit of scrambling over ledges.In an age of mass obesity, it was heartwarming to see literally hundreds of people on the trail on a Saturday afternoon. If you're not up for the full challenge of reaching the summit, there's the option to walk round the foot of the peak, but the route is not waymarked.Start off on the wide main path up from the parking area on Signal Hill Road. After 20 minutes you reach a paragliding launch site. Continue for another five minutes past a rocky overhang above you on the right, with bubbly rocks.Then, look out for a path branching half left downhill. This is the orbital path which contours round the hill avoiding the summit, eventually taking you back to the road.

Absolutely fabulous! . OMG! I really wasn't sure about doing this climb, but I am so pleased that my friends convinced me to go ahead with it. I really loved using the chains and metal steps they put there to help you. The views from the top were absolutely stunning!
Hike to summit. Heavenly hike. One can avoid ladders if one takes path to the left. Preferably not in the midday sun. Glorious view.

Rewarding and fun, but probably not for all. Strolled up this morning. Had walked in all the way from town (Three Cities Inn On The Square) so already was a bit of a hike before we got to the start of the walk!Option to not do the chains makes it suitable for most. However, do be aware that this is some real rock climbing and may be too difficult for some older/younger/unfit hikers!

The Best short Hike in Cape Town for the most reward!!. It is really a awesome Hike for everybody. Some really exciting scrambles for kids and adults alike. Alternative routes is available if you would like to skip The Chains. If you do not have a little bit of fitness in you, it is do-able, but you will feel the pain the next day. Takes about one and a half hours(perhaps two if your really taking it easy) to the top One of the only mountains in Cape Town where you get a 360 degree view. And this is arguably some of the best views you will see anywhere in the world.

Lion's Head- best thing in cape town. Lion's Head- best thing in cape town i think! i love this place. and one hour walk up the mountain. beautiful view of the city! great place to chill with friend and wine for sunset!

Beautiful views and great work-out. We took the less popular route around the back of Lions' Head. I would highly recommend taking this route since the normal one tends to get crowded. Prepare yourself for quite a workout and I would advise you to be at least moderately fit before doing the climb. There is one place where you need to pull yourself up by chains - not for the faint hearted. But the view is unbelievable. It is so worth the climb. One of my favourite trials in Cape Town. Just a word of caution - unfortunately our beautiful city has high crime and trials are targeted. Please never go alone, preferably in a group. And don't take unnecessary valuables with you

A fantastic hike. If your have a chance please hike Lions head. Most locals have hiked it and usually more than just one time. It's a stunning hime that's not too difficult. Make sure to bring enough water and snacks and also consider carrying a light jacket as it gets breezy on top. Once again, please do not do this hike later afternoon as night falls quickly and u might get lost
get the right angle. it is tricky to see why it is called Lion's head from certain angles but once you see it...well worth having a look and a walk up there if you feel like the exertion.watty

Amazing views, exciting walk. Very nice relatively short (1-1.5h up) but steep hike. At times you almost feel llke climbing rather than walking and need to use some chains/bolted steps on the walls. Views from the top are amazing.

Memory for the whole life!!. We have never done hiking before and we're not in good sport shape but we made it! It took us 2 hours to reach the top and same to go back. It's takes so much of your energy but it worth it!!!!

stunning view. you get to the summit via an easy path, but keep in mind that you need to climb a few parts. so better leave your kids at home, might be too dangerous otherwise. the view on the summit is just priceless!

One of my favourites in Cape Town!. This walk/hike is definitely one of my favourites! It is not too difficult, but at the same time you do need to have a certain level of fitness to make it to the top! If you're looking for great 360 degree views over Cape Town, this is your best bet - with a walkway that snakes around the entire peak, you're bound to catch a few picturesque moments.

Good views of the peninsula. I climb it at least once each time I'm here. For fitness and endurance as well as the pleasure and pride of getting there.Be careful while climbing up or down as there are lose rocks and very smooth roots on the way.There was another fatal accident last week when someone fell late at night.
Real landmark. A great feature of the Table Mountain massif. Only to be ascended by experts and in a group, that said a real feature for all to view from many angles

THE LION ROARS TONIGHT. Minutes from the CBD Lion's Head is a must do short drive The one way access road hugs the slopes and gives a driving experience rarely found in cities. The views of the City, the docks, Atlantic Ocean and Table Mountain are the best you can get. Go at the end of the day to watch the Sun go down and you will remember it for ever. At the top is a car park which can get busy and toilets. Your free to walk around and picnic. After loosing count of my visits its still A must do.

Take time and walk to Lion's head. Take time out and take a hike to Lion's head. The views are amazing and it is free. Lower than Table mountain but still worth going and just sitting and taking in the views. Best in the world.

All the way to the tippy top!. This is absolutely a must if you're in Cape Town. I'm a nature lover so this was the best part of Cape Town for me. Not only is it an actual hike requiring some effort (YAY), but when you reach the top, the views are your reward! Unfortunately, this home-grown Minnesota gal did not estimate the water I would need accurately. My boyfriend and I did the hike during the hottest part of the day and brought not half the water we needed. Luckily, we were fortunate to run into other travelers who offered some of their water. I'm afraid of heights so there were some parts of the hike that made my legs shake but I was proud of myself for completing it!

Beautiful views. Gorgeous view, free entry. Great for friends and couples. Parents will need to keep a close eye on young children. Parking is scarce. Take a warm jacket, because the wind can be chilly.
What a view!. After a strenuous walk and a bit of a climb up the ladders you are rewarded with the most spectacular views over Camps Bay, Clifton, Sea Point and the most beautiful coast line.

Great Hike with 360 deg views. wonderful hike, just watch your step. views are stunning. a nice quick hike, best to start early in the morning so you have the rest of the day to do other great things in the city.

Best view of Camps Bay .....and beyond. Lions head is best early morning before sunrise or late afternoon to catch the sunset.
Well worth the climb and it's FREE!

Breathtaking. make sure you go early as the hike is eternal but with impressive views. Take enough water, shades, sun block and a Go Pro. There are 2 routes: one with ladders and chains (the short route) and for those less comfortable with the idea of doing a kind of spiderman mountain climb ( I am exaggerating) ,there is a winding path. I ( 52 yrs) managed the chains and ladder route. It is not recommended for those with back problems or smaller children. Do not climb after 4pm !!

Excellent hike with fantastic views. This hike is a fantastic one to get your blood pumping and when you reach the top it is definitely worth it. Spectacular views of Cape Town and on the other side of 12 Apostles and Camps Bay
Amazing view. We paraglided off Lion's Head so it was a crazy experience. All these hills in Cape Town have their own unique views.

Great Climb. Quite a climb up rock ladders and stainless steel hand and footholds - don't look down! Can be windy at top. Leave by 0600 and climb the hard bit in the shade. Great views and even better sense of achievement. Took us 45 mins to climb to summit

Better than table mountain . We hiked up one evening; starting at about 5pm. The hike is easy enough but some climbing is involved. We went off the track to find a cave looking out towards table mountain. This was well worth it. The view from the top is also incredible. It probably takes around 1.5 hours to the top of you move at a comfortable pace.
GREAT VIEW. Some of the climb was quite vertical and would not be appropriate for anyone with a fear of heights.

Fantastic hike . This is one of the best trails you can do in Cape Town. The views from here are unparalleled. It's a very challenging hike, quite a steep climb and may be a bad idea to attempt on a hot day. There are no rest places/shade. Bring lots of water and take it easy!

Awesome Detour from Table Mountain. My husband and I spent a few awesome but WINDY days in Cape Town to kick off our honeymoon. Unfortunately, we happened to be there during bizarrely windy days, and Table Mountain was closed. Instead, our great guide from Ilios offered to take us to the top of Lion's Head, and it was a gorgeous alternative. It was a fun hike up - not too difficult but a few spots where we had to use hands and scramble up some sections. The path spirals up around the mountain offering views of the whole city and several beaches, and from the top it's an incredible 360 degree view. It took about an hour up and hour down and we spent maybe 20 minutes at the top taking pictures and drinking in the beautiful city below. Recommended!

Good fitness check. . I have to admit I couldn't go but my family made 2 trips to the top. Took them around 2.5 hours. Youngest child is 9 and he made it easily. Some of the photos from the top were wonderful.

interesting geologic feature. I think it would be wonderful for hikers-on its own it cannot hold a candle to table mountain espcially when the clouds come in called the table cloth-but saw hikers and the trail is kind

easy climb with amazing view.. I have been up Loins head many times and am always blown away by the view once you reach the top.this is most probably one of the easiest mountains to climb. you can walk to the base of the mountain and then there are chains to assist you to get to the top. A must for hikers and overseas visiters.

Could not manage the hike !. As the title suggests, we did not actually do the walk on this beautiful peak but the view of Lions Head from the window of our hotel in Bantry Bay was amazing. Nature's wonderful carving at its best.

Sunrise, sunset. For early birds wanting to see the sunrise, moonrise, sunset and moonset. Magnificent all round views, easy walk/climb. Breathtaking. Wear proper shoes and refrain from being a daredevil.

Best Views. I would recommend this (perfect time and distance) hike over Table Mountain if you had to choose just one. Regular hikes and picnics up Lion's head seem to be very much part of every Cape Town residents' year. The view form teh top is completely 360.

Awesome hike. Finally got myself in gear and climbed Lion's Head. A lovely hike, with a gorgeous view. The ladders tend to get a bit full so I hopped up and down the rocks, but definitely worth the aching arms the next day!

Beautiful!. You need to be reasonably fit to climb to the top. There are stretches where you must scramble over rock piles and do some real pushing and pulling to get higher. But it's well worth it for the excellent view!

Great workout and best view over Cape Town. I love to climb lions head. It's a great workout and one of the most beautiful sight seeings in Cape Town you can do. Take sunblock and rather do it in the morning or in the late afternoon. Bring lots of water and some food to have a picnic on top of lions head. You can also enjoy the sunset and bring a bottle of wine, just make sure you get down before it's dark. Rather bring a torch to make sure you'll get down safe. You can also do a full moon walk.

The walk to walk. This is a really great walk to walk. The last bit may be a little tough if you are not too fit, but most can manage the climb. The view from the top is fantastic. Try and do it late afternoon when it is full moon for spectacular views of the ocean.

What a view - what a climb!. There are very 'alien' locals who run up and down Lions Head for fun - they are to be avoided, mostly because they are travelling at a rate of knots and they are very, very fit. This is a climb for determined, water carrying bet breakers.We had been challenged by a friend who had climbed LH in the winter that if we could climb Lions Head, the wine would be paid for at a very good restaurant in Camps Bay. Anyone who know SA will understand that it is not the price of the bet (wine is relatively inexpensive for Brits by comparison) it is the bet itself…In 30º - 35º heat this is a climb and a half for two people who are reasonably fit - but to be passed by young people constantly up and down the mountain was ignominious.We made it, and were very happy to have made it not simply to win the bet. As we made our way down the mountain there were crowds of young people making their way to the top to see the setting sun on their last day of the Christmas holidays before going back to college out University. It was great to see them, they were not huddled round screens in darkened rooms, they were going to experience a great view from a great place. Though it must have got pretty crowded up there that evening!

Views to die for. Good idea to walk up very early when it's hot in Cape Town. Takes about 45 minutes each way (excluding stopping every two minutes to take pictures) and does get quite busy. Definitely worth the climb when you get to the top. Simply stunning!! Top tips: Take water and camera with you and dont be afraid to climb the chains at the top! One of my favourite days being a tourist!

Watch sinrise from Lion's Head. We started walking up before sunrise and watched the sun come up from a great viewpoint halfway up the mountain. The walk was quite difficult but a lot of fun and well worth it.

Gaining the Lion. After tandem at mother city skydiving with my girlfriend and some friends we decided to continue our adventure to Lion's Head. We started climbing around 8pm without torches and got to the top around 10pm. That wasn't easy at all, but the views on the top paid off. I was completely amused with the stunning 360º views of Cape Town by night. I have no doubt that everyone should try it at least once in a lifetime. Thank you cape town!

Great exercise, wonderful views . Stunning views of Cape Town on the whole climb. Can be strenuous if you are not fit but still worth it. Can be very busy at peak times but everyone is very encouraging. Take water, something enjoyable to drink and snacks to enjoy when you get to the top. The views are spectacular. Try and do it when its full moon and the walk down is surreal. A must do when in Cape Town.

Stunning...a must!. I had thought that I'd skip this after going up Table Mountain the day before, but I was glad that I decided to make the trip to Lion's Head.The walk/climb up to the top is not for the faint of heart, as it requires you to climb up some quite steep ladders and steps. i absolutely loved it and was in my element along with many many others, but I did notice that some people struggled with the climb and turned back. You should be of a medium fitness level to attempt this.A totally different view of Table Mountain and highly recommended.

Hiking on Lion's Head mountain..... An absolute must, even if you are a local Capetonian...but for foreigners as well, if you want to see a breath taking view from the top of a mountain...Getting up Lion's Head can be done taking a lovely stroll, keeping in mind that is is a rather steep way up and going up a little higher will reduce the path's width, so always practice caution when taking up this mountain.I would suggest a nice walk / Hike for first timers and on the second trip, you will know the mountain a little better, as some people actually jog or run up or down but, I will not recommend doing this if you do not know the path.Once up there, the view is so spectacular and you have a 360 degree view of most of Cape Town and the beaches, including Table Mountain.Enjoy and practice caution...and you will have an unforgettable experience.

This is a must for everyone!!. I was pleasantly surprised at how wonderful this destination is. It is a great outing for anyone, no matter how old or young you and unless you are obese you can enjoy this slight challenge of going up Lions Heads. It is not mountain climbing at all, it is lovely climb, well set out paths with rails where needed and the most spectacular 360 degree view from the top. Go early, take snacks to enjoy at the top en enough water.
Beware if afraid of heights.. The other striking mountain! But alas no cable car for this one.Very steep but direct climb but a bit hair-rising at times for those scared of heights.
Phenomenal!. This is not for lightweights - I would describe this as a moderately strenous climb - but very well worth the effort. Really fanstastic experience - a must if you visit Capetown.

Perfect both day and night . This hike is beautiful and not too challenging. Recommended during the day as well as for the sunset. If you go for the sunset, bring light for your way down. Mind the scorpions, though I'm told they are not poisonous.

Great views. As a regular visitor, I can appreciate the gorgeous views over the ocean and Cape Town often, especially at sunset. The route also offers good exercise and is generally safe if hiking guidelines are followed.

360 views. Great hike - do able in around an hour. The last part is a bit of a scramble and a challenge with little kids, but we still made it up. Views from the top are amazing, plus you see the views all the way around as you wind your way up.
sightseeing. this was one good experience when you are on your way to Cable car or from afar , this captures you and makes you understand nature better..

Not just a hiking trail. Aim for an early start. The route is safe, but best to go with a friend. You can join the full moon hike which is spectacular with a great atmosphere. Some local use this path to practice their trail runs, so give way and don't be surprised if they overtake you 3 times in both directions. Take lots of water. A 3rd of the way up you can paraglide down to the cricket field in camps bay, and enjoy a cold beer afterwards at the bar (best to pre book paragliding). The views are breathtaking once you reach the top. It works up an appetite, so have lunch plans in place for when you get down.

Wonderful Hike. The best is to start off early in the morning, still cool and the city is asleep. You may consider doing a full moon hike, but the mountain maybe very busy. For the unfit this maybe a challenge, but enough beautiful views to make you stop and take a photo or two. There are benches along the way to catch your breath. The view from top is spectacular, take some coffee or drinks along and enjoy it while you stare over Cape Town.
Stunning views!. wonderful wonderful views!one can even try paragliding down from here to camps bay. definitely worth the visit

A favourite amongst locals and foreigners alike. This is really a delightful hike, with various paths of varying difficulty. The difficult path is great fun hiking up while the easy path coming down is a no brainer. Feel free to hike anytime. It's always open and always free. An early dusk hike with a bottle of wine for the top is wonderful, but make sure to bring along some head lamps for when it gets dark. The views are breathtaking. Locals and foreigners love hiking up this mountain but somehow it never seems to get too full of people. So a definite must if you are in Cape Town.
Mesmerising Expering!. This is my ultimate best hike of all time. A difference experience with each hike, the view is absolutely breath taking!

an evening I will never forget.... Besides getting engaged :-) we enjoyed an excellent evening. To see the sunset from this spot, is really a recommendation! The hike up is worth while to have the view from the top.

Something you have to do in CT. This is a wonderful walk/hike. The view is incredible and allows Cape Town to show off a little.The view of the Atlantic Seaboard on the one side and the City on the other with Blouberg and Milnerton in the distance is hard to beat.The walk is great for exercise and/or for site seeing.When it's busy it does get a little crowded and you have to dodge people while walking up and drive up and down a few times to find a park, but it's definitely worth the time and effort. You always feel a sense of accomplishment having reached the top.I recently went up with my 7yr old who did the chain section which was amazing.I have done it when it's been damp and/or previously raining and there is allot more traction on the rocks. Recently we went up where it was very dry and the sand on the rocks make it pretty slippery at times...something to be careful of.

A must visit. Lions Head is a must visit place for a meander either during the day or during full moon. Depending on one's fitness level, it can take anything from 1 hour or more to walk up to the top.Once on top, one has beautiful views of Table Mountain, the Apostles as well as Robben Island and the Atlantic Seaboard. Care must be taken with clothing as the temperature and wind can change very quickly, so it is recommended to have some warm clothes with despite how warm it may be.

sweating is goood. what a beautiful head it is !!! enjoyed very much with my group of people climbing to TOP , what an amazing work out it was , recommending to anyone who are fit and can do it , beaware on hot days you must have lots of water !! cheers

Beautiful view. I really enjoyed my hike up on Lion's Head, which took us about 1h up and 45 min down from the parking site on. The good thing about the view from Lion's Head is that you see Cape Town from above BUT compared to Table Mountain, you ALSO see Table Mountain ;) On top, it offers a stunning 360° view. So if Table Mountain is a little too much to walk for you, this is a great alternative. Btw: take enough water with you!

Fabulous Hike with Breathtaking Views. Our family of 4 took a cab to the trail head. Be sure you go early to avoid the crowds. It took us about 1 1/2 hours to the top and a good pace. The last 1/2 hours was a little steep but the kids of course loved that part! The views are breathtaking at the top. I highly recommend this hike just be sure to bring water and a camera! It took us 45 min. to get down and we were able to call a cab when finished to return to the V&A Waterfront where we were staying.

Nice Hike with Incredible views.. Fabulous views and well worth it. I agree with other comments - go early to avoid heat and crowds - bring water and carry it in small backpack and wear appropriate shoes that have good grip. Fairly straightforward hike - with more difficulty and steepness at the top. Close to the end of the hike there is a choice of routes - using the chains and ladders or taking the less steep route. We went up the chains/ladders, which was more conjested as you need to take turns allowing hikers up/down and came down the longer route. We are glad we did both. The longer route had an extra landing with great and different views that we were able to appreciate. The entire hike took us about 2 hours to do - Definitely recommend this one! Only reason I am not giving this a 5 is that we went when it was a bit crowded and needed to wait a few times during the hike to get through congestion spots.
Not for the faint hearted. The climb is not really difficult if you are fit. Definitely worth the exercise. One of the most gorgeous views from CPT and free!

A beautiful Hike. Definitely take half a day off to hike to the peak of Lion's Head where you will be treated to breath-taking views. Moderate climb of about 3 hours+ in total. Will need a car to drive to the base Lion's head.

Must do in Cape Town. If you are in Cape Town, of average fitness and looking for adventure, climing Lion's Head is a must. You will not get a better view of basically everything in Cape Town anywhere else.

Great views !. Nice view over Cape Town and good photo opportunities, both of cape town and the table mountain. This is also from where the sky-divers start when cruising over the city landing at the grass area by the sea, which is quite fun to watch.

Go there for sunrise!!. Bring enough water and good shoes. Take your time to hike&climb, the top takes some breath ;)
Go there for sunrise (bring a torch!) it's incredible beautiful.

Fantastic view but don't get bluffed; it's kind of a steep walk at the end and can be dangerous.. Count for 3 hours in total. It's getting steeper and steeper over time and if you get dizzy quickly, stay away from the end, towards the tip. Some ladders and chains will help you getting up there at the end. Absolut magnificent view and if you feel fit enough, a must do. Careful with undressing since the wind makes you feel rather cool but in fact, a sun-burn will await you when looking in the mirror after the evening shower. :)

Fantastic climb and view!. Climbing Lion's Head was difficult but definitely doable (unless you are afraid of heights). You need to climb ladders and use staples at some steep parts, and it is strenuous.
Amazing views. Amazing views as the sun is setting but it can get very dark so bring torches. The beauty of nature is very real, and it is worth a visit.

360Degree Views of Cape Town. The hike up is just over an hour; and 45mins down. I suggest you leave as early as it get very crowded. When almost at the top you have two choices, use the chain ladders to move up vertically or walk around to meet at the same peak. As the chain ladders gets crowded we walked for an extra 10/15mins to reach the summit smoothly.
Climbing Lions Head. A pretty tough climb for an old fart like myself but, very pleased to get to the top, lots of people of all ages make the climb and the views from the summit, stunning.
Beautiful sight. Lovely landmark in CT good to get a room with this view. ..can hike or walk...good background for photos

Be Prepared!. We decided to climb Lion's Head as Table Mountain was closed. We were advised it would take about 1 hour up and 1 hour down. The first thing we noticed was that there was a small hut with a sign selling drinks and that's all. No other signs in relation to the climb and what to expect. The whole route is a dirt road with an easy start but an acute increase in difficulty as you get closer to the top. There's a fair bit of climbing and narrow ledges so you need a certain amount of fitness to get up there. The first plateau took about an hour and then another 15 mins or so to climb the final steep bit to the top. This is quite a steep climb. The views all the way up are magnificent and well worth the climb. The first plateau is fine if you don't want to go all the way to the top as the views here are breathtaking and there's plenty of room to rest and take photos. Bring plenty of water, start early, wear a hat and sunscreen and wear comfortable walking shoes. There's no signs at all along the route so you really don't know what point of the climb you've reached and when the difficulty starts. The only visible signs are those that tell you to climb at your own risk. At least that's covered!

Impressive mountain. We did not climb Lion's Head, instead we climbed Table Mountain (India Venstre), which fitted our ability better. Lion's Head is an impressive mountain and forms the head of the lion (the rest of the mountain is the body of the lion). Nicely located, and not very far from Cape Town.

Liond head hike. Very well worth itLovely view at the topNot for the very unfitMake sure you have lots if water,good shoes that grip Never hike aloneGo on a day that is not too sunny,or rather go earlyLoved it

Amazing views for those with head for heights. My girlfriend and I walked up on New Year's Eve with the view of watching the New Year's Eve fireworks from there. We turned back at the top as unfortunately my vertigo set in as the top is very exposed. We did see some spectacular views and the sunset however. My girlfriend is not an experienced walker and in the evening (7pm) heat it took about 1 hour to get to the top from the car park on signal hill road. We were glad we got down in the dusk as despite bringing torches it was tricky in the dark. I would definitely bring torches is descending in darkness or dusk

Awesome hike. Friends with kids did this hike, reaching the top in time for sunset. It is challenging for younger kids. Teenagers would manage easily. There is a more technical section for those that want to try. The views are absolutely stunning. Take a light jacket as it gets windy on the top. Take a torch if you plan on watching sunset at the top. You will need it when you are coming down.

Lovely experience late in the afternoon. Loved travelling up Lions head with the hop on hop off bus. Visit just before sunset for a beautiful view of the sunset. Bring something warm and a camera as well as a picnic basket. (Coffee is sold on top of the mountain, bring money with).

Spectacular views reward a challenging (but achievable) climb. We took on Lion's Head having heeded the standard tips - 1) go early to avoid the heat 2) go early to avoid congestion 3) take water 4) wear sensible shoes 5) be reasonable fit and 6) apply sunblock so we figured we were well prepared .. The climb is a satisfying challenge .. In parts it's tough and toward the end steep. Two additional tips would have made the climb more enjoyable 7) have a light backpack so you can free up your arms to climb the steeper parts and 8) there are two ways to reach the final stage - steep via chains and grips, another slightly longer route that is easier to traverse .. Not knowing these two made the ascent more daunting as I was worried about getting back down.. The views from the top are amazing .. I read another review saying they aren't work it but I suspect that reviewer runs a helicopter company ... This is a great experience .. We saw a great variety of climbers from younger ultra fit through to families and even folk who were more mature .. It's doable of you take time and heed the recommendations ... This is a lifelong memory!

Beautiful! . We started our walk around 07:30. I'll recommend that you start even earlier as parking was a big problem and it was already very hot. We took our kids with (8 and 5 years).
