Definitely take at least 1 liter of water per person, or more. In the summer it gets very hot. I really enjoyed the walk (and climb) but it is quite tough if you are not used to hiking and with little children. Although the recommended route has less climbing than the shorter route, be prepared for steep climbing towards the top and narrow paths. I will definitely do it again but maybe not in mid summer. Too hot and busy.

Rewarding climb with breathtaking views . We started our climb at 05:30 and within minutes the sun was rising. We reached the peak 90 minutes later and this was due to lots of traffic....the rocky climbs where you need to use ladders, staples and chains are bottlenecks on the route so i wish we had gone 45 minutes earlier - the African sun can be very harsh.Otherwise the climb was not as bad as i expected - i am not very fit yet i did not struggle to make the climb. It just needs one to be very careful at the last 15% of the climb as the rocks are steep and you pull yourself up such steep rocks. Use shoes with a tough/rubber grip to avoid slipping and yeah, don't give up on the way and turn back (lots of people turned back). #MindOverMatter :-)

Feels like the top of the workd. The top of Lions head is accessible to novice climbers but it does take a few hours. This is the most gorgeous climb I've ever done. chains and grips are installed in the most challenging parts of the mountain toward the top.

Even better views than from Table Mountain. A couple days after hiking Table Mountain (which was fantastic) I climbed Lion's Head late on an early, sunny February afternoon with three colleagues. It's a hike and then at some point becomes a bit of skirting around the side of the rocks using some chain link hand holds bloted into the rock. Then a bit of rock climbing via some steel handholds bolted into the rocks over a short section. Then a steep climb pretty quickly to the summit. It's not as difficult as it sounds. Give yourself a couple hours to get up to the top. The views from the top of the city, the coast below (Camps Bay, Bantry Bay and Clifton) and of Table Mountain are memorable (see attached photos). Make a point of doing this if you're inclined. You'll be rewarded with the best views of the peninsula and Cape Town.

Fantastic panoramic views. A steep climb - bring plenty of water and some snacks - rewarded with exquisite views of Table Mountain and Cape Town. You will have to do a tiny bit of rock-climbing, but for the most part the track is fairly standard, just steep! If you're driving, park at the bottom and make sure your valuables are well out of sight. It's also a good idea to tip the local car guard before embarking on your climb. Lion's Head is very popular when the moon is full - a beautiful sight, but do be aware it will be crowded with picnickers at the top.

Mountains always look pretty from a Distance. We drove as close as we could to the top. It was just like driving up any mountain road. Once we had walked a bit further up, the views of the coast and the city were fantastic. One cannot get the true Lions Head feeling from up there. It looks like just any other hill side. To really see how the entire mountain shows the Lions Head, the Rump and the tail one really needs to take a helicopter ride. I can imagine, it would be a great hiking trail for the enthusiasts but it was not for me.

Make the climb. I had some friends recommend making the climb early in the morning. I'm not a young chicken anymore, but I had no problem climbing to the summit. It gets a little tricky near the top, but just convince yourself that you made 90% of the climb and it would be a shame to turn back before you hit the top. It's worth it.

What a climb. We wanted to get to the top and watch the sunset. The climb itself was surprisingly long…it took us two hours for going 680m up. What starts off as a hike quickly becomes a climb, and it was lovely. The view is fantastic, and it's 360. Getting up there, sitting on the rocks and contemplating -dominating- Cape Town is a strong feeling. Because you're not as high as on the Table, you see everything much clearer. I would recommend being comfortable with heights, as well as secure shoes (ideally with a grip or something, because my trainers kept slipping on the sand covered boulders). You don't need a lot of experience as long as you take your time, and are with someone who is used to this sort of thing. To be honest, I really became a hiker over this holiday, and was use really careful regarding my footing. (I had a camera in one hand to give you an idea..but for going back down you need two hands). Hope you enjoy it, my only regret is the sun was covered by clouds so we didn't see the sunset…the climb up as great though :)
Sunset. Beautiful view. Stunning sunset with 12 apostles on your left.take a head light with for the trip down in the dark. Amazing stunning scenery. Take a friend with to share the experience.

For the moderately fit. We took a cab to Signal Hill for sunset but that turned into a little bit of traffic chaos. On the way, we saw one could walk up Lion's Head so we came the next day. It took 45 minutes of scrambling up there. There are a couple of one way bottlenecks to navigate and the chains and ladders might deter the less hardy but folk of all types were up there when we arrived. And the views made it worthwhile. Wow. The sea, sun, clouds and city all combined. We headed down before the rush (avoiding those pinch points) and sat on the lower slopes to watch the sun sink into the sea. A great few hours.

Great views, challenging hike.. I really enjoying climbing up Lions Head, as someone who is very inexperienced, I found it quite challenging but still manageable - and the views at the top are worth it!Would really recommend going, I probably spend about 2hrs total, including taking pictures etc at the top!
Walk to view the city. A not very difficult walk to the lion's head will lead you to the city view, do the paragliding from the hill and you will love it.
beautiful views. great hike. quite a way up..bring water and something to eat, go early (06.00) and enjoy the exercise

A challenging hike with extraordinary views. Climbing Lion's Head was an amazing experience. My guidebook categorized the hike as beginning to intermediate. The party I was with all agree that this was, for us, quite challenging (we are all active, but not experienced with this type of hike). It took us about 4 hours in all, though we did enjoy the amazing view at the top for quite a while. As I said, the view from the top was amazing, we were able to see Table Top Mountain, the beaches, even Robbins Island. I recommend bring plenty of water and a camera.

Miss Green. Did paragliding from this spot and loved it!Make sure you fit, as the walk up is no joke, took me 20mins! I was really out of it that day, but it's beautiful... really cool just to sit there and enjoy the view, pictures looks fantastic!

Stunning Walk and Views. This is a wonderful walk to appreciate Cape Town. It is not to difficult but still challenging enough. The views are great. Even if you don´t walk up, sunset from here is superb.

Lions Head hike. After several hikes up Lion Head it definitely classifies as a personal favourite. The hike up to the top is spectacular and only surpassed by beautiful sunrises, sunsets and full moon viewing. Truly unforgettable and the proof is in how many locals do hikes there throughout the year.

An Amazing In-City Hike. We have hiked all over the world, and Lion's Head is unbeatable for in-city hiking was spectacular views. Don't go when it's crowded though (you can tell by the parking lot); it is crazy at the chains. The entire hike will take about 1 1/2 hours, with time for photos at the top.

Great hike!. Bring good shoes and sun block! This is a great hike if you are in good condition and can make it to the top. Great views along the way.
Don't forget to come prepared (water etc). Went up with wife and two kids, we had a great day. Approx 80 minutes up and 45 down.

Fantastic Hike!. My husband and I hiked up Lions Head. It certainly proved to be a fun challenge. The hike begins in a steep inclined path, then to rocky steps, and finally a series of chains and ladders. Once at the top the views were breathtaking! People of all fitness levels were present, however it does require a certain fitness ability.

Climb Lion's Head during full moon!. Wow, this is one of my favourite things to do when visiting Cape Town! It takes about an hour's climb to get to the top. The best time to climb is just before sunset, so that you can watch the sun set over the ocean when your at the top. When it's full moon, you don't need a torch to go down, because the moon's light is enough. But if it's not full moon, don't forget to bring your torch!Also, be careful in the dark. There has been an increase in crime on Lion's Head, so make sure you climb with a big group of people.Definitely a must do when in Cape Town! And it's free!

YOU have to do THIS Hike to Lion's head !. Among the many attractions in Cape Town, I rate this hike to Lion's head as the best of all.We parked at Signal Hill Road, exact location -33.936843, 18.394916. Make sure you bring enough water before you ascend. There is a drink stall where the parking is. 2-3 hours is sufficient for this hike.The beauty of this hike is that you see 360 degrees view of Cape Town, because as you hike up, you need to circle the Lion's head and each ascend, the view becomes better and it is amazing. You will come to a point where there is a recommended route , or a route which is at your own risk ( with staples, chains, ladder). We chose the risky route, which is manageable, just be careful and do not rush if you have young children. I would not recommend this route if the child is young than 12years old. There are groups of students doing the hike too, especially in the evening when it is not so hot. Security is not a question. This place is beautiful, lovely, and amazing. We had a great time and fond memories of this Lion's head hike!
Glorious views. Cape Town is blessed with wonderful viewpoints and from here one can see for miles, the breezes are invigorating and their is plentiful flora in the spring months.

Excellent view. Excellent view at sunset! Be careful by climbing up and down, especially after sunset. During the climbing there is not much fencing. People with fear of heights should think about this for that reason. But...a fantastic experience and view!!
Amazing!. We chose to get up early and catch the sunrise. One of the most beautiful things ive ever seen. Bring your hiking shoes.

the ultimate fitness test. Lots of people seem to "climb", hike or even run up Lions Head as a daily exercise. It's a fun hike of approx. 1 hour, you have to use hands and feets at times and you have to walk back down - no transport! But the view from the top is great.

Alternate route with less people. I went up via an alternate route that I discovered on Google Maps. There is a branch of the Lion's Head path that starts at the top of Upper Rhine Road (at the base of Signal Hill), goes gradually up in a southwesterly direction skirting Signal Hill, passes an area where there appears to be a little mosque, and then continues southwest below Lion's Head, before connecting with the main circular path around Lion's Head. It's about two hours to the top from this starting point, 90 minutes back down, so bring lots of water (1.5 liters per person or more). Great views off to the west, and there is a stand of boulders about 10 minutes below the connection point with the main path where you can a rest or a picnic without anyone around.Once rejoining the main path, as you get closer to the top there are some ladders and hand stapels before getting to the split (located at one of the last and few trees on Lion's Head) where you can go the chain route or the "easy" route. If you are in good health, have decent shoes, and are comfortable with heights, the chain route is fine going up ... but I took the easier route that bypasses the chains to go down. People say it's much quicker on the chains but I don't think there's a big difference, especially coming down. I'll mention again the need for lots of water, because I saw a lot of people who only brought a single small bottle. There is little shade and no taps anywhere on the route, so you really need to bring your own and bring a lot because it's hot and moderately strenuous. Take a hat and lots of sunscreen too, and a little food to enjoy somewhere along the way. Have fun! Also, if it has rained recently or is scheduled to rain I would not recommend this ... the rocks are smooth and probably quite slippery when wet.
breath taking view. by looking at the ocean all your problem vanish, the wind relaxes you and soon you forgot all your troubles.

Amazing 360 views of Cape Town. Did this hike with friends before they went to work one morning and had an amazing experience! The trail is a spiral around the mountain so you have 360 views of cape town on the way up, especially Table Mountain. Don't miss this!!

The best things to do in Cape Town. I have been up Lion's Head a couple of times and enjoyed it every time! Although not a easy stroll - you can decide how far you want to take it. Choose another route down to see a different angle of Cape Town.

Amazing View. A friend suggested we get up at 4.30am to climb to the top of lions head. I thought we would be like the only ones there for sunrise. Turns out this is a popular thing. Some people do it daily. I absolutely loved it. If you're scared of heights you might struggle as some parts you really need to climb. But you feel great when you get to the top.

One of my favourite quick hikes. One of the incredible features of Cape Town, Lion's head looms over the CBD. Although over shadowed by its bigger brothers, Table Mountain and Devil's Peak, it offers a lot of bang for buck (no bucks, actually, just a bit of sweat and effort). The 360 degree views of Table Bay and the Twelve Apostles are absolutely iconic, and with a decent amount of fitness, you can be up and down in under 90 minutes. (Actually, you've got to be really fit to do that: more reasonable times are an hour up and 45 minutes down)
South African roadtrip . Breathtaking mountain with walks hikes and mountain bike trails all over it as it dominates the skyline You really can't miss it
Hike to the top. Fantastic tour to the top... However be aware that is not for beginnes and people with height problems.

Grandioser Ausblick - unique experience!. Lovely view, lovely walk with some hiking, but view is unbeatable! You need proper shoes and ample water to be taken for the climb, no toilettes, no waste bins,....
Take the tour bus. Take the tour bus and hear the interesting commentary and here the history, overlooking beautiful white sands,
Amazing view. The trail is a nice workout. The hike was beautiful! I would recommend sport shoes or hiking boots ! the view is fantastic !
A very nice hike. Easy hike on a large path with a magnificient view of down below while you circle around the Head, going up.

Great walk. This was a fantastic walk, we went right to the top, but if you didn't want to climb you still get a great view from the top of the walking part. We went just before sunset and it was beautiful

My favorite little mountain.. Always enjoyable. Wear proper shoes and take water. Always hike in groups for safety reasons.
Please don't litter.

A MARVELLOUS WALK. What a lovely bit of ecercise walking up Lion's Head. The view is quite spectacular. It is quite strenuous but yet invigorating. If you are a keen exerciser, then this is something to do.
Place to be. Perfect for hiking. Nice view on the top and comparing to the hike on top of the table mountain, it isnt long.

Great views over cape town. Nice short 1-1.5 hours hike up lions head from the parking area just between Lion's head and signal hill. Does get very hot in the sun and not many shady areas on the way up so bring some water and try not to go in very hot weather and/or middle of the day

Full Moon Hike. Did this hike on the full moon after shark diving. So amazing. Hiked with our shark dive guide, and he was raving about how great the weather was going to be, and it was splendid! No wind and in the 70's fahrenheit. You walk up and can see the sunset and the moonrise at the same time, and are on this mtn with what seems like the entire city. The sunsets and the city lights make everything surreal. Definitely one of the top things I did in Cape Town, along with paragliding and the shark dive!
Lions head walk. One of the best ways is to walk up the Lions Head. Park your car below and be prepared for a hike and get a beautiful view of the table mountain.

Fabulous views. Nature at its finest. Lion's Head is a treat for the Capetown traveller because it rises you above the city to enjoy the breezes and see the horizon. It is majestic. Wear good solid shoes to protect your feet ad sunscreen. A hat that fits securely on your head would be advisable because both the sun and the winds are strong up here.

AMAZING VIEWS & HOT CHOCOLATE THANKS TO GO TOUCHDOWN TOURS!. The locals like to hike this mountain every night at sunset because the view is spectacular & Go TouchDown tours took us up there for sunset & we also sipped the BEST Hot chocolate on the side of this mountain just admiring another memorable sunset...
Amazing experience !. I climbed it with a good friend and it was a great adventur with lots of fun. You can´t miss it if you are in Cape Town.

A nice alternative for Table Mountain. It's a easy ride up with the car which you can park at the top. The view is beautiful over Capetown so this is a cheap and easy accessible alternative to the more expensive Table Mountain
Lovely hike. I've hiked to the top of Lion's Head a few times. It's not too difficult and it's very beautiful, just remember to take water and maybe a snack to enjoy at the top ♡

Awesome Walk. Very good and quick walk to go on with one of the best views.
Would definitely reccommend this to anyone.

A lovely wslj. We had walked table mountain 3/4 times previous so we decided on the Lions Head on this trip. Great walk, not as hard as Table Mountain. Amazing vista of camps bay. We did not go all the way to the top as it gets really steep & from what we could see a single steep track up.
Skip Table Mountain. Skip table mountain and head here instead for a great view without the crowds. Allow about 3 hours to go up and down again!

Great hike and views of the city and table mountain. I loved the hike, it wasn't to difficult but it had different types of trails from dirt paths to rocky stairs and it also had a chained pathway (a shortcut to the top) that was a bit like rock climbing. And I thought it had a better view of the city than table mountain. But it was a great two for one, you got to see table mountain and had a better city Viewpoint

One of Cape Town's favorite attractions. The funny thing about Cape Town is that the people who live there are more interested in the mountains than the ocean! Lion's head is one of the peaks they love to point to. I observed Lion's Head from the top of the mountain and it is gorgeous. We did not have an opportunity to hike it.

breathtaking, yoga&hike with Stefanie @ inmotion. Awesome 4 hours trip started with walking into hiking and finally climbing to reach the top where we did a wonderful yoga session followed by a picknickUNFORGETABLE
loved the hike and the view was breathtaking. it was too windy to take the cable car up table mt. i believe the view is the same and felt better about doing it without the cable car.

Best Sunset Ever!. We hiked up Lion's Head to watch the sunset and it was beyond amazing. The hike is not easy but it's also not too "tough". Most of it is flat up hill until you reach the top portion. Then you're walking among rocks and climbing a little. There is a section were you need to use chains to get up to the next level, I avoided this. There's an alternative route you can take, which is a bit longer but I felt safer. I wish I wouldn't have waited until the last night to take this hike, so that I could've done it more than once. Maybe even try to get up using the chains. This could quite possibly be some of the most breathtaking views I've ever seen.

A must-do attraction in Cape Town. Having hiked both table mountain and lions head I highly recommend lions head if you only have time for one hike. It's more fun, the trail is diverse both in views - as you're spiraling to the top - as well as in terrain, making this a pleasant hike. The view from the top is amazing, as its really a summit you can look all sides from a single spot.
Lions Head hike. It was really amazing! We enjoyed it very much and would do it again. Quite a hike up especially if you take the wrong path
Steep hike, but worth it!. The start of the hike is quite nice, but once you hit the rocks it is more climbing than hiking. It is worth the trip though, amazing view at the top!

Well Worth the Hike!. Spectacular views over Cape Town, Camps Bay, Table Mountain and Robben Island reward those who make the trek up the Lion's Head.It's a straightforward walk up the ascending trail from the roadside starting point. You get to chose between continuing up the trail or opting for the short vertical gully climb using the ladders and rungs - this is not demanding at all, so don't hesitate if you fancy the exercise!The summit is reached via a lengthy hike up the narrow ridge which offers some great views. At the top, take in all the views - it's great!

Great hike for those with limited time. This is a great hike with fantastic views of Cape Town and surounding areas. Hike took about 3 hours, round trip at a steady pace. Has some narrow sections, also some ladders, not recommended for those without a head for heights.
The best views. A good,challenging walk to work off all the fine dining & good wine! The reward the best panoramic views of Cape Town

Hike up Lion's Head. Really enjoyable hike, not to strenuous which a bit of ladder climbing. We it the bus up to kloof neck and walked up the road to the start of the route. It started off as a winding incline around the "hill" until the route gets rocky. This is where it becomes more exciting and we have to use ladders in some places. There is an option for a recommended route that is easier then a climbing route using ladders and ropes. All in all it took us 45 mins to climb up with some photo stops. The views are great and there are some great photo opportunities. It took about 35mins to climb back down.
Horrible. It is a horrible place because it is long hard and very dangerous walk and really nothing to do no nice places it's not really good view so it's not really a place I think you should go.

Even better views of Cape town. It is a nice hike up to the Lion's head, and views are rewarding! You can see whole Cape town and Table mountain, so pictures are the best! You can choose 2 paths to go up, either easier walk or actual climbing, which is a lot of fun. If the weather is good, it is really a perferct day!

The other mountain. Every time i visit Cape Town I climb both peaks, Table mountain and the Lions Head.Table Mountain is more demanding, between two and two and a half hpurs of steep climbing where as the Lions HeD is a challenging one hour climb with parts of chain-climbing . The most omportant difference is the arrival at the top. At Table Mountain there is allways a welcoming committee of chinese and japanese tourists while at the top of the Lions Head there is.....nothing, nothing but silence and nature.

Top hike with beautifull views!. We started the hike around 6pm to see the sunset. It was a relatively clear day and the view was absolutely stunning!However, don't underestimate the hike! It's tough and you literally have to climb over rocks. Then again, once you're up (after having died a couple of times), you know why you have done it!Dress in layers. The hike is tough and in the sun you get really hot. But on top there can be a really cold wind. Bring at least a fleece with you.Take you're time. If you're in really good shape, the walk can be done in 45 minutes. However, most of us will take up to 1 hour 15 to get up. And you don't want to rush it!

Gorgeous Views, Difficult Hike. If you're afraid of heights, be ware of this one! While Lion's Head is popular among locals, who hike it in the morning and even at sunset, it is not an easy trip up. I'll be honest, I made it maybe half way. While the physical effort isn't particularly high, the paths are narrow with sharp drop offs. There are ladders and chains to help climb up some of the rock face as well, and I hear at the top there is a very narrow walkway across to get to the plateau. Even having gone half way the view is incredible, and seeing both sides of the town with the water was a real treat. If you do go, be sure to bring plenty of water, wear good shoes, wear sunscreen, etc.

Full moon hike. The mountain is great to walk! Thr last bit is a climb part but a lot of fun! And for people who don't want to climb there is a way to still get to the top! It's great!And you should really do the full moon hike if you can. It is amazing! Unreal!The sunset is so so so goreous and then you see he moon coming up from behind the mountains! Its just so magical!!! ♡Don't forget a flahlight or torch!!

walking trail adventure. On the same route to signal hill one can try the many walking trails on the mountain to enjoy some awesome views of Cape Town. Parking is available along the side of the road. Always wear comfortable shoes and attire and be fit for the adventure.

Amazing views worth the scramble. I don't think anyone would call Lion's head an easy stroll but it is fun, the chains and ladders may seem a bit daunting but are well maintained and do speed up the process. It is a bit of a scramble to the top but worth it and it seems busy and generally safe!

Good Head. The climb is a lot easier than getting to the base of Lions Head as taxi drivers have no idea. They can point it out but to drive there...Ummph! Never-the-less we got there and climbed to the summit on a clear day. Do the climb early to avoid unpredicable weather changes. Great views of the city below and Table Mountain.

Stunning views. A lovely 45 minute to 75 minute (depending on fitness) walk up Lion's Head in Cape Town. Some parts are a bit scary, but there is an alternative recommend route for the less adventurous.
Great hike -- especially for sunsets in summer!. Lovely place for a hike to watch the sunset. Lovely views of the city, and the Atlantic seaboard at your feet.
Views to die for!. Amazing! Get up really early and watch the sun rise - you wont regret it! Not for the faint hearted though! Please only attempt if you are fit!!

Amazing views but not to be underestimated. I hiked up with my girlfriend to see the sunset and hiked down shortly thereafter. The views are breathtaking and provided you're not afraid of heights you will enjoy being at the summit. However, we were expecting a much easier walk based on what we had read in various brochures, so I would caution inexperienced hikers/climbers to expect a decent challenge and a degree of risk. The climb is generally okay: it starts on wide paths that are safe and not steep; the final ascent is tricker - essentially climbing up rocks, using ladders and chains at times, with a very steep drop almost always not far away. It concerns me to see websites talking about taking very young children on the "easier route" - I wouldn't consider this hike suitable for children or anyone with a fear of heights. My girlfriend loved it though and we did get stunning views/photos of the sunset and we managed to pass the trickier section of the descent before darkness properly kicked in. That said, I didn't always feel safe with strong winds blowing at the high and narrow sections so I didn't really enjoy the climb itself and I'm glad I didn't have to do it in complete darkness!
Great views. Go here near sunset for the most spectacular views you can imagine. If I could sit here all day I would!

Great hike, stunning views!. We had initially intended to climb Table Mountain, but the so-called "table cloth" of clouds forced us to turn back half way up. A local told us that the winds and clouds on table mountain are usually not present on Lion's Head so we drove the short distance there and started the hike. The path winds around Lion's Head and gives you stunning views of Campo's Bay, Table Mountain and Cape Town. The road eventually gave way to a path, which eventually led to a fork where you could either continue on the path or take a more direct, albeit more challenging route with ladders and chains. We took the more demanding route and it was fine, but if people have a fear of heights, it could play tricks on you and the straight path may be a better alternative. The last stretch of the climb will be more physically exerting, but the summit is easily reachable by anyone in reasonable shape. The summit offers a panorama of Cape Town and the local was right...the winds that swirled on Table Mountain in the distance were never a threat to us on Lion's Head. This was a very enjoyable hike that was well worth it.

Ideal for a short hike and a nice view of Cpt. Drive up to the parking and start this 1h hike up to the top on Lion's head. You'll get a 360 view of the city. For the most adventurous, go there for the sunset or the sunrise.

Good hike and view to match!. Table Mountain wasn't an option due to the fog. Our hotel, Ellerman House, recommended this instead. From the top you get a great view over Cape Town with Table Mountain behind it. The walk starts fairy easy but as you near the summit it's pretty steep, with ladders, hand grips and metal chains rigged up to help you reach the peak. Definitely worth it!
Hiking trail. What a stunning view from the top but you will have to hike up, and the walk is not too hectic but you would need energy, water and nibbles

Better than Table mountain . The view from the top is better than the view from Table Mountain. The hike is challenging at the very end as it involves free climbing and use of ladders and handles, but if you go slow you will be fine. Bring a jacket as its freezing at the top! Free to climb- drive to signal hill to begin.

Breathtaking. Best view of Cape Town !!Went it yesterday, on a foggy day but we were able to see Cape Town once we got to the top. For 3 minutes, the fog and the clouds gave us that chance. Mysterious feeling ... The fog, the clouds, the wine blowing ... Fantastic. Took us 45 minutes ... But we're use to this kind of things. Expect 1 hour and a half if you're not experienced. What a day ... What a view ... What a feeling ;)

Well worth the climb.. A worthy climb to get to the top but well worth the efforts. The view from the top is breathtaking. Watch the clouds flow onto Table Mountain from the sea and fall like a table cloth being blown by a breeze. Best time to climb is at sunrise before it gets too hot. Take a bottle of drinking water and mind your head, a hat is recommended. It seems this climb brings the best out of people. Everyone seemed so polite and friendly.

Thrilling little hike. Great little hike with some challenging spots to overcome. It took us about an hour to get to the top. You'll definitely need some hiking boots or trainers with good grip. We liked that the people climbing Lion's Head were a mixture of locals and tourists. You don't get any large groups hence the experience is fairly authentic. Beware that the wind can be very strong up there so take light clothes that you would also take on any other hike. The view from the top is breathtaking. Would love to do a full moon hike next time I'm here.

on the edge. not for the faint hearted, or individuals afraid of heights. but for those that are brave enough it is an exhilarating hike. the views along the way and at the top is all worth it. sunset hike and full moon hike are both beautiful

Lion's head, still don't see the lion :). A trail that gives you a little bit of nerves, but you get up to a really nice view and make sure that you get to see the sunset on your way down. I would not recommend doing this in the dark because of dangerous places to walk.

Firm favourite!. Lion's head offers superb 180 degrees vistas over the Atlantic ocean, Table Mountain, Robben island, Camps Bay and the City Bowl.It is most accessible, just pack water, a snack, a hat and anorak and ... Follow the path to the top! The ascend and descend will take an equal amount of time. Ideal for an early morning hike before it is too hot.

Part of the Table Mountain area. Lion's Head is part of the Twelve Apostles that make up the Table Mountain area. Wonderful views, situated within minutes of Cape Town central. It was raining when I visited which made it all the more beautiful.

Great hike but not if you're afraid of heights!. The hike up to the top is easy enough if you are reasonably fit, but it gets tougher at the end with some pretty airy parts. Last time I was there I chickened out 100 meter below the summit. The views are great all the way up, as you circle around the mountain.

Superb. I went weekday mid morning, there was quite a few people going up/ coming down, I went alone, felt safe but I guess you never know. Took about 25 mins to get up, was a good challenge with climbing and scrambling over rocks. The views from the top blew me away, fanatastic. I don't think I'd like to do a sunset one though as coming down in the daylight requires concentration let alone in the dark.
Great early morning walks. You can drive to car parks (side of the road) and take a bracing walk and find wonderful views - 360 degrees from Cape town Bay, to Table Mountain to the 12 apostles.
great views. very nice views and a good hiking spot as well as long as not windy. You can drive up or take the hop on hop off bus up there as well

The scenery forever beautiful. My favourite route for hiking. Quick and easy. And you'll meet plenty other hikers along the way, which is good for safety reasons. The scenery is always mystical especially with the clouds blanketing the mountains. Beautiful at both sunrise and sunset.

Fun climb, ace views!. First of all I would warn that anyone who has read in a guide that this is an 'easy' climb may want to take it with a pinch of salt depending on your experience and feelings about heights. The start of the walk is a fairly gentle incline but the scrambling sections are tough on the thighs, particularly on the way down, and possibly a bit scary.HOWEVER it is totally worth it and probably my favourite hike that I've ever done. Amazing views from the top, rivalling table mountain and possibly even better since you get table mountain in the view! The staples and chains and ladders make for a memorable challenge and are really fun (if you like that kind of thing!). Achey muscles made walking downstairs a challenge for the next couple of days - it's the descent that really gets you - but would do it again any day.Important to note- the path does split off near the top so you have an option between a stapled scramble and a walk, however if you want to get to the very summit then the more challenging climbing is unavoidable as the entire last section is made up of this.If you go on a hot day bring lots and lots of water, we made this mistake as there is not much shade at all. Mileage will vary on how long it takes - I would say unless you're planning to go speedily allow an hour to the top and another hour to appreciate the view and make a careful descent. Walking boots or at least trainers definitely advised.To get there, there are a couple of buses from the civic centre (106+7, I think) that will take you up to Kloof Nek - from here you can take a right turn onto signal hill road and it's about 500m to the trail start. There is a hut at the bottom with a man selling ice cold water, and there are also taxis which hang around if you feel like getting one back.Oh and a final positive - I don't know if there is someone there every day, but there was a park warden who sat about halfway up/walked around checking that people were alright,which I thought was a nice touch in terms of safety.
Great!. It was a heavy climb but so nice when you reach the top! A very nice view over Capetown. Put on very good shoes!

Great Views. This is a great place to get a good vista of Cape Town city and the beaches. It lies between Signal Hill and Table Mountain and is worth seeking out. A good alternative if Table Mountain is clouded in or too busy.Thanks for your vote if you found this review helpful.

Wow! Views are the Best but a tough climb, So worth it!. Just a warning, the first part of the climb is easy, the second part is not and almost vertical. Needless to say I did it and it was so worth it! I went up for the Sunset and ti was everything I hoped for. Keep in mind if you go up for the Sunset you have to have a torch to go down and if you are not familiar with the trail you need to follow someone and let them know you are following them. I had a group come down with me and I was so thankful they did as it was pitch black.So bring a back pack with water, torch/flash light, high emery snack, light jacket for the way down if you are going up for the sunset as the temperature will drop a bit.The are also two ways up. One from the road and another halfway up. I did the entire climb and I am glad I did. If you are short on time, start at the second higher up starting place. You can get Uber or a taxi from here, I did find that Uber was easier and quicker.
Great climb. About an hour climb up and another hour down. Spectacular 360° views from the top, with the option of taking an easy route or a harder one involving climbing chains etc

Spectacular. Everything in Cape town is fantastic but some sites are just to good to miss. We traveled all over the city via hop on hop off buses and city tours. Lion's head was awesome and should not be missed.
great views. was a great morning walk and exercise, some fitness needed. some great sots for dangerous "looking" pictures
Because it looks like a lions head at the proper angle.. Another iconic Cape Town natural landmark synonymous with the Mother City. Great vistas. Good day hikes.
Amazing view. Great hiking with such an amazing view of the city. You are able to see most of the areas in Capet Town + the view of Table Mountain with an amazing angle!

Beautiful views-good exercise. Very beautiful 360degree views of Cape Town. Quite a hectic climb I was quite nervous but the chains and ladders are great and once you get the knack of it it is a great achievement. Take plenty water and sunscreen and snacks for the summit. Kids loved it,

A hard slog to see the sunset. If you are fit and able and here at the right time of the month then it is worth putting on your hiking boots and taking a walk up Lion's Head in the late afternoon to await the rising of the moon at full moon. The view across the bay is spectacular.

A great view from the top - can you can drive right up so no hiking - good for mobility challenged tourists.. A great vantage point overlooking Cape Town - especially if you don't have the stomach to travel the cable car up to the top of Table Mountain.
Wonderful views. Again sadly for us the weather was not good, but it was awesome being in this iconic venue, despite not being able to view Robin Island well

Hiking at it's best. Lion's head provide a good hiking experience with a great panoramic view of Cape Town, the amazing Camps Bay and Sea point. It has both steep and flat relaxing path for an enriching experience
Lovely scenic views. Great drive up and lovely scenery if you appreciate nature. Short hike up with amazing views. Must visit when in Cape Town

Amazing. A hike up Lions Head is definitely what every soul needs. Breathtaking views all around and if you find Wally's cave, even better. Its not too tough but for the unfit, you'd need to take it slowly. Cape Town is truly a beautiful city and you appreciate its beauty, naturally.

Nice view over Cape Town. Nice drive up to the top the view from the top is beautiful you can have a picnic up top or just look at the view BUT please be careful their is crime up top, tourist have been robbed from their belonging go in a group and not alone.

Stunning landscape!. While Table Mountain is the obvious choice for the views, Lion's Head offers an enjoyable 45min-1hr hike to the top and a different perspective of the city as well as the dramatic view of the clouds rolling over Table Mountain. A must-do in Cape Town.
An essential part of any trip to CT. A great hike/walk that is easy enough for most levels of fitness. Views of the city and ocean that are to die for.
Not to miss . Definitely an experience not to miss. One of the greatest views you will ever see. Look out to the whole of Cape Town. But must be up for a semi challenging hike.

So much fun, and a fabulous view. The view was absolutely breathtaking, and the more challenging route (you have to climb a few hanging metal chains) was so much fun! I highly recommend this hike, especially to people who like a little bit of adventure.

Adventurous Climb. Table Mountain's cable car was not running due to high gusts of wind during our Cape Town visit. We opted to hike Lion's Head instead. The views were amazing (of Table Mountain and he coast) even though we did not make it to the top due to high winds. This is adventurous as there are medal ropes, ladders, and spokes to assist with the climb up. For the less adventurous, the start and middle are a meandering hike up.
More Accessible than Table Mountain, and Great Views. Easy to get to, and a steady hike, but more great views around Cape Town and of Table mountain. If weather is good, a lovely hike.

Magnificent but looks cumbersome. The Lions Head peak is visible from many parts of Cape Town, especially near Camps Bay and Clifton Beaches. The shape of the mountain represents a crouching lion or a sphinx, although it is difficult to imagine that sometimes and takes quite imagination to actually see it that way.The photos with the Lions Head in the backdrop are quite famous and look really pretty. For good views and photo ops, go near the base of the Table Mountain cableway.We didn't do the hike to the top as we were short on time. But our guide also had recommended not to do it as takes a lot of effort and the views are frankly not that different from Table Mountain.

Lion's Head for the unfit. As a local, (not the fittest), this hike usually takes me around 90minutes, including a little break at the top. I make sure to always wear comfortable clothes: tights, shorts and a light fleece jersey. Have hiked up barefoot and with normal tackies, and did okay on both accounts. Have also done this hike starting from signal hill, up lions head and down Camps Bay, walking back to the starting point in sea point. During summer there are lots of people going up, from young children to older persons. Winter is typical Cape town weather with rain and wind. Beautiful to catch the fog rolling in as you get to the upper half. There is also a full-moon hike, where you hike up to watch sunset and the rise of the full moon over the ocean, and hike down in the dark. Take flash lights or headlamps. I don't generally use water, as it's such a quick hike, and no bathrooms and have seen everything from snakes to something that looked like a tarantula just off the route, but always take some gummy sweets and a fruit. During the full moon hike there are people who ensure no one wanders off the route in the dark, as it's quite a drop going down.

Amazing views of table mountain!. The views from the top of table mountain are worth the visit! This is a hard walk/ climb and when you think you are almost at the top you are only really half way up! The route up can be very challenge with staples and chains to climb up!
A top climb . A jaunt up the hill and what spectacular views. No restaurant no crowds. The only way to see Capetown
the walk up of lions head. take good walking shoes and a lot of water you dont have to be fit to do this trip and it is awesome once you reach the top .

A view from the top. Lion's Head is a very good measurement of your fitness level and endurance. It's a fairly easy climb but the last stretch to the top requires some concentration and heavy climbing. The views from the top are absolutely stunning! Pack enough water.
Wow- we made it to the top. Great hike- not for the out of shape or faint hearted. Watch for weather. may be best to Uber up, as parking can be quite a ways away.

Spectacular views!. Going up Lion's Head isn't easy but you get rewarded with some amazing panoramic views. Also, there's only one route to the top so it can get a bit crowded. The easy route gets you about 2/3 up the hill and also offers some great views.

Cape Town's version of a walk in the park. This is a very quick hike (60-90 mins max) that almost anyone who is moderately fit can accomplish. There is some light climbing involved but if you are not very overweight or out of shape then it is possible to do.The views while ascending are spectacular and you get a 360 degree view of Cape Town as you go around the mountain going up. Then at the top its a small rocky plateau which offers views from every angle. It is true that the views from Lion Head are actually better than from Table Mountain. But hiking on Table Mountain is more challenging and fun.

Beautiful and Exciting. During our stay in Cape Town we decided to reach the top of Lion's Head. The trail itself is wonderful and it offers a great view all the time, but when you reach the top you can just be stunned about the view over Cape Town.

Amazing hike!. Loved the hike through Lion's Head! You can choose to hike different levels, easier way up or climbing up. Views from the top are amazing!!!! Incredible to see... both going up and coming down. Make sure you take plenty of water and something with sure, and appropriate closed shoes. Enjoy!!

Phenomenal experience!!. Went with friends at 5 in the morning to catch the sunrise!! we did the chains trail and it's a bit tricky but it's an amazing experience!I'm personally afraid of heights and I made it to the the top!it was beautiful!!! Going down was the hardest part because you see how high you are!But it's really great! there are also caves you can climb and see!You meet friendly people and their brave dogs! it's a definate must do in Cape Town!!!
Don't miss the fabulous views.. Easily accessible viewpoints and hiking. Dramatic views though when we visited in July it was so windy that it was not safe to go to the top. Wonderful place to visit.
Lion's Head and the Twelve Apostles. Lion's Head is one of the main sights worth seeing in CapeTown, along with the Twelve Apostles. Great photo opp as well.

Fantastic local hiking in Cape Town!. Lion's Head is just north of Cape Town Central, and a really great day trip option. It was a 15 minute drive from my hotel, Cape Town Lodge. Really nice hike where you traverse around the peak, occasionally climbing up ladders and using ropes, but mostly just a good moderately steep hike. Wear shorts if possible and good shoes for a vigorous walk on gravel/dirt mostly. You are rewarded with amazing 360 views of Cape of Good Hope, the city, and out to Robben Island. Great for pictures!

Sky high with a view. Fabulous views and lots of space to explore. Great fun watching the sky divers take off and glide down. Great views of the city and the coastline. Interesting flora and birds abound
Good exercise, make sure you have a clear day.. Arguably a better view of the area than Table Mountain and you do not have to queue up for a cable car, you walk to the top (90mins max).

Best view of Table Mountain. What better place to view the amazing Table Mountain than this little sister mountain between Table Mountain and the ocean? It's got a steady climb going up and around it and you can climb it in less than an hour. It also has fantastic views of the centre of Cape Town and Camps Bay.
Awesome. Best spot for amazing views. Friendly hikers and as secure as anywhere else. Pack a warm top....might cime in handy

Must Do but be careful . Went for a hike with a mate. Silly me wore jeans which is a MAJOR NO NO. Make sure you wear suitable gear and lock your car doors. There was a car break in whilst we were there.

Lion's Head better than Table Mountain. Lion's Head was for me a much better experience than Table Mountain.
Climbing the Lion's Head was fun and the view from the was fantastic.

Spectacular view. . Well, that's what it should have been. Unfortunadly we had the bad luck of dense fog. But the hike was still a lot of fun. We even found a small scorpion on one of the stairs. I wish to come back on a bright day and see the beautifull views of Cape Town and Camps Bay.

I'm sold. This may be my favourite mountain in the whole world, so obviously it's a top rating from me. The landscape is green and there are almost no trees, so the view is there all the way. The most popular hike starts from Signal Hill Road and winds all around the mountain so you get great views in all directions before you reach the summit. The top section looks steep, but requires no special climbing skills. You can choose between two routes as you approach the summit. One of them steeper than the other, but still no big risk. I spent two hours on the summit and I got to see the sunset on the way down. Highly recommended!

a MUST SEE. great to see a must for all travellers  This overlooks Sea Point and is great to see.On a good day it is good to take pictures as it soon can become un seeable if the weather turns for the worst.

Well worth the walk/climb. Takes a bit of effort to climb - but what a view! Do it early morning before the sun comes up, wear good hiking boots, ready with water etc and snack at the top. Take a camera to record a breathtaking sunrise and enjoy!Can be a bit chilly in winter, hike back down after the sunrise - use chains on the way down for a bit of fun
excellent. Great hike up Lions head. The walk wraps around the mountain so get great views of the bay and the city as you ascend.

Fun climb. Hiking to the top of Lion's Head gives you a great view of the city and Table Mountain. It also provides some exercise. The trail gets a little steep and narrow in places, so people with little kids need to take care. At one point the trails divides into a longer more gradual trail or a shorter, steeper one. The steeper one has chains to hold on to and was our preferred route (we went up the longer one and down the steeper one). Even a partial climb to the top would provide a great place to watch the sunset.

A must-see!. Lion's Head is lovely and safe, most people come here to climb up the mountain (which is very special, not that tough), but it is also a lovely place for a walk or a run. Keep to the main roads, there are some scary characters in the hilly area above Tamboerskloof. I took an Uber to the start of Lion's Head and ran from there to the V & A - about 10km.

Chase the sunrise!. Make sure you are on top when the sun rises! I normally add 90minutes before sunrise, thats when you should start walking up to be on time. With 90 minutes you have enough time to rest and you can take in everything. Total walking time approx 1:10 for someone with moderate fitness. With moderate I mean you can comfortably walk about 4-5km without passing out.TIP: Take a flashlight and water. COMFORTABLE SHOES

Just Do It!. This was a spur of the moment hike. We took a taxi to the entrance, hiked up and down, then walked back to the guesthouse. The views were tremendous and the scrambling was a lot of fun. There were a lot of people hiking (we went on a weekend), but we were not bothered by that. It was great to be able to get in a workout on our vacation.

See a spectacular sunset iver the ocean. Drive up Lion's Head at dusk to take in the sun setting iver the Atlantic. Go early as it gecomes very crowded with limited parking. The road curves and the views of Cape Town are spectacular. Drive slowly!

Spectacular view!. Most rewarding exercise you will ever do. About half way to the top I thought i might literally die. But when you make it to the top, you firstly feel so proud of yourself for doing it. Secondly the view makes it worth the effort.

Amazing. My Family and I walked up Lion's head and the view from the top was amazing. There is a place where you can sign your name and there are numerous points at where you can sit/stand and see a different part of Cape Town!!! I would recommend this to everyone!!!

Gather up your nerve and go. We'd been told that the hike up Lion's Head was more like a stroll, and the uphill WAS uncomplicated...until we got to the ladders and the chains. At that point, the hike is somewhat precarious, with unprotected drop-offs and a little bit of rock scrambling. The final ascent is really steep, requiring chains and a slow, careful pace. It's not necessary to go all the way to the top in order to see everything. As you wind your way around the mountain, you enjoy glorious views of Camp's Bay, Signal Hill, the V&A waterfront and Table Mountain. It's well worth the effort, even if you don't go all the way to the top.
Good panoramic view. Nice tourist destination. Not very far from the city. There are buses and taxis available at reasonable rates.

Invigorating Hike. This was a fantastic early morning hike! It is a good challenge but nothing that the average person can't complete. Make sure to go for sunrise, its not too hot then and you get to see the sunrise over stunning Cape Town. There are a lot of hikes to do in this city, make sure this is one of them. Its rewarding to be able to drive by it later on and know that you achieved this.

So worth the sore body. I always enjoy doing this hike. Its fun and so are the people that you pass by. Everyone is helpful and friendly. The atmosphere keeps you coming back. Its a fairly easy hike and the little ones can join too.

Almost as good as Table Mountain itself. I loved the spiral walk up this improbable peak next door to Table Mountain. There were lovely views all the way up and spectacular flowers to see in amongst the rocks. On the steep upper sections of the climb you are helped by ladders and chains conveniently placed. It's easier to go up them than down them though. We intended to go down via the "recommended" route (safer as it's not so steep) but couldn't find it from the top of the mountain having not gone up that way - better signposting needed.

Incredible views. Its well worth the hike. It does get quite steep at times and there is a bit of climbing with 2 x ladders and having to utilise some upper body strength, but other than that the 1 hour hike up is incredible. The views, the scenery & all the other hikers are super friendly. Its something you would regret not doing once you're up there because its truly worth it.
Great view of Cape Town from the top. Hike up to the top of the Lion's Head and enjoy the 360 degrees view of Cape Town. Watch the sunset from the top and slowly go down before it gets dark.

Great Views with Good Exercise. As a club (karate school), we regularly go for walks on the mountain and Lion's Head is certainly one of my favourites. The path meanders around so as you go higher you get a different view of the City and surrounds.Once on top, you have breath taking views of the City, Robben Island, Table Mountain and the Atlantic Seaboard with Camps Bay, etc.Many of our students rarely if ever gets an opportunity to experience the outdoors in such a manner, so it is extremely learningsome. From seeing a variety of birds to dassies to the occasional scorpion, etc, coupled with the indigenous fauna, rarely can one go home without having learnt or experienced something new.The best part of hiking to the top is scaling the chains, not recommended for the elderly or faint-hearted and care must be taken as serious injury can happen. For those not willing to brave the chains which is a "short-cut" to the top, the longer pathway is an easier option.Care must also be taken to take extra clothing because at times, the weather can change instantly and that can be disastrous. With taking larger groups, ensure that adults/bigger teens are responsible for x-amount of the group for further safety.One of the better walks is when there is full moon and to take a walk up just before sunset, enjoy the moon setting and later stroll down.Please ensure that you are more than one person for safety both for injury and possible muggers as there has been a few incidents of mugging happening.

Sunrise hike to summit of Lions Head. Early on 6Sept, like 5a.m., we set off from the parking area of Lions Head to climb up to catch the sunrise at 7a.m. (it's way earlier in summer). You can wear running shoes or lightly treaded hiking boots and a head torch was necessary as it was dark. The climb is mostly easy on a jeep track and well marked pathway. The route is well signed with the option near the top to go a slightly and easier route around or to take the vertical ladder, chains and hand grips embedded in the rock. Once on top you get a 360 panoramic view of Cape Town below, Robben Island in the distance and a birds eye view of Table Mtn...and much more. It is advisable to wear sunscreen, take water, a backpack with a light jacket in case. Well worth the photographic opportunity and experience. It is quite popular so be prepared to share the mountain and path way and please don't leave your litter.

Hike of note and views to die for. Living in Cape Town definitely has it's perks, coming back from an amazing trip to Italy and visiting the Isle of Capri was unforgettable but each day I am beginning to realize that Cape Town is maybe the most beautiful city on earth. Hiking up Lions head on a clear Spring morning was most spectacular and the people on the route most friendly and thoroughly enjoying themselves . The great part of this hike was the hearty conversation amongst the kids and the views that could be placed amongst the best in the world . You got to love this place . Gotto do this more often

Spectacular views of the ocean!. LOVE this hike! The best views of the ocean in Cape Town. Short hike of about 1hour 30 min to the top...depending if you walk or run up. Fairly easy hike, mostly steps all the way up. Be prepared to climb up a ladder, short chain and some slippery worn rocks. This is the best place to watch the sunset!

Great Views of Table Mountain. Right next door to Table Mountain is this geographical feature. Our tour operator took us here during a day tour of Cape Town - it was so close to Table Mountain it seemed a waste not to check it out ... and it was certainly worthwhile.The local tourism authority has constructed several (5 or 6 I think) yellow frames for folks to take photos of Table Mountain - the yellow symbolising the National Geographic way of presenting photos ... and one of these frames is available in the park where the road to Lion's Head terminates. While this park isn't really at the peak (you have to go walk a steep trail for that), we were happy with the experience of looking from there as the views were really very good.There is a paragliding company that operates what looks to be a 5-minute experience gliding down to Camp Cove from this park that looked fantastic ... If you're visiting Table Mountain, it'd be a shame to miss out on some great views from this place ... and provided that you're not wanting to climb to the very top, a visit is easily done in 30 mins.
Best view of the city. This is a very nice walk and has great views. Lots of locals and joggers on the route up. Amazing views of the bay and table mountain.
Great Hike!. Great non strenuous hike with unbeatable views of the Atlantic Seaboard, Cape Town city and the west coast!

Nice views. was a great place to visit enjoyed the views of Capetown the shoreline signal hill and Table Mountain. went here to hang out waiting to ride cable car up table mountain was well worth the stop.

Beautiful Vista, Tough Climb. This hike was one of our highlights during our stay in the Cape Town/Camps Bay area. I highly recommend this hike, but be aware that the last 3rd of the trail is almost vertical so coming back down is difficult indeed.

Sunset hike was amazing!. Went up Lions head with a group of friends to watch the sunset come down! Was a brilliant experience full of people all with the same idea's. couldnt of asked for a better evening and would recommend it to anyone! Also managed to get some beautiful pictures through the whole trip up and down! Beautiful place!

A great viewing platform of the city and surrounds with no cost.. The cable car was closed for maintenance so a trip to Lions Head was a must and a great view of the surrounding area and the city of Cape Town
Great views from down below!. They say you can hike it, but we didn't. Is a beautiful backdrop for pics and stunning to look at! Locals are lucky to have it!

Good hike. Pretty easy hike. Only took around an hour and not any serious climbing or scaling compared to Table Mountain. Also the view is pretty good, probably the best place to take photos with Table Mountain in the backdrop.

Puff Puff and wear Proper grippy shoes.. I did this walk (more of a climb) pregnant and my partner kept feeling compelled to hurl himself off the edge. I don't know if the two are related but we had buckets of fun and it was well worth the adventure feeling like a dassie on the rock at the top. There's security present as well now and those without suicidal tendencies can hike at night on full moon. Another one for my bucket list.

Beautiful views, adventurous climb but make sure you are ready for it!. We visited Lions Head in August 2015 after finding out the Table Mountain cable cars were closed for maintenance. The trip was fantastic and after the climb we were really proud of making it to the top. The views are stunning and it took us about 4 hours in total to make it to the top and back. There is a mixture of gentle slopes, rock climbing and then vertical climbing as you get nearer to the top. As you climb all around the mountain you have a different view every 10 minutes which means you keep interested and amazed by the stunning views of table mountain and cape town. One thing I do feel I need to warn people about is that even with a good level of fitness this climb can be quite unsafe. There are handles and metal chains to help you up and ladders (although one has a steep drop underneath and a slip could be fatal). Rocks and ground can be uneven and falls away quite often under your feet. My partner stood on what appeared to be an stable area of ground and it gave way and he fell 10ft down the side of the mountain which was terrifying. Thanks to the help of strangers we managed to stop his fall before he gained momentum but this could of proved extremely dangerous. I felt that the reviews hadn't quite prepared us for this level of risk despite us being very active people who always seek adrenaline activities! Just make sure you are wearing shoes with good grip, take a jumper and make sure you have your hands free (don't take over arm bags). I also took a chest harness for my GoPro as it will be impossible to climb and hold a camera at the same time!Overall a very active, exhilarating and beautiful day out but just go prepared and be careful where you step!

Gorgeous nature and the best views. One of the best walks and hikes to do in the Mother City- you can opt for easy slow walks on the level or do the more ambitious hike to the top of Lion's Head for spectacular views. Do not go alone ever as there have been muggings. Great for sunsets and sunrises-Instagram heaven! Views for days!
Great view and picnic spot. Great view and great exercise. Pack a bag and have a picnic at the top. I would suggest you take the family up or have a beer with friends at the top.

Hiking up Lion's Head. Did a family hike up Lion's Head. Wear comfortable clothes and shoes. A certain degree of fitness is required to hike Lion's Head as there are some parts which include climbing up ladders and maneuvering with ropes. If you are a keen hiker - this is one to do! Very enjoyable.
Fantastic views. Views from Lion's head is fantastic. If you have a car and time to spare it is certainly great especially at night. Would first do Table Mountain before Lion's Head.

Always interesting. We first saw this whilst on the open top bus touring Cape Town and on the way to Table Mountain.whilst we didn't go up, we watched others trekking, eating and even jumping off on paragliding type devices
Just go.. If you're able to, hike up lions head. It takes about 1.5 - 2 hours and it never disapoints. Ask a taxi to take you to the start or take a bus up to kloof nek. Its a short walk from there.
Worth a visit if you have the time. Friends and I visited here after our tour of Table Mountain. The views were wonderful, but I wouldn't say it's a "must."
Views galore. Lovely views over Cape Town and Atlantic Seaboard. It gives one a nice perspective of the lie of the land.
Good View. Pretty much the same as Signal Hill or Table Mountain...gives you a great view of the city and ocean just at a different angle

Great views. Easy walking with great views. The walks are great if you are staying in the Bantry Bay or Camps Bay area. There is a lot of litter (including human feces and broken glass). Can also get crowded on weekends

Getting overcrowded. Not an average walk and take care. You need boots with good grip and water and a jersey. Almost too many people going up now and the trail is getting damaged. Please don't litter. We are regular Lion walkers and its disgusting what litter we collect.

A beautiful wonderful place.. I strongly suggest all tourists go walk Lions head. Allow for at least 4 hours. And learn from me do not wear slip slops or flops. If they break 80 minutes into the walk you have a problem. The views are simply amazing, looking down on camps bay gives you an amazing feeling of freedom and perspective. Take water, a camera.. And yes, rather ignore and avoid the monkeys completely.

Awesome. A Must to climb. Perfect for those who begin in hiking. Magnificent views and panorama from all parts. The view from the peak is the cherry on top! Do not leave Cape Town without visiting it (especially if you go during summer time)

Must see in Cape Town . This again is a must see. I must say if in Africa for safari you must stop at Cape Town ! It was such a beautiful city ! I would love to go back someday in the future. My kids loved it as well

Super Duper view!. I sometimes think walking up Lion's Head is better than going up Table Mountain, as you actually have a view OF Table Mountain!Go early, in mid summer start before 8am as it can get very hot. Take plenty of water and if you plan on taking the short route (involves climbing up ladders, but its is not difficult) make sure your hands are free i.e. do not carry water bottle in your hands. Take food to have a snack at the top and enjoy one of the best views in the world!It get's very busy in summer but so so worth it!There is parking close to the start of the walk, with car guards, but only a toilet at the bottom close to the parking. Take note!

What a climb!. Going up Lions Head for the first in years was most thrilling and exciting. The view on the top is breathtaking. Myself, my father, my brother and friend went up on Womens Day (9th August 2015). A sunday i will hold in my memory for a long time to come. This is the start of many more hiking trails to come!! fantastic!!!

Dont miss the midnight trek on full moon nights. It a little over an hours trek, 2 if you do it real slow :PIt not a difficult and totally worth it! Do it in the evening to watch the sunset or at night during a full moon.You will not regret it!

Beautiful short hike!. This was a great short hike, taking about an hour not counting time spent taking in the sights. Beautiful scenery everywhere. There are some more challenging parts (chains/staples) but really not that bad. Do it!

One of the biggest highlights of my trip! Fantastic Views!. The hike was not bad, but you definitely should wear hiking shoes! I saw some people in flip flops! Some areas were challenging to hike. I watched sunset from the Lions head, it was absolutely amazing! I would do it again. I hear that hiking at sunrise is also very nice.
An ultimate must do in Cape Town. Don't miss this one!Not the easiest of walks, but doable i any shoes and take some water and a warm top...
Why the name??. doesnt look like lions head i dont know why do they call it so?? the view is good from most of the hilly location in cape town as the place is beautiful.

Great view from the TOP!. I have climbed lions head on a very overcast day and could not see a thing when I got to the top however, it was a great hike and good feeling getting to the top! The view when it is not overcast is amazing!

Absolutely Worth the Hike!. Not a bad hike for beginners, but it can be a little difficult in places. We hiked it about 45 minutes before sunset which brought us to the top about 5 minutes prior to the sun setting. It was the most beautiful sunset I've ever seen. It's absolutely worth the hike!
Worth viewing. Looks like a Lion's head from afar hence the name. Did not actually visit the site but viewed it in the morning mist and it looks sureal.

Hike times. Lions head is an awesome hike trail to take if you want to watch the sunset as the path is fairly simple and easy to walk even when it is a little bit dark. It has awesome view of Cape Town to the right when you on top facing the ocean..behind you you will see the table mountain nature reserve. Beautiful views last bit of advice is to go early in the morning or when the sun sets a little as there is very little shade on the path.Take the family and kids and have a lion king of a time hakuna matara

My favourite hike in Cape Town. Lion's Head is by far my favourite walk in Cape Town. The effort to get to the top is rewarded by excellent views of Cape Town, Table Mountain, Table Bay and Robben Island. It is a wonderful vantage point to watch the sun rise or set, or even watch the moon rise when it is full (check what time it will rise before you go so that you are not disappointed). It is a rocky hike, so take good shoes as well as water and warm clothes (it can be cold when you stop at the top).

Underrated Viewing Spot. Everyone runs off to Table Mountain, an iconic site in Cape Town but ques are long, parking a pain in the proverbial & only 5 minutes away is access to Lions Head. No ques, one can drive to the top and the views are stunning. The panorama is different from Table Mountain obviously but magnificent non the less. It's a lot less commercial than Table Mountain but really a worthwhile stop

Quiet mountain viewing. If you love beautiful mountains then this is for you. Quiet area with the most beautiful view. Great for those who want to just be somewhere quiet while interacting with nature.
Breathtaking view of Cape Town. What a breathtaking view of Cape Town when you are looking down from Lions Head. Its beautiful and there are no words to describe the feeling.

Amazing scenic hike. We were a group of 6, and is se the Table mountain tram was under maintanance, we decided to walk the Lions Head trail. It was a clear sunny day and the hike gets progressively more difficult as you go up. We had a 78 year old in our party and she was able to do the first third of the trail, which was clear and wide. After that, it gets more rocky and narrow, so she opted to stay in one of the viewing areas, which was perfect. The rest of us climbed our way to the top, and were rewarded with the most stunning views of Cape Town and Table Mountain. It was a crowded Saturday, so I would try and go on a weekday to miss the crowds. We had been doing a lot of touring in a van, so a day out hiking was the perfect event for us. There are some narrow areas with steep drops, and ladder, rope chain climbs, so best to do this on a dry day to avoid mud and slipping. Everyone loved it, age ranges from 23 to 78!!
Great easy hike. Great afternoon hike if you are looking to get out. Takes a little over an hour to get to the top and has fantastic views of cape town and camps bay

What a Rock Formation !. Perfect nature and wonderful scenery. During our Cape Town sightseeing tour, we passed through Lion's Head and it was fantastic. What a rock formation ! . It is one of the strongest Landmarks of Cape Town. Watch and Enjoy.

Lion's Head and the Views. For two reasonably fit 60-somethings, the hike up the mountain took about 1.5 hours, and back down, another couple hours. It has its scrambles and a couple ladders, but is perfectly doable. And, is WELL worth the effort! The 360 views of Cape Town and the beach towns are stunning, magnificent. Go for it!
My beautiful Cape Town. Very nice lookout point! A bit of a climb to the top! I did not like the climb and don't like heights so I did not get to the top but I was told it is awesome!

There are two ways up. Go the harder route if you enjoy a good hike and your body can handle it. Some areas on the way up are tricky on the harder route. Don't attempt the harder route without daylight as it is dangerous. Remember to bring a selfie stick to capture the breath taking views! Climb it when it's not foggy or you'll see nothing at the top. Note: No washrooms at the top.

Lion's head hike. On a scale of 1 - 5 i would rate this a 2 if you're an experienced hiker, walker. 4 if you're a beginner. Take enough water. The walk up should take approx 2 hours. Make sure you a good pair of shoes. No flip flops. I've seen too many first timers underestimate Lion's head only to end up jn trouble and having to be rescued. Early morning is stunning to see sunrise oe dusk for sunset. You gat a fantastic vuew of table bay and Robben Island,The city and take mountain. It's worth the walk up.
Shame about the rain. Great place to visit. Shame it was raining on our visit. This made walking very difficult on the slippery rocks.

Stunning - must see views of Cape Town. The view will take your breath away, it's a bit of a walk but it is manageable even for those who aren't extremely fit. I recommend going to see the sun rise or set. With warning to be careful when climbing in the dark, it can get dangerous. The view is hands down one of my favourites, I agree it tops the view from Table Mountain easily. There is something special about over looking the vast ocean and the bustling city from a place so high up and in complete tranquillity.
Lovely. Use a driver to see cape Town. Beautiful scenery and small local towns. But be ready for the haves and have nots.

Best View. I think the view from Lion's Head is even better than Table Mountain! The view of the sunset over the water from this mountain looked so fake. It was surreal! I would highly suggest everyone hike this mountain. I would say the only negative was that there were no maps of which path to take. We didn't know which way to go to get up the mountain in a hurry to not miss the sunset!

Must do for any visitor. This is one of the must-do activities in Cape Town! Unfortunately everyone knows about it and the route have become very crowded.It isn't a tough climb and someone of relative fitness can reach the top in about 45 minutes. The views are spectacular!There is no water along the route, so bring your own. Also, be careful when walking along some of the narrow pathways higher up, people regularly slip and fall off the mountain. I don't find the pathways dangerous, one must just exercise caution and not consume alcohol before or during the climb. There is a point on the climb where one can use chains to haul yourself up some steep cliffs. This section isn't for everyone, but there is a much simpler (but slightly longer) way round the side of the mountain and is sign posted. I always take the way round to avoid the risk of injury. Also note that there are occasionally muggings on the mountain, so leave most of your valuables at home, only bring the necessary items along. Having said all that, this still remains one of my favourite activities to do in Cape Town!

Great Hike & easy to do. Great medium-level hike with beautiful views on different parts of Cape Town, it's a popular hike for cape Town locals particularly on weekend (while Table mountain is mostly tourists). If traveling solo or hiking on a week day I'd suggest hiking with a guide or staying close to other hikers just in case.

Beautiful. One of the best things I did in Cape Town,
Beautiful views of Cape Town from the top.
Make sure conditions are dry, as they are some steep climbs, and could get slippery and extremely dangerous, take it easy, no reason to rush, just enjoy!

Great for groups. Walking up on a Saturday late afternoon, you get great views of the sunset. It's ideal to take persons here if it's their first hike, as it's fairly short. You can work on 1 hour up and 45 minutes down. But you still need good shoes and something warm to wear after the sunset. It's great fun if going with a larger group (we were 20), but do take sufficient water and snacks as there's nothing up there at the top.

Spectacular views on this great hike!. We visited Cape Town in winter, so the reliability of accessing Table Mountain is poor. The aerial car was down for maintenance and the top was covered in clouds 3 of 5 days. We opted for Lion's Head and are glad we did! The hike was quite enjoyable including, paths, rocks, ladders, staples and chains. We got a good workout reaching the top and the views were spectacular along the path that winds around the mountain as you head up. We ate a nice picnic lunch that we had brought at the top and enjoyed the sun, views and lack of crowds. Would absolutely do it again!
I love lion's head.. The hike up to the top there is not the easiest, but its a fast one. You should plan 2 hours for up an down again.And the view is amazing!

Not a poor cousin. Most people are pointed in the direction of Table Mountain for scenic views. I am certainly not knocking Table Mountain but the trek up Lion's Head is fantastic. The climb is not too onerous and the rewards in terms of views are spectacular. The 360 vista is amazing once up there. Free parking, free walking - a must in Cape Town

Love this hike. Absolutely stunning views on the whole of cape town! Love this hike so much, it's a tough one during some parts but you get to the top in 1h. You will have to rock climb during a few bits so wouldnt reccomend this to people who are afraid of hights but otherwise, go for it!

Best Sunsets!. Its free and magnificent. Dont take tons of expensive goodies with you and keep your wits about you. Crime isnt nearly as bad as people say it is but it is still south africa. Totally worth the quick hike up. Full moon is best and lots of people up there too with you every day. A must for visitors and locals.

The best view in Cape Town . This is one of the best places in Cape Town, a pleasure trail with a perfect view. In the top you can see the city and the Table Mountain. I recomend a night trail during the full moon.

Not too strenuous with wonderful views. The walk to the very top of Lion's Head shouldn't take more than and hour and a half.
