Care should be taken when using the chains or ladder to reach the very top. Pack something to eat and drink and definitely something warm to wear if one will be doing the full moon hike.

A great alternative to hiking Table Mountain. We only had time to do one hike while in Cape Town and we chose Lion's Head after hearing from several others that it was not only a more manageable hike, but that you get a great view of Table Mountain itself. It was mostly cloudy on the hike up, but one thing we learned while in Cape Town was that if you wait 5 minutes the clouds will often shift and the weather will change. When we got to the top we waited a bit, and were rewarded with breathtaking views of the city, the water, and the surrounding mountains. There were alot of other groups, especially local sports teams, that seemed to be doing their daily workouts on the mountain, so we felt very safe the entire time as well.

A must-do for visitors to Cape Town. It's one of the most scenic hikes in the city - the view from the top is amazing! And its so peaceful up there. It can get a bit crowded on holidays and weekends but the thing about CT hikers is that they are a very polite and respectful bunch of people.

Moderate/Easy Hike. Lion's head was a great hike that did not take too long (about 2 hours to the top) and was not too difficult. There was a part where you could briefly climb that I really enjoyed but you do not have to climb it, there is an alternate walking path you can take. The view at the top is definitely one you should see!

The perfect Sunset spot!. I decided to catch my last sunset from The top of Lion's Head...And it was well worth it. Absolutely stunning! The climb/hike was less challenging than Table Mountain but still had a few obstacles to get over.I recommend taking a flashlight (for the decent) and if you want those perfect panoramic pics a tripod.
best safari site ever. Great guides, greater food orgies, best safari. Saw every one of the big 5 plus many others.Watched a lioness kill a leopord and feed her young. Awesome

A MUST GO if you are in Cape Town. Among all the mountains in and around Cape Town, I found the Lion's Head the easiest to climb up. It is a straight walk up to the top, with a little blend of excitement coming from climbing the small steep areas using ladders and chains fitted onto the rock wall. Great place to view the Sun as it rises behind the mountains in East. I presume the Sunset will also be very beautiful. Only on my second visit (within two months of landing in Cape Town), I met Herchelle Gibbs, and as a cricket fanatic I believe it was the best thing to happen to me in the city so far.

Love this mountain. Ive hiked this gorgeous mountain a few times already.....the views of CT are excellent. Make sure to carry alot of water and snacks to keep you going. Do not hike this mountain when our famous south easter blows, it will blow you off!!

Lovely views the whole way up. This is a great walk for medium active walkers. It should take about an hour to reach the top. The views the whole way up are stunning and give you different perspectives of the city. Be careful of standing too near the edge as some people have lost their footing and had nasty accidents.
avoid peak times. great walk and brilliant quick fix - remember to take a camera for the top. if you are very scared of heights or overweight you might struggle but its a very easy walk

Best Hike in CPT. It's a fun, challenging hike with BEAUTIFUL views! Very safe, as its always busy, parking right by the mountain. Should take longer than 2-3 hours to complete. Easier route for beginners.
A walk on the Lion's Head.. What an historical feeling as you look down on the beautiful Cape Town. Wonderful walk up the mountain ans the sweep around to above Camps Bay is wonderful.
Perfect place for the sunset. Definitely save Lion's Head for a nice/clear day and head up around sunset. You won't be disappointed.
interesting. this is an amazing sight to see if you go to cape town its one of the do"S to do we went on a very sunny day and its just fab the views from here are stunning
Go do it!. awesome views, mini Table Mountain, only 45 mins, do it at full moon, pack a picnic basket, bit of an up hill but nothing you cannot handle

amazing vew. If you are in Cape town on a sunny day, the view you can get after a mere hour is breathtaking from up there. Have good shoes and plenty of water with you and binoculars and camera. 2 passages require you to not be afraid of heights but you are helped with ladders, chains et bars to hold on.

Start to hike it super early to see the sunrise!. Sadly we had a cloudy day to climb Lion's Head but it was beatiful.
Even when it's summertime take a jacket with you, proper shues and a realy good torch!
Best you take something for brackfast on top with you! Sunset is too croudy and gets a bit dangerous becouse of all the tourists pushing down!

Awesome Hike. I did some research about this hike prior to traveling to Cape Town. Let me reiterate that this climb is a intermediate+ skill level. I was winded by the altitude alone, but that's probably because I live at sea level! If you take your time, it's about a 3 hour excursion up and down Lion's Head, but reaching the summit is more than worth it. The pictures you get from these 360 degree views don't even do the scenery justice; it's a breathtaking (literally for me) landscape. I would definitely go back, just to find Wally's cave, which is hard to find on Lion's Head but from this cave you can get a nicely framed shot of Table Mountain.

Not too difficult. Anyone of a reasonable fitness level could tackle Lion's Head. Watch out for the chain ladder though as this can be quite scary. There is a longer path around if chain ladders are not your thing. Provides great vistas of Cape Town. Many Capetonians will run up Lion's Head in the summer before work to keep fit.

Great Views, not a bad hike. Some of the best views of Cape Town. Much easier hike than the Table Mountain hikes. We did a sunset hike, and most of our group stayed at the top to watch the full moon rise.

Beautiful view. The view from Lion's head is absolutely stunning. You can see different sides of the Mother City. Some days it is quite busy and a challenge to find parking place. The spot itself does not have much too offer but it nice to go there for walks of a hike.

Great scenery. Lion's head is a lovely hike with stunning views of the city on the way up and when you get to the top. I would certainly recommend a hike up there for anyone visiting the city. You need to have water especially on a hot summer's day as there is no shop on top like the table mountain. I would also recommend good running shoes/hiking boots. People often fall and get injured/die up there so don't be ignorant on the mountain, accidents do happen.
roben island's perfect viewing spot. best for picnic and for taking pics of cape town stadium and robben island, great place for hikers aswell with view of the whole cape town

Extreme view. Take a taxi before getting to lions and there should be taxis there when you come back down try to do it a bit early during the day because everyone's total time up and down will be different. The start of lions head is a bit easy and is just a breeze but as you get to the rock pathways it gets a bit tricky and requires some focus there is 2 pathways one for experienced and one for the inexperienced but both paths get you there take your time don't rush.
Nice Hike up Lions Head?. Awesome spot to explore in Cape Town, Take a slow hike up and savour the views from the top. Sometime a better option than Table mountain f its too crowded.
Nature treats. ZA is a wonderful place. Nature, people, wines, food, a paradise on earth. But poverty and crime can destroy this place.

Great Hike to the Top!. The trail to the top of Lion's Head is pretty challenging! Be sure to take water! At one point, you have a choice to walk around the back side for a less strenuous hike. If you are not short on time, and are not up for a more vertical climb, including chains and staple-like hand and foot grips to get you up, take the longer route :) The views are phenomenal in every direction - from Camp's Bay to Cape Town and beyond! No food or water available at the top!

Hiking around Lion's Head. If you enjoy hiking I would recommend you contact Peninsula Ramblers and go on one of their hikes. This was what I did when I arrived in Cape Town. a group of 12 of us set off from the bottom car park of Table Mountain and we walked across the base up towards Signal Hill where the paragliders set off. Amazing views of Lion Head & Seapoint to be seen a fabulous afternoon. There are places to sit and watch the World go by either on benches on on the large boulders scattered around. Also trees offer some shade from the Winter sun. Recommended to visit, don't forget your binoculars and camera .

Magnicient views of Cape Town. It's amazing how such a short climb can be so different every time you do it. This climb is more difficult than the guidebooks let on. It's doable by a reasonably fit person but take your time. There are some challenging places.

Spectacular Trail. Absolutely one of the most beautiful one hour walks in the world! Spiral to the top at a leisurely pace, smelling the fynbos or power up and compete with plenty fitness fanatics! Can get very crowded on the narrow track in season, but when you get it to yourself, you could enact your own version of the "Lion King" at the summit!
Worth the trip to South Africa.. my favorite place in Cape Town. A relatively simple walk and hike to do for sunrise or sunset. Worth the trip to South Africa.
Good view. Scenic place to hike or drive up. There's a lovely painter there painting the Table Mountain from Signal Hill.
Full moon view. Great experience. Did a late afternoon climb and just reached the top in time for sunset.One of the most beautiful views I have seen. Full moon over Cape town and the harbour.

What a hike!. Hiking up Lion's Head is so much fun and a definite highlight of my recent 2.5-week trip to Cape Town. It only takes about an hour each way and, while the trail can be steep at times, the route isn’t too hectic. Plus, the views from the summit are out of the world -- you can see all of Cape Town including Table Mountain and its Twelve Apostles, Signal Hill, Table Bay and the Atlantic coastline. You can also spot Robben Island in the distance on a clear day.

Amazing!. I'm not going to lie, the walk up is HARD! But it's so beautiful that when you reach the top, it's totally worth it. Make sure you watch the sunset from the top. It's the most beautiful sunset I've ever seen!
360 degrees Cape town. Easy 1 hour hike with 360 degrees view of Cape Town. Can get a bit windy on the top, but the views are spectacular. Always nice to be there.
One of my favorites. Our hike up the lions head was one of my favorite things in Cape Town. Lovely hike up with sweeping vistas of camps bay and all of Cape Town . Few tourists and lots of locals
nice trek. Fantastic place for trekking and walking. You can opt for paragliding from here. Nice to walk specially in the morning.

360 degree awesome views of a gorgeous city. Awesome and gruelling hike for the unfit. Taking the chains...a great experience. But, NO TOILETS! Should have one somewhere, surely, it's a must....considering the amount of water you must drink to make it.
Good view and easy access. We droved up here in the afternoon. I popular place, so it was difficult to find a parking lot, but we managed that. Good view and noce place to be.

A superb view of Cape Town and Sea Point. Take the Kloof Nek Road and at the top turn left to go up to the top of Signal Hill. The hill gets it name from a cannon which signals noon every day. The top of the hill reveals exquisite views of Cape Town, the mother city of South Africa. You will also see he sprawling views of Sea Point and Camps Bay.If you are lucky you may see hang gliders jumping off the hill and gliding peacefully down to the beaches below. A good place to visit but if going up at night do be careful of vagrants.
views to die for at the end of the walk. a must walk. takes a few hours but worth the effort. make sure you take water on a hot day. awesome views

One of the best views in Cape Town. Lion's Head is a great place to hike during the day and for sunrise/sunsent hikes (remember a flashlight). Some parts of the trail are more challenging and require climbing up some ladders, but very doable. Great views of the city, surrounding beaches, and Table Mountain and Devil's Peak.

Awesome views. Relatively easy hike even for amateurs (1-2hrs); my 16yo niece and I made the summit in alittle over an hour in time to enjoy the sunrise. There were some small ladders to climb and gorgeous views to enjoy at every turn. A must see!

More fun and fulfilling hike than Table Mountain. This was not an easy hike. While you'll see the occasional grandma hiking, it's not the norm. The top 35% of the mountain is more like mild mountain climbing than hiking. The view at the top is incredible and well worth it. Summiting it was a pretty cool way to start my 30's.

Amazing free views but be warned!. This hike is no walk in the park. Where proper shoes, bring water, and don't forget flashlight for after sunset!
For pictures and full story see here - http://www.thislifeintrips.com/climbing-lions-head-cape-town/

Scenic hike. After seeing the award winning photograph from the top of Lions Head we decided to have a look at the view. sadly we didn't have enough time to get to the top but we had a great hike halfway up. We are moderately fit so we enjoyed the gentle gradient which was only steep here and there. The proteas were in flower which was really pretty and it is more attractive than when we hiked a third of the way up in the summer. The view is really great and the rocks and plants along the way a pleasure to behold. Very worth doing.
It's just a rock. It's just a rock ..... don't expect too muchyou can't even get close and you have to take pics from below
Beautiful Cape. Lovely views of the Cape seen from good roads. Well worth driving around. Traffic can be heavy.At times patience is needed

Awesome Hike. We hiked up Lions Head in February. I enjoyed it, the views from the top are fantastic. We even got lucky by seeing a man paraglide off the side of the mountain. Was really spectacular. I recommend this hike to anyone and everyone. It took me 45 minutes to the top. It's a dirt road most of the way and then at the summit you need to scurry through some rocks and climb a ladder to reach the peak. I have hiked both the advanced route and the easy one they were both amazing!!!
great sunset spot. very pretty spot, especially at sunset... free.. if you have a rental car, buses may go up there too...with beautiful view of water and town

Great hike, great view, great sunset. Lion's Head is way more fun then its bigger brother the Table Mountain. You actually have some passages of real climbing while you are getting up the mountain. You also get a lot of different perspectives during your hike. If you can try to go up for the sunset or sunrise or even at nigh times. As there are no lights on the path, make sure to bring sth. .

Amazing, but ZA has a very different idea of safety than other countries. Did this hike with some friends visiting from the states. The brochure said that it was fun, 2 hour, family friendly hike. My friends and I are not super fit, but we're fit enough to do this hike and it was more like 3-4 hours. Also, there are ZERO guard rails, and looking back through the news it seems that there's a fatal fall every few years. Do not recommend if you're afraid of heights. There are several spots where you will have to do a bit of a scary climb. It's very doable, but if you're the panicky sort, you might want to skip. Be very careful not to lose your footing on the way down. I would not bring small children. Totally a personal opinion, but I wouldn't bring any of my own children until they're at least 7. Then, when you get to the top, there's NOTHING LIKE IT IN THE WORLD. So, if you're physically capable of doing this, you have to do it before you leave Cape Town.
My favorite hike in cape town. I have been up Lion's Head for at least 5 times and I just love it. It is a very easy hike up and the views are just spellbinding.

Many viewing points and some strange wild bird activity!. An excellent view of both Cape Town and the Table mountain. Perfect and free and a good substitute to the mandatory table mountain. Particularly if there is cloud on the Table Top.

Great view at night!. Can't go too late or the star at the top will be off. Luckily, I was able to get to the top of lions head while the star light was on and then soon after it was turned off. A magnificent view of Cape Town with all the twinkling lights below....A must for sure.

The most climbed peak in Africa. Did this twice while in Cape Town. Fun hike and great views from the top, but a bit more challenging as you get to the top, especially if you don't like the heights or not fit. Also, if you start your hike using steps on the right, it takes you on another nice walk without going all the way to the top. For the second hike we took the kids this way all around the base and they loved it.

Lions Head... It is a must.. If you come to Cape Town be sure to hike up Lions Head. The hike will take approximately 2 hours. It is challenging in parts with some climbing involved. Wear good trainers or hiking shoes, also bring some water and a small snack. A Sun hat and Sunglasses is a good idea but do not wear the sunglasses on the way down as the can interfere with your depth perception when stepping down.

Lions head is stunning from the top of the mountain.. With the naked eye you can see things in a 360 degree radius.The view from the top is one of the best in the world.Robben eiland, the famous land mark, can be seen from the top of Lion's head
Great views. I did not walk to the top as I found the higher part of the path too narrow for me, but the views are wonderful part way

Beautiful View. Beautiful view on a clear day, it is a must visit place when visiting Cape town. Also good for bit of trekking. It is quite windy up there and one definitely need protective clothing specially on a cold day.

A different view of Table Mountain. We now live in Cape Town and people here have told us about the walk up Lion's Head - so we decided to do it. It is firmly easy to park as most people using this road are heading to the adjacent Signal Hill. My advice for any one wanting to walk up Lion 's Head is wear good footwear and be prepared for a fairly good work out! Also take plenty of water to drink. The only mistake we made was starting the walk at noon on a day when the temperature was already 32C - not a problem if you are prepared to sweat a lot and not go into Cape Town after.The walk itself is stunning - starting on the side of Table Mountain you get some great views of the mountain and the 12 Apostles. As you go up you then get great views of Camps Bay, Clifton, Signal Hill and the city of Cape Town. A lot of people enjoy the walk and stop to eat on the way up. For me whose balance is somewhat less than optimal using a pair of walking poles made the journey so much easier to do.

The iconic walk of the Cape. You cannot visit Cape Town without going for a sunset walk up Lion's Head. The locals will tell you that it is an absolute must, and they will be happy to take you! Timing is key as it gets quite busy after work, most people go up for sun downers as the views are truly spectacular.

Lion is the King. IT just one of the most amazing places!All you can feel it's majectic Lion lying there!!!For sure you will visit TAble mountain, but all these Cape Town mountains worth flying half world there!

Best view over Cape Town. We were in Cape Town for 4 days and went to Lion's Head, Table Mountain and Signal Hill. However, Lion's Head was by far the best. Therefore we've been there twice. We strongly recommend you to go up there for sunrise. It's a really thrilling experience. However, you should wear sturdy shoes and bring a torch if you do so. If you have fear of heights or have never been to exposed tracks before you should at least bring a friend for a few encouraging words.
Not bad. Average trek up. Wonderful at sunset. Nice to have a bottle of wine with. Decent views. Not bad. Recommend!

Lions Head Hill - Good for adventure. The place close to the table mountain and Signal hill is another of those adventure hotspots capetonian's love to engage in. Trekking and Paragliding are quite popular sports in this area and couple with Signal Hill, these places provide a good sunset watch area. Spent an hour during sunset with your own picnic bag and just let your dreams take flight from there.
A must-do in Cape Town. Easy enough for the whole family. Or a great sundowner hike with friends. About 40-50 mins to reach the top with amazing views all the way

a great hike for beginners. wraps around the mountain, very relaxing, and beautiful views! this is a great hike for beginners with an urge to hike. head down to Kloof street after for a delicious meal!

Very fun. It is a very easy, fun and great experience to climb up lions head. Its free too! At the top there is a great view point and awesome photo spot, there's a paragliding spot about three quarters of the way up to paraglide off.

Excellent for hiking. Specially in early hours or around 6pm in summer is wonderful, try to avoid weekends or high season since there are lots of people going and ther´s a certain point where there is only one way to go up and down, so it gets long queues.Spectacular 360 view of CT, it takes around 40 to 1 hour to get to the top, depending on your pace obviously.. the pictures up there are incredible and well worth the visit, at least once in your life although you will probably want to go again after you´ve done it.There is a fullmoon hike once a month (dont think it works in winter, it gets very dangerous), dont advise it for small kids, you have to climb vertical at one point...

Beautiful hike!. We hiked up Lion's Head at dusk & arrived at the summit in time to watch the sunset. It was absolutely beautiful. I highly recommned this hike. The hike down in the dark was a bit more difficult: bring a flashlight!We took the path that was "at your own risk." It was steep & a bit challenging. If you are not in good shape, do not take this path!

DANGEROUS. Take it very easy guys. Having myself fallen and taken a bit of a beating on Lions head I'm speaking from experience - I've lost count of how many times I've been up, including last week in the rain when I saw only one other soul there!!The track/ climb to the top really is sketchy. There are so many thousands of people that cover the same route that the rocks and tree stumps that you have to negotiate are almost worn flat. If there has been rain then it's even more perilous. You're actually much safer climbing Table Mountain.To be fair, though, it's a relatively quick and straight forward jaunt to the top and the 360 degree views are to die for. Just take it easy and enjoy :-)

Nice walk,view and not too touristy. Some local friends recommend us to climb Lion´s Head instead of Table Mountain: less touristy and safer. Great choice. Lots of locals and we indeed were among the few tourists there. Nice and walk walk: not too hard not too easy. And beautiful view. Totally recommend it.
Great Hiking Trail. Brilliant views as you climb up, but the best view when you reach the top, a bit of challenge towards the end of climbing up the mountain but a hike well worth doing.

Great hike and great view!. Great hike that gets a bit difficult in the end.You start walking, you end up almost rock climbing!View up their really worth it !!! (Table Mountain and the City look very nice from up their!)
Breathtaking photos!. Don't forget to check out Lion's Head. The photos are amazing and it's worth the short hike up. Beautiful day or night depending on the season.

Full Moon Walks. Lion's Head has been a winner since I arrived in Cape Town in 1980. I love going on the full moon hikes up Lion's Head because it's festive and fun and the view at night is achingly beautiful. Take a friend. Pack a picnic and put on your walking shoes. Take a torch too!Of course, you can also go during the day. The walk is a bit strenuous but if you pace yourself and go slowly, even someone who is seriously unfit can enjoy the outing. It's really lovely.Put this one on your "To Do" List :)

March has the best sunsets. My arm was nearly twisted off but I finally agreed to join my friends for a hike up Lion'shead to see the sun set over the Atlantic. It was worth every huff and every puff up the mountain. The views are endless and if you reach high enough you can touch the stars. Must must must when you are in Cape Town.

A great walk for a sun rise or set. Start early and give yourself at least an hr to get to the top.Bring a torch so that you find your way.If you are brave use the chain ladders but be very careful since people often fall and hurt themselves.Once at the top enjoy Cape Town

Panoramic. Excellent walking with changing perspective of views over Cape Town, and down the Atlantic seaboard.Always take the safest route (marked) and there are some chains in a few places. Plenty of water when climbing in summer.

Her Majesty Mountain . Terrific view of the city and the Robben Island, just a place after seeing you have to come there and summarise your visit, a must visit when you are in mother city. suggestion, may I recommend you visit this Iconic place as your last point of call before you leave CT, it will give you a different feeling of your visit.
Best Hike in Cape Town. The best combination of exercise, fresh mountain air and the best views of Cape Town you could ever want!

This is a gret hike if you have a few spare hours. Lions Head is a popular hike in Cape Town. I recommend it. It takes about an hour to go up and an hour to come down. the views from the top are amazing. The majority of the hike is quite straight forward, however as you get closer to the top you are faced with a few minor obstacles that have chains and ladders to help you navigate. There are a few options to go around the chains and ladders, but you have to know where they are...not well marked. I don't like being in an exposed position, but I didn't mind the chains and ladders. I went on the hike at 9am to beat the crowds, but because it is not an overly challenging hike, it was already very busy. No matter, it was still worth it.
Nice little hike. Hiking up Lion's Head is great fun! It's an easy trail with fantastic views! Go up there for sunset. Epic photo opportunities!

Great view of Lion's head. Lion's Head Mountain is another spectacular view especially from the Table Mountain. As one ascend and descend the table mountain the view and greatness of creation is brought out. The scenery is very unforgettable. It speaks of the greatness of God the creator. He is simply the greatest of all artists.

Great walk and a bit of a scramble. Have done this walk a number of times with visitors to CT and never get tired of it. The views are well worth the effort of getting to the top. While this is a walk the top part could be a bit challenging if you are not so agile.

The view is the reward. Although the hike was quite rough and exhausting, the view from the top was totally worth it. Bring enough water (about 1.5L per person) and maybe warmer clothes because the weather can change quickly and the higher you get, the colder and windier it is. There is a small shop to buy snacks and water at the bottom of the mountain, btu nothing else going up. Also, bear in mind that some trails are narrow and you'll come across some hikers. Adventurous, pleasant hike with a beautiful reward at the end. Big highlight of Cape Town

Very pleasant walk. Walking up Loins Head is a lovely experience,but i have a few suggestions for the people who manage it.There is a small shop at the bottom that sells water and drinks,but after that nothing else and when you have to climb up and down again you cant carry too much with you.A small kiosk at the top to refresh your drinks would be welcome and also afford much needed income for someone.The walk way can be dangerous at times and there are no railings or even guides along the way for safety.Apart from this it ia a very satisfying climb and well woth the effort onece you reach the top.The view is absolutely stunning.

Beautiful View. You get the best view from on top of Lion's Head, and the hike is not too challenging. I am in no way fit, but manage to get up and down without any problems. The first 20 minutes are always the toughest.

A great hike up and amazing views!. The hike up was nice, the ladders and the chains makes it more interesting, and it's not a very hard or difficult hike. The view on the top is amazing! Definitely worth the trip.

Best quick hike!!. 45 minutes up, 30 minutes down with teh best sunset views you will ever have, take the chains up for a more direct route. The most beatiful panoramic views of our beautiful city can be seen from there!!

Walk/hike up Lions Head. My daughter & I enjoyed an exhilarating walk/hike up Lions Head late in April. Unfortunately, it was a little misty on the day, so we couldn't experience the view to the fullest. But it was still a wonderful way to spend a Saturday morning. I would suggest wearing sturdy walking or hiking shoes/boots and taking a snack & water or juice with you to enjoy at the top while you catch your breath & enjoy the view. A walking stick would be helpful as it can be slippery in places. The walk should take you 2 - 2.5 hours, up & down.
long way up yet satisfying!!!!. The scenery is amazing wait till get to the top and there are so much to see. what a great place cape town is wow wow wow.

Get there for sunset and bring a beer. Amazing view at sunset, bring a beer and some friends, you won't forget it. I'd say it's the best view of CT, as I t only looks like CT, when you can see Table Mountain. Also you can go any day as it never suffers from cloud cover.

Not a lot to do there but definately worth doing. It is a local tradition to drive to the top and toast the sun going down over the ocean.. On a clear day you have a perfect view of Cape Town and the Table mountain.You wouldn't really want to spend much time here but it definately is worth doing.

Great experience. Great views. If you are a beginner hiker, a trip around the base is perfect. You still get to see amazing views as you do the entire circle. We did a sunset hike during May at 16:00 and it took us two hours. It was still light when we returned to our cars. Pack in warm clothes as it gets cold quickly.
Exercise and Views !!. Another way to experience the beautiful outdoors around Cape Town city. A manageable walk to the top is rewarded with endless eye candy ..
Beautiful views. Magnificient views, we travelled up signal Hill, lovely view from the top. You get to see the whole Cape Town City Centre and surroundings and Robben Island too from a distance.

Extremely rewarding challenge. One of the most pleasant physical challenges I've ever had was to trek up the Lion's Head. It's suitable for all ages and the amazing view is simply one of the best in Cape Town. Definitely a place to go back, especially in sunny days. Do not underestimate the physical challenge... It's not extremely hard, but not that easy either.

A view worth a thousand words. The walk up lions head takes a circular shape rotating around the head, while ascending. This gives views in all directions even before getting to the top. It's a tough walk for unfit people as you're going uphill the whole time yet we did it in 2 hours despite not exercising regularly, and being out of shape. Leave plenty of time so you won't feel rushed and stop for drinking water. Take water and sandwiches as the best part is right at the top just sitting and relaxing while inhaling the fresh air and incredible views.
Stunning. Stunning views of this headland are visible from numerous vantage points locally and all superb especially from Table Mountain.
Lovely walk. This is a fantastic early morning walk. It is not a difficult walk seeing as you are climbing a mountain. The paths are well marked so therefore access is easy. The viewer magnificent.
Breath-taking views. A great climb, great view! Be sure to bring along a fully charged camera, water bottle and some snacks. Wear comfortable shoes! This is well worth the climb.

Beautiful but not so easy. After reading some reviews I thought it would be a pretty easy 1 hour hike but it was much harder than I thought. It does get quite steep at the end and there is some rock scrambling, so make sure you wear good shoes- and take lots of water!! The views from the top (and on the way up) were incredible and made the hard hike up worth it.
45 Mins Walk uo Lion's Head. Beautiful Views across Cape Town and Camps Bay, an excellent short climb, if you dont have the strength for Table Mountain.

A nice small hike. About 250m elevation gain, this hike gives nice views. Took us about 70 minutes to go up, which included a fair amount of picture taking. The path forks into an "easy" and a "steep" route partway up, the latter of which requires climbing up some near vertical parts with the aid of steel holds set into the wall. At the top, there are some moderately steep places, which small children would have to be handed up. The views of Cape Town and the sea from the top are really great.

Great walk. The hike up was reasonably easy, up until you got to the chains and ladders. The chains and ladders are not difficult, but make sure you wear the correct footwear. The views from the top are great, although it was busy when we were there on a Saturday.
Spectacular!. Got up early to watch the sunrise from the top and it was spectacular! The climb was not as bad as I was expecting and the views are amazing.
WOW. Amazing walk up Lions head, the last bit is a tad bit hectic but worth it all the way!!! The view is breath taking, definitely making it a weekly routine!!!

Amazing views!. The hike was harder and longer than I'd thought, but well worth it! The ladders and chains added a fun element to the hike up and the view at the very top was spectacular. The only thing I disliked was all of the trail runners who would dart around and over the top of you as they ran up or down the hill.

Climbing. Go up to Lion's Head for sunset, it is worth it .. I am actually kind of afraid of heights, which made the last part of the hike not as nice as it is only rock climbing. However it was amazing, despite the fact that I really had to conquer my fear !

Full moon hike!. we did the full moon hike up lions head!It was amazing!First a beautiful sunset and then just chilling.after a while you'll see the moon come up! Wauw! it's amazing!And the mountain itself was very cool to climb!some parts was just walking so very nice.And then the adventure part!with iron pieces sticking out of the rocks and you need them to climb!Felt like a kid again! was really nice!Also nice is that they made an other way for people who don't want to climb.
Amazing!. I have a fear of heights but am so glad my daughter persuaded me to climb Lion's Head Mountain. Though I didn't make it to the top, the views and experience was so memorable.

..sadly the often forgotten landmark... ..another of the Cape Town landmarks..this is often overlooked even though it is a stunning mountain..it does not take any imagination to spot why it is called lion head..

Lion's Head (regular route). Shortish hike for people who are fairly fit, only 45 mins to an hour one-way to the top. Amazing 360 views. Lots of people hiking it all the time so easy to meet other travellers. Free. Fun. There are a few challenging bits if you're a beginner hiker, even on the 'main' route.

Beautiful. Beautiful look-out point. Expect to park your car far from the look out point and wear comfy shoes. If its a sunny day you'll be able to see as far as Bloubergstrand/Grotto Bay. No enterance fee

Wonderful views. If you don't have the time to climb Table Mountain, a hike up Lion's Head is an excellent idea. The first part of the trail is very easy, but then it gets quite a bit steeper. The all-round views are spectacular - Table Mountain, Camps Bay and the Twelve Apostles, Seapoint and downtown Cape Town. Don't forget your camera!
What a beautiful view. We did the climb on a beautiful autumn morning , beautiful view and good exercise Strongly recommend it and it isfor free
Cycle UP. Nice climb on quiet roads to get the heart rate going. Take your camera for the splendid views of Capetown and Table Mountain. This is free.
Spectacular. I have hiked,cycled and driven up this mountain.The view from the top is spectacular .Favorite place for local and an absolute must for visitors .

Awesome, Awesome Views. We scrambled up the mountain in about an hour and absolutely loved the last 35 minutes or so where it's real hand over hand climbing. Views were incredibly dramatic - obviously not as high as Table Mountain and less of a time commitment, but totally worth it for the views since the summit so narrow and really feels like a peak. Amazing photo op's up there!
Perfect morning coffee spot. Love going up first thing in the morning, having a thermus filled with coffee and enjoying the views once I get on top.

Climb the lions head. It's easier than you think. A moderate level of fitness is required for this climb, mostly a mild uphill before some chains/staples/ladders and a rock scramble at the end. The last bit is treacherous and falling over the cliff is very likely but it adds to the excitement. The views are as stunning as the top of table Mountain but with a feeling of accomplishment. Best of all its free. No water or toilets on the route

Great walk. Excellent views... I had been told before going that the walk was really tough. I have to say, it was far easier than I expected. You do need to wear proper shoes, I did feel for the girls walking in heels and knee high boots, but it is very enjoyable.
Great way to start a day in Cape Town!. If you're moderately fit - this is a great way to start your day off. Try get here at sunrise to catch the morning light falling over the city.
"A LOVELY VIEW". Go for a hike to Leons Head. You will never regret. Almost for everybody in normal shape. Enjoy a free trip and an astonishing view.

Great hike!!. We went and started hiking up Lion's Head. You should start as early as you can because it gets hot and muggy. Go prepared - you can't buy water on the way! Take a picnic - the views are incredible! Unfortunately we didn't make it to the top because one in our group sprained her ankle on the way up!

What an experience. This was one of the best hikes I have ever done. The spectacular view of cape town was breath taking. The view changes as you hike since you have chance to rotate the head of the mountain 360 degrees. The view from the top was just priceless.
Great view! Nice hike!. I did the Lion's Head twice during our stay as a morning run and enjoyed the view. The last section is very steep and you should be sure of step..
Most loved peak in CTN. Arguably the most hiked peak all year round. Young and old alike descend on the mountainside daily. Especially popular on full moon.

Worth repeating as often as possible. Walking on the mountain is theraputic and free. You can run up Lion's Head as a substitute for gymming, or you can stroll, stop to take photos, take in the views or just catch your breath. You can carry a picnic to the top and stay for sunset, or you can beat the crowds and walk up in the dark for a spectacular sunrise. The only downside of hiking up Lions Head is the ever increasing popularity of this attraction. Parking can be a problem and in the summer months you can queue just to get to the start. If you are in Cape Town and are not totally unfit, this is something you really should experience. It is a great place to orientate yourself and offers spectacular views no matter what direction you look. Robben Island, the ocean, the mountain and the city.
Hell yeah !. Just climb it and enjoy the rest ! This is probably one of the best spot that I made. Make sure you are fit and rock it ! Lion's head, you gotta make it !

Great. We climbed up the top! It was a fanstastic experience and relatively easy for kids. 3hrs total up and down with some time to enjoy the view. Chains and stairs were very accessible if no major problem.

Great climb, excellent view. The 50 min climb is demanding (for a person who does not exercise regularly) but its very scenic and interesting. It requires a certain degree of focus but its also fun and rewarding in terms of physical beauty. The top of the mountain has breathtaking view (weather permitting) with a great 360 degree view of the area. Its worth the effort to climb up to the top, recommended to start early (like 5.45 am if during March) to catch the sunrise while at the top and avoid the hotter temperatures that make the climb a bit uncomfortable after 9 am. Give it a try , you will not be disappointed!
Worth it's name. Nice way up, not too long, great views. But be prepared (shoes, clothing, food, water). Don't forget to watch the sunset while climbing, but be aware of the sudden darkness.

Amazing but suprisingly challenging. I'm rather surprised at how this hike is described as a casual walk. It gets very difficult at points clambering over very steep rocks using hands and feet. You don't need to be particularly fit but you do need your wits about you. I saw a woman in tears because she was so afraid of heights. It takes about 2-3 h to complete. The views are well worth it!

Be careful. This is worth the trip if you can do it. I am 50 and went up with a bunch of college kids. I could hold my own but there were some spots where I had to be careful. There are no railings. Very easy to fall off while taking the perfect picture. The views were worth it. We went up around 4 so it wasn't so hot. Bring water.

A stunning view - and interesting history. We didn't plan to visit Lion's Head before we saw it from a distance. We had a guided tour of the area called district six, an interesting area historically that calls for a separate visit/review. From the district six we saw the view of the mountain with a single top shaped to the profile of a lion's head. So of course we had to go there to take a closer look at its habitat. Having been at the table mountain and learning to know the fauna, it came as no surprise to us that the same unique fauna could be found at Lion's Head. It is an impressive mountain, as so much else of this fantastic country, but if you have been to the table mountain, you really do not need to see also Lion's head. The history of the mountain entails some interesting facts, as e.g. how the area have been protected by the community by not allowing exploration between the mountain and the outskirts of Cape Town. The Cape Malay, another example, is an area inhabited by an ethnic group of people that springs from the Javanese people that were brought to South Africa by the Dutch as slaves between 1650 and 1824. Still Malay ancestry lives in the area at the very foot of the mountain. There is, in our opinion more to learn about Lion's Head and the surroundings than what can be experienced only by paying it a visit.

Great climb. Climbed in the morning at the weekend, busy but good atmosphere and easy to find parking space. Amazing views from the top. Definitely recommend taking the route with the ladders/chain assists to get to the top.

Great views over Cape Town. We were lazy and drove to the top as we had only arrived the previous day after a long flight. The views were great. In fact we had intended to get the aerial cableway up Table Mountain, but because of the cloud it was closed for several days. Then there were the dreadful fires on the mountainsides near Tokai and so again it was closed. The last day we had the opportunity to get up to the cable cars the traffic and volume of cars and coaches was manic. So we decided against it. However, I think we got just as good a view from Lion's Head without all the crowds.

Lions Head. Lions head has a really nice hiking trail. It's not so hard to get to the top. Anyone can do it! Young and old. And it's really fun :) and safe. I usually do it once a month and I do not consider myself to be fit. It has a few ladders to climb and the rest is just some rocky walk. But it's fun for everyone with one of the best views of the Cape...
Great sunset. Ran up from Cape Town for sunset. Busy but great atmosphere & lovely views. Don't miss this! Lots of places to sit & security people around. Party atmosphere, take a bottle of wine!

fantastic view,. I didn't realize at first that south Afrika had so many breath taking views.It really is wurth while to visit every inch of South Afrika, and that is not possiable in one visit to the country so we will have to go back.I am really clad that we had the chance to see so much of the country.Lion's head is really breath taking
Brilliant views. It's definitely worth a drive along the Lion's Head for amazing views of Cape Town that you won't find anywhere else.

Scenic Lion's Head. Lion's Head is popular with Fitness junkies and photographers as well. I went there with some two local photographers. We were going to take pictures of the sunrise in summer and so we started the hike at 5am. It took us about 50 mins from the foot to the top. The hike gets a little intense as you near the top but it was well worth it. All in all it is quite a safe place to hike as some modifications have been made on the side of the hill to help climbers. Lots of people hike up the mountain in the dark and that just shows how safe the place is.By 6am the place was already busy with runners, photographers and tourists who had come to see the sun rising over the city. From the top one has a good view of the City centre, Green Point, Gardens, Vredehoek, Table Mountain, Signal hill as well as Camps Bay and the Atlantic.The hill also has caves on the side. they are not as easy to access but definitely worth a visit for the adventurous lot.It can get a little cold up there so be sure to dress warm and wear proper hiking shoes. There is NO entry charge to go up Lions Head and hikes can be done at any time.
too good!. You need to look at it carefully to understand as to why is this known as Lion's head. But a picturesque view from Table Mountain of Lion's head

The beauty of Cape Town. This is one of the peaks on the mountains surrounding the beautiful city of Cape Town. Your eyes are drawn to it when you stand in the bay or ascend Table Mountain. stunning scenery.
Ideal place for a sundower!. If you have the chance you definitely climb lion's head for a sun downer and watch the sunset from there!

Head of the pride . We spent a long time just admiring the beauty of this lion... Every angle is different n has its own unique look, add to that the sunlight & u can't stop snapping away.The view of being there with city below is 2 good.

Brilliant activity. Walked to Lions Head from our accommodation and then took on the climb. I wasn't really sure what to expect despite reading reviews - an easy hike to me might be difficult to someone else. From the car park, we took the climb to the right and came down from the left. In hindsight I would have taken the path to the left. It is steep but the path on the right has a lot of loose rock and is a bit unnerving in parts. The final bit has some steps and climbing aids where needed. Take your time, bring water, a hat and a snack. The views are breathtaking
easy, beautiful hike. A beautiful, yet not a taxxing hike in the wonderful mother city. The links we had to climb were a lot of fun.
Great sunset. Great sunset. Crowded parking, long time to get out of parking lot. Hop on bus night tour was worth it, driver was great entertainment, talking drivers into moving.

Stunning walk and views. What an incredible way to spend a few hours; my husband and I walked up Lions Head one Sunday morning. There were loads of people walking and chatting and enjoying the views. It's a stunning walk and the views are incredible. A must do!

THE CROWDED LION. Over the last few years, the Lion has become more and more crowded. Is it still a pleasure? Well if you want a perfect short walk (45 minutes to the top from the car park and 40 minutes down again) and are happy to queue at various key points but ...

A view like no other. Definitely a must when visiting Cape Town for the nature seekers. You get to see the other side of Table Mountain also the view of the most popular beach in Cape Town namely Camps Bay.This is a local hiking spot for the locals of Cape Town and also a very safe place to walk that you don't need a permit. I will definitely recommend this to all the tourist coming to Cape Town as you can pack a nice picnic and enjoy it on the top of Cape Town - basically a picnic with the most amazing view. Please avoid this route if the weather is changing or if rain is on its way as the rocks can be slippery.

It's worth it!. You'll feel more Cape Townian once you've made it to the top of Lion's head. Views are breathtaking but go prepared with water, a snack & sunblock. Don't be surprised to be overtaken by multiple small children & family pets
See the Moon. An awesome short hike, with an amazing view of the full moon rising over cape town. I highly recommend the moon rise hike if you are around during the right time of the lunar cycle.

Definitely a MUST, if you're reasonably fit.. If you're not afraid of hights (just a relatively short path before reaching the top) and OK with doing also an intensive climb (but again, only short part of the overall), then don't miss it. The climb takes about an hour, depending also on 'the crowds'. Most of it is a very gentle but consistent climb that takes you up as in a snail trail, around the peak, and always higher. The last part, if you didn't pause too much until there, can take your energy away, as it's steeper and involves (if you choose the more direct and faster option) climbing a few SIMPLE and short ladders. It becomes a quite narrow path for a while, before opening up to the wide and relatively flat peak, that seems to have room for everyone. The views are truly 360 degrees, and simply amazing and beautiful. Many people stay and even climb up right before the sunset, which means that before and after that time, the path will be quite crowded and will impact the time of the climb. Overall - don't miss it. BTW, I climbed it up on the same day that I climbed the Table Mountain, and it DID make an impact on my tired legs. That's why I also had to do it alone :-).

Scenic hike. It seems to be the fitness crowds place of choice and joggers, hikers and dog walkers were constant.The drive is scenic and although parking is limited it is worth doing.A very unique view of Table Mountain with the 12 Apostles traveling off to the side.A great view of Camps Bay and the fynbos along the trail is very pretty.Pretty steep climb so not for the frail or very unfit or impaired.
DO IT!!!. This is a must-do in my opinion! Just make sure to wear comfy hiking shoes and take plenty of water.

Most Amazing Cape Town experience. We trekked up lion's head. Took a total of 4 hours on our journey to the top and back. You must carry water/glucose and try starting very early in the morning when the sun is not on the head. It can be tedious and challenging but fellow trekkers provide support. The view from the head is breathtaking with the whole city like a painting on a canvas with the mighty table mountains in the backdrop!

Hiked all the way to the top. Lions head is a beautiful lookout point. I found the views to be more attractive than those of table mountain which is at a higher altitude and a very long hike. This is a intense hour hike so it is doable by anyone in any sort of shape. One of the things about it is that there are often clouds in the sky which will obstruct your view. You want to make sure to go on a very clear day. Then the views are just breathtaking.The path starts as a wide path then turns in a very rocky steep climb. Bring good shoes and shorts and shades. Wear sun lotion! The sun is very strong there. I got burnt to a crisp and I am not fair skinned. Can't remember last time my skin peeled.

Go for sunrise!. We got up at 5 AM to catch the sunrise over capetown & Table Mountain from Lionshead and were not at all disappointed! It was gorgeous!! We did not hike all the way to the top, as we didn't have a lot of extra time, but just hiking part of the way up was gorgeous!!

Hate love relationship... As we have expected an easy 30min walk, we went up totally unprepared: no sunscreen, no hats, no water, wrongt clothes.... Of course we got one of the hottest days and without any wind. So getting up took us almost 2 hours, but it was really worth it! I hated hiking up there, but at the same time I wanted to go higher and higher because the view got nicer and nicer :P

An experince on par with Table Mountain. I hiked up both Table Mountain and Lion's Head. Both are beautiful trails with almost the same level of difficulty. The trail up Lion's Head gives you a beautiful of Clifton Beach as well as the city. You're actually able to see a whole lot more than at the top of table mountain. The hike requires a certain level of fitness, but it is definitely worth the effort. Bring plenty of water and be aware that there are no shops at the bottom of the mountain. The hike to the top is around 1½ hour and around 45 min. to get down again.
Nice view with ice cream van. Good for a lower than table mountain similar view, no cost, watch the paragliders launch or take a ride on a tandem flying rag.

LOVELY WALK, LOVELY DRIVE. Even if you don't have plenty of time, this is a MUST. We walked (not even with hiking shoes) the 1.5 hour to the top to catch sunrise and what an award! Sea and sun in every direction, literally 360 degrees! A drive up takes about 10 minutes, places to stop and admire the views are everywhere and the friendly Capetonians are eager to share their road with pedestrians.

Awesome Hike. Great place for anyone to go to. I've seen people propose there, awesome view of the city and beyond. You basically see almost everything when you are on top. It is near another wonderful place, Signal Hill, that's perfect for family fun and picnics. And on the other side, you are welcomed by the humongous Table Mountain that is one of the Seven Wonders of the world. It is on average an hour long hike but you can do it in 30 minutes. (I DARE YOU) It is great to hike during the morning before sunrise or even in the evenings when the sun sets and do remember to bring your torches.
Climb the Lion for fun and great views!. The trail is a little bit crowded, but worth it! Ladders and chains will get you to the very top, where panoramic views surround the city and bays. .

Up the side - yeh!! walk all the way up - nah!!. If you are young, fit and headstrong, go for a hike up Lion's Head.If, like me, you are less young, still fit and far less headstrong, opt for a balloon flight over the top, or even a helicopter ride, or just gaze at the majesty of the rock.

On the Prowl. Started the hike from my hostel which was about 45mins away and reached the peak another 45mins later. Easy hike most of the way and saw some kids doing it too. Wear comfortable shoes with a good grip as the sand can make the rocks a little more slippery. I hiked up close to a full moon so i shared the view at the top with plenty of other people which has it perks when you're hiking alone down at night as you feel much safer with plenty of people around. The view at the top is amazing day or night and a must-do when you're in capetown.

Wear suitable footwear and don't attempt it if you are afraid of sheer drops. Unfortunately we went on a day when the summit was in cloud, so there was no point in going right to the top, and since one of our party decided to stay put once the path narrowed, our guide was unhappy about leaving her on her own there in case of muggers, the route being very quiet that day and we only saw rangers as we were leaving later on. That said, even if you don't go that far up, the views are worth it and change as you go round the mountain and look for different vantage points. The climb is possible for most people and we saw some really elderly folk taking it very gently and runners perfectly happy to bound up and down. Go early to avoid the heat.

What a climb!. We climbed on a very warm day and forgot to take water - absolutely stupid. I got nearly to the top with my daughter, my husband got right to the top. Even so there were fantastic views of Camps Bay and all around. Quite a difficult climb later on, steep and it got progressively steeper and more difficult right at the end. Take water and a camera!

Nice hike w. unbelievable views. Not too hard of a hike but should definitely wear proper shoes. Some parts can get narrow and there is nothing protecting you from falling off the mountain so be careful. The views at the top are spectacular and although I don't recommend walking back down in the dark, it was amazing being able to see the sun set from the top.

Excellent views of CT and table mountain. It is best to do this at the same time as going up table mountain. You can do it in your own car. I'm not sure if the tours go here. There are a few places to get coffee and food. You can also do a par ascending ride from here if you fancy.

Fabulous 360deg views .. a must if in Cape Town but take care!. Definitely a must .. you can drive and park at Lion's Head trail head on Signal Hill Rd or take MyCITI bus ( get MyCITI CARD AT bus station Adderly St) to Kloof Nek (same bus as for Table Mountain) and walk up from Kloof Nek stop. Make sure to wear proper shoes and bring water .. start is easy, however some difficult parts towards the summit. The walk spirals around as you ascend/descend with spectacular and breathtaking 360deg views .. especially at the top ......Robben Island, Table Mountain, The Twelve Apostles and Camps Bay, Signal Hill, Cape Town and the Water Front etc. etc. Note you can get MyCITI buses in Hout Bay or Camps Bay Area which pass through Kloof Nek the stop for Table Mountain or Lion's Head or Signal Hill.

Challenging but beautiful. The climb up Lion's Head starts easy but gets more and more challenging higher up. The views are incredible. Be careful of windy conditions. If you are in reasonable shape and have the right shoes, it is very manageable. Don't wear flip flops or carry a handbag if you intend to get to the top - you need to climb over rocks.

Lions Head is AMAZING. If you are looking for an easy hike in Cape Town, Lions Head is by far the easiest. Hike with caution though as there are a few places where hikers have fallen.The tree you need to pass on the way up just after the chains (There is another route that does not include chains, for inexperienced hikers) has really slippery roots, so be careful.The Official Lions Head Twitter account @LionsHeadCT is a perfect place to see when is a good time to hike and when not.

The Pride of Cape Town. The walk up Lions Head is something that you must do at least once when visiting Cape Town, if you live here and have not yet done it- WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR?The walk looks intimidating, but I would say that if you are moderately fit it isn't to much of a challenge. The scariest part for me were the chains that you climb to get closer to the top. Once you are up there and have a 360 degree view of the beautiful cape you will have no regrets, so put your hiking/running shoes on and get on up there.

Top views from Lion's Head. It takes at least an hour to walk the strenuous route up Lion's Head; a little longer if one takes the easier (longer) route near the summit and not the chain ladder. Once at the top, one has amazing views of Table Bay, Cape Town, Table Mountain and the Atlantic seaboard. Especially popular are walks up Lion's Head on clear evenings at full moon in summer. Somewhat off the beaten track is Wally's Cave, well worth a visit. The route is steep, especially near the summit and unsuitable for the unfit and small children. There are no facilities on Lion's Head, so hikers should take enough fluids and something to eat. Sometimes it can be cold at the, so always take something warm. The best time of year to climb Lion's Head is probably the autumn (March, April) when it is not too warm and the rainy season has not yet started.

Great Natural Ferature. This is a smaller crest just next to Table Mountain quite safe to climb but some route the funal assent is on chains so be carefuk and always take water and phone as although only moderate can be hazardas. Again wonderful viewa over table Bay!

On top of the lion of Africa. I recommend this hike on the full-moon night, an hour before the sunset. The view to the ocean once you are on top will leave you speechless and the moment you have the sun and the full moon on the same line.... MAGICAL!!!

Outstanding views!. This hike is a must for any outdoors types visting Cape Town. A bit challenging at points, but the hike is not very long. The views along the hike are unbelievable! You will never see anything like it in your life. It's best to go early morning or evening, espicially during summer as there is little shade and it gets really hot.Try do the hike at full moon, its spectacular

Challenging hike, but worth it !. The first half of the hike was relatively easy (but steep). However, as you near the summit, you will have to climb over boulders and certain ladders. There are no safety guards along the way, so make sure to keep that in mind if you are afraid of heights. Nonetheless, when you reach the summit, all of your efforts are recompensed by the wonderful views of Table Mountain, 12 Apostles, Camps Bay, etc. We would reccommend going early in the morning or late afternoon to avoid the heat.

Brilliant views over Cape town. This is a wonderful spot to park and walk there are many different walks here and you can climb to the top of lions head by way of rope chains not easy to do but well worth it..

Lion`s Head Hike. This is a lovely walk/hike with magnificent views of Capetown central, Camps Bay, Robben Island in the distance and a closer look at Table Mountain and the Cable Car. Sunsets can be stunning as well as a night walk but only if you are accompanied by someone who knows the walk. .For those not so fit you can do the round walk to the base point or take on the challenge of the steeper climb to the top. Remember to take water as there are no streams on the mountain and don't forget a hat and sunscreen. When the wind is right you may also be able to see Paragliders launching themselves off the mountain towards Camps Bay.

paragliding. I did not walk up to Lions head, but was picked up from the hotel and dropped back.I did paragliding off of it. The down side ,it did not last long enough. I would like to have walked. It looks down over cape town and Camps Bay.

Hanging out with friends on Lion's Head. To see the most beautiful view of the whole of Cape Town, one MUST simply take a short walk onto Lions Head, the view will indeed take your breath away. It can get a bit rough walking the slopes so make sure you have the correct shoes on, but for the most part the walk is rather easy.Also, it is much more fun to go in a group so you can share what you see below pointing out sights in the famous mother city and more saver as well. You can take a longer or a shorter walk, either way the air is fresh and the view simply stunning!!!

Great hike. Amazing views.. The hike up Lions head took roughly 45 minutes from top to bottom. Some parts are trickier than others but not too difficult and well worth it for the views. We did it during the day, wouldn't advise doing it at night as some parts are awkward, but ive heard the views are even better at sunset

No excuses!. ...for not climbing lion's head when in the mother city. You'll be rewarded with the perfect view on city, coastline and table mountain. It's up to you if you choose the chain and iron steps supported or the regular route - but take water with you and wear your hiking boots!

MAGNIFICENT.. You can see the Lion´s head from many places in Cape Town and it really looks like a Lions head if you really Think of it. You got good Pictures of it when you take the Cable car up to Table mountain.

Easy easy hiking. Lion's Head is not a difficult hike but it is a very rewarding one - the views up there are spectacular. The start of the hike is not from the Signal Hill car park but from the road on the way up to Signal Hill. In summer I recommend you start early, say 6-7am and have breakfast up there - it only takes between 40min - 2 hrs depending on your fitness level. (some nutters run up and down as a weekly fitness routine) It can become crowded during peak season. ( Dec/Jan dispite the wind, Feb is generally windless) There is a moonlight hike at the full moon, you get to see Table Bay bathed in silver moonlight. Being up on Lion's Head at sunset is awesome but be careful of having alcoholic sundowners, you still have the hike back down!! There are 2 routes - one with chain ladders (fun to do), one without ( a bit longer walk). There are no facilities on top, so use the loo at the Signal Hill ablutions before you set off. Never hike alone, there is safety in numbers and if you are traveling alone look on the Internet for hiking groups to join. Lastly, though I've said it's an easy hike, it is a mountain and caution is a must or you could end up with injury.

Favourite mountain in Cape Town. I have been walking up lions head since I was a kid, and it is my absolute favourite for a number of reasons. Firstly the start is near the centre of Cape Town, so you don’t need to drive much to get there which makes it extremely convenient.Secondly it is not nearly as long as Table Mountain, which means if you just have a morning, and want to get some great exercise and views, you can be up and down relatively fast.1.5 hrs up and down (in total) for the fit! and could be much less for the super fit exercise fanatics.Thirdly, unlike other mountain walks, the path revolves around the mountain, so you get amazing views of the city, sea and distant mountains from all sides.The walk is fun with a bit of scrambling up the chains, and pulling oneself up and over rocks. There is nothing monotonous about it.Just bear in mind that the uphills can be quite steep, and while I certainly think it is suitable for kids and less experienced walkers, it is not a super easy walk. You are dealing with heights, and a small amount of balance, so not recommended for the very unfit, or those who are super scared of heights.The former can however always walk a bit of the way up, and stop and enjoy the beautiful views while the rest of the party carries on.It has a wonderful summit where you can sit and picknick for hours.The cons are I've heard from various people, that in peak season, and at peak hours, the mountain is becoming unbearably full. The path is not that wide and I have heard stories of people queuing to walk up certain bottle neck parts like the chains. So I guess it would probably be best to avoid this, though morning, and close to sunset are the nicest times.It is also possible to go up at full moon with a torch. You can literally see the moonrise and sunset at the same time specifically on the day of full moon. This also gets pretty crowded, so be prepared.Bear in mind that there have been accidents and fatalities up the mountain, so stick to all the usual hiking precautions. The weather at the top is obviously changeable, and if you start the walk too close to sunset you will be coming down in the dark.
Great Hike - Beautiful Views. Be sure to go early in the morning to get the sunrise and avoid long queues in peak season (December/January).

Worth every climb. A most enjoyable hike however one must proceed with caution.There are two routes that one can take to the top and it is highly recommendable to keep kids close by. A mis-judgement of your step can lead to unexpected mishaps. Enjoy the hike,take in the gorgeous views and definitely try catching a sunset on the top.If catching sunset be sure to carry a torch which you should do anyway.
remember this place always.. As a younger man I walked on Lions Head every morning. The tranquility and spectacular views are special. A peaceful and majestic place to go.

Great workout for a superb view. We hustled up early in the morning (recommended due to the heat and wind as the day progresses) to an amazing panoramic view of the city. Will do it again!Is a must for fit active travellers to Cape Town. Bring water and sunscreen!

Beautiful Views. One of the most beautiful destinations to explore. Whilst it is hard work to get to the top and requires a lot of perseverance, good walking/hiking shoes and lots of water; it's 100% worth it!

After Table Mountain, don't forget Lion's Head!. A walk up Lion's Head is one of the most enjoyable walks in the Western Cape. There is a bit of climbing up some chains near the top and you do need to be reasonably fit, but the views over Camp's Bay, Clifton and Sea Point are spectacular! Take a picnic lunch with you and enjoy the views from the top.

Full Moon Hike. Wow!!!! That is the best description I can give of my experience. I must admit that I am not an avid hiker, so the though of hiking up Lion's Head did not get my blood rushing, but once at the top I experienced the most amazing views and then realised that the climb was well worth the effort. The weather also played along, we got to the top just in time to see the most spectacular sunset on the one side and the rise of the full moon on the other. I would highly recommend this but if you are going to be there after sunset make sure to take a torch or headlamp as it gets quite dark and you need to light up your path on your way down.

Must see must do views!. The climb to the top not boring at all views to take your breath away. A great workout without feeling like exercise. Very social so don't climb alone but you're bound to meet people on the trail. Pack a picnic the summit is spectacular. I enjoyed the trail immensely.

Lion's Head. Another one of Cape Town’s iconic natural beauties!
Beautiful hikes, with scenic views of the Atlantic ocean coastline – and postcard sunsets.
A paragliders paradise or must-do full moon hike…

Lions Head Hike. Perfect for someone who is starting to hike. But make sure to prepare for it. Just to build up your leg strenght. A few lundges and squats for a few days before the hike will help beginners or you will get shaky legs on your way down =).Once you at the top the views are amazing.Also beginners try not to do a sunset hike if it is like 38 degress outside, it gets quite hot. I prefer a 5:30am sunrise hike, make it to the top to watch it rise over the mountain.

Not for the feint hearted. Lions head is a unique and very special attraction in Cape Town. The 360 degree view from the top is stunning, the way up although is not for the feint hearted. It starts with an easy stroll on a lea surly hiking path but further up it gets smaller and there is even a part with a chain involved to get to the top. There is people using lions head as a training track to run up. All in all, a very unique and rewarding experience. If you have the chance to be there for the rise of the full moon, that's the chery on top.

Must see view of Cape Town. The best time to head up is either early in the morning (for sunrise) or around 2 hrs before sunset. Remember to take loads of water and leave the mountain with all your rubbish. It is extremely popular on full moon evenings so expect delays while climbing the ladders.

Great Hike. Its a fairly easy hike to the top of Lion's Head. It takes about an hour to get to the very top but the views are well worth it. The trials are very well maintained and it wasnt overly crowded as the neighbor Table Top can sometimes be.

Alternative Million Dollar View. If the line at Table Mountain's cable car is way too long, choose Lion's Head instead. You will have to hike up but there is a moderate route for the steeper part so you should be fine. I really like Lion's Head because your view into Cape Town is complemented by the majestic sight of Table Mountain...something which you obviously won't have if you're on top of it. So hike up, take some water and enjoy the landscape. If you're thinking about watching the sunset up there, I know it's a nice idea but I really advise you not to because the path is horrible after dark. So make sure to get back while the sun is still up.
Honeymoon trot. Always amazing going up there. Weather was stunning although there were tons of people (Sunday) which was a distraction. Still great though, perhaps mid-week?

Epic climb - great view!. We climbed on the night of the full moon and it's a popular time to make the climb - in fact it got very busy and crowded. Nice atmosphere but I'd suggest going at a quieter time as you can get stuck behind slow climbers.It's a demanding climb - make sure you wear trainers with a good grip. Not suitable for those afraid of heights and there is some scrambling and climbing over some routes. Great view - take a picnic. It's isolated on the way up so take care not to go alone.
good view. Situated on one side of table mountain it is a famous peak .We really ,however ,had to strain to figure a lion's head .It looks good and provides a reference point.

Well worth doing. Perhaps a better alternative to Table Mountain??. I have climbed table mountain several times before but I think the view form Lion's Head tops it, as you have the view of the city and the mountain. Also, I thought it was a bit more challenging, which I prefer.

A "must do" in Cape Town. Climbed this last year with my children last year, what an experience! It's worth going right up to the top, the viwes are amazing and the feeling exhalarating! On your way up, you will see more proteas than you have ever seen in your life.absolutely beautiful..

Breathtaking (literally). From the moment we arrived in Cape Town we had agreed to do this hike equipped with a bottle of wine and watch the sunrise from the peak just as the locals do. It took us to our very last night to finally set off equipped with water, wine and torches to do the hike as we wanted it to be a perfectly clear evening. Now let me say we're probably not the fittest bunch of people and the hike was definitely not what i'd class an 'easy' one but if you go to the gym more than once a week you'd probably think that it was. I'm not a massive fan of heights and as we came to the top and realised there were ladders and chains etc I started to freak out a bit. The view made the hard work worth it though , it was one of those 'woahhhhhh' moments I'll never forget and was the perfect way to end our 6 week trip, what a glorious sunset.
Amazing mt.. To see people actually hiking on this Mt. Was unbelievable. It does look like a lion head from a certain angle at the bottom.
awesome hike. go up early and possibly not on the weekend when is crowded with hiker of sll the sizes snd skill.go up the chains the are good fun.

Majestic LIons Head. You cannot miss LIons Head from anywhere in Cape Town but getting up close is even better. We had the opportunity to view the sun set from there and it was a spectacular view watching the sun set over the ocean. Excellent to visit pack your picnic basket you will not be sorry.

Walk around Lion's Head. Lion's Head has a beautiful walk with amazingly scenic views over the city of Cape Town, the V and A Waterfront, and out to sea, towards Robbed Island. It can be done in an hour or longer, if you stop for breaks. There is a ring road around the head which is an easy walk, and it is a good bit opportunity to get the circulation going, enjoy the views and the fresh air. There are chains at one point to help you up the steeper part, so some level of fitness is required.

Challenging but worth it!. Such a great hike up and down, but very busy, so go early in the morning. It gets bogged down with waiting at the ladders, chains, and via ferrata steps, so you'll get your chance to rest there! Worth it getting to the top though, such a great view overlooking the ocean.

Magnificent Hike. HIKE AGAIN: Yes, this was a fabulous hike, not too difficult for someone who hikes regularly, with outstanding vistas. I chose to go up the cables/staples, which was pretty easy but then came down the path. Lots of people hike this and I was surprised to see about 20 teenage girls on top, as well as children and older people. Good hike for anyone who enjoys hiking. It looks more daunting then it really is.
Best ever. Be sure to head up here for sunset, and take a torch for the way back down, makes for a thrilling short hike to get great views over the city!
Tough hike. It's a nice walk / hike if you have time. Best not on a weekend , can get really crowded and many people are not trail wise

it took me 10 years to walk up there. I have to admit that I've been living in Cape Town for over 10 years before I did the hike that everybody is talking about. But now I'm hooked and I can't wait to go up again. But next time I'll take 2 bottles of water and I'll try to avoid a hot day. Even if you start early you should be prepared for the heat since a hike takes between 1,5 and 2 hours.
Kind of dangerous but it's WORTH IT.. I went there with my boyfriend and a few friends of ours. It wasn't easy to get to the top, but the view really worth the sacrifice. 100% recommended.

Astonishing view. A fantastic track up the mountain of Lion¨s Head.We could´t imagine the incredible view when reading the top. Below we could see the whole Cape Town area, the beaches of Clifton and Camps Bay.And the two hour walk was excellent training.Do it - you will like it.

Worth the hike. Well, it isn't a simple hike but it's also not Everest. Just make sure to take a liter of water and a few breaks on the way up. I would not do it if it is windy. There are a few narrow spots that could get dicey. But once on top (on a clear day) it is an amazing view. You want to make sure to come down by 6 or so otherwise the sunset could make the descent tricky. If you are short on time or not in good shape, you can still have amazing views without going all the way to the top.

It's best to hike. Absolutely worth it. The only way to fully appreciate the panoramic views that you get from Lions Head is to make the +- 1 hour hike (depending on fitness levels). It's completely doable though and I would highly recommend it.The best time to go is an hour or so before sunset that way you can get the best views and pictures from the top.Cape Town at its best. Free and beautiful.
Hike. Absolutely spectacular views, the walk is safe and well sign posted. there were grannies, kids, dogs all having a fab morning out.
Lion's Head. It is situated between the Signal hill and table mountain.The mountain looks like a Lion's head.We can go for a hike as well.The view is great during summers as the sky is clear.
Another Amazing place to visit when in Cape Town. well worth the time to do this one it was not on my list until I arrived in Cape Town and yes go and it amzing views of a stuuning place
