Make the time to walk up it. It's a good hike, intermediate especially if it's a hot day. Worth the effort though as the views of Camps Bay, the City of Cape Town and of Table Mountain are just breathtaking.

great view. nice drive up the mountain form the view point you can see the whole cape town and then also find the trekking paths to climb lions head, an enjoyable hike though can be a tad tough, for all fitness levels most of it but can get a bit hard closer to the top

Great and accessible outdoor fun. This hike up Lions Head, which lies adjacent to Table Mountain provides spectacular views of Table Mountain itself, Camps Bay, the City Centre and parts of the Cape Flats. It is picturesque and well worth the effort of getting to the top. As hikes go, it is a walk straight up. Do not be fooled by the fact that many people casually approach this hike and make it up and back down. To enjoy it a moderate fitness level is required because it is a walk up from the start with no flat parts and a return via the same path. The hike is not technical but there are many places requiring extended climbing over rocks that form a part of the path. For those that are afraid of heights, please note that there are three sections requiring climbing up on ladders afixed to the face of the mountain with one climb utilising steel hand and foot hold and chains to climb. At this point of the climb requiring the use of chains, there is an alternative route that is marginally longer that requires no climbing. The two ladder climbs however, cannot be avoided.There are also parts of the hike where the path is about 2 meters wide, with a steep drop off on one side. If you go off the edge, prospects for survival is marginal. About two days after I last hiked Lions Head, a hiker unfortunately fell to his death. I donot mention this to scare you off the hike as its is a wonderful one with many kids as young as 8 years old easily making it to the top. I mention this simply so that you come prepared and donot treat this as a walk in the part. Under estimating it or not respecting it could get you hurt. Please enjoy this hike responsibly.
Awesome Experience. Best to go before 7am as the mountain gets super busy.Comfortable shoes are a must and it is a mountain so people must be careful.
An Amazing fitting title, LION's Head. as one drives around the mountain it is amazing how u actually can identify with the shape of the lion, even the view from Table Mountain

Super Easy but Fun.. Fun, easy, two hour up-and-down hike with beautiful views (3 if you hang out at the top). The path is fairly boring most of the way up, but once you start getting towards the top it gets fun (especially if you take the alternate route where you have to climb up chains. There is not sign, but it's off to the right when walking up the main path). The climb towards the end and view from the top of Table Mountain, Cape Town, and the ocean on each side is what makes this worth it. A definite must if you are in Cape Town.

A must when in Cape Town!. Despite a pretty long walk/climb with some fairly troublesome passages, you really need to experience this. Me and my family are not climbers but it felt fantastic to reach the top and the view is absolutely stunning from the top!

Awesome Photo Op, and Tough Hike. The Lions head is about 2/3rds as high as table mountain so its a much eaier hike. Towards the top there is some real rock climbing that makes it an interesting and exciting hike.Once you are up there the photo opportunity is great. There are two rocks that stick out over the edge of the drop off and you can stand on the edge with the city in the background and take an amazing picture.Definitely worth the walk. Also do it before 8am to get the best of the day. It can be hot at midday.

Excellent views, don't underestimate the hike. Lion's Head offers excellent views over Capetown and the beaches. If you are a good hiker, you will do it in 45 minutes to one hour. However, don't underestimate the hike. It is exposed in parts, and you will need your hands and suitable shoes to do the hike. On one part of the path, there are climbing aids installed. It seems there is a second path up, which is easier, but I didn't use it myself. Bring water & sun protection.

Worth the effort, but take care. We loved our early morning hike up the Lion's Head. It was rather more challenging than we had expected, so some caution is needed. We are experience hikers so we had 1,5 liters each of drinking water with us and good hiking shoes. But we saw lots of people with flip flops, carrying no water and they were struggling in the heat, this is dangerous! It is very step near the top, with some almost vertical scrambling required. It takes around 1 hour to get to the top if you are fit. We recommend that you start early, at least 6AM to avoid the intense heat and huge crowds later in the day.At the top you are rewarded with a magnificent view!

Spectacular. Where else in the world can you walk up a steep hill in the middle of a wonderful city and get 360 dramatic views? You can in Edinburgh but, as much as I love that city, it doesn't compare to Cape Town. The walk: just be warned that it is very steep in places. If you are injured or have vertigo you are going to struggle. It took us 75 minutes to get up and the view is sensational. There are chains 3/4 of the way up but you can walk a longer way round. The very top has some precarious steps but you'll be fine. Allow time to sit on the top and hang out. Take some crazy dramatic photos. Soak it in. Check out Camps Bay, 12 apostles, Table Mountain, the new soccer stadium, etc. Fantastic.

Great views, but crowded. A steep but relatively easy walk, save the ladders and scrambles near the top, but the narrow path can get very crowded at peak times, and there is no safe "overtaking". Once at the top, superb views.

Slow and steady. Lion's Head is one of the most beautiful hikes around Table Mountain, but it is not trivial and some care should be taken, particularly in parts that are exposed and rocky. Falls have claimed the lives of many people on this walk, but by being careful and not taking chances you'll be fine. If you're not terribly fit, then take advantage of the few shady spots along the route to take a breather and check out the view. Take at least 1.5 - 2 litres of water, something warm (just in case) and snacks to keep your strength up. There is a lot of clambering up and over rocky slopes nearer the top, but nothing too difficult. All in all, a very rewarding climb and amazing 360 degree views at the top.

Fun, but harder than expected. Enjoyed a lot climbing to the top of Lions head, but the climb is steep at times and for some reason the climb has the reputation of being easy, but it is anything but. Also very narrow paths at various points with cliffs on either side mean that it is not the safest, especially during peak season. Enjoyable, but be prepared.

Not for the faint hearted!. A challenging hike up what looks like a pushover! You need to be in relatively good shape to summit this one, and it'll take 1 - 2 hours, depending on the shape you're in! You should start early as it get's very hot in summer and really busy too. If you're up to it, take a picnic and beat the sunrise! Wow, well worth it! Don't forget to take a small backpack with a sweatshirt or light jacket and +- 1.5 litres of water.Enjoy, have fun and take care!

Magnificent views of beautiful Cape Town. Lion's head is an ideal hike for the whole family, including dogs on leads. Start early because it gets very hot and busy. There are a number of routes, my favourite being starting at the SAN Trail sign half way up Kloof road. The path wends its way up the southern side of Lions Head, with world class views of Camps Bay, Clifton and Sea Point. As you come over the summit of signal hill, the City bowl and Table mountain are before you. At this point you can choose between contouring back to the start of the jeep track, and walking back to your car, or taking a right turn up quite a steep path to the top of Lion's Head. The short walk will take about 1 to 1 1/2 hours and the longer hike 2 - 3 hrs. Enjoy!

Number One. If you come to Cape Town this should be number one on your list - best time to go is full moon... But it's also the busiest time... If the crowds get too much on a moonlit night veer off onto the lower path and see just as much (with a little less effort)

Great way to spend the day!. So if u love the outdoors, this is a fantastic way to spend the day with the whole family. It's best to start ur hike either early in the morning or late afternoon so u don't suffer in the midday sun, which can get pretty darn hot in Summer.Pack some snacks and drinks for when u get to the top. And enjoy the splendid unspoilt view of The MotherCity.Tip: steer clear on windy days.

Sunset. I took a guided tour (meeting point the office of the Big Red Hop-on Hop-off Buses) to make the top of Lion Head for the sunset. I have to admit that I only made it 3/4 to the summit but had a beautiful sunset nevertheless. If you are not pretty well in shape, set off earlier and give yourself 2 to 2 1/2 hours for the hike to the summit and wear shoes with a good profile. It was fun .....
Sunset = Perfect. Take the night tour to singal hill, from where you have a great view on the lions head, and with nice weather you will have the best sunset ever!!

Worth the hike!. There is nothing better than starting the day with an early morning hike in one of the most beautiful places in the world. As we ascended the trail, we were fortunate enough to have a breathtaking view of Cape Town, seeing as it was a clear day! Good for moderate to advanced fitness levels. Though the trail becomes quite busy as the day progresses, it is still advisable to walk with a partner seeing as multiple accidents have been reported in the past. Look out for trail-runners, as they will become somewhat impatient with you if you get in their way. :) Also remember to hydrate as the temperature rises after 8 am in the summer.
Nice walk.. A lovely walk around the head and not difficult at all. Great for kids over 8 yes and the elderly if they have their legs a about them.

Holiday exercise with a view. a must to do in cape town , we started up around 10:30 in the morning and it was still partially in cloud. By the time we reached the top it was prime viewing across the whole of the area. We walked a steady pace and took our time 1hr. You can choose to climb ladders and scale up with holds in the rock (this cuts 15 min off) or walk up the path. My husband suffer from vertigo and he managed the last bit ok. A must for people visiting!
Take a hike!!. If you don't want to hike Table Mountain, Lions Head is a decent alternative. It's a good way to get exercise but I wouldn't recommend it for those not in great shape.

very beautiful. this mountain is a little underrated because it is beside the more popular table mountain. i climbed both and would defenetly say lions head has a nicer view from the top. the views are fairly similar but here you get to see table mountain as well in all its glory. it is an enjoyable hike with photographic scenery the entire way up and is the best sunset view i have ever witnessed. table mountain itself is much more beautiful but again, you get an amazing view of it ontop of lions head as well as all of cape town. highlight of a 7 weak stay!

Breath-taking views. If the cable car to Table Mountain is closed (and it often is due to windy weather) you should climb Lions Head. Relatively easy going for those of reasonable fitness ….. until you get to the very top - when some serious scrambling is required.The beauty of doing this instead of Table Mountain - is that you get to SEE Table Mountain !! Great photo opportunities. Arrive there early - as in 6.30 am (avoids heat, crowds and difficult parking)

Hiked to the top on Christmas Day! Fun hike, great view. My husband had done the hike before and raved about it, so we trudged up to Lion's Head on Christmas morning (not sure what else there was to do) in the fog to hike to the top. This is not for someone who is not in good shape as there were several difficult, steep climbs requiring use of chains and metal steps drilled into rocks. It was challenging but very fun. My sons (20 and 17) were grumbling at the beginning but as it got more challenging they became more interested. When they got to the top, they were very happy they had done it. At the top the fog was still with us so no view, but I have seen photos of the beautiful view so it is well worth it. You can go and hike just a little ways up and still see a nice view of Camp's Bay, so a group could go and split up. When you look at Lion's Head, it is hard to believe you can hike to the top, but you can, and it is well worth it. It took us about an hour to get to the top - faster coming down.

go REALLY early in the morning. a great hike, start really early as it gets hotter as the day progresses. Don't go alone as even tho it is an easy hike, there have been random accidents. This is easier than climbing Platteklip Gorge on Table Mountain, but still needs some level of fitness. And if you are scared of heights, be warned...there are a few areas with chains and steel ladders.

Lovely walk. Lovely walk with family members good exercise for a couple of hours superb vew of Cape city feom the top . I was surprised that I didn't see any presence of any officials/ rangers during my walk there..Just in case if there is any need for help
great view. Lion's head has great views, and is just challenging enough to be rewarding. It was great exercise with free parking and conveniently close to town.

Best hike for beginners . My boyfriend and I decided to hike up lions head . We don't hike ever and it was surprisingly enjoyable . Beautiful views everywhere . It's safe but be careful as there are tricky parts on the mountain but there is guidance such as chains or fixed steps to help you along the way. Take lots of water.Be careful of snakes :) definitely will be doing this again and again

A must in capetown. I don't understand why this is not top 5. For someone who loves to walk and have an average physical condition this is a must do. Do not underestimate the climb as most books rate this as easy. In Belgium this would be rated difficult. First stage is steep dirt road, then steps and the last part is some nice free rock climbing. Not too difficult, the most spectacular rock climing I ever did.Come early because this is a VERY busy climb. Some places are narrow and waiting times can be 5-15 minutes...The view is just fabulous.Bring your own water, there is nothing at the top.Take decent walking shoes

Spectacular hike. We enjoyed a spectacular hike around Lions Head. We took a taxi to the trail head, and hiked most of the way up. We did the circular hike, enjoying view of both city and ocean. Views were spectacular. We saw the paraglider - looked amazing! We did not manage to hike all the way to top but understand it would take about 4 hours.

A Hiking mountain. Lion Head hill is a hill that can be seen from any corner of Cape Town. One can easily reach the base of the hill by a car; this gives you stupendous views of Cape Town. The more athletic can consider a hike up the mountain-it can take an average of 45 mins of walk. Carry a bottle of water and sunglasses and a cap. If you stretch your imagination the hill looks like the head of a lion from certain angles.

Worth the steep walk. The views from Lion's Head are stunning. It is a one hour walk with some steep parts assisted by chains and ladders fixed to the rocks. Many locals call this the best view of Cape Town and I see why. Not to be missed.

Stunning view. We started at 7:30 am on 27 Dec and we wouldn't have wanted to start any later - it would have been too hot and crowded. As it was, it was very crowded but with a few exceptions most people were patient at the chains and ladders where you had to wait for people going in a different direction. You get stunning views all the way around and it is an achievement to make it to the top, especially if you go at a busy time. Going down is more difficult, watch you don't slip on rocks covered with coarse sand like I did! Easy for anyone with moderate fitness.

Most beautiful view of Cape Town. tou have to do this activity early in the morning for different reasons. - parking and the heat. The walk starts with a steep walk on a gravel road and turn into a narrow walk path and eventually turn into climbing rocks. You have a choice of the longer way which is easier or the one where you have chains to pull you up. Seeing that I had a back operation last year having a device and 6 screws in my back we opt for the longer way. Reaching the top felt like a great achievement and you have the most beautiful view you can wish for. You walk around the mountain and have the view from all sides. I would love to do it agIn!!

TAMING THE LION.... Early morning hike up Lion's Head was indeed a rejuvenating experience! 'On top of the World' is the feeling one has. With a 360 degree uninterrupted view of Cape Town and the surrounding ocean and mountains in all its splendour - also Robben Island in full view! What a wonderful way to start the day! Took our breakfast in our backpacks and enjoyed it at the top!
A nice little trek. Took just over an hour, some 'difficult' parts perhaps for less experienced hikers but can be done by basically everyone. A must do. I suggest going for either sunrise or sunset.
Take plenty of water!. This took us 1 hour 30 to get up to the top and we took the short route, it was about 30 degrees that day. But was totally worth it when you get to the top.

Fantastic walk. A great walk especially at sunset. Safe places to park by the road before the footpath. Easy to follow footpath. Takes about 1-2 hours to walk up. Best views ever, as good as table mountain & 360 degrees views.

Perfect hike. If you want a half day out, try Lions Head. Approximately 1 hour hike to the top in quite a spectacular (and sometimes steep!) scenery. You're rewarded with a breathtaking 360 degrees view of Cape Town and its surroundings - like Robben Island, Seapoint, Table Mountain and Camps Bay. And of course the city itself.
Stunning. Just as magnificent as table mountain. A fair hike up, but well worth it. Superb views of table mountain and the city. Good for sunrise and sunset.
Great climb :). A moderately tough walk/climb with the most breathtaking (and worth it) view! A must do! Early morning or at sunset to see the city at its best...

Away from the crouds. It is really a good option to visit the Lions head instead waiting in a long qeue to go to the table mountain. The view is perfect all around and even better as you have a very nice view to the table mountain

The view from the top is worth the climb. While the climb could prove difficult for anyone who isn't a veteran hiker/climber, from the top you get a panoramic view of Table mountain, Camps Bay, Clifton all the way to the city of Cape Town. Can get busy at times, but well worth it for the view. Take water with you and a flash light if you'll descend during the dark. DO NOT go up if windy, it's dangerous enough in nice weather.

Best view in Cape Town. We regularly do this walk and it's fantastic . It's always best to get there early , by 8 at least because Amy later and it's vey crowded parking wise and too hot to walk . You must take water and it's not for the unfit or those afraid of heights . Not ideal for children under 13 either unless they are fit and accompanied . But you can also just walk up to where the para gliders jump from and get a stunning view of Camps Bay and Clifton and Table Mountain . The other popular time to walk is sunset or at full moon .

Very nice. Lion's Head is a lot easier then Table Mountain - it's like an hour in and 40 minuites out. From the top, where you can easiliy spend some time with a drink or a picknick, you have a 360 view over the city. This is different to the Table Mountain, where you can only see one side at a time. It is indeed better to not go alone, but in the season there are a lot of people by day. You can easily join them and you won't get lost.

Be prepared. I have been coming to CapeTown for 16 years and for some bizarre reason never thought of doing the Head. Until about three weeks ago. I'd highly recommend it (the views are super both on the way up and at the top particularly, and well worth the effort). But don't be fooled. It's not for the feint hearted or the unfit. Without stating the obvious it's all uphill! Meanderingly at the start but steep enough as you get higher. There are a few bits that are hairy but in those locations there are ladders/ropes. Most people in average shape can do it with a reasonable amount of effort….we are a family of 4, with an 8 and 12 year and we all did it, so that's good perspective. Like any activity in SA, bring a rucksack with water (carrying a bottle is a pain because you need your hands in several locations) and wear a hat and sunscreen. A proper pair of sturdy runners/boots are in order also….no flip-flops. Totally different experience to Table Mountain but it's much more satisfying and certainly not as crowded! 8/10

Challenging but worthwhile climb. No charge to challenge yourself. Enjoyable to walk only three quarters of the way even if you don't fancy the more challenging bits. To not attempt if you don't like heights. Lovely views.

Breathe taking. This magnificent hike was breathe taking literally and figuratively. The panoramic views walking up the mountain is fantastic. Everyone visiting or living in Cape Town should at least do this hike once in their lives.
Amazing place for sunset. This is one of the best place to watch the sunset in Cape Town. You will truly love the view. Get your hiking shoes on as it takes approximately 45 minutes to climb to top.
Great view.. Wasn't a hard hike as we though. But the last part was difficult. Which was les or more an hour climb. Don't recommend to climb solo.

Beautiful. We climbed Table Mountain on a Tuesday and Lions Head on the next day. They are very different walks with Lions Head being an easy stroll until the last 15 minutes when it becomes quite hard work. Getting to the top is definitely worth the effort because the views are staggering, especially the views of the clouds rolling over the top of Table Mountain - breathtaking. The Lions Head walk is easier than walking up Table Mountain but there is much less camaraderie amounts walkers than on Table Mountain, and queues develop at the ladders and chain sections.However, it is simply a must for visitors to Cape Town.
great view. climb and walk up to the summit in an hour but its tricky in spots and avoid the ladders if you don't like hanging off of the cliff
healthy hike. a great walk which will afford a 360 view of the city. be aware that the last few metres are accesses by chain ladders, again for safety best not to go alone
Wonderful!. The Lion's Head trip is another must-do while in lovely Cape Town. Views are stunning and on a clear day, it is simply beautiful. Recommended!

Evening climb is quite the adventure. Just before sunset we started our hike for the top of Lionshead. The sunset was just fantastic over the ocean. As it gets darker the ascend becomes little more challenging. But once on top, the night view of Cape Town is stunning! If you love hiking parted with a bit of a danger aspect and excellent views, then this is definitely recommended. A good idea to take a headlamp with you. I forgot mine, that may be where the fear factor came in.

Dress appropriately!. I would say this should be on your must-do list when visiting or living in Cape Town. The exercise gained and the views all along the way are worth the not so difficult climb. However, we have noticed many people starting out on the walk wearing street clothes - it is a mountain so proper shoes, sunscreen etc should be a necessity.

Fairly easy walk, great views. 45 minute walk to top from parking on Signal Hill Road - excellent views to effort ratio. Easy going most of the way, with ladders or chains taking you up a steep section near the top. 360 degree views of Table Mountain, Cape Town city bowl and the Twelve Apostles. A great sundowner walk!

Great free mountain climbing/hiking activity. I regularly run up Lion's Head. In my opinion it is one of the most visited sites in Cape Town, always busy with tourists and locals alike.(with good reason)It is a GREAT hike/run for anyone of reasonable fitness.It is STEEP.You have to set aside about 2 hrs if you hike and take in the views and about 1 hr if you run, and turn around at the top, not taking in the scenery.You are rewarded with GREAT views.There are also many great trad climbing routes on Lion's Head (granite and sandstone) and there is a good climbing guidebook available at most Cape Town climbing shops.As I said, it is always busy, so if you want to have less people, go very very early in the morning.The route splits at just over halfway, with an easy option (slightly longer), or an option where you ascend a small rock face with the help of steel clips and chains bolted into the rock. Most accidents happen at the chains so if you are not sure/confident using the chains, rather go around and take the easier route.There is no water or toilets on Lion's Head.The views from the top are spectacular, looking out over Table Mountain, Campsbay, the ocean and the city.A very popular activity is to pack a backpack and then picnic at the top. Please note that if you do this and stay until it gets dark, please take a headlamp to get down.Lastly, the main route up Lion's Head is the most used, but for the more adventurous, there are quite a few alternative and very rewarding routes to ascend Lion's Head.

Wonderful, quick, and beautiful hike. This 3-hour total hike at a leisurely pace is perfect. I've done it many times--with friends or alone--and always enjoy the 360 degree view and, of course, the sunset. It's beautiful and I highly, highly recommend it.

Imagineer. Was there. Heard it. Couldn't look like a lion to me. Wished there was more definition like the Spinx. Tried hard.Even changed glasses.  Kept thinking of the "Miracle at St Anna film's sleeping man. Now that, looked like a face. Surprising cause i am generally thought of as highly imaginative. Perhaps I will see it in the future. Grateful for the experience.

a good hike!. absolutely worthwhile, drive to the bottom of the hill, hike up. a minimum 2 hr round trip hike. best if you bring some refreshments because there's only a little hut at the bottom that sells water bottles! hiking boots, a hat are handy suggestions, although i didn't have any of that! you can also paraglide from here but you have to book in advance (which i did)

Get in shape!. I was in CT for a month so I vowed to hike Lion's head four times a week to improve my fitness, it worked!!! In the evening there are lotsa people at the top otherwise a great way to spend your days. You will be rewarded with great views as you hike.

Lions Head, Mountain in the City. One of the most rewarding hikes in the surrounding mountains of Cape Town. The views from the top of Lions Head is breathtaking. We started late afternoon to catch the full moon rising in the East. Absolutely stunning!Parking can be an issue if you start late!

Competitive. Sundays there are alot of traffic on Lion's Head. Men running past you without shirts. Dogs and kids, tourists and locals all atempting to get to the top. Halfway up you are thinking, why am I doing this. But when you are looking down on Cape Town at the end its totaly worth it. Be carefull when coming down. I almost fell a few times because my brother seems to think that its all a competition. I suggest leaving the men at home if you don't want to be up and down in a flash. Take water and snacks. Jacket on a colder day for the top. Sunscreen is a must. Leave fancy camaras at home. The best thing is: IT'S FREE.

Great afternoon hike. Great hike, reasonable workout and fantastic views! Some general uphill walking, followed by some rock scrambling, was all worth it when we got to the top and overlooked Cape Town.

A great hike and it's all free!. A very popular excersice spot with the locals... Who tend to compete with their own time to get up and down.This is such a great hike to do even with kids and your rewards once at the top are simply breathtaking views for ever and a day.Be sure to take your own water, this is a mountain after all! When you think the trail has ended ( because the footpath has ) that is not the end! Follow the locals and you will see you get to discover the raw part of the mountain! It is the end only when there is only sky all around you... After doing the last part with the help of the built in chains on the mountain - this is something totally unique to Cape Town, try go on a clear day.You can also paraglide off here, Whoooooohooooooo !

Beautiful walk but please be careful. This is a beautiful walk and when you reach the top you feel exhilarated. Make sure there are other people walking. Please don't do this alone. And definitely don't wear any jewellery or take any money, phones or cameras. There have been reports of muggings.

Spectacular Panoramic Views of Capetown. It will take the average person just over an hour of vigourous walking/climbing to reach the top of Lion's Head. You will not be dissapointed when you get there, rewarded with 360 degree panoramic view of the Mother City. Don't forget your camera, and a bottle of water/snacks. Not for young children, easy for teenagers.

Best view in Cape Town. Climbing Lions Head is a weekly event for me. It's a 2km trail that rises 350m from the car park. Near the top the path splits and you can choose to climb up some handholds and chains if you can handle heights. Otherwise stick to the path.The best thing about this walk is that it winds right around the mountain so the view keeps changing. And it's free. But note that a certain level of fitness is required. Please always take lots of water and cold weather gear just in case.

Breathtaking Views. Lion's head is a 3km hike which starts out on a gravel road. This section quickly gets your heart rate up and makes the start of this climb feel very tough. However things get rewarding son as you wrap around the mountain once and are presented with views of Camp's Bay, Table Mountain and Cape Town city bowl. During the climb there are a couple of spots where you have to make use of sturdy metal ladders. This brings you to a fork in the road where left takes you to a normal walk/hike and right takes you up a cliff face with chains and steps to make this route easier. The cliff face is not as daunting as it sounds but sometimes, because of the number of people on the mountain, it can be a bit of a wait.Take some water along and keep hydrated. Also if you are a smoker, try and keep it to a minimum and bring a container along for your ash and the buds as this is a national park.

A must visit for the sunset. This place needs to be visited for a sunset while you are in Cape Town. Bring your camera and take the most stunning pictures of Cape Town during the sunset and at night. It is a great place to have a picnic but be aware of your valuables in the car while you are away :-)

360 Views. This was a relatively quick climb with a fun, challenging last leg of the trail that has some ladders and chains to get you up the difficult parts. There is another (easier) route available that allows you to skip that ladder-and-chain section if it is not your forte. Once at the top you get a full 360 degree view of all of Cape Town, Table Mountain, The Ocean and all the surrounding beaches. There is quite a crowd that accumulates for sunsets, which is absolutely amazing if you have the opportunity. Just bring a headlamp or flashlight for the trip back down. The night's view of the city is also an amazing spectacle.

Great hike. We walked up the Lions Head in the morning. Quite demanding but rewarding. The hike is around 1 hour, sometimes quite steep and good shoes are recommended. The view is amazing over all Capetown, Tablemountain, Clifton Bay, 12 Apostels. Loved it.

Go for Sunset, but hurry back down!. Sunset from Lion's Head is just breath-taking. And you've GOT to go all the way to the top. But it does get a bit technical, and is not for anyone remotely afraid of heights. It took us about 45 minutes to get up, but we were racing the sun and I would have liked to go much slower to take photos - I'd give yourself an hour and a half. Also - you'll be coming down in the dark, so bring good flashlights, and leave the top as soon as the sun sets to make it past the chains & ladders before you lose the light.
Too busy. Lions Head is brilliant. The only drawback is that it got to popular. Even when one starts in the early mornings. Now we go somewhere else hiking.

Better walk then Table Top. The views from Lions head is so much better than table top. You get to see TT and the whole bay. It takes less time and has some fun ladders which were challenging for some older people. However you can walk around if you want to.

wonderful views all the way. This is a beautiful one hour hike each way. we went on a wonderfully clear day so our biggest dillema was whether to watch where we stepped or keep looking at the views.It is a little steep - or even very steep near the top , but for people reasonably fit , this should not be a problem. Be sure to take water and wear good walking shoes. would not miss this walk on a trip to Cape town!

360 View of Cape Town. This is by far the best hike in Cape Town. For those who are looking to get fit, start hiking or just want to take a walk somewhere different. Walk around the chains going up and come down the chains coming down. For those who like to pass others on the trail just let the slower people walking ahead know which side your coming up to pass on. For those slower walkers in groups remember to stick to the side so you don't create a jam for those who are going faster. It can be a risky hike for those who don't pay attention. A fit person it will take you about 35 mins to climb up and run down. I think the record is 25 minutes up and down running. The moon light walk is a lovely walk - it is an organised experienced. Take up some tea and rusks, or coke and biltong for the top. It is worth sitting down an appreciating the 360 degree view around Cape Town with Table Mountain on the one side. A Camera is a definite. Have fun!!!
Nice views. We wenta after finding the cable car up ™ closed. Good viewing spot and fun to watch the para gliders if operating.
Best hike in cape town. I went for the sunset and it was beautiful takes about 45 mins to get to the top. I would recommend bringing a flashlight [or torch] on the way down. It gets so dark!

What a view, what a hike!!!. If you are in Cape Town and looking for action and little adrenaline boost you should definitely try to go up to lion's head. It is at your own risk though. It is almost like hard work ends with amazing reward at the end. Climbing up can take a hour if you're not fit enough. Watch out for trial runners. . Whole experience is just an amazing. ....
Beautiful. Standing alongside the mighty table mountain and 12 apostles the lions head is a beauty and adds to the magnificence of the whole area of Cape Town. Provides great views of Robben Island.

Great 45-min climb with super-views. Fairly easy 45min-1hr climb to the top from the parking, with a great view as reward. Try to time before sunrise so you walk up in dawn and can have breakfast at the top while sun rises over Cape Town. Last bit involves some climbing on chains and steps, but it's still not really hard. Do go in a group or at least two/three as muggings do occur now and then to people hiking alone.

Almost better than table mountain. The view from the top is great, stunning view of the mountain and real panoramic view of the city. Climb (more of a walk...) takes just over an hour for most, but can be done quicker. You feel you've earned the stunning views! Only tip, leave early when its warm...gets hot up there!

I did pat the Lion's Head. First day in Cape Town, and what a way to celebrate it. With a hike to Lion's Head.It's a fun short hike for travel adventurers. t gets tricky and demanding at places. But an average hiker can do it without any trouble.Lovely for a weekend walk for residents. Or a morning walk for tourists.
Spectacular Hike. We hiked to the top and it was one of the highlights of our trip! The views were breathtaking. The hike was a little bit difficult but worth the effort.

A lower view than that from table Mountain. The advantage of the view from Lions head is that you can drive right to the top. The views of Cape Town are still good, and actually of greater detail as you are not quite as high as from Table Mountain. The weather needs to be clear, otherwise, like the view from Table Mountain, you will be in cloud.Walk about 400 metres down the road for other views.

Perfect to watch the sunset. We hiked up Lion's Head twice - once in the middle of the day and once right before sunset. The view is spectacular. The hike itself isn't easy, but only takes about 50 minutes. Getting to the top was 100% worth the hike. You get a perfect view of the coast and of Table Mountain right nearby. Towards the end of the day and when it gets cloudy, it can get a bit cold at the top.
Great view. Easy hike, beautiful view. Great fun with friends or family or even a romantic moonlight walk. It does not cost a thing and its a great workout.

Get the sunset view. Went up Tschüss Lions Head at 5pm to get to the top while sunset.First is a easy path to follow then it changes into climbing and hiking. It took us about 1,2 hours but we made lots of breaks to enjoy the vierw so I guss you'd get up within 50 minutes to 1 hour depening on the fitness level.So when we were up it's a beautiful view over Capetwon, table mountain, 12 apostels and the bay. Even a better view than frok table mountain!When the sun touched the ocean we decided to back down to the easier path. We had headlights with us (take them!!!) but we didn't wanted to climb down in the darkness.Even from a lower level the rest of the sunset was awesome. I recommend it to everyone. If you fitness level is not that good stay at the lower level. You still have a good view over the bay and you can enjoy the sunset.I'd do it againCheersPs: we get there and back with a taxi. Was about 100ZAR in total
A little scary but so worth it !. My kids made me do it and I was glad I did it! A little scary if you're afraid of heights but a great hike and amazing view of the city!

lawtev62:wonderful mountain. I walked up the mountain lion's head in Cape Town Central, South Africa in May 2013. It is wonderful to see what the Lord has done.You have to walk up, reach the top and see the wonderful view of Cape town.From the mountain , you will descend into Camps Bay , just one of the popular Atlantic seaboard beaches.The walk takes about 90 minutes.You will enjot it;

Tough but stunning.... Lions head is as iconic a hike as any around the world - Every picture of Cape Town includes Lion's Head! Stunning views of Table Mountain, Robben Island, the Atlantic Ocean and the city bowl await those take on this little challenge.Note that this not for the faint hearted as there is a short section that involves ladders and chains and there is no water on route which can get very hot in summer. Be prepared. The hike from Signal hill road is pretty much uphill for an hour. Enjoy!

Worth the effort!. Experiencing the sun rise over Cape Town from atop Lion's Head is a sight to remember. Find out the time of sunrise and begin your hike early so that you don't miss it. Take a picnic and relax up top !

Amazing views. The walk up Lions Head is for moderatly fit people. Wear good hiking shoes. I am afraid of heights but I am glad I braved it. Perhaps luck was on my side on the morning we went up it was very cloudy so I could not look down. It is more of a climb than a walk and I found the walk to the base of the head more tiring than climbing Lion's Head. It does get busy and there are some fitness fanatics who run up so just be aware so you don't get pushed over. There are chains to climb up the head, but we took the longer route as I did not want to climb the chains. Once at the top - it was all worth it. The clouds lifted a bit so we could enjoy the scenary below. I am not brave enough to do the full moon hike, maybe some other time. The walk is free so that is great.

Lion's Head Short & Sweet. Great rewarding hike, was perfect even with a limited time to see and get out and do things. Very beautiful, something to add to your list. Plus you will see a lot of locals doing their daily workout on the way up and down.
Breath-taking views galore. The view from Lion's Head is breath-taking and super awesome. It is a nice hike up to the top of Lion's Head.

A full moon hike up Lion's Head. SanParks try very hard to keep the paths up this mountain in good condition. They also regularly patrol this area with their Safety Mountain patrol and dogs. I regularly do the full moon hike up Lion's Head. Start at about 17H00 and make your way to the top. Take warm gear to put on at the top and a light/torch for your walk down. Keep hydrated and perhaps something to snack on at the top. Wear good hiking shoes. See the lights of Cape Town come on as the sun sets over Camps Bay area and the moon rises in the East. A great fun thing to do when you have the time. Enjoy. Always check weather conditions as sometimes too windy.

Hike to the top of Cape Town - What a view!. We arrived at 8am to start hiking and the trail was already full of people. I didn't realise it was such a popular spot to hike. Took us under 2 hours to get to the top. Mostly walking, some climbing, not too difficult. You don't have to be super fit but wear sunscreen, hat, a large water bottle, sneaker with grip, not indoor sneakers and work out clothing that lets your skin breathe.The view up top is beautiful. Really worth the trek up. We had great weather with no clouds and not much wind. Going down took an hour and was easier. I'll do the climb again and wear shoes with grip.

Great views, hike & hang gliding.. The views from Lions Head are always a delight & it is well worth hiking all the way to the top. It takes about an hour from the car park. It only becomes a bit of a climb towards the end.
I've also been tandem hang gliding from Lions Head, that was the greatest thrill of my life.
A must do in Cape Town!. Easy walking up to the most spectacular views of Cape Town! Take a picnic and revel in the views above! Definitely worth going up Lions Head and only takes a few hours.

Lion's Head - Best for a Full Moon Hike. I've been up Lion's Head a few times. It can definitely be windy and the top is much much colder than street level - bring layers.Lion's Head is best (in my opinion) for a full moon hike. Start hiking with the crowds an hour before sunset. Grab a spot and watch the sunset over Cape Town and linger for the moon to rise. When the moon is high enough, it will light your path to return down, though headlamps/torches are encouraged.Note: If you are scared of heights, there are a few passes, that especially when crowded are intense and you are close to an edge. You may want to not go or limit how high you go up.

Sunset hike. Seeing the sunset on this mountain was amazing. The hike was very mild and only had one slightly difficult portion was at the end. Drinking wine and watching the sunset was a moment I won't forget

Glorious. If you enjoy fresh air, physical activity and fantastic views you should consider climbing lions head. It is not high is physical demand so do not worry about huffing and puffing. I would advise you go in the afternoon as it does get busy during the day with a bit tourists. It's safe and and an enjoyable experience.
Amazing view . I went there with my Dad and It took an hour to reach the highest point but it was definitly worth it because the view is breathless!
gentle hike with excelient views. Well worth a walk up to see table mountain and the spread of cape town in all its glory. Plenty of places to park.
Great View. Loved the view, needed more parking but it is a must see as it is quick and easy and free. A bit of walking is required to see the entire city from here, but its easy.

Great Hike!. The line for Table Mt. was longer than we liked so the Lion's Head was next on the list on our second day in Capetown. . Spectacular views of Robben Island, Table Mt., Capetown all the way up and down. The Chain Route was fun, but an easier route is available if you're not up for the chains.

A must do in Cape Town. One of the best things to do while in Cape Town. You get a 360 degrees of Cape Town and the Atlantic Seaboard. Take something warm to wear at the top and always take water. It is best to go early in the mornings or around 18:00.

Views to die for. What more could you want than a trip to this place. Great views you will take to the grave!!
Would put this on any trip's itinerary.

MUST DO - sunset walk. You haven't been to Cape Town if you haven't hiked Lion's Head. You haven't seen the city if you haven't hiked it later afternoon, watch the sunset from the top and hike down with the sea of city lights below your feet.And if you do, plan properly - wear the right shoes, take the right support (water, sunscreen) and off course a headlamp for the hike down!

Great Views. This is an easy hike that gives great views over the city and Robben Island. Be aware that it can get very hot in the height of summer and it is a good idea to start walking as early as possible. Make sure you take enough water!
watched the sunset. amazing views and a great spot to watch the sun go down... my daughter and her dad wandered up there to eat ice cream and chat. great memory.

Mountain with most rewards. allow yourself 2-3 hours out of your holiday to climb a small mountain and reap the rewards. Remember to always take a jacket (even in the middle of summer). Do not go without a liter of water (even in winter) Sunblock is a must (you are in Africa) and comfortable shoes (hospitals aren't a good place to spend time on in a holiday) Compared to other Hills and mountains in the area, this one is the easiest climb for the most rewards. Get prepared to wind your way on a circular path and be treated to all the views this city has to offer in one go. There is the city bowl. You get the ocean. Look for the 12 apostles. Throw in uninterrupted table mountain in all her glory. Just past the halfway mark you have the option of two paths. To the left the road keeps winding up. To the right it gets a bit technical with chains and a small ledge or two. The right is definitely the shorter route if you are up for a little adventure. Be careful of the slippery tree roots and before you know it you are at the top. Great for the best sunsets in the whole of Cape Town.

Relative easy hike, awesome views. If you are not from Cape Town, you have to go walk up this mountain. Awesome views. The hike on a normal pace takes about 45-60 from the bottom to the top. Try and get to the top about 15min before sunrise. Police also patrol the bottom of the path and there is security cameras on your way up. About 90% of the path can be walked and the rest is a bit of a climb. There is a easier route as well for the not so advanced hikers. To give you an idea: some locals go with the small dogs (Jack Russels) who is able to go almost to the top without much assistance. The trail up is almost alway busy so it is relatively safe.

A must visit. Wonderful views, popular to watch sunrise and sunset, both breathtaking. It is easy accessible, walk goes from easy bottom part to challenging top part. Not for people who are afraid of heights. Narrow path with a long drop both ways when approaching the top. Go prepared - it is a mountain although in the middle of the city.

very special. this is one of the worlds most amazing hikes.. not for the faint hearted but it rewards at every twist. Arriving at the pinnacle affords one of the most special views anywhere.. love it totally !
Wine and climb. Take a bottle of wine and watch the sunset. Easy long climb with the most amazing 360 degree views. Walked with Hubby, daughter and Bizou the dog.

Stunning view of cape town-worth the hike!. Lions head is great for a hike not just the experience but getting to see cape town from the top and a 360 degrees view as you hike around the mountain. Its good to go early at around 6am so you can catch the sunrise , the sunset is also lovely but it is much safer and advisable to go during the day. It gets cold up top so make sure you have a jacket!

The real pearl of Cape Town, Stunning views & a great place to hike. Lions head is the real unsung star of Cape Town, a much more stunning outlook than its more famous & glamorous neighbor Table mountain, wonderful hike, if your lucky you can see paragliding from about 1/4 way up, Pretty narrow ledges as you get close to the top, as others have said not for children or the frail. The views are breathtaking & you get the whole 360o as the track winds its way around

Great mountain for a 'small' hike. Lion's Head is (in my opinion) the best place for small hike. Hiked it 8 times now and the view is amazing and the hike itself is fun to do. I especially love the sunset/sunrise/full moon hikes on Lion's Head. Also really do-able for inexperienced hikers.

not easy to get to the top but worth it!!!. my wife and i climbed to the top on 09/23/14. it took 1 hour and 10 minutes to get to the top and 50 minutes to get down - we were moving at a pretty good pace. for novice climbers/hikers, allow more time. i'm not going to lie - the path is very narrow and dangerous toward the top. one bad fall or step, and you will tumble to your death. you get great views all the way around as you hike up and the view at the top is also stunning. just a fair warning - this is really not for children / families. it is a must for those looking for a challenge and adventure while in cape town.

Worth the Effort. My husband and I hiked Lion's Head on our last day in South Africa. The guide books and brochures said it would take 60 to 90 minutes to hike the top and back, but it took us three hours because we stopped to take so many pictures! Every corner afforded us a new, stunning view of Cape Town, Table Mountain and the ocean. Parts of the climb near the top were more challenging than expected. Definitely wear hiking attire, carry lots of water and pack a snack to enjoy at the top.

Incredible place!. A must do when visiting Cape Town. A beautiful national park for families, couples, runners, trekkers etc... With an amazing view of Cape Town, Table Mountain, the harbor and the coast. A bonus is to watch the sunset from this privileged spot on earth...
Wonderful 45 min walk with unsurpassed views. Great evening walk, not too strenuous.Exceptional sunset complemented by a bottle of cold Stellenbosch wine

Excellent hike, excellent views. The short hike is not for the infirm! There is some climbing involved and I would not recommend doing it on a wet day. However, it was magical. The flora was in full bloom and the views from the peak were not to be believed; table mountain, the sea, capetown. It had it all.

Harder that some people say. Takes about a hour for us to get up. First part is easy but a steady climb but the second half is not for the faint of heart. You have to scramble over rocks and a wrong step or slip could be fatal. Chain ropes and ladders helps in places but you should be cautious. Lot of younger climbers seemed to be part mountain goat but we are not spring chickens. Just trying to warn older travelers that the climb is not a walk in the park.

King of Cape Town. This is one of my beloved Capetonian nature spots... I enjoy the panoramic view to be seen from the various viewpoints of Lion's Head. This is a joyful activity to be appreciated from the young to the old... I have a warm place in my heart for the mountains of Cape Town, and Lion's Head whispers all the secrets of the precious Mother City while sharing her beauty and splendour with all members of the human race.A note of caution: It is safest to wear tekkies or sneakers when you mission up Lion's Head.Be sure to always take along enough water, sunscreen, eye protection, caps and/or hats, and a flashlight or headlamp in the event of dusk/evening climbing. Be cautious of other hikers- some people jog (or even run) the course to the peak of Lion's Head. It might sometimes seem as though these people are in a hurry, and that might be the case. I would just recommend that each person be considerate of the other people, grant others their speed and allow each other to walk/climb/hike safely up and down Lion's Head.

Worth while. A must when in Cape Town. Stunning view from the top, and safe to do alone or in a group. secure parking at the bottom for your car with car guards. The best view of table mountain and camps bay. The Entrance is free and the whole family can do it.

Full moon walk. When it is next full moon you should take a walk up Lion's head. walk up late afternoon and have a sun downers on top and then walk back down using the full moon to guide your steps. Life time experience and worth it. A Must for the Bucket list.
Amazing Trekking. soft trekking recommendable to all ages. Superb views. sunrise and sunset are the best time to do it!

Well worth the hike!!!. Get up early and hike up! Great way to start the day!There are two routes. The standard route will have more traffic. It starts from the first parking area. A bit further down (on the saddle of the lion) there is another path. Much quieter!It goes up the back part of the mountain and eventually joins the main path.A bit further on you will have an option to take the "short cut" using the chains. I would recommend to take that and come down with the longer route. Both are easy enough and both have it's own something special about it!!!TIP: It is just very important, when hiking in any of the Cape Mountains, take water with!!!If you forgot, the guard at the parking area does sometimes sell water.

Made it!. First i walked up Tablemountin, it took 2 hours to go up. I tought lion´s head would be easier but far from it. It was very hard do go up the last meters because you actually have to climb. It was worth it, i will never forget this amazing view!! it was full up there and everyone want to take a picture but keep calm and enjoy the view. AND than up again !!

Its another mountain. I don't know whether one would have a better review of this if one had climbed up it. It looks nothing like a lion to me and is just another mountain- there are far more dramatic examples to see else where in the region.

The View from the Top is worth all the Effort. I am not fit and found the last 200m tough. Take plenty of water and start early, especially in the summer months.The youngsters who run up make it all look so easy! Middle aged probably make it look difficult!It starts very easily but the end is tough and keeping your eyes down and concentration is essentialNot for those with no heads for heights. Certainly made me feel faint in a couple of places

great hike within the city. Such a convenient and very worthwhile hike within the city. Takes less than an hour to get to the top of Lion's Head and less time to get down. Really spectacular views of Table Mountain, Signal Hill, the city and the beach coastline. Such a good way to start the day. We brought our own little picnic and had it at the summit, then drove towards Signal Hill where we met our Paragliding guide.
Astonishing. The climb is not too hard, it can be done by almost everyone from children to adults. The view is just amazing. One of the "must go" places in Cape Town.
Views. Very interesting view of Capetown. If you have the time it is definitely worth the trek. The vistas of the city are quite interesting from this vantage point.
Well worth the walk. We went at sunset. All though it was a steep climb, the view at the top with the sun going down was well worth it.
Most beautiful hike and view. If you thought Table Mountain was beautiful, please make yourself a favour and climb on Lions Head as 360 Views and the road itself is magnificent!
Some climbing for excellent view. Made it up to see the sunset. It might get dark on the way down. Bring a torch when late. Narrow passes can result waiting when crowded.
A great morning walk. This is an incredible walk, easy to do in about 1.5 hours and boasts beautiful views of Cape Town, Robben Island and Table Mountain.

Amazing. Been there during my gap year and it was totally worth the visit. We walked up at around 7pm to watch the sunset which was one of the most beautiful i have ever seen. The hike is quite long and steep, so don't take to much stuff with you :) Normally quite crowded by tourists.

Must do. Lovely view and such and not too difficult to complete! The photos you will take will be amazing, usually nice and full and when there is a full moon it is for sure a MUST. Take some snack and some tea/coffee and enjoy the beautiful view.

My backyard is full of tourists!. Perhaps my review is a little jaded due to the fact that Signal Hill and Lions' Head nee Rump is situated in my "backyard" So to speak. Initially i loved making the short trip up the hill. But it has become more and more of a mission, (but only on weekends) due to the busloads of tourists. Not to be mistaken, i welcome tourists with open arms. But there has to be another sustainable solution to the traffic issue on the narrow road.It has to be said that regular visitors know of the secret "roofs" where one can just marvel in the view over the ocean and seapoint , mouille point and three anchor bay. Far from any tourbus, photographers or running children.It is an amazing experience. I guess I should just nut up a bit

Always a winner. Lion's Head is an easy hike near the city centre of Cape Town. What is nice is that the way up leads you all around the mountain. So while hiking you get to admire Camps Bay, Sea Point, Signal Hill, CBD and Table Mountain. It's the hike I've done the most in CT and am still enjoying it.

Glorious sunrises. Worth the hike!. Wake up at 4:30 to catch the sunrise in the summer time. It took about 1 hour to hike to the top. It can be a little taxing if you are out of shape but not a problem for those who are pretty active. Beautiful view of the ocean and cool to see the city at night. Great hike in Cape Town.

A challenging climb, but well worth it. It'a lovely walk up Lion's Head. The path starts quite easy as it winds round the hill, giving good views in all directions. The top of the path is more challenging, involving a bit of scrambling in places, but it's well worth it for the amazing views from the summit.

Nice walk, good views. ...that's all you need to know. Parking was easy, the path is very clear and it is easy walking - no need for specialist equipment. You can go a short way and still get great views of table mountain.
Beautiful. Try climbing it! Just kidding. I stayed directly in front of it, and watched the sun rise daily! I absolutely loved it!

Nothing to see. Well. I did not like it that much. Does not have anything there. It is just a place that you could see some of the Cape Town from up side. However, if you go to Table Mountain so do not lose your time here.
Lions Head. Breathtaking views from Signal Hill- Table Mountain - Cape Town City - The Cape Flats and False Bay as far as Robben Isle.

Fancy A Walk?. Always great to do this walk. Make sure you take water with you!The route goes right around Lions Head to the top. The views are great and once at the top you can catch your breath and take it the views of Table Mountain, The Twelve Apostels, Robben Island, the Atlantic Ocean and the CBD.There are certain sections of the walk where you have a choice to either climb holding onto chains or you can just walk around and you will still see the top. It really gets the heart pumping this one.
The best sunrise I´ve ever seen. Only the way up worth enough.You will have an wonderfull view over CPT and to the Tablemountain.I was 2 weeks and I went 8times to the top of the lions head
Beautiful views. Beautiful views of table top from here, nice little walk although there is no where to buy water so you need to go prepared.

an icon. seen from all over the peninsula this outcrop is tempting to climb. Initially it is an easy walk along the contour path but closer the summit there are two ladders and then a steep ascent. Join the locals on full moon nights for sundowners but remember the torch for your descent.

Possible even with kids!. Climbed with an 8 and 4 years old and they both made it to the top! Great outdoor activity if done under the sun.At some point you can choose 1 recommended way which we did for the kids to be able to continue to climb. Great afternoon!

Nice Hike Great pictures. Lion's Head starts out with a moderate incline on a dirt pathway and then get more of a rock path as you ascend. It took about an hour to get up there but locals say it's more like 1 hour 30 minutes to hike up. As you move up the mountain it gets steeper and there are big staple looking things and chains you use to climb. It's not hard but a little intimidating until you do it then it's no big deal. The pictures and views up there are incredible overlooking Cape Town and Table Mountain. The weather moved in while we were up there and it looked even better being above the clouds.It's a fun hike that I will never forget.
Spectacular. What a lovely walk at full moon. It really is beautiful. Just a pity about all the people with their head torches blinding you as you go. It is full moon after all.

Great view of the City. If you want a great view of Cape Town, then this is the place. It is settled almost in the centre of the city which mean you do not have to take a long drive to get there. I also sometimes run from my hotel up Lion's head - what a great run. Go with friends and enjoy the beauty of Cape Town from the top of Lion's head.

Accessible climb for most people, beautiful sunset as a reward. We arrived at the mountain an hour before sundown and made it to the top with about 20 minutes to spare. In July it was not very warm, and the wind made it pretty chilly, so bring a jacket. Also, if you go for sunset (do it!), it will definitely be dark on the way back, so bring a torch as well. We stayed on top until it was dark, and the views of the city at night were really nice. Better yet, the stars above were very beautiful - we watched the Milky Way, the Southern Cross and Scorpio all emerge during the walk down.

Gorgeous Hike. We took the cable car up Table Mountain and saved our hike for Lion's Head. We are really glad we scheduled time for this hike. It wasn't terrible hard, but was challenging enough to make it fun for our teenage kids. There are some steep areas but there are metal ladders attached that make it very doable. The view is spectacular.

Excellent hike-great views.. This is an excellent hike to do whilst in Cape Town. It takes about an hour to climb to the top and is not good for people who have knee problems or suffer with vertigo. The first section of the climb is a steep slope which is a path but as you get further up the climb gets a lot harder. You have to climb rocky sections and some parts are vertical which you need to use chains and foot holds to climb. Once at the top however the views are spectacular and well worth the climb. The best time to go is about 3pm so it is not as hot and you get to see the sunset. You will need to wear sensible footwear and take plenty of water and suncream. A good alternative if table mountain is closed.

Great Spot - Great View. This is definitely one of the best spots if you are seeking great views over Cape Town. Since the table mountain is frequently in clouds, the Lion's Head usually stays cloudless. It is not as high as table mountain, but definitely worth climbing. You should not have a fear of heights though, the climb is quite steep to the very top.
Beautiful drive. Stunning view over the city but apparently it is not safe to go there alone or in the evenings, but still worth it

Awesome morning trek!. Recommended as a morning exercise, with spectacular views. The shortcut is a bit challenging, so think twice before taking it. The long route is even more scenic. Also great in the evening, but brings some cider!
Best view. A panoramic view on the city of Cape Town as well as a perfect view on Table Mountain.Worth spending some time there

A Must Hike. Loved this walk and the views are stunning. This is not a really easy hike and there are some very steep parts on the edge of the cliff so you need to be careful on this one. Be careful with kids.

Great hike with iconic views. Climbing Lion's Head gives you the ideal viewpoint - high enough for panoramic views of the city but also superb views along the 12 Apostles and of Table Mountain itself. You can't get that from TM!It's a bit like New York - if you want the iconic view, go up the Rockefeller Centre rather than the Empire State. That way you can photograph the Empire State! Simples!

Spectacular Views. Lions Head is one of the most popular walks in Cape Town. It's fairly easy if you are of a relative fitness but it is by no means difficult and no advanced skills are needed. The chains can be tricky to climb for some people, but you can always skip them and walk around. The views at sunrise and sunset are spectacular. It is also popular to climb Lions Head during the full moon, and something a lot of people want to tick off their list. If you climb it during the full moon, expect huge queues. It took our group about 1h30min to descend after viewing the full moon. A trick is to go a day before or a day after the full moon as it still looks very much like a full moon, with less crowds. If you are going in the morning or evening (Especially evening), pack some warm clothing as it can get cold quickly especially during winter. Also, there has been some crime like muggings, and although rare and there is now increased security, I'd recommend walking in groups and during daylight hours.

Wauw!. It is not a heavy climb, but the view is amazing! It is a 360 view, with a huge variety. You can see the ocean, camps bay, the forest, the city and even the airport. The mountains look incredible andyou can hang out there for a couple hours. If the weather is nice you should defenitely bring some food, because it is a nice area to chill! Great experience!

Better than Table Mountain. Before hiking up Lion's Head I hiked up Table Mountain. The Lion's Head hike is a bit more "difficult". However once you get to the top you won't be disappointed. We hiked up just before sunset, I would definitely recommend everyone to do the same. The sunset is amazing and you'll enjoy every second of it. Bring water though, you won't be able to buy anything on your way up. And last but not least, don't go up there alone always travel in a group.

Not an easy climb but worth doing for the view. Since Table Mountain was closed we decided to climb Lion's Head and it was not as easy as i thought but the view from the top was breath taking. Not recommended for families for small children or the elderly.

A great way to view Cape Town. this is a wonderful 2 - 3 hour hike, with spectacular views of Cape Town. The path goes round and round all the way up to the top so you are treated to 360 degree views.

Great hike as always. Second time doing it ,the weather was perfect ,great time ,beautiful flowers and views .It's a nice outdoor activity for the family . Always space at the top to take good pictures and relax.
Fantastic view. Only a few people might not want to walk up there. It's steep and challenging but it's absolutely worth it. To see the sun set from up there is one of my highlights in Cape Town.

Beat views of Cape Town, better than table mtn. I've been up Lions head 5 times and table mountain 3. Lions head is just so much better in every way. Firstly, it's free but it requires a hike that can be done in under an hour for the able. Second, the peak is small so when you finally get up, it just feels so much more special and quaint. Thirdly, the views are superior to table mtn because you're closer to the sea. Last but not least, if you like photographs of yourself with views in the background, the rocks at the peak here allow for the best pictures in Cape Town!
A Challenging Walk. A challenging uphill walk with a little bit of hiking and rock climbing at the end, rewards you with spectacular views.

Lion's Head - best ever east-west views. THe walk up was fine, about an hour, stopping for photos. The walk down in the dark with torchlight was slower and tougher on the knees.But walking up and sitting watching the sunset over the Atlantic and then walking across the Head and sitting watching the full Moon rise was breath taking. Out of this world. Spectacular, fun filled atmosphere with largely foreign tourists. Highly, highly recommended.
Challenging hike. Great views, an excellent work out. Have to be OK with exposure, climbing ladders, using handholds and hanging onto chains.

Great view and enjoyable. At a steady pace with a knee that had surgery 5 monthes prior it took 50 minutes to the top. Great view. I had heard of Lion's Head from a mate I had played Rugby with in Toronto ... Was on my list for Cape Town.

40 minutes to the top. On average if you pace it very slowly you will reach the top of lion's head in 40 minutes. This climb is very easy and can even be done during full moon. You will even have the Cape Town Traffic Department on Stand By to help with all the traffic as it is such a popular full moon activity.
Cape Town's lesser peak. Lion's Head is a wonderful place from which to get perspective on Table Mountain - as well as lovely views of the rest of the city.
Amazing. Amazing mountain, the view is fantastic. Sad history about the last lion in ZA. If you are going in winter, be sure to take a coat

Helter Skelter Panorama. A more than casual stroll on a spiral path ascending Lions Head gives you the most incredible views of the City, The 12 Apostles, and Table Mountain. My girlfriend has 2 historic knee injuries and found the walk to be within her comfort zone. We didn't reach the very top as it was 35 degrees and we'd seen all we wanted. The final few hundred meters is ladders and a few slightly precarious rock climbs, but nothing you couldn't do in regular shoes. Maybe not for the unfit, or elderly, mainly due to the heat.

Not so easy. I read a lot of reviews and thought we could do this for sunset, it was steep off the bat and we gave up at the ladders, the thoughts of coming back down in the dark did not appeal at all. We ended up driving to Devil's Peak and watched the sunset from there, was amazing and comfortable. Unless you are confident and ok with climbing down, rocks ladders and chains in the dark i would suggest walking up a portion of it to take in the the views but make Devil's peak for sunset.

The fairest cape of all!!!. The wAlk up Lion's head can be a little strenuous and you must wear walking shoes....but the panting up is worth the mist magnificent view when you come around some of the corners! It's a reserve incredible with protea bushes and other South African flora , stunning views and what Cape Town is all about.....at some point you will see table bay, green point, sea point, camps bay devils peak and table mountain.....take water...and go breathe in the spectacular views of this magnificent city!!

Perfect spot to watch the sunset. Amazing spot to watch the sunset, we drove there and parked the car at the top, there were a lot of people just relaxing, drinking and waiting for the sun to go down. There are toilets but no coffee shop or anywhere to buy drinks/snacks so bring your own and enjoy the view!

Not for the faint of heart. Began the walk up Lion's Head and it was very steep right away. Gorgeous views all the way up but the path became narrow and then you had to climb up rocks where the path got very steep. I stopped half way up. If you progress there are ladders and chains to climb before reaching the peak. Even my 17 year old son did not go all the way to the top. Prefer Table Mountain since it was much easier to maneuver.
the second highest point in cape town. lions head is not too difficult to climb so even the beginners and less experience can start to practice here. you can walk around the hill and get a 360° view
Awesome view!. I loved the trekking. You need to go very early (before 6am) in order to see the sunrise. Take a jacket because is very windy in the top. The view is just spectacular !!!!

Hike for Sundowners. Great hike if you have good weather for a gorgeous view over Cape Town, The Twelve Apostles and Table Mountain. I think it took us about 30 to 40 minutes to reach the top. Make sure you allow enough time to be there at least 10 - 15 minutes before the "official" sunset time to get the full experience. We did the route that involved the chains which was interesting going back down..make sure to bring flashlights, headlamps etc. All we had were our phone flashlights! Also bring plenty of water along with your wine and snacks. This was our first trip to Cape Town, so it was great to see the sights from up high!!

Awesome Views. My husband and I hiked up Lion's Head which is located close to Signal Hill however for more advanced hikers, there are other starting points further down the mountain. The hike starts at a steady, gradual pace. Overall, the climb is not difficult but give yourself some time as parts of the hike involve climbing rocks. I loved how all the locals go just for jogging and fitness. Even, local jog at night however all of them had flashlights. Excellent pictures can be taken from Lion's Head.

Breathtaking in more ways than one. Breathtaking both literally and figuratively. One does not have to be insanely fit so do not be afraid. The chain stair case is an experience. The views from the top is breath taking. This is one of those glad to visit or live in Cape Town experience and to top it all, it is free

Lions Head Hike!. Pretty spectacular way to spend your early morning sunrise or late afternoon sunset! If you're lucky you can do the full moon hike where you'll have the privilege to witness both sunset AND moon rise at the same time.....!

Awesome. The view at Sunset is a sight to be seen, if you have never seen the view from Lions Head you have never visited Cape Town.From being crowded the top is so big that people spread themselves apart. Take a picnic basket a bottle or 2 of wine and enjoy, you will not regret it.

Lion's Head for sunrise. I am not a morning person. Not even a little bit, so that's no excuse. Climbing Lion's Head to watch the sunrise at the top is phenomenal. This activity was surprisingly popular. There's no need to book a tour - the path is very obvious and you can do it yourself. Take water. Find out what time the sun rises and aim to get to the base about 1hr 15 before.The climb itself require a certain level of fitness. There are parts where you are rock climbing, not hiking. If you're lucky, there's a chain that you can hold onto whilst you hoick yourself up. Other parts have stirrups that you can use as a leg up. It's a lot of fun, and nothing beats the views from the top. The sun rises over the mountains in the background and goes through phases of different colours.

Best view of Cape Town. Been up Lion's Head a few times now. Climbing the peak is more of a walk apart from the last 15-20 min which involves some climbing but it is definitely worth the view from up there. This is definitely a don't miss in Cape Town.

Perfect sunny Saturday walk. Perfect walk on a sunny Saturday. The most incredible views of Clifton, camps bay and the city on the walk as well as from the top. I've only ever done the "chains" route where you have to climb a portion of the mountain via chains. A reasonably easy walk, and usually busy in season.

Makes for a Great Mountain Trail. We were happy that we did this trail. My wife and 3-year old daughter went up as high as we could on a lovely sunny morning. The trail becomes challenging (with a young child) as you progress. But it's totally worth it and no point giving up at any time. There's nothing you pay for this wonderful treck. It takes up to 2 hours at least (with children).

Good hike on well marked trails. We love hiking when we travel and since we had a sunny (but windy) afternoon available decided that Lion's Head looked like a good option. The trail is very well marked, somewhat groomed at the lower elevations where protea were just blooming. As you go higher, the path narrows and has ladders in places where you'd otherwise need climbing experience to continue on. There's a short cut toward the top that takes you up rungs and lengths of chain drilled into the rock for hand and foot holds. That can feel a bit hairy, but well it's worth the effort. 306 views from the top of Cape Town and across to Table Mountain.There are parking guides at the base to help you locate a space since that can be a bit of a challenge on busy days.

Very busy walk. We climbed Lions Head on a Sunday evening & it was very crowded. At times it was a bit scary as people weren't being careful climbing, one girl coming down fell flat on her face. Some people weren't very fit or dressed correctly & also made the walk a bit difficult.

Best view of Cape Town, easy 2hr mountain walk. I've lived in Cape Town for 4years now, and I always recommend Lions Head 'hike' to visiting friends and travelers - it's really more of a WALK up the mountain on a clearly marked trail! Best part, it's 100% FREE!Easy-medium difficulty, you can walk up with a basic pair of Tekkies (trainer / sport shoes!) for 1-1.5 hours depending on your fitness. Gorgeous hike, you get a 360 degree view of the city! Starting with. Rewarding view of the 12 Apostles towards camps bay, rounding the hill with views of Atlantic Ocean , back into the city bowl with Table Mountain as perfect backdrop of the city!The view from top is unbeatable, and incredibly satisfying after the walk up! Pack water, snacks, even picnic and wine if you are up for the challenge ;) enjoy a Sunrise or Sunset hike for extra delight!If you happen to be in Cape Town on full moon nights, join locals for the ever popular Full Moon hike - get some head lights or a handheld flashlight/ torch for safety though!

Must see on your Cape Town trip. This is definately a must see on a visit to Cape Town!! Even if you aren't fit enough to go all the way to the top, if you just go for around 40 minutes you will still be treated to the most amazing views. Highly recommend doing this whilst in Cape Town.

Take Me to the Mountain Top!!!. This is an impressive mystic view! It's sort of a Rocky Mountain and Not that High but It's Amazingly Beautiful and it has an unknown magnetic reason to attract you!!! You Can't miss it!!!

A beautiful and enjoyable walk. Well it's winter here in South Africa (May) and the temperature is dropping, the winds are picking up and it's not that hot, a nice warm temperature.
