What do you need:1 x Backpack (small)1 x waterproof light jacket1 x camera1 x water (1.5 litres - 3 little 500ml)A nice set of comfy laced shoes, not flip flops, sandals or anything exposing.And determination!I started from the waterfront and headed up towards the first bend which overlooks the beaches at Camps Bay. Then I took a left and headed up towards the start of the trail. The whole journey took around 5 hours, easily done in 3-4 hours I just did some photography and as I completed an 11 hour flight that morning I was rather tired. Very simple long and windy paths up to the base of the lions head (I can't see the shape of the lion, more like a pineapple). This is when it can get a bit more technical as there are chains and ladders to use to get higher as it wraps around the back of the mountain opposite Table. Once you get to the top take some amazing pictures, have some fruit and food and then head back down. I recommend it and would say kids from 8+ however each to there own. People seem to take dogs up here which would be difficult as the ladders are quite steep.I fully recommend.
My favourite jogging route in the morning. You can hike or jog up to the Lion's head for a magnificent view of Clifton Beach, Camps Ba, the city y and Green Point. Just stop, listen and breath.

A must do for any visitor and local. Lion's Head is an institution. It offers the perfect combination of exercise, amazing views, a social outing and a sense of accomplishment. It's an easier walk than Table Mountain, but still offers some challenges (e.g. a few meters of clamouring, but steps & chains are provided for support and there is also a detour). Lots of locals walk (or ... gasp ... run!) up on a weekly or even daily basis. Early mornings and late afternoons are best, especially in summer. And don't miss the full moon walk. Great atmosphere and very social. Remember your headlamp and a snack for the top. Note: it takes a while to get down due to the human traffic jam :)

must do hike for the energetic. having done the Lions Head hike for the second time, the experience was still excellent and this is a must hike for anyone who has a few hours to really get a good work out, The rock climbing and climbing the chain ladder is challenging for the average hiker. With the city being covered by fog / low cloud cover, the views from the too were excellent with signal hill just being barely visible. views of table mountain from the top were spectacular.

Great views. Lions head hike should be one of the things you do when you get to Cape Town. The view is absolutely a m a z i n g !!.It also lets you see Cape Town and give you a sense of direction of where everything is. There are plenty of photo opportunities. The hike itself is fun. There are some tricky sections where you have to climb up but it's not hard as there are ladders and chains to help you. Make sure you take plenty of water. If you forget, there is a lovely man at the very beginning of the hike who sells drinks. Try to go early in the morning or in the afternoon to avoid the heat.

Great views for free. Easier walk than we thought it would be, we even braved the chains and ladders part of the climb which wasn't too challenging. The weather however made us turn back, never experienced such strong wind, it would have been dangerous to have continued, so check the weather carefully or judge how far you can go safely.
it does not look like a lion,s head !!!. part of the mountain, you can see it from so many places as you go around in cape town. it needs a lot of imagination to see it as a head of a lion !!!

Nice hike. Quite steep in some parts. A perfect spot for see the sun rise. The hike to the top is possible for most people thet can climb a ladder and are not to terrified of heights. The view on the top is magnificent. The hike one way is somewhere between 30 and 90 miutes depending on how fit you are.

When the night life meets nature. A big group of friends and I decided to do the full moon hike up Lion's head. We took the less challenging route and gasped at the spectacular views along the way. The route can be done by almost anyone and the little sweat you break will be forgotten by the spectacular view from both sides of the mountain. We sat there until late, chatting with the rest of people who came from all over the world and then made our way down.Absolutely unforgettable!

Challenging but rewarding hike!. Its not a long hike but some tricky challenging bits. It is very rewarding though for its 360 degree views of Cape Town and the coast line. Beautiful. Make sure you push yourself all the way to the very top!

Got me stuck for hiking. This mountain was acutally the first mountain I ever climbed. With that said, this can be climbed by everyone. The feeling when you're at the top is indescribable. I climbed it early morning and watched the sunrise from the top. It has some fun parts when you can climb on chains, but I heard that there is another way when you skip that part. The mountain is not that challenging, but don't forget water and some energy to have on your way.

a dream at night. this place must be visited during an early morning sunrise or a late afternoon/evening when the lights in Cape Town are all on, it is a must see for all who want to admire the beauty of our mother city and by day or night.
Proud Lion. I did not understand why it was called Lion's Head until I was standing and looking at it. It really looks like a proud lion guarding the city
My fav hike ever!. this is the best hike - loved every minute of it. you are able to do it with a low fitness level which is even better. Go try it out!

Lions Head is awesome!. Lion's Head hike was amazing. In the 2.5 months I stayed in Cape Town for Summer 2010, I hiked Lion's Head 5 or 6 times. It's a great hike, and you can hike up in an hour or so. The views of Cape Town from the top are just breath taking. I only wish I could do this again. If you like hiking and have the chance, definitely make this something you do. Relatively speaking, it's a short hike with the bonus of a great view!!!!

Nice quick climb. I had to abandon my climb due to sun going down and i started late but this is absolutely brilliant, and the far reaching views of mountain, sea and city are just great! Would recommend anyone to take the difficult path to climb than taking stairs if you are able climber. There was paragliding company on top as well for those who need some thrill.
Breathtaking views. Loved the walk up the to the top, hardwork close to the top though. absolutely amazing 360 degree views

See The City. A relatively easy hike of between 1-1.5 hrs with spectacular views stretching across Cape Town. Best times are either for sunrise or sunset. One of the top free things to do in Cape Town. With sunsets bring a flashlight as it will be dark soon after.
What a sight!!!. What a great site the lions head is from all anglesWe have stayed at 12 Apostles twice before and the lions head is what we look to as we have breakfast which is awesome
natural monument. it is also one of the capetowns landmarks, standing opposite to the table mountain easy to access by car nice view to the atlantic ocean, i prefer more the view from table mountain

A good climb. I loved climbing up Lion's Head. The views all around were stunning, especially on the top. It's a good 40 minute climb and wonderful exercise. After climbing it up the regular way, the next day we climbed it from the back. Enjoyed every minute!
a South African land mark. fabulous Lion's Head peak can be seen from all over Cape Town! and enjoy the paragliders jumping off from both sides and amazing those of us on the ground below!!
Another must do!. Looking across the bay to Lions Head is just one the things on the "must do" list. It's a great lump of rock but so distinguishable and part of any trip arounds the peninsula.

Great hike for the best view in town. The Lionshead hike is a great alternative for hiking up table mountain. Given the location of Lionshead, you will even have a better and 360 degree panoramic view compared to the view from table mountain.It is rather easy to get there: right of the point where the road to Table Mountain begin, on the top of the pass between Downtown and Camps Bay, you go the opposite way: Signal Hill road. It is the first point where many cars are parked.The hike takes about 1h15 up and 45m down, for an untrained person. On the top there is some climbing involved, so hand and arms are needed. There are no severe drops close to the path of the hike, which would scare people with moderate fear of heights (like me). For the severe cases: you are climbing a mountain where you have a view of 670m above sea level: think twice.On windy days it might be smart to bring some extra warmth protection and be more careful during the climb. Also bring water as there is no water around. It was certainly worth the effort and I enjoyed the view more than from the top of Table mountain (also because you don’t have to share it with 100s of tourists).
Sunset on Lions Head. You have to hike up, there is no transport and that makes it even better! Once you're up, just enjoy the sunset with a couple of friends.
Climb it!. For me, this was not an easy climb, but well worth it for the views! I had a guide who could tell me all about the different sites. Careful on the chains!

Great hike with sensational views. My partner and I ventured over to Lion's Head after visiting Table Mountain. The walk up is very beautiful, on the way up we stopped to watch some of the Paraglider's take off over Camps Bay. Before reaching the summit there is one part that requires the use of chains and ladders - this is the part I found most fun. If this isn't your thing there was a sign directing people to an easier route.Unfortunately once we arrived to the top the clouds covered up most of Table Mountain however we still had a beautiful view over the city. I can't imagine how glorious it would be with no clouds but you can't control Mother Nature! Descending down was a little hard on my injured knee (there are lots of steps and rocks to scramble down) but in the end it was well worth it and my trip wouldn't have been complete without climbing Lions Head.I definitely recommend this hike to everyone, if your fitness levels are a little lacking you can still do this hike, just allow yourself a bit more time and lots of water. I also recommend doing this with another person if you are a little worried of heights. It was nice having my partner there to direct me down the chain part.Enjoy!

quite a climb but worth it. The view from the top is amazing, but you have to be in shape to do it...well at least not out of shape. The path can be narrow and the last bit is a proper climb.But the view is amazing..

Great hike with a breath taking view. Directly across from Table Mountain, Lion's Head is a great climb (roughly 2 hours round trip) with outstanding views of Cape Town, Camps Bay, and Table Mountain. It is much less crowded than Table Mountain yet a good climb with the last part quite steep but fun.

Great view. It all depends on your fitness level, but this hike took about 1hr 15 min up and about 45 min down. It was more difficult that I had expected, but it will still fun to do. The views on top were amazing. My suggestion would be to start very early in the morning before it gets hot and bring some water.

Easy hike to the best view of Cape Town. I took the spiral path up lions head. It leads all around the mountain and offers spectacular views over the city, the 12 apostels, the sea and Robben island as well as Table Mountain. The path is easy to follow. Further up I took the shorter way with some ladders, all safe and easy to manage. If you are not so fit and want to avoid the ladders, take the "recommended" path to the left (a little longer). It took me just about an hour to get to the top. The allround view is breathtaking. Allow 2 1/2 hrs round trip. Wear good footgear, a sunhat and take a windbreaker and waterbottle along.
Best hike in Cape Town. Great views, really unbelievable. Advanced trail, not for the faint of heart or afraid of heights. Bring water, it's pretty steep and takes a bit of fitness.
Great views. Just make sure you don't try to go on a public holiday when the weather is fine - the roads can be awful but the views are specks!

Great view,great hike !!. Best with full moon although can get crowded - it is not a secret !! But the hike is at all times great for the view of it all : Sea-beaches -up to the westcoast and off course tablemountain and citybowl !!

Little effort, much reward. I used to climb Lions' head every Thursday morning for about 10 consecutive Thursdays. Lovely to see how the seasons change! Except for the first 10 minutes of the walk that comes at you quite fast and furious, the rest of the way is a fairly easy stroll, some coordination required to do the optional chain section of the climb, but all the aspects of Cape Town can be inspected at leisure. You can never get tired of the view. The full-moon hike has to be done with a bit more patience, but a great way to meet people on the trek down.
Rewarding views. An amazing hike to the top, and you get rewarded with great views once you reach the top. Picturesque views of Robben Island, Table Mountain and Cape Town are worthy of the climb.
Must Do. Hiked this with Lauren from Mother City Hikers. Let the Cable Car do the work on TM. This is a short hike with fantastic views with TM in them.
Stunning views of the Mother City. A wonderful experience for tourists and locals alike. Take some water and walk right to the top, it is so worth it.

You must hike up to Lions Head. I went on a full moon hike. Seeing the sun setting over the Atlantic and the (full) moon rising over Cape Town. Absolutely stunning. A must do when you are in Cape Town.

Moderate difficulty, well worth if for the amazing view. I went on a warm day around 10:30am. I am not a particularly fit person and it took me almost two hours to make it to the top. There are very few shady areas to rest along the way. The top part of the climb is just that a climb on rocks. But once you are at the top the view is amazing. There has been incidences of crime on the hike but the day I went there was security in the mountain and lots of hikers. Still I wouldn't do it alone. Be sure to take enough water and sunscreen.

LION'S HEAD - CAPE TOWN - 5PM - TUE 05 MAR 14. Great views and a good physical workout.It appears I walked the long way up. I came to a hut where there was a footpath to one side, and a road on the other. Being on foot I chose the footpath and it took quite a while to get to the top. At the top I met some friends from my tour group; we descended at the same time, and I then realised that I should have taken the vehicle track on the way up. A bit of investment in a couple of signs to aid walkers would be appreciated.

lovely walk to lions head for sunset. Nice walk with some climbing - make sure to have good shoes with you! You won't be alone up there! If you stay there for sunset, have a light for the way back with you. Excellent view to table mountain and cost line.

Easy scenic climb. Well marked path, a couple of ladders and chains to hold on to. Even if you don't go past the wide part of the path, well worth for some of the most scenic views of Cape Town. Not to be missed.

The BEST place to see Cape Town. In my view this is the best place to see all of Cape Town. Even better than Table Mountain. As you walk round you can see all of the different contrasting areas. The beaches, downtown, V&A, the new stadium etc..

Brilliant views (bit of scrambling near the top). We loved our walk up to the top of the Lions Head, most of it with some ascent on obvious paths, then steep short scrambling near the top. The 360 views from the top are great. Its easy to do in trainers, and if you don't like a steep scramble you can still walk most of it and get most of the views.

Not easy to climb but really worth it!. Making it to the top was not a walk in the park, but it was worth it. The view across Cape Town, Camps Bay and Table Mountain at sunset just got better and better as you got higher. it gets a fair bit steeper closer to the top, having to climb using hands and feet, but its not impossible. Great activity to do, especially as it's free!
Good views. A relaxing place to visit for the views over Cape Town and Sea Point. It's good to watch the paragliders takes off.
Sunset hike. Stunning views from the top especially at sunset. Don't stay to long though because the top part of the hike is slightly challenging and you don't want to go down there in the dark.

A Good walk. Well worth a walk around Lions head - I would say you have to be moderatly fit too, and do not do in extreme heat or midday time.Beautiful views of Cape Town, Camps Bay and Clifton along the coastline. Take plenty of water as no where to buy any. We saw plenty of people struggling with the heat and had no drinks with them. The path gets more trechorous and rocky the higher you go with very steep drops.

Great hike & stunning views. The walk is fairly comfortable and very scenic to the top of Lions Head. The last part is more tough and somewhat treacherous. Once you get to the top the view is stunning.

Great hike & views. This isn't the easiest hike, requiring some scrambling up rocks, climbing ladders, rungs, and pulling yourself along with chains. Nothing most people of even average fitness probably couldn't handle though if you place yourself.
Can you see it. This is good if you have a little imagination. It also needs to be viewed from the correct direction. Have not yet found a way to get up though. Maybe because you can't
Climbing Lion's Head. Awesome spur of the moment experience.Don't forget to grab a drink and sunblock for the climb.Amazing views.

Best to visit during full moon. Lions head peak is one of the unique place where one could see 360 degree view from the top.During full moon, if one could manage to hike to the top, can see beautiful sunset, fullmoon and Cape Town city at night. Everything looks so beautiful from the top, specially table mountain.

Do it for a sundown. We hiked up Lion's Head for sundown. There were quite a few people up there which makes it fun. I liked the hike up Lion's Head, there are a few climbs on ladders and up the rocks (but there are iron bars and chains to hold on to) So it's a little more adventurous than Table Mountain. We took some bottles of wine and some food to with us and were just in time to see the sun setting :) Be careful when you go down. Firstly, when you go down after dark the way down is a little more difficult (cus you can't see much) so be sure to take some headlights or use your phone flashlight. that works as well. Secondly, hike down in a group of at least 4 (and be sure to have one or two guys with you) just to be sure not to get mugged. That would be just plain stupid.... But overall, it is a great hike, less people than on table mountain, also great view to each side of the city.

Awesome Hike. I reckon this is a better option than going up Table Mountain. Firstly its free! It only takes about an hour up and an hour down, you just need to get to the starting point in the car park. The views are amazing but you will need to be relatively fit and take plenty of water. There have been a few issues with safety from time to time so try and walk close to other people, and thats not hard if the weather is good as its pretty popular!
beautiful. Go with friends, takes about an hour up, maybe less. Beautiful at sunset, but be careful and don't take valuables. One of my favorite hikes in the world.

Panoramic Views of City - A Great Hike!. Great activity to do with friends, on your own or with family. Pack a picnic basket and enjoy the sunset or sunrise! Can be a bit challenging at times, but 100% worth the climb! Great views of the city from all angles - from Table Mountain to Sea Point, to Camps Bay, the City Bowl and beyond!

You can go all the way to the top, even at night. Two ways to do it, easy walk up to about half way, well worth the effort, flat walk, easy hiking. You can also do it all the way to the top. More effort, some ladders to negotiate, not for the unfit and jittery. You don't need climbing skills, it is a hike, with some tricky bits.In general it is safe, as long as you stay on the route. The more adventurous can do it at night around full moon, one of the best experiences in town.

Lion's Head. Lion's head is a nice place to visit. You can go to Table mountain and on the same day you can visit Lion's Head. I've seen many people stopping their cars and enjoying the natural beauty. Don't miss it.

Stunning Views from the top. We took this sight in on a day when visibility was cloudy but nevertheless had spectacular view down to Cape Town and the Waterfront.We also watched daring due para gliders jumping of and descending. We managed to get some photos from Camps Bay itself of those coming down.If you are fit and able then this is a must do.If hiking up make sure you have sturdy shoes, clothing and have some water and snacks.

what a view. This treat for the unfit seems like a mountain BEFORE you even start, i would suggest visiting with someone that has climbed it before as sometimes the track seemed to disappear. Be aware that some stages seem to have a sheer drop with only barbed wire to stop you from falling, but when you reach the top and crack open your booze (water!) you know it was worth it.I am a little affraid of hights, so my explination could be extreme :)

Even my 10 year old son did it!. We were up early & down within 1hr & 20 minutes. Take enough refreshments & a snack. Do not litter, only leave your footprints behind. Nice family outing but proceed with caution as some parts are rather steep. Sunblock on a warm day, nice run down if you have steady legs.

Hike and view. A fantastic hike with some challenging ladders and chains to climb with spectacular views at the top. Allow a few hours at least and bring water, nothing at the top and the shop at the bottom runs out frequently. Sturdy shoes a good idea as is sunscreen and hat.

Great Views. A great place to see the sun set. Loads of locals come here so the views must be good. If taking a Taxi to Loin's Heads, remember to take his number or book a book up time otherwise its a long walk down
Great Hike, Inspiring views. This hike is mild if you stick to the contour path but be aware if you climb to the top of Lion's Head. You will be climbing! The views are inspiring.

Completely worth it!. Just make sure you have an experienced hiker with you, or someone who has hiked up Lion's Head before, because it can be quite challenging at certain points. The views, just like from Table Mountain, are absolutely gorgeous!

Which type of weather will you encounter?. Most visitors do not believe how much the weather varies, not only from the top to the bottom of Table Mountain but between the seaside and the town side. You can have a fairly still day on the northern side and very fresh winds indeed on the south side.This also applies to Lion's Head. Under the right conditions and in the evening, it is particularly worth the trip because you can sometimes see the moon rising when the sun is setting. I think it is a good walk which should be taken at a leisurely pace but beware, robberies are not unknown. On 17 December 2013 a tourist was robbed and stabbed. This is not a regular occurrence by any means, more like once a year, but who wants to be the first?South Africa has many opportunistic thieves who are frankly hungry or frustrated so don't walk around with any indications that you might be well-off, for example flashing a designer bag. Keep your money well out of sight. I have been to South Africa 17 times and only had one bit of trouble in Johannesburg which was entirely my fault.The rainbow nation it may well be, the very rich and the very poor so bear this in mind.

Great view from Table Mountain. A must see when you are in Cape Town. Great view from Table Mountain,and the cable car ride up the mountain. There are a number of historic graves and shrines (kramats) of Malay leaders on the lower slopes and on Signal Hill.

Great hike!. Great hike that was more challenging than we thought. We hiked up midday in the middle of December, which can be pretty hot, but it was worth it to hike to the top. The 360 views are incredible! Parts of the hike include- narrow walkways, climbing some rocks, and ocean views all around. Took 60-90 minutes to hike up and about the same coming down. I heard the sunset or after dark hikes are amazing as well.

Great views and a lovely workout!. We couldn't get to the table mountain cable car station due to a broken down car for a few hours - hiking up Lion's Head instead was a brilliant alternative as you get all the views - especially CPT together with the Table Mountain - and a great workout, too!Just DO wear trainers or hiking boots as you'll have to climb in several places and flip flops are not exactly safe. Also carry some water - it'll get quite hot. And don't forget your camera...

Superb views but be careful.. Just got back from Lion's Head. Some of the most beautiful scenery I've ever seen. Half of the ascent is a trek which turns into long steps before the rocky sections. Keep your wits about you on the rocky sections. It's surprisingly easy to go off track. I went up the recommended route rather than the more adventurous section with chains. I meant to do the same coming down but ended up coming down the chains, which had the old knees knocking. Can't recommend it highly enough, but pick a day with clear skies and wear decent footwear.

Breathtaking Views. A must do for any visitor to Cape Town, provided you're walking fit! It's a great walk, some parts have chains and ladders to assist, but very well maintained! It was my first time up Lions Head, although I've been to Cape Town many times - I'm sorry I never did it sooner! We took some great photo's on top, and enjoyed an ice cold Stoney when we got back!!

Great short hike. It won't take you more than an hour of leisurely hiking, and the experience at the tiny summit is breathtaking. The views of the city bowl and Atlantic seaboard on either side of Lions Head makes Lions Head a unique vantage point in the city (and an awesome panaromic photography point too).

A great hike - but not for those who suffer vertigo!. Be prepared for a 3 to 4 hour hike and clamber. This is not a casual stroll, so go prepared for a scramble and some knee shaking views. Well worth the climb, but go prepared with water, sun screen and a jacket in case it rains. Fantastic views 360 degrees as you circle the hill on your climb.

Amazing hike with spectacular views. Up and down takes 2 hours +\- it's a decent test, couple of options near the summit but is user friendly for about everyone. Take water along and rather do the hike early in the day or in the evenings. Lovely for family's, gives great perspective over Cape Town

Hike on the 31st of Dec. It seemd that us and the rest of Cape Town had decided that this was the day to make up for all the overindulgence of the holidays by trudging up the nonstop incline to get to the top of Lion's Head. Although we did have to wait a bit at the chain ladders etc for people in front of us or coming down, this didn't take away from my enjoyment of the view at the top - definitely worth it. From a timeing point of view if you're walking at a good pace without lots of stops you can get to the top within 1 hour. In summer, leave super early in the morning as it gets very hot! If your'e nervous of hikes or scrambling up rocks, beware because there is some of that involved.
Stunning. An excellent substitute when it was too windy to go to table mountain. Views down over the coast are stunning and being able to have a 270 degree of Cape Town helps!

views without the cost. Lions Head, Cape Town, provides visitors with a scenic view of the city and it's surrounds. It's easily accessible, provides good walking tracks without the cost of Table Mountain. Worth a visit .

really beautiful - get up early. outstanding views on Capetown, 12 apostles, table mountain, seapoint, camps bay... Hiked up from camps bay (not easy to find), but would recommended this, as the main trail from main parking can be very busy. Went up on boxing day, there were a lot of people on the last 100 m (ladders), so if you go up a busy holiday, start your hike latest at 7h. Lions Head does not have the 'table cloth' problem alike Table mountain which ofetn is covered in clouds and wonät have a view hence
A great climb up. It takes 2-3 hours to go up & down, take plenty of water & sunscreen in summer. A great hike that can be done with family, amazing views all the way
A must!. This is a must in Cape Town! In my opinion, the most amazing views are from the Lions Head, even better than the Table Mountain. Better go with clear sky, and not in a windy day.

Exhilarating!. Although we had been up table mountain once we wanted to go again but unfortunately extreme winds meant it was closed for the last two days of our visit to Cape Town. We decided to go for a hike here and amazingly there was hardly any wind! It is a proper hike though so you need to be prepared. Take sun block. water and wear a sunhat and sensible walking footwear. There are places that are quite tricky so not advisable for people who aren't used to hiking or find long walks difficult. We told the rest in our group where we were going which is always advisable. As others have said don't wear sandals or flip flops this isn't a gentle walking experience! It was fantastic. Views amazing and the walk and climb felt like a really good work out!

Hiking. Be aware that you always tell someone where you are going when you go for a walk in the mountain. Do it with at least another two persons. Always take enough water and something to eat and something warm. Do not walk at night. Do not carry expensive stuff with you.

What a view.. Go to lions head at sunset or sunrise. I went at sunset and everyone takes food and drinks and sits on blankets to watch the most amazing sunset over the city. A definite must while staying in Cape Town. I do it every time I'm there.

Lovely. lovely view. Just make sure you go on a nice weather. very interesting place to go. Great place,
lovely view. Just make sure you go on a nice weather. very interesting place to go. Great place,

The fall back hike to the top.. When its too windy or cloudy to do Table Mountain, Lions head comes into its own. It is a great 1.5 hour walk to the top and not too difficult. There are chains where the path becomes a rocky scramble to assist you on the difficult portion. The groups always enjoy the stunning 360 degree view of the city and its surrounds. Take plenty of water on hot summers days , sun block and good shoes. Flip flops are inadvisable. People get hurt every year on our mountains because of ignoring these simple guidelines.

Sensational sunset viewing. We arrived at about 630, had some sandwiches and chips packed and watched the sunset at 745... For as many other people were there we had space and getting out afterwards was not too difficult.

full moon excursion!. it is said, and possibly true, that you should avoid to hike up or uses pathes of lions head and signal hil as soon as the sun has gone down.yes BUT, there is always a big monthly gathering every full moon - lots of them bring a small picnic with them, lots of photographers to take spectacular pictures, if the night is clear!

Best thing I have ever done!. I wouldn't recommend doing this hike in ballet flats like I did!!! Completely unaware of how big a hike this was going to be I was not prepared! But 4 hours later I reached the top and I was blown away by what I saw!I highly recommend this hike, it is beyond worth it every step of the way! This experience meant so much to me I even went and got the coorindates of Lions Head tattooed on me :)

It's a great hike!. My buddy and I ran to the top of the mountain. It took about 30 or 40 minutes to get to the top. We did need to use some chains that they had bolted into the rocks to climb up some sketchy spots. Once we got to the top the view was amazing, one of the best in the world. I have some great pics and videos from this little excursion.

Beautiful Hike!. Lion's Head is my favourite place in all of Cape Town! It is a great path to take to go at your own pace. As you wind your way up the mountain, you get to see the different parts of the city! It's a great activity for family and friends. You can go up to watch the sunset!

Best views. This hike is recommended for anyone. It is strenuous towards the end but most of the way is easy. The view of Cape town and Camps Bay from the top is amazing and the hike is completely free. Took us about 50mins up and 40mins down. Go at sunset, its stunning!

If there's one thing you do, do this!. Lions Head is the single best thing you can do in Cape Town! Climb up (45 - 60 min) so that you're up before sunset. The view is spectacular! You can see close to all of Cape Town. Try avoid going up if it's windy or quite cloudy as there is a bit of climbing and it is quite high up!

View. One of the nicest view of cape town. You need a car: I am not sure for the public transportation. The view on the table mountain is outstanding and the same for the town. It s one of the largest view of the site.

Great hike. This is a wonderful hike up to the peak of the Lion`s Head. Wonderful views of the Table Mountain and the "table cloth", Cape Town and Campsbaai. You should be ok with looking down from heights and and wear sturdy shoes.

360 View. A great walk and an even better view. We climbed Lion's Head for the purpose of paragliding off but the winds were not cooperating. It is a nice walk with some slippery sandy parts so I would recommend wearing sturdy shoes. Bring some water and snacks and enjoy the view because its awesome!

Heaven for adventure sports enthusiasts!. This is the start point for para gliding enthusiasts. The lions head stand right in front of table mountain albeit at a lower altitude. A short para gliding ride starting and ending here would give you a thrilling experience!

Don’t let me put you off but….. The views are spectacular, but I didn’t really notice them as I was concentrating on staying alive. Once you get to the rocks you are pretty much scrambling on all fours, clawing your way up the mountain, with deadly drops all around. Tip: DON’T WEAR RINGS OR BRACELETS as they get horribly scratched on the rocks. I rate myself as a reasonably fit 50 year old. But I found this hike to be well out of my comfort zone, certainly not an 'easy walk' for me.There are two routes to take up, almost everyone on the trail was going the ‘hard’ way, but part way up I found I couldn’t reach a hand grip. So we turned back and took the ‘easy’ route up. I think being short (5’2”) was a handicap as I simply didn’t have the stride and reach to easily navigate the rocks. (I know that many people shorter than I will have found it no trouble at all)…. But I am being totally honest here.But once at the top I had a very keen sense of satisfaction - and apprehension as I knew the decent was probably going to be harder – and it wasn’t. I found the best way down was on my bottom - a lower centre of gravity is the key. (most women were opting for this technique).So, I am glad I have done it. I have been told Table Mountain is an easier, but longer climb, hmm we will see….

Lunch onto of Lions Head. Great place to get up to and have lunch whilst enjoying the panoramic views; not to mention the challenge of just being out (up) there.Take:- Water (one litre per person was good for us)- Good footwear (running shoes are fine)- Light weight clothing as it can get hot- A small backpack with a warm jacket and hat inside as weather can change and become cold- A cap- Sunscreen- CameraWe set out from the carpark at the base of Lions Head and took the longer route close to the top and it ended up taking us 90 minutes at an casual pace. Whilst a lot of earlier reviews I had read suggested an easy climb, I think that these might have been written by long legged people in their 20s; knowing this for that is what I would’ve written at that age.Unfortunately the passing of the years does have an impact on the body and I realised a while back that I wasn’t the “mountain goat” I used to be. However from the perspective of a human male in his late forties the climb is definitely achievable; it just did not feel to be in the “easy climb” category.Picnic style lunch at the top is a must; since you have invested the time and sweat in getting up there, you must take the time to enjoy the views offered which are spectacular on a sunny day.Do check the weather before heading up; if the wind picks up whilst you are on the head, it can take the fun out of it.
Easy walk. Loved it! 45 minute walk for an amazing view and perfect to make a lot of crazy pictures. Walk in clear sky!

Great Walk!!. I walked up and down Lion's Head over the course of about 3 hours or so (including time to stop at the top and admire the view). The view from the top is excellent and I would highly recommend making the hike to the top! As with Table Mountain, bring a camera as the view at the top makes for great pictures!I have a healthy fear of heights, and on one or two occasions I had to block out my fear and keep pushing forward - very glad I did!
Sunset trip. Great walk with amazing view the whole way up to the top. Great to see the sunset at 7:45 PM. Challenging enough and takes everything from 30-60 min to walk from the road
Best hike ever. Great Hike.. Better than table mountain. The view is awesome and I loved every second.. Average fitness required.

A great experience.. Climb to the top of Lion's head, otherwise you haven't done one of the best things one can do in Cape Town. Yes, you need to be somewhat fit and go with someone who know the way, otherwise you can get lost and be up there all night. But the views and the experience is amazing.

A Must Do in Cape Town. We came across Lion's Head by chance as the cable car was closed for maintenance. Our 8 year old son, who complains about walking to the bus stop, turned into a mountain goat and lead the charge up the mountain. Views were superb - we went on a cool day thank goodness as I can imagine it is much tougher when it is hot. It could be a bit scary for people who are afraid of heights but I'm not and loved it! A really great morning's excursion.

what a view. this is a view that you will never forget, the walk up to the top is sometimes taxing but worth every step of the way. One is always surrounded by nature, views of the ocean or the beautiful Cape Town below.

Great family hike. Go early morning and miss the crowds. Have not felt unsafe but we always make sure to go when there's a few people up already (can tell by cars parked at starting point). No loo's or shop at the top. Take your own picnic and enough water.

Make an early start. We started out walk at 7.15am - about the right time before it got either too hot or too busy. Took the hard route up (climbing wall parts) and the easy way down. It does take the hour up and back as you have to stop for photos of the spectacular views

Awesome experience. 360 degree views of Cape Town. Can be a little bit challenging for first time hikers towards the top but well worth going as far as you can manage it. On a warm day, take lots of water! A wonderful experience.

Awesome experience - Don't go past the ladder if you are afriad of heights. The views were remarkable. We love the experience. If you are afraid of heights or have anxiety turn around when you see the ladder. After you get above the ladder it gets increasingly narrow and I personally got very nervous I was going to have a misstep and fall down the side. For most people this will not be an issue, but I am known to be clumsy, so I was concerned. We turned around when we got to the spot where you have to use the handle to get up. In hindsight I wish I would have continued, but I did not know what to expect. For those who love are not afraid, what a wonderful hike!!!!!! (You can still enjoy it even if you do not go past the ladder!) 

Wonderful walk with stunning 360 degree views - a must do in Cape Town!. Far preferred this walk to Table mountain as it takes you spiralling around the mountain so you get everchanging views over Cape bay, Table mountain and Camps bay on the other side. It is not easy and requires a bit of scrambling up steep bits at times and nervy walkers might not like the steep left hand edge at times eg there are chains to hold onto and a ladder at one point but it is a safe walk for fit people and you dont have to do all of it!! Absolute must do for walkers and photographers

What fun. We spent about 2.5 hrs hiking Lions Head on a beautiful Sept. afternoon. The trail starts out rather smooth and wide but it soon changes. It gets steep and a bit challenging but not too hard for a pair of 67 & 69 yr olds. There are iron ladders embedded in the rocks in a few spots where needed. This was a first for us. Then there are sections where there is really no clear path but large rocks to climb over. Finally you reach the top with a 360 degree view of Capetown. At the top you can reward yourself with a snack if you carried one and just sit back and enjoy the view. On the way back down we watched a paraglider take off and ride on the thermals. I would suggest you dress in layers and bring sun screen, water and a snack. Hiking Lions Head is a great way to spend an afternoon in Capetown.

In top 10 things to so in Cape Town. I live in Cape Town and have done the Lions Head climb over 30 times and never get tired of it. Last trip I took my 7 year old daughter with me and she managed fine. Safe hike and not to advanced. The views are amazing and give you a full panoramic view of the city as you spiral up to the summit. Best to do the hike early in the summer months before it gets to hot as the trip is exposed with little shade on offer. Late afternoon and night trips are popular. If you looking for a bit of a party, every full moon about 2000 people hike up in the late afternoon to watch the sun set and the full moon rise. You hike down in the darkness and can be done without torches depending on cloud cover. This trip should be on every able bodied tourists list of to do's when visiting the city if Cape Town.

Breathtaking!. Relatively short spiral climb. It does get quite steep towards the summit but the view at the top is worth every drop of sweat. If you're lucky you might get to witness the paragliders taking off half way up the climb. Could be done in the dark with the assitance of a torch as is common on full moon nights. Would probably recommend this over Table Mountain itself.
Great views, wonderful flowers. Easily accessible spiral hike to the top. Upper part a bit of scramble , chains, ladders a exposure.
Beautiful and very symbolic. Lion's Head is one of Cape Town's icons. It's beautiful seeing the mountain and amazing sunsets in the background!
Trecker's Paradise. Good place for trekers. The view of this hill, in no way looks like a lions head. Visible from the Table Mountain.

Lion's Head Hike. I hiked up Lion's Head on a Tuesday evening just before dusk. The climb up was moderate, even the walking trails before the climbing section are quite elevated. The hike took about an hour up, and you will be greeted with one of the most stunning views at the top. We stayed at the top for sunset, watched the clouds roll in, and then hiked back down in the dark. A wonderful, free thing to do in Cape Town for a workout and some sightseeing!

Hike. We hiked up Lions Head which at first freaked me when I saw the terrain but once we got going the perfect view of Camps Bay and Cape Town harbor took all my apprehension away. It was so much fun and very good exercise.

Great sunset views. We took the red line bus night tour up to Lion's Head and saw some fantastic slights along the way around the trendy beach neighborhoods and up to Lion's Head for sunset. Nice there are restrooms up there and a guy who sells coffee out of his truck. Beautiful vistsas, you won't be disappointed!

Superb view and beautiful wild flowers!. The hike starts out with an easy to moderate climb from Signal Hill park, full of wild flowers at this time of year (October). We went on Sunday and there were many people going up, but it still was very enjoyable. The views were superb! We had a clear, sunny sky with a light, cool breeze which was a plus once the climb got to be a bit more strenuous. At the end, it was like doing stair master on a high level, but there were always rocks to hang on to. It was the perfect combination of physical activity and nature. Highly recommend it! Once on top, Robben Island, Table Mountain and Cape Town were in sight. A couple of metal stairs, but very secure. I saw families with very small children, but I think I would have been too nervous to bring along very small kids.

Easy Alternative to Table Mountain. Lion's head hike is short, simple, and easy to do. Approximately 2.5 hours round trip on an average pace of a 20 something traveler. The wind does make it extremely cold, so be sure to bring a big jacket or wind blocker. It is also a very safe area with your car, due to car thefts in the past, the community has pushed for security that now watches over your car. So you can hike without worry. If you have time, it is also great to drive further in to Signal Hill.TIP: Right before you hit the top, there are rock formations near the stairs at the top that opens up for a private chamber. It's a personal sweet spot for personal reflection!P.S. No toilets on top, so be sure to take a bathroom break before.

Hard work but great view. I only got half way up lion's head as I had not long had surgery but the walk is well set out and the views beautiful. Make sure you wear training shoes/sneakers/sandshoes. Have heard that the full moon walk at night is great but did not get a chance to do this.

Such a nice hike!!!. I have to say I enjoyed this hike more than hiking the Table Mountain even though we couldn't get to the top. It is not an easy hike but is so wonderful! The parking lot is a good starting point and it will take roughly 2hours to make it to the top and back to the car.

Totally worth the amazing view. Something free,fun and fabulous. Of course if you don't enjoy hiking then stay away. It is a challenging climb for those of us that are not as fit as others but the view at the top is stunning. Be sure to take water and a jumper incase of a change in weather.

Moderate hike with good trail. Lion's head has a few narrow spaces, a few steep spaces, some staple and ladder climbing. Not overly challenging but not for the faint hearted. When we climbed it was windy and cloudy/foggy. There was a lady with a baby strapped to her back hiking up. The reward is a fantastic view of Capetown from the top. Bring a camera, a snack, and 1L of water per person. Takes about 1.5 hours roundtrip.

Climb the Lions Head (free). We went by taxi to the bottom of the Lions Head trail, and from there just followed the broad path, which becomes smaller and stepper as you go. At one point we had to choose between the "recmended route" and climbing up 5 metres - the 9 year old child was delighted to climb. Fantastic view at the top. Not recomended for people with dizziness or those who are afraid of heights. All others: Try this wonderful and free south african hike.

Glorious free views. Lions Head lies between Table Mountain and Signal Hill peaking around 669 metres above sea level. You can drive to the top or walk which will take a couple of hours, when you get there there are stunning 360 degree views as the S A authorities have had the sense to deny high elevation building in the area.
Go hiking on lion's head. Best way to explore Lion's head is to hike to the top. Beautiful views of Cape Town, thrill of climbing will make your eerie nice worth while

City Centre Scramble. Even by the standards of England's Lake District trails, the trek up Lion's Head (yes, you do need a vivid imagination) is fairly sanitised. (See my previous posts). Nevertheless, there can be few, if any, cities in the world that offer such a wonderful scramble within the city boundaries. There are no hidden dangers but one does need a head for heights as the helter-skelter route that winds round the mountain is fairly exposed in places.I did it early one October morning and was rewarded with cloud inversion views from the top with Table Mountain floating in bright sunshine above a sea of cloud. I was short of time and charged up and down from the car park at the base of the trail in 90 minutes. I would advise allowing more time than this just to allow space to soak up the experience

go hiking. skip the gym and go hiking up lion's head for beautiful views of the city. have seen many tourists climbing unprepared in flipflops and heels! it is not an easy climb and people have fallen to their death here. Please wear hiking shoes with good grip (rocks are very slippery) or atleast sports shoes before you attempt a climb

Drive to the Top. Exploring Cape Town wouldn't be complete with out a drive to the top of Lion's Head. From the car park and surrounding area you have great views of the harbor, city and of course Table Mountain and the cable car. Go up just before sunset and see some great views as the sun goes down.
A great hike. Not too technical, but some great views of Table Mountain and the surrounding area. Some parts involve scrambling, but that's a fun part. Easy to do in 1/2 day.

Easy walk and an amazing view. Easier to walk up to than the Table Mountain, mainly b/c there is a clear wide path guiding you to the top. The walk isn't very steep and pretty easy. There are several benches along the way to rest or have lunch, and the higher you get, the better the view. You will be able to see Cape Town and its ocean from different sides. An absolutely stunning view. There are beautiful flowers along the path as well. The final parts are a little more steep and you'll need to climb a ladder (there is a real ladder installed there so no worries, it's easy). I believe the walk from the 'entrance point' (it's free but there is a little information cabin) to the top took us about 1 hour. Nice to walk your dog here too (which we saw several people doing).
Another scenic spot on the landscape. A standout icon as you ride the cable car to Table Mountain. Great views and photo opportunities.A little unsure re the naming - most lions would be insulted.

Great views, definitely worth it. Fantastic experience climbing up Lions Head. We took a taxi from our city hotel to the car park at the entrance to the walk (right off the top of Kloof Nek road) for R50. It's a relatively easy walk up for the first 30 mins or so thereafter it becomes a scramble over rocks and up a couple of ladders. Make sure to wear good walking boots and stretchy trousers (for the big steps up). It's well worth the short climb for the fabulous 360deg views over Cape Town, Table Mountain and Camps Bay. We finished our walk by heading towards Signal Hill then towards the city. however note that this returns via the back of Bo Kaap and we felt a little uneasy as we strolled through the housing estate in our hiking gear, clearly tourists!! Wouldn't recommend this walk on a wild day as I'm sure that a strong gust of wind might result in you taking the fastest route down!! Sun cream, a camera and sunglasses a must.
Breath-taking views. Initially an easy hike, becomes a more strenuous climb the higher you go. The view from the top is definitely worth it. Comfy shoes, lots of water and sunscreen a must!

totally unmissable!. The view from the top of Lion's Head is amazing and the walk to reach the edge is even better!The hiking would approximately take 1.30 - 2.30 hours if you start directly from the city center, otherwise it takes approximately 30-50min from Signal Hill. You walk surrounded by wonderful nature and, paying a bit of attention, you may see agames and common snakes relaxing on the rocks near the path. This hiking is quite easy (you can find people of any age on the track) and it does not require any special equipment (I went there just with my tennis-shoes), but there are some short sections near the edge where you should use also your arms.
Serious Trek. Brilliant views and a good practice for Table Mountain!best to be coming down at Sunset. Beautiful views ( only if in a group )

Excellent Trek. the changing views around the 270 degree trek would take your breadth away. worth every lost breath going up the mountain. must do for people fond of walking- hardly takes 45 mins to go up.
Great sunset shots. nice sunset, I went on the city bus tour, take some food as you stay a while and there isn't much on offer when you get their except for a mobile coffee van with a few candy bars.

A fairly hard climb. This is a fairly strenuous walk, not for the faint hearted. I am in my 50's but still manage it quite well, but be prepared. Amble alone if you're not quite fit but do try it. The view from the top over Clifton and the Camps Bay area is breath taking.

Beautiful, even in winter.. It was a cold, windy, little bit stormy day and we loved it! Beautiful photo ops. Advise, bring your own tissue and sanitizer, cuz restrooms are not equipped with any out there. Wish we could have stayed longer.

Reason I came to Cape Town and well worth it!. Seeing pictures from atop Lions Head was the reason I looked into coming to CT. My first day here I was going up but turned back due to bad winds, heavy clouds and no sun! Day two was rain all day. At 9AM on day three I saw the sun coming out and raced up to the top. AMAZING views at the top and on the way up. Definitely fun to scramble over the rocks and up a few ladders. Just incredible at the top in a clear day, you can see everything from Table Mountain, the Twelve Apostles, Robben Island and the city itself. If you are in CT, do this hike.

Climb Lion's Head. This was a fairly easy walk the majority of the way becoming quite challenging in the latter stages, though my husband and two sons (one 15yrs the other 10yrs) would say otherwise. They all loved it and didn't find it hard or scary at all! Being a bit wary of heights I found the last bit quite difficult as there was some clambering up fairly steep rocks, including a couple of ladders and I knew we would have to return the same way on the descent. The view from the top was spectacular, especially of Table Mountain, and there is a fairly large flat area at the top to sit and eat a packed lunch. Being unfamiliar with the route we booked a guided walk and would highly recommend Margaret Mcurran of Table Mountain Walks, who collected us and dropped us back at our apartment and is extremely knowledgable about the area.

Not for the faint hearted!. Capetonians will fool you into thinking its jut a walk uphill but it's a climb! Especially 3/4 up, it becomes a cliff, where you're climbing over and above rocks, with chains to ensure you've got a firm grip and not slip off. The payout is incredible all round views but fair warning, not for the faint hearted or the unfit!

If you can only make it out. The view from camps bay was superb, and making out the Lion Head was just one of the things you get to see with tremendous joy, not to mention the so called twelve apostles peak. All in all an excellent ride into this lovely part of the Cape area. Highly recommended!

Fantastic Hike!. This hike is well worth the effort. You get a 360 degree view of Cape Town, one of the most beautiful cities on the planet. The lower part is a moderately steep grade and the upper part involves some easy rock scrambling. It gets crowded on weekends/holidays so on those days go early.

You are rewarded when you get to the top. This is the most amazing climb. It was a Sunday and quite busy. As have been previously posted, you see every age range from youngsters to strident pensioners. And how the dogs manage I have no Idea. I walked from Bantry Bay up through the posh houses at the base of the park , and then just kept walking up. It takes a good 90mins from sea level to peak, but when you get there.....what a phenomenal view. A 360 degree panorama, taking in Table mountain, camps bay, signal hill and Cape Town itself. The last section could be challenging for some, requiring a fair amount of scrabbling up rocks.I'll take the advice next time and go up for the sunset with a glass of wine.....sounds stunning

Harder, but shorter hike than Table Mountain. I hiked Lion's Head in time for sunset--wow! I had underestimated how vertical the hike is, but it's not too strenuous. The views all the way around (and the hike wraps around the mountain about three times) are absolutely gorgeous. I saw so many rainbows, too. Much fewer ppl on this hike compared with Table Mountain, so go with a (strong) friend. This hike was totally worth it.

A Great Short Hike with Awesome Views. The hike is challenging but very accessible, I've seen children of all ages and even dogs take part. Make sure you wear proper shoes though as flip flops might cause you problems on the ladder section.If you go up to watch the sunset and stay enjoying wine etc, remember to pack a torch for the way down!

Hard and long --- but worth it!!!. The first time I went up to the top I had my dogs with me! What an experience!! and even if you think now poor dogs, they actually did enjoy it more than I did!!After the first relaxing walk to the climbs it gets rather steep. But for all those that are a bit squeamish about heights, there is an alternative walk past the first climb!Make sure yo bring proper shoes!! It is more a walk than a climb, but you want to be on the safe side!! And be aware that there is no water facility at the top and there is no shade up there!! For the descent there could be a separate route, because you keep running into people on their way up all the time, but it definitely is worth it!!Plan about 4 hrs!!! Not everyone can run the whole distance like some overly fit people do!! Otherwise have fun and enjoy!!

Exercise in the most gorgeous setting.... If you want to keep fit, see the most amazing views of table mountain, Camps Bay, Sea Point and surrounding peninsula as well as the CBD...Lions Head is a must!!! A sunset walk is best as the view of the sun setting into the Atlantic ocean is breathtaking. If you are in Cape Town for the full moon, alot of the locals go up traditionally ...so try not to miss it!!! Word of advise, dont go up on your own if you are a woman, especially when there are not alot of other hikers. Though in more recent years the South African National Parks Board officers have been really brilliant by being a real presence on the mountain...
great hike. wonderful views from the top and really a wonderful hike. It's fun and challenging. I liked very much the views from every angle
Slight degree of difficulty - accessible for most. A lovely hike with options at the top for those that are more adventurous, take a picnic and enjoy the views at the top.

great walk. I am not fit so battled a bit but very enjoyable, could not do the ladders so had to walk round. Great way to spend a morning. There are also organised trips, check them out on the internet.

Worth the walk. I have walked Lion's Head twice now. It starts with a steepish walk up the road, but after that it is easy enough walking on well laid out mountain paths. There are 3 sections of scrambling up slopes with Chains and iron grips for assistance. After the second of these is a great pause-spot at the foot of a massive pine tree where you can take photos of table mountain and prepare for the last push to the top.The summit is crowned by a beacon and has 360degree vistas of Cape Town, Camp's Bay and the peninsula.It is worth the effort. It can be climbed at night to watch the moon rise as well - although I have not done this.

Breathtaking views for the fit. For those who like walking up a mountain, takes an hour to two hours depending on level of fitness and offers unbelievable 360 degree views. Two routes up....one requires climbing up rocks using a chain ladder and chains...can be circumvented for a slightly longer route.
Well worth it. Decided to climb Lion's Head with a friend. Wear very comfortable shoes! Don't rush as there are many photo opportunities. Took about 1 hour to talk up and 30 mins to come back down.

Full Moon viewing. Every month, weather permitting, many people climb Lion's Head to view the Full Moon rising. This event is highly recommended.People who are reasonably fit will find this an experience that is shared by many.The view of Cape Town City at night is also enchanting.

Still can't see lion's head in this :). We didn't bother going all the way to the top but heaps of people seem to be doing it all the time, even running it. The views of Table Mountain and 12 Apostles are great.

A fun hike, with amazing views of Table Mountain. This hike was a lot of fun, not particularly long or difficult (kids can regularly be seen enjoying it), it's a lot of fun, with rocks to clamber over, ladders to scale, and chains to hold on to. All the while, you rotate around the peak as you make your way up, with views that get progressively better as you continue. The top is magnificent, with 360 degree panoramas of Table Mountain and Cape Town. Very highly recommended.

Great Hike in the City. Lion's Head is a lovely hike to do right in the heart of Cape Town. Easily accessible by car (although parking can be a challenge) and relatively accessible by public transit, this 1.5-2 hour hike is well worth the spectacular views. There are some steep points but since the hike is not very long, it is manageable for most people with reasonable levels of fitness.

Amazing View. The hiking trail on Lion's Head is relatively easy, and has amazing views as you are climbing the mountain. When you get to the top, you have views that are even more beautiful than when you are on Table Mountain.
My favorite. My favorite thing to do after work. It's safe, well trodden, and a marvelous hour long workout (if you really go for it). I do this every day that I can.
Good for sunset walks. Try walking up or even around the base for panoramic views of the city and ocean. Very popular for full moon hikes but can be very congested then.

One of the best ways to spend sunset. Climbed here with a friend spur of the moment for sunset. Nice little climb up, took us 1 hour as we were enjoying the views and taking many photos all the way up. Stunning scenery and great atmosphere once you get to the top. Bring food and drink (even champagne) for a beautiful way to see the sunset over the ocean. As soon as the sun set we started the descent before it became too dark. We saw a few people slip over, so a piece of advice from me would be to bring a torch!
Drive up Lions Head. Ideal spot for a picnic or just to enjoy the views of Cape Town and Table Mountain. Safe and secure, good amenities, many tourists.
A great full moon experience. Great to climb and witness full moon.... also a not too demanding hike.... very popular and on Full moon nights there is quite a crowd.I wouldnt do it alone for safety.
Charming Little Mountain. This was one of my favorites as it was so sweet all on its own. No where near the size of Table Mountain but it holds charming none the less.

better views than table mountain. loved this hike because it's relatively short (depending on your ability) and the views are better than table mountain in my opinion. if you're a serious hiker, this is a piece of cake and table mountain will be more of your cup of tea. however, you cant beat the views you get from lion's head because you get a little bit of everything (cityscape, nature, etc.). i will be doing this hike hopefully a few more times before i leave. just make sure you carry at least 1L of water so that you dont get dehydrated. there are cabs everywhere at the bottom of the hike so that you can get to your next destination after the hike.
Good views. Once you have finished visiting Table Mountain make a quick trip here and you will not be disappointed. Its stunning again and you get to see the other side of CT
Always such a treat!. The view that Lions head provides on a beautiful clear day, never ceases to amaze me! Or even on a clear evening when the moon is full.

worth every tired muscle.. Climbing mountains has never been so fun! We hiked up to the head in a group of 5 and it takes a while to get up there, but the view was breath-taking and worth all the trouble.

Perfect way to start the day.... We opted to head up around 7am so that we would be on the hike while the sun rose. It was spectacular. The earlier the better if you want solitude. The numbers of people increase as soon as the sun is up. Make sure you bring a camera.

Must Do At Sunset. Very glad I climbed this. Looking at it you would think it wouldn't be possible but it's actually pretty easy. Just get a cab and tell them to take you to Lion's Head and away you go. Takes around 40 minutes if you are taking your time. Go in time to watch the sunset as it's truly amazing, definitely the most memorable one I've witnessed!

Perrenial Favourite of mine. I try to hike up Lion's Head 5-10 times a year. My children have been doing this hike since they were about 6. It's a great morning or afternoon hike. Take a picnic for the top. Evnign sundowners are great up there in summer, or else a daytime picnic on a sunny winter day is lovely too. I love it up there and the views are gorgeous. Especially the sunset views. It is a reasonably strenuous walk, but not that tough.

Be active and climb the Lion's head, a great experience. A very beautifull walk/climb to the Lion's head. I went there with my son and 2 grandsons (6 and 8 years). We had a great walk and climbing experience. Not too difficult, but enough to sya, that was a great achievement !!

Awesome sunset. Maybe the most wonderful sunset i ever saw.Go early to have a nice place, get a cot, because the wind is there too.And if you go earlier than the sunset get some food and water, there is no place out there to buy anything :)

nice climbing. Good alternative for Table mountain because you have to walk to the top by yourself. The views are spectecular. The climb itself is best done in the early morning hours because its rather cold than.
Needs more than two hours!. We thought we had enough time, but to really enjoy it and not be rushed, take more time than what we were told (two hours) to climb all the way to the top!

BEST DAY OF MY LIFE. climbing this nearly killed me, I am a young women (not very active) but after seeing it from my hotel window everyday thought i would give it a try. took around an hour and a half to get to the top, just in time for sunset. and my gosh, the best view my eyes have ever seen. there were a few clouds in the sky, and some of my best travel pictures are from the top of this place!

great views. A much easier hike than Table Mtn, with great views! The top portion with the chains and hand holds was a nice change from the gradual hill in the beginning and also gave you some security on the way up, especially when the winds pick up!

Worth the detour. The lion's head seen from the top of the table mountain is beautiful, but it is even better to see it and stop for a picture or two on your way to Cape of Good Hope. The view is just stunning! Best time is around 16.00 hour, before sundowner.
Views. Views that take your breath away accompanied wonderful weather made for a lovely afternoon taking lots of photos from all angles.

Best Views, best outdoor party!. Lion's Head is surely the place to be if you're after a stunning view of Table Mountain. The hike to the top take about an hour, less if you're really fit, and more if you stop en route to admire the ever-changing scenery.From one point you are graced with uninterrupted views of coast, mountain, and city!There are two options, one via some well-placed and recently installed steps and chains (marine grade stainless steel) and one slightly longer walk to avoid this. Either way, it's a lovely hike.On and for a few days before full moon, hundreds of people, locals and visitors alike, walk up Lion's Head and sit on top in what must be the best outdoor "party" in Cape Town. I've met people from a wide variety of places up there and even made good friends from these trips!

Best city hike. This is a relatively easy hike right in the city. If you're reasonably fit, there's no reason why you can't do this hike.The first part is very easy to navigate -- just follow the jeep track and then the path. The problem comes when you get up to the chains. If you don't want to climb the chains, then you'll need to find the alternative route. If you've been climbing this route every week, it's easy. But if you've never done it before, you can get lost, and falling is a reality. So be careful!Also, definitely don't take any valuables with you, even your rings and watch. And I always attach my car key to my clothes in case my backpack gets taken from me. I've never once had a bad experience -- or any type of robbery experience -- when hiking on Lion's Head. But I've read about enough cases to take precautions. Also, make sure you don't go up alone, and even if you're in a group, make sure you're walking at a time of day when there are others around. So early Sunday morning you'll be fine -- if you don't mind the crowds! Get there at 7am summer, 8am winter, to have just enough people. Any later and it's hectic!Take water! And please take your rubbish off the mountain -- one sweet wrapper, one cigarette butt, a banana peel -- you're ruining the environment if you leave those behind.

Lions Head. a day out for leisure its what it was meant to be...but the scenic drive up the mountain to Lions Head is the best and at the top, you have this perfect 360 degrees view of Cape Town. picture perrrrfect.

A thrilling must in Cape Town. Easy accessible for young and old - but a bit exposed close to the top. Extraordinary beautiful views. An abslolute must to hike up there for everyone visiting Cape Town.
Stunning views. A short walk around the base of Lions Head is not too difficult - the more adventurous can climb it. It gives you beautiful views and is a nice way to spend some time outdoors.

Lion's Head. The best way to look at Lion's head is from far away. It is a mountain and like any mountain, you can see a "shape" which resembles something and this mountain, quite close to Table Mountain and Signal Hill is just that. Looking from far away, you can see the "Lion's Head". The more adventurous can climb it too but there is nothing else than that!
Scenic view. If you look at this rocky outcropping just the right way, it does look a bit like a lion's head. I would not hike to see this--look for it through a vehicle's window.

Wonderful view, worth the effort. Climbed it one morning last week before it got too warm. It's a decent effort to climb, not as easy as I expected but at the same time, anyone taking their time and in a reasonably fit state should be able to get to the top. The 360 degree view is stunning.
vis. views from lion point to die for fantastic on a clear day you can see for miles table top mountain signal hill all across down to coasts three anchorages bay mouille point hout bay etc etc

Cape Town at a glance. This is well worth the drive out, be patient in terms of hikers as many families do the slow walk with their kids. Cape Town at a glance with some history to everything as well. Wear comfortable shoes, have a bottle of water handy and some sweets as there's no shop close by. Lots of people picnic right there as well (nice idea on a hot day) and dont forget the camera to capture the stunning views and add to that memory box.

Easy hike!. I went there with a guide, but this can easily be done alone. A lot of locals use this as a quick hike before or after work to get some workout. The views are great. Little exposure and I do recommend if you've got the time to go up on top. The top is flat and a lot of places to sit.
Full Moon Walk. Must do, weather permitting. Fantastic views, friendly atmosphere, remember to take a torch for the walk down.

Awesome views. mmmmmmmmmm, the smell of cape town and the yes the view is spectacular with a touch of the cold breeze. Fiesty hikers and tourists trying to get the best pics. Will advise them tourists to try base jumping form there :)
indeed a lion. The lion head mountain from the camp bay is the most beautiful sight to behold. The white sandy beach of the camps bay is also so beautiful white the waves behind.
A wow experience. A must go for those who love trekking. View the town from the top. Experience the clouds covering you.

What's not to like?. Cape Town is surrounded by beauty and the views are unsurpassable. Lion's Head is no exception - an easier hike up than to the Table itself, and quick to get down. It is a pity, however, that the path has become a dusty highway - the price you pay for popularity. Wear hiking boots (the road is rough), always carry enough water, and take a warm top and/or rain gear - you never know. Doing the hike at full moon is a glorious option - we didn't even need a torch to find the way down.

Quick, tough and scenic. Beautiful views of the 12 apostles, the Atlantic seaboard, and the city bowl. Best to do on an evening where the moon will be full so as to catch the sun set and the moon rise. Better done with proper tackles and take water.

awesome views and nice climb. awesome views and cool climb up, moestly walking but further up you will need to do some climbing. (as in hanging from chains and metal fixtures to go up a 4.5 meter wall)Once up it's awesome, but be sure it's not windy1

Awesome view and a great workout. We ventured over to Lion's Head because the skyline to table mountain was closed and the summit was clouded over, which is pretty common. If you want a great view in less time, head across the way to Lion's Head! The whole hike up and down took us about 2 hours, spending 20 minutes at the summit to take in the sights and some water. The path gets very narrow towards the end with two routes to choose from that lead to the top. Take the longer route (no chains or staples to climb) and get several 360 degree turns around the mountain with great views of all the local communities. Plus, all the tourists and people wanting to be "extreme" think the chains and staples are so great that they form lines to go up and down them. I wasn't hiking to wait in line, I just wanted to go up and down. On that note, there are normally lots of tourists and locals alike on this hike, so be courteous and give way to older people and the large groups. Some of the locals even enjoy RUNNING up and down this peak, so be courteous and give way to these extreme athletes!

Better than Table Mountain! Great hike!. We loved our hike on Lion's Head, it starts as an easy trail winding around the mountain with lots of birds to spot and great views. It then becomes a bit more difficult, there are two routes, one using chains and ladders up and a slightly longer, flatter route. The top is flat also so you can sit and take in the spectacular vista. It is a challenging hike at times so good footwear would be advisable but even if you only do the walking trail at the start you'll have a great time.

good view all round. its a short hike up lions head (not hard at all) takes about 1.5 hrs for someone of reasonable fitness. awesome 360 views of cape town and camps bay from the top, just bring some water and perhaps a banana and of course your camera

If you can, then go for it..!. If your health & travel plans permit, then climb the Lion's Head Mountain...it is a much more satisfying experience than taking a cable car to the top of Table Mountain. The views are comanding either way, but the satisfaction is so much greater when you reach the top of Lion's Head on your two feet.Make sure you have water (lots of it) and maybe a picnic-type celebretory lunch/dinner for after your climb. You will surely want to sit back and capture the moment.

A great climb. Start in the parking lot, and go up either left or right around the mountain. Almost at the top, one can chose to go up chains, or to walk around. I reccomend to do this trip by full moon, to see the sun go down, and walk down in the light of the moon.

Full moon hike. A wonderful experience to celebrate a birthday. Strenuous walk but definitely worth the effort. It's a lot more difficult than most people expect. There should be warnings at the car park and re moment rations to take water, warm jacket, good shoes and espe I ally a torch. Many if not most people were underprepared and did not realise the extent or difficulty of the hike. An information board giving details and expected duration and risks should be clearly visible. .

Extension of Table Mountain. Table Mountain is one side and Lions Head the other side separated by Kloof Neck....the Round House restaurant used to here not sure is it still is but as kids we used to climb up this mountain and make tree houses. Still enjoy driving here and looking at the breathtaking views of Camps Bay and Clifton.

Hiking. This is a hike for intermediate hikers. Do not attempt this hike if the most exercise you've done in the past year was stretch at your desk. It's about an hour to the top depending on your pace but the view when you get to the top is spectacular!!! Definitely a task to add the the bucket list.

Whatever the local say - it is a one day activity. You see it in movies and on postcards, the peak Lions Head at the south end of signal hill, dividing Cape Town into City Center and Sea Point. Locals and taxi drivers told us that it is a 1, max 2hour hike... We believed them and went there after breakfast thinking we would be back to lunch. They also told us that it would be an easy walk, that you COULD climb a shortcut if you wanted to, but otherwise there was an easy path around it. We believed that too and went in normal shoes (!). What we DID do right was to bring a water bottle, shades and sun protection (hats). All together this turned out to be one of the most exciting and beautiful experiences ever in Cape town area. It is a must! On the top there were individuals, couples ans small groups of people, meditating, eating or having conversation. But there was this magical respect for the greatness of Nature and the magical feeling that you really made it up (as they all did up here). Now you were entitled to enjoy the breathtaking, 360 degree view! There were groups of retired people, middle aged and youngsters. It is challenging bu possible. It is not a walk in the park though. A couple of times you even have to climb on ladders (!). But we already are hoping for weather when we can do it again! This cost nothing and is not promoted in the ordinary tourist fliers. This is a genuine, almost spiritual experience!

Amazing views. You can reach the base walking point of Lions Head via Signal Hill but be very careful and climb in a group. Best just to get a taxi to drop you off and avoid the car being broken into. Take a walking stick and watch out for snakes!

Best thing we did on this trip!. If you want to do something what the people in Capetown do, this is the thing to do. You meet people who do it every week.
