You need at least a half a day to do this and enjoy it fully. A fantastic experience that can not be described in words. You just have to do it! It will be a memory for your whole life! Go for it!

Never gets old. I have lived in Cape Town for 2 years now. I have been up Lion's head about 30 TIMES IN THE PAST 5 MONTHS (conservative estimate). I take every opportunity I have to do this hike. It is quick (about an hour up if you are of average fiteness level). I have a fear of heights, and thus always use "alternative route" which avoids climbing up the chains. There are two ladders (which might be a problem for those with severe vertigo), but they are very sturdy. A definite must-do!

Swallow your nervousness the scrambling is worth it!!. Walked up the mountain with excited 9 year old who saw it as a challenge! Certainly in parts the climb made me apprehensive for my own safety let alone my mountain goat son. 13 year old took it in his stride though.The vertical nature of the climb in parts, especially coming back down, takes your breathe away but the sense of achievement on reaching a wide flattish summit worthy the fast beat of your heart.Was hot and we are fit. Not for anyone who can't hike on the flat at a reasonable pace for at least 2 hours

Lion's Head. We watched the paragliders launch off Lion's Head for several days from our patio. A perfect place for paragliding if the winds are right, as they were able to ridge soar along Table Mountain before landing at the waterfront, amazing rides. Next time!

One the the world's best 90min exercise opportunities. Budget 90 - 120 min to get up and down from the car park, and this will be the best exercise budget you ever spent (and it's free)! It is a fantastic workout, you can go as hard or slow as you like, and the environment and views are mind-blowing. Tip - take a half-litre of water.

Lion's Head Offers a Nice, Uneventful Walk and a Great View of Table Mountain. This mountain offers some native vegetation and a wonderful view of Table Mountain, especially when clouds shroud the big mountain and nature plays a spectacular game with light.
Great views. A very enjoyable hike for some very rewarding views. Accessible for even the most inexperienced hikers like myself! Definitely worth a visit.

You really should climb it!. The city of Cape Town is surrounded by mountains, there fore it is only right that you should get to the peak of at least one whilst you are in Cape Town!Lion's Head is more manageable than Table Mountain, doesn't eat as much of your time whilst scaling it, but still manages to give you a great workout, and rewards you with stunning views of the city.

Heady heights. We went up Lions Head on a clear night, with a full moon. Obviously, these are prime conditions and as such, it can get super crowded. None the less, it is worth it on a night like this. One needs a certain level of fitness and a bit of a head for heights too! Even better if you can take some wine up with you but please, don't leave anything behind when you leave - let's keep this place rubbish free.
Great exercise. Love being out and about.. it's very full if you don't go early enough on a weekend, and can get very hot, so make sure to take adequate water with you.

Scenic splendour. This was packed, windy, fun and scary with a mosque - what a view the only one of the stadium. Plenty of families eating delicious ice cream and paintings for sale. A must see for locals and tourists alike -lovely cape town for all to see.

Amazing Views. If you are an avid hiker this hike is a piece of cake. If you are not used to working out it could be a tough stroll. But, the views along the hike will be worth all of your effort. Plus there is no charge to park at the entrance.
For the love of immagination, couldn't make out the lion. Best viewed from table mountain, from the cable car, or any other suitable vantage point in the area...impressive rock feature nonetheless.
A great view if the city. Good for a sunset trip, it's like going up the Rockefeller in New York, because you can vie the Empire State, this is true of viewing Table Mountain

great day out. This is one of the things to do in Cape Town.The whole family climbed Lions Head including my 4 year old.Near the top it became a little stressful for my wife and son so they stayed behind and took in the great view.It was a Sunday so lots of people on the climb,we felt safe all the time and we had a police car on patrol on the road.We did however notice a guy walking past cars and checking to see if the doors were unlocked.so becareful on quite days and do not take valueables a long.

Underrated. What do u see when u come into kappstad only table mountain and instantly you want to go up it..but look right and its lion head..go up it the views are amazing 360 degrees, looking down on camps,looking over at table mountain,down on the city bowl,across to robin island..u turn u see it, good walk up but so worth it

Full Moon Hike. I hiked up Lion's Head about an hour before sunset on the night of a full moon. I should have started earlier, it was such a large crowd so there were queues at many points along the way. The first half of the hike is easy and straight forward. Those who doubt their ability or are afraid of heights can stop here and still have amazing views of the sunset and sights below. The majority of the remaining hike is challenging, not always marked, and frequently on a narrow trail with an unprotected drop on one side. This being said, there are young children hiking the trail, it is not dangerous but you must be careful. It took just over an hour to reach the top, where many others were laying around and watching the moon rise. The views from the top are amazing and totally worth the hike up. The climb back down was a bit tricky because I didn't bring a torch and had run out of water. I would definitely recommend bringing a torch, and more than one small bottle of water.
A bit of imagination and you see a lion. It's another landmark you cannot miss. The nature is beautiful. The walk takes about 90 minutes to reach the top. Carry enough water when walking

Take the Night Bus Tour for Sunset. Taking the night bus tour, which is free if you bought the 2-day pass, head up to signal hill for cracking views over cape town, table mountain and lions head - remember your picnic but if you're lucky the man with a van with a real expresso/cappucino machine in the back will serve you a good coffee.

Amazing views of the City. Loved everything about Lions Head, no better place to view the Sunset and amazing views of Table Mountain. We met a local artist and bought one of his paintings. So many happy memories of our times in South Africa, we can't keep away.

Geat hike. An excellent hike up the Mt. Amazing views all around. Bring some water because you will need it. The trail is well marked and challenging to a novise hiker. It proved much more difficult then I had thought which is why I enjoyed the hike so much.

Great view, but difficult trail.. It takes quite a while to climb it and I did not go all the way to the top as I am scared of hights and the trail gets very steep towards the end. But it is worth it to go there just for the view as you can see everything from there.

Incredible view. We got up at 5am to climb the Lion's Head to get up there for the sunrise! It took us about an hour to get up there and the view was incredible. The trail was quite steep and would rate it as difficult but it was definitely worth it. I am sure going up there for Sunset is beautiful as well. It was a memorable experience.
Excellent views; be ready for the wind. Our tour occurred on a very windy day, so instead of going to Table Mountain, we went to Lion's Head. The views were amazing.
Great for climbers,walkers,hikers. The walk isn't too difficult if you are reasonably fit, but not in the heat of day - take enough water. The views and sunsets are spectacular!

A hard walk to a hardcore view. The walk all the way up to the top is hard and not the safest, when you haven't really prepared footwear-wise. But the stunning view made me forget the sweat on my back and my tired legs. Breathtaking in more than one way.

Hike up Lions Head. This was a really nice hike however there is some climbing involved and one should take a drink and possibly a snack for the top. You have to be relatively fit for this hike and it takes about 2-2.5 hours
Drive, Hike or Bike. Great city park for all walks of life. Nature trails for hikers or a winding mountain road for cars & cyclists to the plateau which offers stunningly picturesque city views.

Breathtaking views from the top of the Lions head. What a great hike up Lions Head near table mountain. Parking available on the road as one drives up signal hill , the hike is a must for anyone visiting Cape Town. Managed to hike up , spend time at the top and enjoyed the spectacular views of Cape Town and table mountain and signal hill and Robben island and hike down within 3 hours. The walk is strenuous as need to climb chain ladders , boulders , rocks and not the average easy walk. However very enjoyable and views are stunning. mistake we made is start the hike very late in the morning at 9 am when is was very hot. Should have started earlier and will definitely hike again when in Cape Town and if time permitting. Interesting and good workout
Hike up Lion's Head. It means an early rise but if you can do this walk at 6ish in the morning it is amazing - stunning views once you get to the top and well worth the effort.

Best hiking adventure!!!!. My husband and I ventured to Lion's Head and hiked up the mountain in just a little over 1 hour. Make sure to take sunscreen if it's sunny!!! Most incredible views from the top!! I would recommend wearing sneakers! Set aside 3-4 hours though so you can take some time to enjoy some food and drinks at the top (bring your own)

Go at sunset!. This is a beautiful place to go and watch the sun set.Don't expect it to be a secluded and romantic affair though, because while you sit there, coaches and cars of other people turn up to do the very same!One couple had the right idea - they had turned up early with a blanket and picnic, complete with champagne!The colours changed in the sky so frequently, I took a lot of the same photo!

Wonderful Start to a Morning. Why not start an early morning with a hike? This is to me one of the best "before work" exercises and is always pleasant! Meet new people and just start the day quite positive! The views are stunning and the walk always fun, it does get busy sometimes and then the up/down might take a bit long, but hey, stuck in nature, why not!

Climb was easier than expected. Great views from top of Table mountain and Cape Town Bay. Path is easy to follow for most of the climb with only a couple of more strenuous sections. There is one section which requires climbing up metal wrungs and chains which less agile people would find difficult but there is an alternative route marked. Worth the effort of the climb.

Take plenty of water. My wife and I hiked and climbed to the top but did not appreciate how tough some of the climb was, you must be of reasonable fitness, have proper sport shoes, a head for heights and plenty of water. To ascend and descend takes about 2-3hours but well worth the effort

Best place to be at dusk. Many young and mature people come here to see the sun setting with a glass of wine or just for a picnic during the day. We've been told that they used to quarry stones from that mountain, maybe, but a nice place to be anyway, and the views are spectacular.
Birds Eye View. A relatively easy walk and if you go up on a full moon be prepared to share the path with plenty of other hikers. Pack a picnic and find yourself a spot to take in the glorious views.

Easy start..then take care. Good parking. Great views. The first part of the walk has amazing views over Camps Bay pn a wide accessible road, but as the path steepens you'll find iron ladders and , worryingly, runners pushing past you on the narrow sections. The day after we did the path a man fell to his death from the higher upper sections, so take care..but hey...how long do you need to live?All joking aside. It's a great day out. Take your lunch.

Lions Head. I love Lions Head, especially in a full moon with a picnic hamper. Lions head does tend to get overcrowded on a good day and there is very little shelter from the heat so plenty of liquid is advisable - Lions Head has a few hazardous places which the visitor needs to be aware of and lives have been lost on what most people perceive to be a straightforward easy climb. Extreme care should be taken at all times. Alcohol is not a good idea on Lions Head in my opinion, it could impair judgement and this could have disastrous consequences.
Hike it. If you have time and energy, just hike it. It is not so hard and you can see around the mountain 360 degrees.
Quiet and beautiful at sunrise. I started hiking early enough to be on top at sunrise. Even on a Sunday, I only saw two other people in fifteen minutes on the peak. It was a great experience.

Great hike, amazing views. Always a very enjoyable outing. Go early in summer time, as it can get very hot & busy. Go steady the first 15 minutes - it's the worst part of the hike, so don't judge it just by how you feel then! Take it easy, take a snack / coffee, and take a lot of pictures.

Uphill all the way - but worth it. Do not leave this too late in the day, if you are hiking in the summer. it gets intensely hot up there. Take water, and a hat. It's uphill all the way, but you go round the peak and get incredible views - on one side of the City Bowl and Table Mountain, on the other, the sprawl of Camps Bay beneath the Hottentots-Holland mountains. Some bits take you into the shade, thank heavens, we found ourselves panting from the heat! We only walked up to the ladder - this took us an hour. Although we hike regularly, we are by no means at peak fitness - we were told the entire trip to the top would take an hour, so we were disappointed in only reaching the Ladder before time constraints meant we had to turn back. There is good parking for cars at the bottom of the hill, free. And a small booth selling a basic selection of water

Awesome hike. A relatively short hike up to the peak. Should take about an hour to go up for a person of average fitness. Some of the best views in Cape Town. The views are also 360degree views! The hike up also has 'the chains' which is basically for the slightly more adventurous - it's rock climbing on a smaller scale. Highly recommended. Try to go near full moon for the moonlight hike. Start just before the sun set, watch the moon come up, and hike down in the moonlight. Avoid the day of full moon as it gets very crowded. Take some water and sandwiches as there are no shops up on top!

One of our favourite walks around Cape Town.. If the guide book tells you this is straightforward and will only take you 45 minutes to get up then you would have to be young and very fit. Allow 1hour 30 minutes to get and go early morning to avoid the heat of the day. There are a couple of ladders and a little hand work up some small sections but these are fairly straight forward. The views are just wonderful.

Great Views. Parking is easy and the first part of the walk a steady climb on a dusty path which then turns to boulders and steps but still relatively easy although there are handgrips and a ladder at one point.Great views over the Bay, Cape Town itself and of course up to Table Mountain.It can get very windy so be cautious and take plenty of water and sunblock.
Don't miss it!. This is a fantastic short hike with amazing views of Cape Town and the coast, and of course with Table Mountain in the background.
Nice alternative to Table Mountain. Easy to park. Watched people taking of doing their para glide. Nice ice cream from the man in the van.

Fantastic hike with great views. No need to be super fit to do this one, really worth a hike up there and then chill out on the top with some fantastic views although be a bit careful if its a windy day!

Lion's Head. Apparently it looked like a lion's head when the first explorers arrived from the sea? It is a good walk up to the top, but we chose to walk around it, ending near where we parked. It was about an hour's hike, stopping along the way to admire the view over Cape Town city and the coastline and the rest of the mountain as it disappears towards Cape Point. You get a good idea of the layout of the city and peninsula. Many locals hike to the top after work or on moonlit nights. Do it!!Oh yes, it is very safe but don't let valuables lay around in your car.

HAVE TO GO UP THERE!! YOU MUST!!. Went there with my brother and my mother. Mother did not make it till the top but we did. And man.. A-M-A-Z-I-N-G !! And so much fun to clim up. Good work out! also. Use sun block otherwise you will burn alive.

Not an easy walk, but worth it. Walked up here for the sunset. A good walk that isn't too physically tough but the scramble near the top tests the nerves slightly!
At the summit it was surprisingly busy and someone had brought music to spoil the occasion but it was still an unbelievable view.
Iconic. What would a trip to Cape Town be without seeing the Lion's Head? Take you time smell the roses and do take in the view.

A good walk with great views. We walked around Lions Head, but did not climb to the peak, which was a rather steep climb. The views of the beaches and mountains running down to the Cape Point, were very good, and you could see Robben Island in the distance. This is a fairly easy walk around the Head, and is worth the effort just for the views. You could easily combine this with a visit to Table Top Mountain. Roadside parking is available.

What a hike!!. I was lucky enough to have hiked Lion's Head on a perfectly clear day, so I had a lovely, lovely view from the top.But be warned - the last 30 minutes or so of the 90 minute hike up Lion's Head, is quite demanding - you will have to use your hands to scramble up and around rocks/boulders.BUT SO WORTH IT!!!
One of the best views in the World.... This is a great hike...and a must if you are up to it. Very special with great views. Best to do when it is not windy and early or after 6pm in the summer

exhilarating!. this somewhat challenging hike has all the rewards - for 360 degrees you can sit at the top and wonder at all of Cape Town below. be warned though that the top portion of the mountain requires a strong stomach as there are places where you have to grapple with rocks to continue the hike.
A must!. Easy to walk, view just sensational. We drove our car to the first pathway and walked up from there. We took our time taking photos etc so leave yourself about an hour.

Be Careful. Lions HEad is an awesome walk/hike/climb, but concentrate! There are loads of people running/jogging up the mountain and will push past you if you don't get out of the way in time. People have fallen off, and people have died - the most recent incident was a month or so ago.
Spoke Films. A unique view of Cape Towns beauty, the "Full Moon" hike allows the best of both sunlight and moonlight.
Brilliant Views from Up Top. Couldn't go to the top of Table Mount coz of bad weather, but the views from the top of Lion's Hear are mesmerizing and the 1.5 hour hike to the top seemed worth it!!

Be ready for a good climb!. Friends took my husband up Lion's Head one evening in the summer. He loved it, but be warned: It's not for the unfit, or the faint-hearted.There were sections where chains had to be used to clamber up the rocks near the top, and there were a few rather narrow areas to navigate.My husband was amazed to find some teenagers walking barefoot up the mountain, despite the scorpions (he saw a large one) and snakes in the area!Make sure you don't ever walk alone on the mountain. Always, always remain with a group for safety.

Not as Easy as Everyone Says. We started hiking at around 9 in the morning. After about fifteen minutes the hike narrowed and we started going upward more steeply- but at least we were in the shade. In an hour and a half, we reached the top. We were soaked with sweat as it was the middle of summer, but thankfully we had water, cookies, and grapes to snack on at the top. My brother and I took the more fun way- the way up the rock with chains and handles that you "use at own risk"- both up and down. Our parents took the much longer way and we had to wait at least ten minutes for them to catch up. The views (on a clear day, of course) of Table Mountain, Table Bay, Robben Island, and Cape Town are breathtaking. So are the two ladders that are necessary to get to the top. Don't go up wearing a skirt and sandals and expect to be done in an hour. Not like I did that, but I saw someone else. She was not smiling.

The best views of Cape Town !. If you reasonably fit, this is something that you have to do.Its gets really busy, but I can see why.Easy to climb and safe - that offers the most spectacular 360 Deg views of the city, from Clifton and camps bay beaches, the city below you, sea point, and the waterfront.Some parks are a bit tricky to climb up, so just be careful.Very popular in the late afternoon (for the awesome sun sets)!

beautiful sunset and moonrise. They hike is a little bit hard not everybody can do it. And the way back was really hard when it was dark without a flashlight. But the view on top of the mountain is amazing, especially when its full moon.
Long climb. Long climb to top; some places have lines where you must go up by peg and chain. Do not bring bags - use knapsack and pack light. Very nice views though. Pleasant people on trail

Amazing, but steep. Need to be fit to climb the top. This hike is amazing and offers great views! It is not that easy as described though, as approx.half the way is quite steep. You need to be fit and bring water and a hat. It took us an hour up and back down, we both exercise 3 times per week. Enjoy!

Very worthwhile but not nearly as easy as some claim. I would caution older and unfit people that the last half of this fabulous walk (from the chains or even before) is not as easy as some claim. Ignore the young people (or regulars) who say it can be done "easily" in less than an hour. You should allow at least 1.5 to 2 hrs each way, including rest stops, and maybe more on the way down as you'll be tired and it gets hot, especially if you go up in the morning and come down around midday. In summer you should start at sunrise or even earlier if you want to avoid the heat.

Amazing sunset. Besides the very nice trail to reach the top, the Lion' Head offers spectacular views over Cape Town, Green Point, Camps Bay and the Table Mountain.Go there during the afternoon and enjoy a breathtaking sunset!Don´t forger to take some warm clothes and water.

Jogging to the top & down at dawn. Enjoy the view and the fresh air at the end of a hot sunny day... and take the long path if you do not dare risking your life on a steep rock... Amazing feeling to be on the top of the rock.
Even harder climb. We climbed this on what was the hottest day of our trip.....but oh my ....well worth it for the view alone
It's Free. Great view of the city and Table Mountain and it's all free. I would definitely recommend it. Two stopping off points.

ON A GOOD DAY, UNBEATABLE VIEWS !. Lion's Head is not a difficult climb, but you should exercise caution, as it does require a degree of fitness, appropriate shoes and you should take care not to fall !If can easily be done in about 45 mins to one hour and for those who are fit, even in less time.I have climbed it several times, including with my grandsons as they turn 6/7 years old.One a clear (and should I say, preferably not windy and not cold) day, the views are fabulous.
Spectacular View. The most spectalar view of ocean, Robben Island, 12 Apolostles and Cape Town. Night time wonderful with lights.
Nice walk up with stunning views. You have to be fit to walk this one quickly, it took us 1,5 hours. To go up and down. Amazing views on Table Mountain and Cape Town.

Spectacular views. A lot of people have written that this is an easy hike, but it wasn't for me. I am of average fitness, I work out 4 times a week, and I was still struggling to climb the summit of this mountain. Make sure you take lots of water and wear a hat, it gets extremely hot and it can tire you out faster.Once you get there, it is definitely worth it. The 360 degree views are amazing. I'd do it again in a heartbeat, but I do want to caution that for amateur or inexperienced hikers/climbers it's quite a challenging hike.

Favourite hiking route. The easy accessability to the top of Lions Head makes it a favourite hiking route to many. we are treated to a 360 degree view of Cape Town.The visits to the top at full moon is always enjoyable and exciting.
Great views over the City bowl. Can be crowded, but that is because it is such a great place to be. Drive up to the parking, or hike to the top. Both are super rewarding.

Lions Head almost as good as Table Mountain. We were unable to get up to the top of table mountain on our first try so we went to Signal Hill. We could view Lions Head and Table Mountain and the City and surrounds from this point. Make sure you try it as an alternate if Table Mountain is closed.

Too windy for table mountain. We had a great walk up lion's head as table mountain had its tablecloth on big time, and cable car not running due to high winds. Wonderfull veiws - get talking to people at the top. We were lucky enough to meet a friendly local who gave us a 360 degree visual tour.

Great hike. Great hike! You can stay on the path if you like, or for the more adventurous you can practically rock scramble to the top. See it on a full moon night, get there early (5pm-ish) and bring a picnic dinner for the full experience. Once you get to the top (about 2 hours or so) settle down to your picnic, then watch the sunset (sunset was about 740pm...adjust your start time as appropriate). After which, you'll see the full moon, and if your timing is right, you'll get to see the full moon rising. Bring a headlamp for the hike down, but with the full moonlight you won't have too much need for it! Great way to end the day

Fantastic view of Table mountain and the 12 Apostles. Takes about 55 minutes to walk up... a wee bit of climbing at the end but brilliant brilliant views at the top. We did it near sunset and it was great light for photos

Fun Hiking. Lion's Head is one of the most fun hiking routes to do with friends and family. The last time I hiked up with friends, we all had backpacks filled with snacks and drinks and we ended up having supper at Lions Head. To watch the sun set from that view is priceless. This hike was good exercise and was not tough so it is suitable for people who are not extremely fit too.Take 2 Tours,Sanobia

A climb with amazing views. Lion's Head is not a gentle stroll and not for those who don't like heights. It ends up as a climb with some chains and steel ladders and gets very narrow towards the top. Having said that the views are stunning and it's fun to do.
Great climb, awesome views. A free tourist attraction in natural beauty...! Awesome! Be careful near the top. Not a difficult climb but certain degree of fitness required.

Beautifull views of city of cape town and the sea. Great views from this vantage point with visitor wooden view decks but dont expect any nice restaurant as there is none but just a ice cream vendor so take a packed meal/lunch
Fun quick hike.. Beware it needs some hand over hand and chain climbing at the top on one route. Great view of the city. Nice when you don't have the time for Table.

Something to do on a Sunday morning. If you ever wonder what to do whiles in Cape Town. Get your walking shoes on and walk up Lion's Head. It's all worth it and its for free. Remember to pack water and sun screen as you will need it.
Worth a climb. Take a picnic / bottle of wine up here and sit and watch the sunset. Advise you go in a group though.

Full moon hike. Full moon hike on lion's head rock! View is great - watch the sun set and the moon rise and the hike is not too tough (about an hour to the top) - go early as the whole of the Cape area is on the mountain on a good day with full moon.
Adventure and beauty. It was too windy, but we could do almost all the way, with great views of the Table Mountain, Camps Bay and Cape Town.

Stunning. A beautiful hike that will give you a good amount of exercise without wearing you down. The views from the top are stunning - full panoramic views of the city, the beaches and the bays, and is great for sunset watching.

Hike you could do over and over. No need for a guide --- Lion's Head is a great, well marked trail hiked often by people from Cape Town. The part at the end is a bit of a scramble, but you can go almost the whole way on a fairly easy trail with great panoramic views. If the hike up Table Mountain seems strenuous, this is a great alternative (and is lovely in its own right!) There are two routes---one up some chains that is a lot like rock climbing, OR if you continue past that, a simple hiking trail. I've done both, and don't recommend the chains if you're afraid of heights! Scarier than it looks. Overall this is a pretty short, very pleasant hike with wonderful views.

Another challenging climb. Being a bit nervous to climb up the rungs in the rocks we took the longer and slightly easier climb around which was still quite a haul to the top but more than worthwhile for the magnificent views.

More like Baboons Head. Almost as famous as Table Mountain Lions Head is an ever present rock formation which dominates the city and which, due to erosion does look more like a baboon than a lion nowadays. This des not detract from is magnificence in any way.
Take a leap. Went to Lion's Head when encountered a huge line at Table Mountain. Taxi driver recommended. My daughters para-glided down to the beach. They both thought it was one of the highlights.
Superb views amid wild flowers. This is a great way to spend the early part of an evening and work up an appetite for supper. Great views; plenty of wild flowers, and good walking.

Best Holiday Fun. We hiked up Lion's Head with picnic basket and lots of water, expecting to find the best view of Cape Town (from above). On the way up, however, we saw some paragliding takeoffs and ended up flying with Stef and "Iceman" down to Camps Bay. It was the most awesome thing to do in Cape Town - the view was spectacular and serene! We then watched the glowing red sun disappear behind the sea over some beers in Camps Bay. Stef's company's name was ParaPax - what a fantastic crew!
Great walk!. Such a wonderful place to take a walk, the views were amazing and we took a few bottles of mineral water and sat up top and soaked in the scenery.

Most rewarding walk!. An awesome walk with 360 degree views of Cape Town! Great photo spots along the way and at the top. Advisable to go on a day with good weather as it is probably slippery in the rain. Some scrambling involved and more difficult coming down than going up. A must do!
another walk up this fantastic spot!!. Drive to park car, as you will be grateful on return....easy climb up- not so easy down....dont go on a cloudy day

Fantastic. We climbed this small mountain in less than one hour. In october this mountain is like a botanical garden. When you are one the top you can enjoy a 360° view.This hike is easy, but it could be dangerous if the weather change and if the rain comes (slippery rocks). You can choose a short way using cables but you need to be trained for that.It was a great walk (2 hours round trip)

Wonderful hike, amazing views. For ambitious hikers looking for amazing panoramic views of Cape Town and surrounding areas, this is a must do. We were a group of 15+ - ranging from ages 6 to 70 and it is a good hike - not for the faint of heart. Some climbing involved and you can climb the ropes or walk around (takes longer). Views at sunset are AMAZING!

Full moon hike!. If the weather's fair and you happen to be in CT on a full moon, join hundreds of hikers to the top of Lion's Head for an amazing experience. Start well before sunset so catch the moon rising over the city and remember a head-lamp for the descent. Take something warm and watch your step. A wonderful adventure!
View!. Well worth the walk. It is also nice at night, do not even need at flash light, if the moon is out. a must do in Cape Town!

Breathtaking views, staggering heights, great hike. Decided to hike this on a gorgeous sunny day from the centre of town. Only go if its clear weather, otherwise you can't see the view or even where your walking. Wear comfortable clothing that allows freedom to stretch on the climb. Being petrified of heights, I decided to challenge myself with a friend. We hiked to the very top. The scariest part was the cliff edges(only a few feet,no safety railings like in canada) and the climbing of the steel ladders and chains. Did i mention scary to us people who have vertigo? And that was near the last 5% of the hike from the top. After reaching the top, We then cont. our descent and then walked all the way to camps bay. Amazing workout for 5 hours start to finish (because of the extra walking involved to and from lions head)
Great day in Cape Town!. This is a really nice, short hike right in the city where you are constantly rewarded with amazing views! Pack a lunch and make a day out of it!

NO WITCH OR A WARDROBE HERE. As a child it took me years to recognize the lion. Once you've seen it, you can't miss it. A lovely drive takes you around the hill to see the Sea Point side. If you're into hiking, there are organized moonlight hikes or you can go on your own (in a group for safety sake)

More amazing views. We had fabulous weather for a relaxed wonder taking in the sights & saw so many hikers, runs what a great place to watch the world go by with lots of Helmented guinea fowl running around.
good for most abilities. Super views and a pretty easy hike (a bit of scrambling near the top). A must for anyone doing hikes in the area.

Looks more like a gorilla to me!. A drive up to the rear end of the 'Lion' on a nice day will reward you with spectacular views over Cape Town, the bay, Robben Island and back towards Table Mountain. This is all about the view, take a picnic and enjoy a leisurely stroll. There is little else up there apart from really unpleasant toilet facilities.

climb on it!!!. It's easy, just a 30 to 60 minutes walk according to your fitness and you'll have a wonderful view on Capetown and it's beaches. There is a short passage with some chains to help you but it's very simple, as local people can confirm you. It's a local habit to go there at the sunset with a bottle of wine to profit of a mervellous sunset

Beautiful view. A really nice hike to the top from where you have one of the best views over Cape Town. Best to go close to full moon, but I don't recommend going on exactly those dates as you can stand in a queue to walk down again. I recommend being on the top by sunset and to stay till a few minutes after dark at least. Also a very nice hike before work in the morning...

A great hike with spectacular views of Cape Town on a nice day. Not recommended for the unfit and will also recommend take warm/ waterproof top even if the weather indicates good weather - just in case as Cape Town has been known to have four seasons in a year ! After climbing to the crest over a narrow ledge you can enjoy spectacular views - a must for the visitor to Cape Town. Entry is free but car guards do expect a tip!
If you love hiking. We choose to hike Lion's Head because the Table Mountain had zero visibility that day. It was a very comfortable walk with nice view on your left. If you love hiking, try it.
Great. I liked it. It's a fantastic mountain. We ook a lot of pictures. It's not necessary to go on the top. You can admire it from far away

Best hiking spot in CT. I love this place, which is a great low-strain hike with amazing view - just a 5 minute drive from Cape Town centre. It takes you 40-60 minutes up (and same down again) and the view is great all the way up, as your walking round and round the hill (unlike Table Mountain). If you happen to be in Cape Town during full moon, you should join the locals and start off an hour or so before sunset, catching the sunset and full moon rising from the top with a glass of wine and good friends. Excellent.

A great way to see Cape Town and Table Mountain. A walk up Lion's Head must afford the best views of Cape Town and Table Mountain. It's not a long walk, but it is uphill! Towards the top you have the option of the easier route, or of the direct route up using the chains and footholds. We took the chains,( and we are in our 50s). It was not far, and a bit of fun. We decided to come down the easy way. The walk up is through beautiful hillsides of proteas and other wildflowers. It took us oldies a fair bit longer than the hour and a half promised in the guide book, but that's probably because we stopped to take about a hundred photos.

Best views of Cape Town. The trail starts at the road that leads from Table Mountain to Signal Hill. It spirals up giving you views of all of the city and peninsular. It's moderately strenuous, especially at the start and near the top, but worth every step. There's no shade, so wear a hat and carry water. We take about an hour to get to the top (with a few rest stops) and 30 minutes to return.

Cape Town by day and night. Hike up Loins Head late afternoon with locals and tourists alike. Watch the sun set over Clifton and Camps Bay as Town lights on the other side. Take a sundowner to dink at the top (remeber to bring your own trash down again) and jumper and flashlight for hiking down.

A great afternoon walk. It was an easy afternoon walk - the Captonians go up for sunset - but you wouldn't want to come down alone after dark... that even we two 70 yr old women had no trouble with up to the very end - (there it gets a bit steep and my friend didn't want to risk a broken bone or twisted ankle. The views are unparalled in all directions and you walk round and roun so get all sides, the fauna (fijnbos) is spectacular even in this almost-end-of-winter period. We couldn't stop taking pictures. Something to do with energetic kids and teens, to give your dog a hike or just to do something "else" if you have a free bit of time.

Treacherous climb, excellent view. Hike up Lion's Head gives you an excellent workout but people with fear of heights must tread carefully. Once on top you get a 360 degree view of cape town. Beautiful to say the least. Must do while in Cape Town.

Good views across Cape Town. climbing Lion's head is more challenging that climbing Table Mountain because it is much more exposed as you approach the top. The ladders and cables are easy if you want to take the slightly quicker route to the top. The first time I climbed it, the top was in mist, I went back a few days later but abandoned the climb because the winds were making it dangerous to continue. But still a great walk and easily combined with Signal Point
A great climb.. This is a relatively easy climb for those who want to see scenery not available by car. An invigorating experience.

Early evening run. For a lovely sunset early evening run or walk, Lions head is highly recommended. The path is clear and makes for easy walking. There is a bench overlooking Campsbay that is the perfect spot for watching the sunset. There are also organised walks up to the top on nights when the moon is full.

Easy walk with great views at the top. An easy walk to the top (about 1 hour at a slow stroll) and you will be rewarded with awesome views of the entire city. No proper hiking boots are needed, and the route is 90% of the way dog friendly.

Great Day Walk. Exceptional 360 degree views and a really great walk, even for beginners, the last section near the top has vertical ladders, so for those who suffer vertigo, you may have to turn back just at the top section or sit and wait for your party.
The best way to see it. The best way to see the lions head is by helicopter from the waterfront. At the right altitude you can clearly see it looks like the head of the lion

Great walk/scramble. We climbed Lion's Head on a sparkling winter's afternoon. It was stunning from beginning to end. The walking is pretty easy, though do be aware that there is some scrambling (including negotiation of two or three stepladders) to reach the summit.

Amazing views but a tough climb!. We chose to walk up lions head, as we were told we would get great views of cape town and table mountain. We were not disappointed, as the walk is circular for the most part we could see right the way around cape town, and as it was a beautiful sunny day had uninterrupted views, we could even see a whale swimming in one of the nearby bays. The last third of the climb is challenging and there are a few sections where you climb straight up using iron struts in the rock face, so some degree of fitness is required. Although am told is easier than table mountain.

Not very hard to climb. You will not be there alone so do not choose this one if you want some more quiet mount. The view is good, you have fantastic close view to the Table Mountain, the city of Cape Town incl. harbour, Robber Island.

Most excellent view of the peninsular. Making the journey up the long winding road as you accent to the top of Lions Head will prove to be a worthwhile investment of your time, energy and money. The views are spectacular and breathtaking.

Sunrise above the clouds. I hired a guide to take my on a hike to view the sunrise from the top of Lion's Head. We experienced a magical sunrise above the clouds and enjoyed every step of the way. It's not too strenuous, but there are a few ropes to climb, etc. I took some of the best pictures of my life. I wish I could remember the guide who picked me up at my hotel, but the Table Bay Hotel referred him to me.

Walk with a view. The walk spirals around this epic Cape Town landmark giving you breathtaking views of the city, the sparkling ocean, Atlantic Seaboard, Robben Island and sandy scenic beaches. The route requires you to pay particular attention to where you walk near the top.

Great hike. We went up Lion's Head near sunset. Nice hike with the last part of a bit steep requiring a little scramble. Great fun. The view from the top was panoramic and beautiful. Lots of friendly people on the trail.

Table Mountain and Lion Head. Great photos of lionhead from various angles can be had when you do the table mountain cableway. Didn't get a chance to hike it but if I ever go back, it will be in my plans to do so.
Amazing view. You can skip it, as long as you visit this or table mountain
Awesome hike!. It's a bit of a climb at times, but totally worth it!!
Good hike. Suggest you not hike to the top unless you are in very good shape. Very rocky and slippery. I hiked only to the first ladder which turned out to be a good choice.
Nice place to hike, but with care. View, hike a little treacherous. Not for the feint hearted, but stunning view.
Must seee. Get there for sunset if you want to snap some amazing views... 25 walk from the bottom OR an hour is you are a slow walker

Very Good, but getting there can be a nightmare!!. Great views of the city for this point especially at sunset, but because of it being so popular the road leading up to it can get very congested and calls for so confident driving in tight spaces.

Birds Eye View of Cape Town. This is not a difficult walk (but not for totally unfit individuals) and really is worth the effort. There is a path that winds all the way up to the top of Lions Head where you have 360 degree views of the surrounding areas. Full Moon hikes to the top are also popular. Take a camera - you'll get some amazing shots!

two day pass. we bought a two day hop-on, hop-off pass and visited table mountain which meant visiting the coastal area...and the second day got us to constantia and a visit to jonkerhuis for lunch...

Not for the faint-hearted, but fantastic!. Another hidden gem of Cape Town .. on a clear day, warm or cold doesn't matter, the walk/hike to the top of Lion's Head is a 'must do'. The athletes can race it; the less fit amongst us may stroll and enjoy the view around every corner and especially the world-class vista from the summit. Take a light back-pack with water, camera and if you are that keen, binoculars. Be prepared for some relatively easy ladder-climbing .. help is always at hand .. and know that you will have done something really special.
best sunset. We drove to Lions Head just for the sunset. It was amazing, only minor problem was how many others had the same idea. There is restricted parking so get there early but well worth it.

A challenging but very rewarding walk!. Lions head is the mountain that sits overlooking the central city of Cape Town, and it offers some spectacular views of the city, the ocean and the adjacent Table Mountain. It can be a tough walk for some unfit people, as it gets quite steep near the top, but extremely rewarding, as it offers 360 degree views!There are 2 routes: one has some scrambling you have to do up some steep rock faces, with metal bars, but the other route is easier and only has some easy scrambling over rocks.I've done it about 40 times, as I live in Cape Town and always enjoy it, every time.

A wonderful way to see Cape Town. I love climbing Lion's Head due to the fact that throughout the entire hike there are stunning views of Cape Town. Climbing up the rock with the bars is always fun, although I miss the chains that used to be there. It was quite cold when we got to the top (and it was a fairly hot day), so make sure you bring something warm!
better then table mountain. if your the more adventurous type this is for you! i loved it can see a full 360 degrees over cape town! easier hike just climbing at the end makes it harder!!
roar!. Lion's Head is beautiful! Definitely something you should see in Cape Town! Lots of good restaurants near by too!

Amazing hike and view. Lion's head is right next to table mountain and you can hike all the way up. It is a great hike but does require actual walking shoes or at least trainers as the path can be slippery. You also have to climb at times on metal rails so is not suitable for young children. The hike can take up to an hour depending on how fast you go but the view at the top, all over Cape Town is absolutely stunning. It was another highlight of my trip. Apart for parking or taxi, this is a free attraction. I woudl not recommend doing it on a wet day.
amazing. the view of and the view from this little head is so supurb, DOnt miss the walks around this little mountain

Silver Moon. To watch the moon rise over the head is just an awesome experience - quiet, serene area with a view to remember for ever - on a clear day Robben Island can be explored by the eye from majestic heights - not just a lock up and go, but stay and enjoy experience

Great views in the city. Its about 1,5-2hr walk up- use the chains if you feel adventurous. Gives you a nice 360 degrees view of Cape town city bowl, table mountain, waterfront, stadium, and camps bay and the apostles on the other side. Take water, no valuables. It is patrolled and I've seen cctv cameras at the base. Gets busy on full-moon nights as its a beautiful walk up and the light is great
Alternative Photo Stop.. If you can't be bothered to wait for the cable car to get to Table Mountain or to windy to operate, drive up to Lion's Head. Great view of the Football Stadium too.

Full Moon Hike Up Lion's Head. The Full Moon Hike up Lion's Head in Cape Town is definitely a most memorable moment in my life. It takes about an hour or so to get to the top. Be sure to start at least an hour and a half before sunset. Pack in two 500ml bottles of water and snacks for when you reach the top. If you're doing the full moon hike in winter, make sure it's not rainy and that you take a windbreaker as it can get chilly. The hike is quite easy, except for the last bit near the summit which can be a little steep. The hike is great for families and groups of friends. The view is spectacular so take your camera. A small torch may be necessary for the decent. It is recommended that you have patience and go slowly as this is quite a popular hike and there can be quite a few people on the mountain during the full moon. This is also a great team building hike for companies.

Good second option to Table mountain. You can drive up, or walk up. You dont need to pay, and can do it at your own time, own pace. You can enjoy a picnic up there or just amble around! For a spectacular view go at sunset or sunrise! its worth it.

Lion's Head Walk (Cape Town). A steady uphill walk which takes around an hour. It is very close to the city so was able to do the walk early in the morning before walk, especially nice in the summer.Nice views overlooking the city of Cape Town. My family (along with hundreds) made the walk to the top of Lion's Head to watch the sunset in the west, follow shortly by the full moon rising in the east. Take along a bottle of wine n picnic if your travelling dates happen to coincide with this event.Plenty of parking available by the side of the road below the Lion's Head (which is the start of the walk)Make sure you bring along your camera !!

Roar with the Lion!. Climbing Lion's Head in Cape Town is rewarding experience. It is best to obtain a local Capetonians’ advice, but in general – it is accessible; a tough work out and it is relatively safe. One can also hike this mountain at night when it is full moon - the views are spectacular with the sun setting in the west and the moon rising in the east. Always be on the lookout for the ever changing weather conditions in Cape Town. Park your vehicle or let a taxi drop you at the parking lot near the foot of the mountain. Be prepared with an anorak, something to eat and water. Dress in shorts and a short sleeve shirt, but pack a warm top too. Do not carry items in your hand – rather in a small day pack on your back. Leave all valuables and large equipment at your hotel. You can complete the total walk/ climb in 1 - 2 hours if you are very fit; longer if you have children with you and if you want to spend time at the top. In general it takes equally long up and down.The first part of the walk, on the gravel road, is steep, so take it slowly. Follow the walk around the Lion’s rump and enjoy the changing views. It is magnificent to be above the city and have a 360 degree view at the top. Take extra care and be conscious at the section with chains. Savour the experience and tackle the descent slowly. Enjoy!
Good Walk. Do this on a full moon just as the sun is setting. It is magical.

most exciting evening. We followed a Capetown tradition of climbing up at sunset and descending after dark by the light of a full moon. A highlight of the trip. Notes: it is a strenuous climb, bring a headlight or at least a flashlight.

Breathtaking. A good half a day hike, for average fitness. Breathtaking views, some steep drop offs, paths are maintained but it can get windy or misty very suddenly. Not a flip flop hike!!!!!!!! Worth the effort

Awesome hike, but be careful!. I LOVED hiking Lion's Head. It is a perfect distance to get your heart rate up, but doesn't take the whole day. The views are stunning the whole way up. Just be aware there are some pretty steep drop offs in some areas and most of the last part of the hike is a bit scary if you are afraid of heights. I saw many people stopping towards the top because the heights and rock scrambling were too much.

instead of hiking table mountain. Lion`s head is a good alternative to hiking table mountain. It`s not that high but you have a really beautiful view there too! I went up there for a sunset and it was just amazing. You could see the sun going down in the ocean.:)

Good Half Day Hike. A great view of all Cape Town, Camps Bay, and Sea Point.The Capers supposedly hike this hill at least once a week. In low season the trail is crowded and I can't imagine how many people are here in peak season. The hike should take about 1 hour up and down in average physical fitness. There are no facilities after the start of the trail so bring everything with you including a jumper, sunscreen, pancho, food and water. Use the bathroom before you go or risk exposing yourself to all of Cape Town.As stated in other reviews it is very windy. The trail is marked well and there is no possible way to get lost. Bring a torch or flashlight if you intend early morning or sunset hikes. The trail is divided into to two grades. The initial sloping part and then the second half which is more rocky steps.
Windy. Though the scenery all around was breath-taking,the wind was a bit much,so ladies tie your hair back on those windy days,but still worth the view
Spectacular View. The view was great but it gets a bit cold in the evenings so dress warm.

Great short sharp climb. We went up with 4 children aged 10 to 12 (wouldn't recommend doing it with children under 8) on a cloudless hot day and it was fantastic at the top. Start early and get some shade on the way up as you curl round the mountain and wear footwear for a bit of easy rock climbing. I hate heights but enjoyed this very much!!

A long but beautiful walk. Lion's head is amazing, don't just pass by on the bus, but take the walk/climb to the top! Even kids can do it and they love it! So take a hike with your friend or family, it's a great way to spent a half a day in Cape Town.

Exercise and spectacular views. Make your way around Lions Head and see the coastline around Camps Bay to Sea Point and further. Some people were running!!. Exposed to the elements but a nice hike and take water if its warm. Paragliders could get help at the base to take there shutes to the top.Make time to do this walk and get a parnoramic view of Cape Town--spectacular.
Sunset is spectacular. Bring good shoes and be prepared to rock climb nearer to the top. Certainly areas are dangerous so not recommended for elderly or children.

Not for the unfit but truly beautiful. I climbed Lion's Head with my two daughters - did not make it to the top, got about 3/4s up. The paths are well maintained and emergency staff are onhand all the time. They just installed toilets at the bottom. Parking is a bit of a problem as it is a very popular climb. Sunset is amazing and the views spectacular - even if you only go a little way, its worth it.

Beautiful Hike!. Make sure you hike this mountain if you are in Cape Town. It has the most amazing views of the city. It's a fun hike and only takes about 1-2 hours to get to the top. Great for photo taking!

Great views but a little warm!. We enjoyed hikes on both table mountain and lions head. Lions head has great views and is a good hike, but there is very little shelter or shade, so it was considerably warmer. Just be prepared with water. The hike is also shorter and a bit more straight forward than Table Mountain.
Brilliant exercise ;0). From the foot it is a nice short evening "work-out" to run to the top. The sunset is beautiful:0)
Amazing view!. The view from the Lions Head is really good, you can see both Table Mountain and Twelve Apostles. During summer, be prepared for the trail, it can get extremelly warm.
Super cool!. What a sight to see! We went up to Lion's Head around sunset and were not disappointed!

Beautiful. Awesome way of seeing Cape Town and the sunset without going up Table Mountain. Just make sure you are prepared for a rough climb (ladders in rock), and make sure you take torch in case you return after dark!
awesome views of Cape Town. If you don't have the energy to climb Table Mountain as a tourist, Lions Head is a must. 2,5 hours of glorious views.
Lion's Head. Go there at noon when they fire the canon. Nice view of the city.

Work off the holiday indulgence. Its definitly worth climbing.Just the shot to get some excercise you need moderate fitness, a lot of people take picnics to the top & watch the sun set. Apparently it gets popular on the full moon as well.
Excellent Hike for Starters or Travellers. Great for hike, full moon... Amazing view. put this on your to-do- list when visiting Cape Town.... :)
easy hike, real rewards. a nice hike around a gentle mountain with magnif views. there is a bit of rock climbing, but nothing your granny couldn't handle!

Driving to Camps Bay. I got to experience this beautiful scenery Lion's Head while being driven in style from 15 On Orange to Camps Bay Azamare and the driver just took us for a ride to take in the beautiful Cape Town :-)...

Best view of Cape Town. We did a sunset walk up here on a lovely summers day, ideal for everybody and the view from the top is just stunning so make sure you take your camera, pack a picnic and just chill and take in the natural beauty of CT when you reach the summit.

Just talk about the moonlight.... Our guset house - the fabulous Camps Bay Ridge Guest House (see my review) is situated at the foot of Lion's Head. The relatively easy (nb for someone who enjoys fell-walking) walk up to watch the sunset is highly recommended and especially on the night of a full moon.

Full Moon Rise & Sunset make a great combo. An easy hike for the fit and attainable for the not-quite-so-fit too, take a picnic to the top and enjoy some sundowners while you watch the sunset over the atlantic ocean and the moonrise over false bay & the rest of the city. truly beautiful!

must do :). 1.don't go alone2.take 1l water and never go hungry3.no matter if it's hot, take some hoodie or jacket4.if the sun is strong put sun cream, otherwise u can get burned easily5. take the recommended routes always6.it takes time and it's beautiful on the top , so enjoy it7. be careful on the way back, there are many steep rocks, hold strong, use your hands, don't hurry up8.take your camera with :) capture the beautiful view :)

Tips and suggestions from a Lions Head regular. As a Lions Head regular I am going to begin with a few helpful tips, especially for those visiting Cape Town on holiday and planning on hiking up Lions Head:HIGHLY RECOMMENDED:1. You need to wear takkies / sneakers / trainers.2. You need to wear a pair of shorts. (I see too many tourists struggling to do the hike in jeans / long pants).3. You need to take water. (I usually take a 500 ml water bottle)OPTIONAL:1. Put a few food items / picnic into a backpack, as it is lovely to sit, have a few snacks and enjoy the view at the top.2. Take a camera there are lots of amazing views and photo opportunities.BEST TIME AND CONDITIONS TO HIKE:1. Do this hike when it is not windy. When it is windy it can be unpleasant, and you will find that the higher up you go the windier it gets.2. Personally, I think that the best time to do this hike is in the late afternoon. That way it's not too hot., and when you get to the top the sun is starting to set which results in beautiful views. In the SUMMER time, If you are a slow hiker start hiking at 4 in the afternoon, if you are a faster hiker start at 4.30 or 5.3. Many people hike up Lions Head to watch the sunset, as the view of the sunset from the top is beautiful. If you are going to stay to watch the sun go down then you need to either leave soon after the sun has set, or take a torch along, so that you can find your way down in the dark.OTHER INFO:1. The trail begins on Signal Hill Road. The start of the trail is about a third of the way along Signal Hill Road. You can get a taxi to drop you right at the start of the trail.2. The start of the trail is a wide gravel path that slopes upwards. There is a metal bar / barrier in front of the path, simply walk around the metal bar and continue up the wide gravel path.3. It is an easy path to follow, and during summer there are normally lots of people hiking up and down along the path.4. I have seen MANY children doing this hike and they all seem to love it, so take your kids along!5. The hike is not a difficult one, and as long as you are relatively fit you should not have a problem getting to the top.Last, but not least, this hike has the most spectacular panoramic views. From the top you can see the ocean, Robben Island, Table Mountain, Signal Hill, The City Bowl, The Twelve Apostles and more. It is truly truly beautiful.Enjoy your hike!

Lions Head Paragliding. We paraglided of Lions Head which was fantastic, I was scared but loved it.We witnessed a few bad take offs which ended up in the trees and bushes which made us a little nervous.

3 hr walk/climb for fantastic views across Cape Town. Take the adventurous route to get the maximum out of this walk and pick a day with minimal wind and you are rewarded with superb panoramic views up and down the Atlantic coast

A classic mountain hike in the heart of Cape Town. Lion's Head is a good steep hike with some light scrambling closer to the top. Early mornings and sunset offer the most breathtaking all round views of the city, the harbour, Robben Island, the Atlantic seaboard, and of course Table Mountain. You experience many different views as you climb up in a spiral around the base of the mountain. If you're superfit you may mange to get up in less than 30 minutes, but it's more likely to take an hour each way. If you don't want to climb the steep staples and chains (used to be chains only) you'll be treated to a wider range of views and terrain by hiking past and around on the left.
Yes .. I can see it. Yes you can easy see it.. The red bus said that they have two lion head mountains.. I am not sure with the second one haha

Great views of Cape Town from the top. It is a good drive up the Lion's Head with great views at every turn of the road. At the top there are places to sit and a good ice-cream van! It is especially good to be here at sunset as the views are wonderful

Worth a visit. A great way to spend a couple of hours if you have seen the sights of Cape Town and are looking for something different to do. It can get quite physical in part climbing over rocks but once you reach the top the views are great!

Must-do in Cape Town!. Climbing up lion's head is one of my favourite things to do in Cape Town. Almost anyone can do it. It's a leisurely walk and mild climbing that take maximum 2 hours if you go really slow.Views are stunning and worth the effort!
Go when its not windy. Try the scarey chains & staples to the top! Great view, but you'll have to work for it! Take water. Not for children under six.
Next to Table Mountain. If you like to see mountain tops then fine but otherwise there are better things to do with your time, especially as you can see it from the ground
A fine viewpoint. Worth a visit for the views. Watch out for pickpockets etc
Easy comfortable and accesible hiking option. Great way to gently hike up a mountain, experience the majestic views and feel accomplished even if you're not into physical fitness all that much!

Quickie in Cape Town. Lions Head is one of the best value for time hikes you can do. Spiraling as you walk up you get 360 degree views of the city below and the ocean and all the different neighborhoods in Cape Town as you walk along. It is beautiful, adventurous, and you can be up and down in 2 hours if you are quick!

Walked this mountain often. great for a Sunday morning vigorous stroll. Do-able, although out of breath! Good walk. no other access except on foot! Park your car safely at the foot, but leave nothing in it and have some cash on hand for the unofficial "car guards" when you get back down. ps. Take water and a warmish jacket

Best Hike by far!. You must absolutely hike Lion's Head, when visiting Cape Town. It is free of charge, hardly any tourists and the views are a million times better then Table Mountain! Take you're time to get up there with a medium level climb. Camera, lot's of water and half a day will give you the experience of a lifetime...

Sunset walk. Go for the sunset!! Was a challenging but most definately rewarding walk/climb. If you do go for the sunset though (which was absolutely beautiful) make sure you take a torch for the way down!!
Great work-out. Worth the sweat once you reach the top! Take plenty of water and go early to avoid the heat , few places offer shade.

On a sunny afternoon. We booked a small cruise with a catamaran, to enjoy a glass of South African white wine at sunset. Were lucky enough that laguna was calm so the Captain could go really upto the Lion's Head where Indian Ocean enters. It is said to be a vert dangerous place, but not that day as there was almost no wind. Enjoy a glass of wine with those you love looking at sunset on the laguna

A great brief hike. The hike up Lion's Head takes about 1.5 hours both ways, and it is pretty good if you are at medium fitness levels. There is one section which gets quite steep, and you have to use chains and handles to climb up a sheer rock face. The views from the top are really great, and the trail winds around the mountain so you get a panorama the whole time. The only down side is that the mountain has become VERY crowded with tourists over the years.
Must visit at sunset. Wonderful place to visit just before sunset and view the amazing colours of cape town at sunset!!! Incredible to see the night lights coming on.

A great walk with great views. A steady walk to the top gives great views of Cape Town. There are 'tricky' parts of the walk but an 'averagely' fit person should be ok. It takes about 60 minutes to get to the top...wrap up warm as its chilly on the summit!

Walking the Lion. Lion's Head viewed from a distance looks spectacular, however, the best way to view Lion's Head, is to go on a hike to the top of the mountain and also view the spectacular scenery on the way up, as well as when you reach the summit..........what a breathtaking view !

The best view of Cape Town. As a local we walk up Lions head regularly. It is a straightforward walk with most people walking up with dogs and children. Take the normal hiking precautions of making sure you take the necessary water, food, windbreaker, sunscreen and hat (the weather can change quickly so check the weather report before walking). As you walk up the mountain the most beautiful views unfold with a full 360 degree view from the top. It is unmistakably the best view of Cape Town! As you ascend there is a choice of the chains or you can continue walking around the mountain which will take you to the same point, so don't be put off if you are less adventurous. You can even walk to a point where you are comfortable and just enjoy the view and smell of the fynbos (the local flora). This is a popular walk at full moon, it is wonderful watching the sun set over the ocean and the moon rise over the Hottentots Holland mountain range but if you go up on full moon it is VERY popular and busy, you are often queuing to get up and down the mountain and it is a bit dangerous as you walk down at night by torchlight. http://dostuffct.com/activity/lions-head/lions-head

parasailing, climbing, hiking, ..... This little mountain has it all. Put on top of that : amazing views, beautiful nature and crazy night-excursions and you have a good recipe for a well filled day !
The hike to do. This a great hike, that gets a bit tough at the top- you'll need good shoes and some mountain climbing skills. Great for exercise or go on a clear morning for beautiful views.
Climbing. If climb is your thing, then I reckomend that you climb up Lions Head, sit down and enjoy the view.
Full Moon. Hike to the top for a picnic supper at full moon - it's a jol up there - and hike down by the light of the moon ... although always good to have a head torch too.
Nature lovers. Wonderful hike if the big old Table mountian is still tooo much of a challenge. On full moon there are night hikes which is very popular.

Hiking it up ? Yes ?. There are little pathways up lions head which makes hiking accessible, and enjoyable. I was holding my camera so I could not hike to the top. But on my next visit to cape town, I will definitely hike it up! plus the view that you get... I am ...amazed

Easy walk. The most accessible mountain walk in Cape Town. It will take less than an hour to walk up if reasonably fit. The path winds right around so lots of different views present. There are no facilities so take your own water. Its always busy during daylight or at full moon so safe enough.
If the clouds prevent a trip up Table Mountain, do this.. The views are spectacular but better up the Mountain. Easy to get at by car.

Paragliding. Climbed lions head to paraglide off the top of it. Quite good views from the top, and a pleasant and easy climb. Apparently, it's a tradition with the locals to do a 'full moon' climb and climb the mountain at night by the light of the moon and stars.. but this tends to be quite popular, and sometimes you even have to queue! which rather ruins the romance, I suppose..

One of the best hikes in the world. Love this hike. Can be a little tough at times and i don;t recommend bringing kids under 8 years old. What a view when you get to the top of the mountain. Should take about 45 minutes.
another mountain. Has a lot to do with the past and a wonderful look out point

Beautiful Hike. Throughout the hike up Lions Head we were surrounded by breathtaking views of cape town, the walk itself was really good but I don't recommend it for those who dislike climbing up rocks. It was really nice in the early morning before it became too hot! I highly recommend this walk.
A must for visitors to Cape Town. Breathtaking views, a definite location for the foreign traveller to see.
Go for it!. It looks harder than it is, but there are two paths to the top.. one is less tricky.

very steep, very hot, very worth it. Try and go at sunrise or at sunset, if you go in the morning it will still be a scorcher in summer.The trail is mildly strenuos, but the views pay off your effort.They say it takes about 2 hours up and an hour down, but we did the whole thing in an hour and forty minutes, excluding the time we spent on top.

The best hike I've ever done. I really enjoyed this hike, as you got to use your hands as well as your feet. I really enjoyed all the scrambling over the rocks and boulders.We made it all the way to the top. Awesome views.

To climb or not to climb the hard way. We used a small guide book and rather that use the well set out path we criss crossed up the side facing Table Mountain until we reached the tree and rock near the top. There is the a chain to climb but we bottled as we were on our own. If you do this climb get a local guide, have sturdy shoes, and take food and water but no expensive belongings.
sunset. Walked up the Lions head on a fu;; moon night and saw the sunset, an easy and reewarding hike

Great walk and fantastic views from top. We did the walk up to the top, it was challenging in places, but as someone who does not do a lot of hill walks, i actually thoroughly enjoyed it, especially the view of Table Mountain from the top of Lions Head.

Easy climb with the best views. From the top here, are the best views of Cape Town. In my opinion even better than off Table Mountain. It takes an hours walk to get to the top, with the end bit being a little steep (optional chains). Did it a couple of times with the last time being New Years day. Well worth the trip. At the top there's a cross which you can see from down below.Just be careful as occasionally there have been muggings going up.

Cape Town at it's best. A traditional 'best walk' in Cape Town. But not in a strong south-easter. I can't say how many times we've enjoyed this walk (free) - both during day time and in the moonlit evenings. Some of our best memories with visitors. Superb views and it's a manageable walk (with a slight scramble up the chains) which doesn't take too long. You need to be relatively fit in order not to 'expire' on the final steepish bits. This is a Cape Town 'must-do', for visitors and residents alike.
Lions Head. The name is apt, and this is a true landmark in CPT. One can only imagine the sailors of yesteryear catching sight of this landmark, and their hearts leaping!
AMAZING HIKE!. A highlight of our trip to Cape Town. Hiked to the top of Lion's Head then back down and run to Signal Hill and back. A must for the active traveller! Outstanding views from the top!

Definitely a Cape Town Highlight!. This was one of our favourite experiences, but be prepared to work for it! It took us an hour and a half to climb up Lion's Head and we were not rushing, but enjoying the views along the way...however, it was steep in places, so hard work. Wear comfortable trainers as there are some loose rocks and climbing over them in sandals is not a good idea!

Great short hike. This small hike needs to be started early in the day! There is little shade on the way up or at the rock section. There is a plateau before you complete the peak of the mountain, it is very busy when we did it so you need some patience for those coming and going. Great views and worth the effort. Take water!

Great views but watch for sun, time needed and level of effort required!. This is a climb up a rocky hill (670m high) of about 3.5km each way. Allow 2-3 hours plus. Path is narrow towards the top, unpaved, and uneven. In some places you will climb ladders to higher levels. It is difficult to pass other people when busy, so allow for this. If climbing in summer MAKE SURE you are adequately prepared! The summer African sun is harsh and dangerous, esp between the hours of 10am - 3pm. Suggested commencement times are <9am and >3pm in summer, noting the total time in the sun. Ideally avoid being topless, or even sleeveless. Sun lotion (>SPF20), applied often, is an absolute must. A hat, ideally wide brimmed, is also a necessity. Wear practical walking shoes, and loose-fitting shorts. Take lots of water, min 1litre per person. Views from the top and along the way are stunning. However there are few places to stop and rest for any extended period. If with young children note you may have to carry them on return journey.
Great Views across Table Bay. Good for walking or even just drivng to the vantage point and admire the views.
Pretty impressive. The views are amazing, take some time to drive around.

Wonderful evening walk. Walked up towards the top (but stopped a little short when the path got tricky). The views over Cape Town and the Bay were magnificent. ell worth the effort and the sunset with the 12 apostles as a backdrop were stunning

Spectacular views, great exercise, worth the trek. Hiked up to the top of Lion's Head, a prominent geological feature that is part of the Table Mountain Range. Drive along the road to Signal Hill to the trailhead and park on the pavement across the road. Water and drinks are available for purchase in the shack at the entrance. There are no bathroom facilities. You will be hiking on a path that spirals up to the top of the rock feature that sticks out of the range. We saw many hikers with dogs. First part of the trail is a relatively steep gravel road, but it is not too strenuous. You will come across the launch site for local paragliding companies. Fun to stop and watch a takeoff. The next part of the trail includes manmade wooden steps as well as natural rock steps. (You're getting higher!). Some rock scrambling comes into play. There are metal rung ladders, chains and handles to help. The last part of the trail is the most challenging but not undoable. If you go slowly and think about where to place your feet and hands you'll do ok. The views along the way and at the top are breathtaking. The water near the shore is clear blue and green. You can see Robben Island, the harbor and waterfront, many prominent buildings and people populating Clifton Beaches and Camps Bay. Plan to rest up there for a little bit.Going back the way I came up, I found that I felt safer sitting down on the rocks and sliding onto the next level. It's helpful to be able to use your arms to lower yourself. Take water with you, do not do this on a very hot day and plan to spend about three hours round trip, depending on how much stopping and gawking you do.

An exciting challenge. Lion's Head offers great city and bay views, particularly when there is a full moon. Remember to take a head lamp and warm clothing for the descent. Don't take too much food and drink, because the climb can be tricky at times. Go early, because there can be quite a crown at full moon. Be cautious if you don't have a head for heights, particularly if the wind is blowing. Also note that this is not a guided route and yo'll be pretty much on yourown!

Great for the walk. This is a popular walk for the locals and tourists alike. It gives a truely awesome view of Cape Town and surrounds. just over half the height of Table Mountain, the view on a nice day is spectacular. if the wind is blowing, avoid it. You can only accend by foot and need to be reasonably fit.
Nice view if Table Mountain is closed. If you are unlucky while visiting Cape Town to not get up the mountain, the Lion's Head is the next best thing.
easy walk. travel in a group is better, excellent for the full moon night walks

Work out with a view. Meander up to the top or run it. Go very early in summer as it gets hot. Bar Table Mountain it is the best views of Cape Town. Various routes. Two ladders and two or three chain climbs later and you are on top. Good fun for the whole family (even the little ones). Take water.

Excellent for hiking. If you are a hiker, this is the place to get the best views from Camps Bay, Table Mountain and the Twelve Apostles, Bantry Bay and Clifton Beaches, all the way to Cape Town downtown areas. The hike is not too strenuous (we did it with kids in back pack carriers when they were small) and the views are spectacular. Allow a morning for this excursion, and take water and snacks because you will want to spend a lot of time admiring the view.

A doable hike/climb.. Great views of Table Mountain and the Cape Town surroundings. It is a great hike. I have done it twice and my wife and I made it to the last pitch on this visit. You also go right past where the parasilers take off from.

Best value walk in the country. If you are half-way fit do this walk - as it winds around the Head, you get awesome 360 degree views of the city. Allow for 3 hours up/down including time to enjoy the views from the top. Bring a windbreaker and some good wine.
Amazing paragliding experience!. Go paragliding from Lion's Head - you will love it!!!

What a trip. This is the best thing to do on a moon lit night! Drive to the base of Lions head and walk to the top of Lions Head in the late afternoon. Take a picnic and maybe some liquid refreshment and take in the awesome view from the top! The sunset is breathtaking. The walk will take about an hour depending on fitness levels, route and in how much of a rush you are. Hopefully not :) Then walk down using the moons rays. Spectacular and free!!

Great Walk!. If you are in Cape town, do it!! it is a great walk up to the top with spectacular views, I am not overly fit or coordinated, so it was quite hair raising at times, but what a great sense of accomplishment! We will do it again when we are next in Cape Town, Just remember to take enough water with you!
