Spectacular Mountain.. In some ways, this is as spectacular a mountain as Table Mountain itself. The likeness to a lion's head is weird, (hence the name, I guess!). From my hotel I had Table Mountain, Lion's Head and Signal Hill competing for my attention. What a dilemma!

Perfect for Full Moon Hikes. Approx 1.5 - 2 hr hike to the top of Lions Head depending on which route you take. One can either go up the ladder and chain route (which is quicker, but a lot more vertical climbing), or the 'flat' route to the top.I would recommend this hike for summer sunsets, and / or for the full moon hike. Truly a spectacular experience, one which will be shared with the majority of Cape Town, as full moon hikes are very popular. Bring your camper chair, some snacks, a chilled bottle of wine, and enjoy what mother nature has on offer.
Lions Head. A superb view of Cape Town. Try climbing to the top - superb!
Beautiful Mountain. Lion's Head is as beautiful as Table Mountain.It's a pity they killed the last lion up there!

Climbing fools. Fantastic that Lions Head is now open to the top. A long walk with amazing views. Not for the faint hearted at the top when you have to use a series of chains to support your onward travel. Views at the top to die for.

Pamoramic views of sea, mountain and city. The circular walk around this little mountain is do-able by tourists of even mediocre fitness and was one of my favorite activities when I lived in Cape Town. Outstanding and ever-changing vistas and you're not too tired when you reach the top! Go before sunset on a full moon and climb down after dark. Lie on your back on a windless summer evening and stargaze.
Energetic. Allow yourself the day if you want to enjoy it, you need to be fairly fit, but the view is worth it.

Awe inspiring!. We had stunning weather and walked up the mountain, it’s a steep walk, but I made it with my asthma so not THAT challenging. There is lots of space to rest and have a look at the wonderful view! There is 2 ways up – a little ladder and a walk way. I did not know this so took the ladder. We mad an appointment with a tandem paragliding company and that’s how we got down. This is a MUST on your holiday to Cape Town!

Another great attraction for Cape Town. Cape Town seems unfairly blessed with great attractions, Lion's Head just being one of them. It is unfortunate that it is located so close to the incredible Table Mountain, which overshadows Lion's Head. Anywhere else in the world, this would be a very top spot. Not sure what is best, the views from Lion's Head of CPT and Marina area or the pictures you can take of Lion's Head from the city or from Table Mountain. Luckily, if you can go to CPT, you will get lots of time with Lion's Head in the background or hopefully on the actual mountain if you can afford the time to make a hike there. Like Table mountain, you can walk there all the way from Long Street if you wish. Or you can get a taxi to take you to the foot of the mountain. This is recommended!

Stunning views!. If for some reason you can’t get to the top of Table Mountain, or just want a free view, then the Lions Head is the second best view point in the city. Due to the fact we wanted a good amount of time up there, we visited when we had just picked up our hire-car, which worked out perfectly. You could get a taxi but would incur charges whilst they waited for you and there is no taxi rank at the top to catch a different taxi down (like at Table Mountain). It is definitely worth stopping at some of the many lay-bys on the way up to the top. Not only do you get some amazing views but also very few people stop on the way to the top, so you get the views all to yourself! Once at the top, there is a good amount of parking but not plenty. We had to wait a few mins to get a space, so I would suggest going earlier in the day before it gets too busy. Some people just wonder up take a few pictures and disappear off. Many people take picnics with them and some people just wonder off and go for a walk along the top, which is highly recommended and very beautiful. It is certainly an attraction which should be visited as the views are amazing.

Unparalleled views!!. This is a must-go alongside Table Mountains! The views are so good and it was a good workout, for someone who leads a sedentary lifestyle. Hahas. Be in comfy walking attire, bring water n camera and it should take you about an hour to reach the best views of cape town.

It is a slight effort, but well worth it!. Having done this hike several times, I think it is something definitely worth doing!! The 1st part is the hardest, with it beeing quite a steep incline, but you are immediately rewarded with great views!!! Try go as early as possible to avoid the heat. When we did it (moderate fitness, nothing spectacular), it took us 2-3 hours to get to the top and down again. We enjoyed a rest on the top-make sure you have some water and a few snacks. I wouldn't recommend it to those who have difficulties with their knees or who have poor fitness levels.So beautiful!!!

Pretty easy hike with 360 degree views.. In my opinion this is probably the best "introductory" hike in Cape Town. It is relatively easy, with no scary drops or anything like that. The best thing about it is that you corkscrew up the mountain so get fantastic views of Camps Bay and the Twelve Apostles, Sea Point and the Waterfront and the City Bowl and Table Mountain.
